description: PEKING, Feb. 1 (Reuters)President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan met Mao Tsetung tonight and said afterward that he was very satisfied with their discussion of Pakistan's problems.

title: Olympic Return Stirs Memories
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 1Dipping down at dawn over the Sea of Japan, Tokyo loomed out of the orange mist.

title: Judicial Inquiry for Ulster
description: Prime Minister Heath has taken a highly unusual action in appointing the Lord Chief Justice of the United Kingdom to investigate the clashes that brought death thirteen men on Londonderry's bloody Sunday. That he has asked Britain's paramount judge to conduct the inquiry is a measure of Mr. Heath's anxiety over the charges of Ulster Catholics that British paratroopers shot to kill without having been fired on first.

title: Lab Not in O.E.O. Project
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Feb. 1Behavioral Research Laboratories, Inc., stated today that it was not one of the companies working under the aegis of the Office of Economic Opportunity's performance contracting project. 6r. Allen D. Calvin, chairman of the board, stated, These poor O.E.O. results stand in sharp contrast to the results obtained by our educational programs in Gary and Philadelphia. He added, The reported failure emphasizes the fact that to obtain significant improvement it is necessary for educators and industry to work together with researchbased individualized prograins.

title: PUBLIC TV GRANTS STIR NEW BATTLE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The long  standing underground, struggle between the White House and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting about funding and power in public television surfaced sharply today before the House Commerce Committee.

title: DENVER SUFFERS SAPPORO ORDEAL
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 1 For 15 agonizing hours last night and early this morning, Denver thought it had lost the 1976 Winter Olympics.

title: NIXON ASKS FUND FOR RURAL AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1President Nixon asked Congress today for a $1.3billion rural development credit fund to stem the flow of people to the cities by promoting economic growth in the American countryside.

title: Market Places: Levitz's Fioat': How Big Is It?
description: The biggest guessing game in town is estimating how many shares, are in the Levitz Furniture Corporation's floatshares actually available for trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Brazil Getting Hospital Ship
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 1 (UPI)The hospital ship S.S. Hope will sail Friday for a 10month medical aid and training visit to the port of Natal in northeastern Brazil. While in Natal, the Hope's medical staff will train Brazilian medical personnel and conduct a measles eradication program. The Hope has been in Baltimore for routine maintenance.

title: City Departments and Agencies Seek $10.7Billion for Budgets
description: The Budget Director announced yesterday that city agencies and departments had made expense budget requests for 197273 that totaled $10.7billion. The total was immediately, assailed by City Council leaders, who warned that drastic cuts must be made.

title: RANGERS ARE SET FOR TOUGH BRUINS
description: In a confrontation that has aroused more speculation than any other game the Rangers have played, this season, the New Yorkers tonight face the National Hockey League's top team, the Boston Bruins at Madison Square Garden.

title: Bridge: Teachers Conference Scheduled for This Saturday
description: Those who teach bridge cover almost as wide a spectrum as those who play. At one end of the scale is the internationally known expert who makes a substantial living teaching those who can afford to pay his fees.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: I would like to add two questions to the commentary on the President's speech concerning Indochina. Were the revelations partly an attempt to convince China of American willingness to leave Indochina so that a deal could be arranged whereby China withdraws material support for Indochinese Communists in return for American trade?

title: Colombo Gives Up Effort To Form Cabinet in Italy
description: ROME, Feb. 1 (AP)Premierdesignate, Emilio Colombo gave up his effort to succeed himself tonight and reported to President Giovanni Leone that he had failed to give Italy a new Cabinet.

title: ACCENT ON MUSIC OF 20TH CENTURY
description: Speculum Musicae, an ensemble devoted to contemporary music, has been appearing out of town and on the fringes of New York's concert scene for a year or so. Monday night it plunged itself down in the middle of thingsTown Hall, to be exactcourtesy of the Young Concert Artists Series. It drew a large audience and rewarded it with a generally worthwhile program of old and new 20thcentury works.

title: Tenneco Profit at Peak;
description: Tenneco, Inc., the Houstonbased diversified company, reported yesterday a 17 per cent increase in 1971 net income on a revenue gain of 11 per cent, both setting records. Fourthquarter earnings were up 29.4 per cent on a revenue rise of 13.1 per cent.

title: Angels Almost See Play in Rehearsal
description: The door that bars Broadway angels from participating in the process by which plays are made ready for the stage was opened a littleseveral millimeters at least for the backers of one show Monday evening.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The question was put bluntly: Is Ted Williams a good manager? Ted Williams gazed at the ceiling, taking his time, thinking it over. He is a man whom some have regarded as hasty and heedless, but when the subject is baseball he does not go off at half cock. That's not easy to answer, he said. He pondered a little longer.

title: NORMAN POWELL, 54, AD EXECUTIVE, DIES
description: Norman H. Powell, a vice president of Albert FrankGuenther Law, Inc., financial advertising and public relations agency, died yesterday at his home, 321 East 54th Street, after a long illness. He was 54 years old.

title: Hanoi Cites Private Message
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)  The United States informed North Vietnam in a private message last October that President Nixon's eightpoint peace plan for Indochina went to the possible limits of generosity, the North Vietnamese press agency reported today.

title: ERVIN QUESTIONS CHECK ON SCHORR
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. asserted today that the Nixon Administration had acted with either stupidity or duplicity in ordering a personal investigation of Daniel Schorr, a television newsman.

title: DEVELOPER NAMED FOR BATTERY CITY
description: The Battery Park City Authority announced yesterday that it had designated Harry B. Helmsley, the head of one of the city's largest real estate management concerns, to act as the developer of three major office buildings in the lower Manhattan project.

title: Dobbs Ferry Group Is Fighting Abortion Facility
description: DOBBS FERRY, N. Y., Feb. 1 The presence of three doctors who have performed nearly 4,000 abortions since last March in an office they share here has stirred strong emotions in this old Hudson River village of 10,350 people.

title: Island Venture Prepares for First Trip
description: When the cruise ship Island Venture leaves Pier 92 on her maiden voyage to the Caribbean Saturday, no one will be happier to put to sea than her captain and crew.

title: Textile Accord Reached
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) The United States and Japan have reached an agreement limiting textile exports by the Japanese to this country for 21 months starting next Jan. 1, the State Department announced today.

title: Cordero Will Receive Woolf Memorial Award
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 1 (UPI)Angel Cordero Jr. was named today as the winner of the George Woolf Memorial award. The 29yearold jockey was selected by vote of racig writers and sports editors covering the current Santa Anita season.

title: HOISOAKE RESIGNS IN NEW ZEALAIG
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Wednesday, Feb. 2 (AP)Sir Keith J. Holyoake resigned today as Prime Minister of New Zealand after 11 years in office and 34 years in Parliament.

title: City Grants Fare Rises To 10 Private Bus Lines
description: A twostep fare increase was authorized last night by the Board of Estimate for 10 private bus lines serving 428,000 passengers daily.

title: Knocking City Draws No Smiles
description: Rowan and Martin do it. So do Johnny Carson and Dick Cavett and a whole host of lesser funnymen.

title: U.S.Soviet Arms Talks To Recess Vienna Round
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The current round of SovietAmerican talks on the limitation of strategic arms will wind up in Vienna on Friday with continued expressions of optimism but without any firm accord, a wellplaced State Department official said today.

title: 1972 Draft Lottery Scheduled for Today
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)Men who will be 19 years old this year will get some idea tomorrow of their chances of being drafted next year.

title: Wasted Construction Dollars
description: The city is making another strenuous effort in Albany to break through the legislative wall that forces it waste nearly 10 per cent of the huge sums spent here every year on construction of schools and other municipal buildings.

title: FOREIGN BASE PACTS BACKED AT HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The State Department contended today that the President, as Commander in Chief, had constitutional authority to enter into agreements for foreign military bases without obtaintng Congressional approval.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The Formula Vee champions of Mexico, Canada and the United States will be among the 100plus competitors in the seventh annual Brundage International Trophy race for Formula Vee cars next Saturday at Daytona International Speedway in Florida. The race, for $11, 500 in purses and prizes, will be 76 miles long, or 20 laps round Daytona's 3.81 mile road course. The event is named for the late Hubert L. Brundage, who conceived the Vee racing classopenwheel cars built around Volkswagen compoents and capable of 120 miles an hour on the straights.

title: Science Official Sworn
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) Dr. H. Guyford Stever took the oath of office today as the fourth man to head the National Science Foundation.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate Rejecting Closure Move
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate failed today to muster the twothirds vote needed for closure, or cutting off debate, on the bill extending the Government's powers to fight employment discrimination:

title: SHELL CANCELS BID FOR GAS AND OIL RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) The Price Commission said today that the Shell Oil Company had withdrawn requests for price increases in fuel oil, automobile gasoline and crude oil.

title: 16 HURT ON RIKERS IN INMATE BRAWL
description: Thirteen inmates and three guards were reportedly slightly injured yesterday afternoon when prisoners in the Adolescent Remand Shelter on Rikers Island went on a 20minute furniture  smashing spree to protest dining condi:. tions.

title: Air Quality Plans Received From 40 States by E.P.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency said today that 40 states and four other jurisdictions had submitted plans to implement nationwide air quality standards.

title: Modified No F Fault Plan Is Supported by Governor
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1A modified no fault automobile accident insurance plan was announced today by Senator Bernard G. Gordon, who said the plan could save vehicle owners in the state about $300million in premium payments during its first year.

title: No. 1: Patulski BallCarrier at Heart
description: In a blue pinstriped suit and vest instead of the blue jeans he usually wears on the Notre Dame campus, Walt Patulski suddenly added 30 pounds in weight and possibly $300,000 in stature yesterday as the No. 1 choice in the National Football League draft.

title: HEAVY SELLING BATTERS WHEAT
description: Wheat futures were under heavy selling pressure yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, with the nearby March, 1972, contract, the most active option, declining 5 cents a bushel at the close.

title: Challenge of European Unity
description: The tennation United States of Europe that could evolve out of the accession to the Common Market treaty of Britain, Denmark, Norway and Ireland promises to alter profoundly the economic and political shape the Atlantic community and the world. The American response is of critical importance.

title: A U.S. Company And Toss to Issue Soviet Newsletter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Porter International, an American consulting company, announced today that it had formed a joint venture with Tass, the official Soviet press agency, to issue newsletter twice a month on Soviet economic developments.

title: Postal Service
description: The United States Postal Service has been established only a few months and so we suppose it is churlish to voice complaint at this early stage; but it does have nearly 200 years of Post Office Department experience behind it. The mailing and delivery of letters is not exactly a new development; nor for that matter, is the sending of telegrams.

title: Factory Orders Off in December; Building Gained
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (Reuters)New factory orders fell 0.4 per cent, or $235million in December to a seasonally adjusted $59.3billion, reversing November's downward revised 3.6 per cent gain, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: Following the President's startling announcement on nationwide TV of the extensive and energetic efforts which he and Dr. Kissinger have made to find a workable solution to the Vietnam impasse, I settled back to watch the commentary on the several networks.

title: Suburban School Officials Fear Effect of a Freeze on Spending
description: School officials in highspending suburban districts, who are studying the recommendations, of a state commission that they freeze their expenditures while other districts catch up with them, are concerned about the impact such a step would have on the quality of education.

title: SWISS CANTON SAYS LEARY MUST LEAVE
description: GENEVA, Switzerland, Feb. 1Dr. Timothy Leary, who escaped from a California prison while serving a sentence on drug charges, has been ordered to leave the canton of Valais within a week, officials announced tonight.

title: DOW OFF BY 0.38 AS TRADING RISES
description: Stock prices moved through a generally indecisive session yesterday, as trading interest in lowprice issues continued active.

title: AD FOR MGOVERN DISTURBS MUSKIE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Senator George McGovern is using a fouryearold recording of an endorsement by Robert F. Kennedy to promote his Presidential campaign, and the backers of Senator Edmund S. Muskie do not like it.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Bohemia Lumber Company, Inc., sold 200,000 shares of common stock, and stockholders disposed of an additional 210,000 shares yesterday in an offering at $21.75 a share by a Dean Witter syndicate. The company is based in Eugene, Ore.

title: Thousands of Police Honor Two Slain Comrades
description: Patrolmen Gregory P. Foster and Rocco W. Laurie, who had been Marine Corps comrades in Vietnam, and who walked a beat together on the Lower East Side, were buried yesterday.

title: Dollar View Is Confident
description: PARIS, Feb. 1A group of economic experts representing the major trading nations sought today to dispel concern in the world's money markets about the effectiveness of last December's currency reallignments.

title: Credit Markets: Bond Prices Stage Rally in Late Trading
description: The bond market, after declining most of the time for the past three weeks, staged a moderate rally late yesterday afternoon.

title: Tenneco Profit at Peak;
description: Tenneco, Inc., the Houstonbased diversified company, reported yesterday a 17 per cent increase in 1971 net income on a revenue gain of 11 per cent, both setting records. Fourthquarter earnings were up 29.4 per cent on a revenue rise of 13.1 per cent.

title: This Italian Dinner Is. Served With Language. Lesson on Side
description: Che e questo? asked Nicolo Balducci, the Italian teacher, holding up a knife and asking what it was. The class struggled for the Italian word and then repeated il coltello, after the teacher. Questa? La forchetta. Vino rosso vino bianco  sale e pope zucchero  formaggio portacenere.

title: U.N. Hears Appeals Of Guerrilla Groups In Africa for Aid
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Feb. 1The United Nations Security Council heard pleas for help today from a parade of witnesses representing the nationalist organizations that are waging guerrilla wars against Africa's few remaining white governments.

title: Roberts Acts to Plug Loopholes Allowing Scofflaws to Escape
description: District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx announced yesterday that he was moving, in coordination with the courts and the Department of Motor Vehicles, to close the loopholes that, he says, have allowed perhaps 100,000 summonses for moving violations a year to be ignored.

title: BroadwayHale Defends Seeking Bergdorf
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Bergdorf Goodman, New York's fashionable retail establishment, has indicated that it may close the Fifth Avenue store and convert it to a highrise office building to obtain maximum economic use if the Federal Trade Commission disapproves Bergdorf's proposed purchase by BroadwayHale Stores, Inc., a public hearing on the acquisition was told, here today.

title: APLANT SAFETY WILL BE DEBATED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Atomic Energy Commission and 46 environmental groups will begin debate tomorrow on the safety of nuclear power plants, an issue that promises to rival, in duration if not intensity, the fight over the Amchitka bomb test.

title: Yale Sextet Wins, 106
description: NEW HAVEN., Feb. 1Bob Kane, a sophomore, scored three goals tonight to lead Yale to a 106 hockey victory over Boston College. It was Yale's first victory over the Eagles in 17 years.

title: Smoking Foes Ask Law to Limit Tar and Nicotine in Cigarettes
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Antismoking forces opened a drive today for legislation to limit the tar and nicotine content of cigarettes.

title: State Ends Its, DrugPrevention Aid For Programs in the City's Schools
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1  Statefunded programs to prevent drug addiction in New York City's elementary, junior high and senior high schools will end by Sept. 15, the State Narcritics Addiction Control Commission chairman, Howard A. Jones, said today.

title: Rural Uses of Telecommunications to Be Studied
description: Dr. Peter C. Goldmark, an electronics pioneer and former head of the Columbia Broadcasting System Laboratories, said yesterday that he would direct a Governmentfinanced study of the imaginative uses of telecommunications in a 10town area of northeastern Connecticut.

title: Pipeline Concerns In $30Million Pact For Arctic Drilling
description: TORONTO, Feb. 1Three major United States pipeline companies, hungry for future supplies of natural gas, have committed themselves to spend at least $30million on exploratory drilling on Canada's Arctic islands.

title: Canadiens Win, 31
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 1 (UPI)Frank and Pete Mahovlich, brothers, scored a goal apiece tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 31 victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Brundage Is Angered
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 2Karl Schranz, the Austrian ski star who was disqualified from the Winter Olympic Games on charges of commercialism, was accused today by Avery Brundage, president of the International Olympic Committee, of being disrespectful to the Olympic movement.

title: Steelworkers End Strike
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 1 (AP)A contract agreement has been reached ending a United Steelworkers of America strike at seven BlawKnox Company plants, a company spokesman said today. The three year accord was reached here last night and covers 2,700 workers. The strike had lasted nearly four months.

title: Oscar Mayer Quarter Net Below That of 71 Period
description: Earnings of Oscar Mayer & Co. for the first fiscal quarter ended last Saturday will be lower than those for the yearago period, Oscar G. Mayer, chairman, told the annual meeting in Chicago yesterday. In the 13 weeks ended Jan. 30, 1971, the company had earnings of $5,760,000, or 62 cents a share, on salesitof $159,870,000.

title: Cavaliers, Braves Split
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 1 (UPI)Austin Carr scored 12 of his 19 points in the third period tonight to help the Cleveland Cavaliers defeat Buffalo, 10499, in a regulation game, but the Braves gained a 9190 victory in a replay of the last four seconds of a protested contest.

title: The City That Joyce Knew Has Changed
description: DUBLIN  No. 7 Eccles Street is gone now. The tower at Sandycove is closed. Nelson's Pillar, the statue on O'Connell Street, was blown up five years ago by the Irish Republican Army. And Davy Byrne's pub is now a carpeted lounge with purple pillars, South Sea landscapes and a sedate clientele of young couples, businessmen and tourists. The Dublin that Joyce knewso much of it is gone, said John Ryan, former owner of the Bailey Pub (known as the Burton in Ulysses) and editor of The Dublin, a literary magazine. Joyce's Dublin was a huge family. Everyone knew one another. They were like a special breed of city sparrows that have vanished with age. Along the bleak, rainswept boardwalk, Sandymount Strand (Am I walking into eternity along Sandymount Strand?), Vivian Igoe, the 27yearold secretary of the James Joyce Foundation, said quietly: Joyce boasted that if the city were razed to the ground it could be raised up again by using his book as a blueprint. It's not so, anymore. By the time the 1970's are out, none of Joyce's Dublin will be left. The Georgian houses are going. The people are changing. And, of course, a lot of the Irish don't especially care about James Joyce.

title: GAS PIPELINE PROFIT SET NEW HIGH IN 71
description: The Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corporation yesterday reported new highs in revenues and earnings for 1971.

title: S.E.C. HEARINGS SET ON HOT NEW ISSUES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb.The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today a series of public hearings aimed at finding out whether new rules were needed to protect investors who buy hot issues new issues of stock that have a fast runup in price.

title: Economy Dominates Puerto Rico's Politics
description: SAN JUAN, P. R.The once volatile issue of Puerto Rico's commonwealth status, which dominated political debates here for years, is being overshadorved by a growing dispute over the state of the economy.

title: Vehicle Output Up
description: DETROIT, Feb. 1 (UPI) Booming truck production raised total vehicle output during January to nearly 1 million units, the four major auto manufacturers reported today.

title: Francesca Kress Is Married To Paul Boyesen in Norway
description: Miss Francesca McCormick Kress and Paul Kael Boyesen were married at noon yesterday in a civil ceremony at the Registry Office in Oslo, Norway.

title: OffDuty Police Lieutenant Killed by HitRun Driver
description: A 39yearold offduty police lieutenant was killed last night after he was apparently struck by a hitandrun driver in the Huguenot section of Staten Island.

title: Chou Berates India
description: PEKING, Feb, 1 (Agence FrancePresse)  In a virulent attack on India Premier Chou pledged China's support today for selfdetermination in Indian Kashmir and for the safeguarding of Pakistan's territoral integrity.

title: THOMAS G. WOLFE, A SOCIAL WORKER
description: Thomas G. Wolfe, for the past decade executive director of the GoddardRiverside Community Center, died Monday of a heart attack at his home, 515 East 14th Street. He was 52 years old.

title: Joyceans Here to Mark 3 Anniversaries Tonight
description: The James Joyce Society convenes in New York tonight at 8 at the Gotham Book Mart, 41 West 47th Street, to observe a trilogy of anniversaries  Joyce's 90th, Ulysses's 50th and the society's 25th.

title: Merger News
description: The Federal Trade Commission announced yesterday that it has provisionally approved consent order requiring the Lehigh Portland Cement Company to divest itself within four years of a number of readymix concrete plants it acquired in Virginia and Florida. The order would end the F.T.C.'s complaint proceeding, filed in 1966, that Lehigh's acquisitions of the plants injured competition. Under the order, Lehigh has to divest 11 plants in Virginia acquired from the Virginia Concrete Company. The order also requires that Lehigh sell either six plants in Florida acquired from the Materials Service Corporation and the Acme Concrete Corporation or Lehigh's own cement manufacturing plant in Dade County, Fla.

title: Music: Previn Conducts
description: It was almost an allRachmaninoff program, except that Andre Previn opened with William Schuman's American Festival Overture. The London Symphony Orchestra, on an American tour, gave a concert in Carnegie Hall Monday night that had the Russian composer's Second Symphony and Paganini Rhapsody occupying most of the evening. The sophisticates, who despise Rachmaninoff, stayed away. The public, which adores him, turned out in large numbers.

title: Jackson Gets. Little Support in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 1  Gov. Jimmy Carter gave Senator Henry M. Jackson a very friendly introduction, and Lieut. Gov. Lester G. Maddox warmly shook Mr. Jackson's hand when the Senator addressed a joint essidn of the Georgia General ssembly yesterday.

title: Diversified Cancels Declared Dividend
description: Diversified Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that its directors had rescinded the regular quarterly dividend of cents a share declared on Jan. 10 for payment Jan. 31.

title: Shutdown of Nuclear Plant in Jersey Blamed for Death of Thousands of Fish
description: New Jersey environmental officials are all but convinced that a sudden removal of thermal pollution was responsible for the killing of thousands of fish last Friday near a nuclear power plant in Ocean County.

title: Patulski of Irish Is Drafted First By Bills
description: Walt Patulski, yes. Ed Marinaro and Pat Sullivan, maybe.

title: Youth Who Left School Is a Novelist at 17
description: To be a published novelist at any age is the lot of a comparatively small number of people. But to be one at 17 is the luck of only a very few. One of these is Rafael Yglesias, whose Hide Fox, And All After has just been issued by Doubleday.

title: WALL ST. ANSWERS S.E.C.'S PROPOSALS
description: Wall Street responded yesterday to the controversial proposals of the Securities and Exchange Commission governing the safekeeping of customers cash and securities at brokerage houses.

title: TV: Willowbrook State School, the Big Town's Leper Colony'
description: For the last several weeks, Willowbrook State School has been getting prominent local, and even national, attention. With 5,300 patients, the Staten Island school is one of the largest institutions for the mentally retarded in the world.

title: Where Ulysses Bloomed, Plus la Meme Chose
description: PARIS, Feb. 1Joyce? Connais pas.

title: Ballet: The Folklorico
description: Mexico's Ballet Folklorico, directed by Amelia Hernandez, returned for its eighth visit last night at the City Center with a somewhat modified and festive program. It differed just enough from the program seen here in 1970 to suggest that new wine in old bottles tastes better than one expects.

title: Poverty Aide Hints Agnew Interfered in Suit in Jersey
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1A Republican who heads a controversial Federal antipoverty program accused Vice President Agnew today of bringing possibly improper political influence to bear on a lawsuit filed by poor people against the city of Camden, N.J.

title: Economic Council Warns State It Faces LongRange Weakness
description: New York State's economic brain trust is warning that a longerrange weakness may be developing in some parts of the state's economy and that the temporary slump, felt everywhere, may have masked more basic structural changes here.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1President Nixon is now concentrating on his forthcoming visit to Chinathe great diplomatic experiment of his first term in office. He is working his way through a mountain of briefing papers, studying the transcripts of the Kissinger. Chou Enlal conversations, and quietly putting out the word not to expect too much from this month's spectacular Journey.

title: Brokerage Firm Incorporattes
description: Irving G. Kaufmann & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange, a partnership since its founding six years ago, has incorporated. Irving G. Kaufmann, founder and senlior partner of the firm, has become chairman.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Why is unemployment so sticky? In December, 1971, the jobless rate was still at 6 per cent, about where it had been a year earlier. I am determined to reduce that number significantly in 1972, President Nixon has said. His Council of Economic Advisers is forecasting that the unemployment rate will be in the neighborhood of 5 per cent by the end of this year. But even if gross national product ex1 pands as the C.E.A. predictsabout $100 billion, with the output of real goods and services climbing by 6 per centsome economists outside the Administration think unemployment will come down only to 5.5 per cent by the end of 1972.

title: New French Revolution: Mandatory Price Tags on Everything
description: PARIS, Feb. 1 (Reuters)A new French Revolution began todayone in merchandisingas a new consumer protection law went into effect.

title: Philip LeBoutillier Dead at 91; Retailing Leader Headed Best's
description: Philip. LeBoutillier, for many years a major factor in retail merchandising in this city, died yesterday in a nursing home in Greenwich, Conn. He was 91 years old and lived at 2 East 70th Street and Lake Placid, N.Y.

title: GREECE INTRODUCES A NEW LOYALTY VOW
description: ATHENS, Feb. 1A Greek seeking government employment must formally repudiate the views of any close relative linked to a subversive group, according to a decision by the militarybacked Cabinet published here today.

title: Gold Prices Set Records;
description: LONDON, Feb. 1 (AP)The price of gold soared by $1 an ounce in London and Zurich today, and set records on markets across Europe. The rush to buy gold helped send the value of the United States dollar down on foreignexchange markets.

title: Hanoi Denies Report Of Cambodia Contacts
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Feb 1 (Agence FrancePresse)The Foreign Ministry said today that reports of contacts between the Cambodian Government in Pnompenh and North Vietnany were nothing but a hoax.

title: STATE BODY URGES THE LEGALIZATION OF ALL GAMBLING
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1A special commission study recommended today that New York State change its Constitution and take over the multibilliondollar field of illicit gambling.

title: This Bill Limits Beer To Those Over 40
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 1 (UPI)The Oklahoma House voted 39 to 18 today for an amendment, to prohibit persons under 40 years of age from drinking beer.

title: State Presses Its Inquiry Into Westbury Drug Case
description: The mystery of who gave the ups to Frisco Fagin and Early Henry thickened yesterday when their trainerdrivers easily passed liedetector tests.

title: Man in the News
description: LONDON, Feb. 1  Eight years ago a distinguished team of American judges and lawyers came to England to study the system of criminal law. Shortly after, an equally luminous English team returned the visit.

title: Construction Spending Rises
description: Pierre A. Rinfret, an economist who frequently has taken unconventional positions on the business outlook  he said about 1970 that there ain't going to be no recessioncame down solidly yesterday on the side of the conservatives. He predicted a somewhat less expansionary economy in 1972 than most of his colleagues expect.

title: Pros Conquer Chaps
description: MEMPHIS, Feb. 1 (AP)Coach Babe McCarthy of Memphis won his 200th American Basketball Association regularseason game tonight as the Pros topped the Dallas Chaparrals, 9887.

title: Price Changes
description: The Reynolds Metals Company said yesterday that it would raise prices on most of its lines of aluminum commercial and farm roofing and siding by approximately 4 per cent.

title: $2BILLION IN U.S. AID APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The House of Representatives today approved United States contributions of nearly $2billion to the World Bank and two other international lending agencies formed to aid the world's poorer countires.

title: HISS CASALS UPSET BY THE OTHER EVERT
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 1 (AP)Jeannie Evert, 14yearold amateur of Fort Lauderdale, upset Rosemary Casals, 46, 63, 63, today in the $25,000 women's international tennis tournament.

title: Breaking Up City Hall: III
description: SYRACUSENeighborhoods, particularly in large cities, have been rediscovered, not by the people who live in themthey've always known about thembut by political activists and theorists of right and left. A growing body of nonideological scholars and citizens also are seeking ways to increase citizens control over their own lives and over the quality and quantity of local servicesespecially services which touch people who live in the least affluent areas of our great cities.

title: U.S. Sales Of the Book At 880,000
description: When it first appeared, James Joyce's revolutionary novel, Ulysses, was not a ripplecausing literary pebble; it was a tidal wave washing away accepted standards for writing.

title: SMITH OF WINGS STOPS LEAFS, 40
description: DETROIT, Feb. 1 (AP)Goals by Alex Delvecchio and Mickey Redmond led the Detroit Red Wings to a 40 National Hockey League victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: President Nixon has pinpointed the predicament in which the U. S. Government finds itself in Indochina. The President's proposals are indeed generous and farreaching. They provide for a political as well as a military end to the war. In fact, they are quite similar to the McCarthy platform rejected by the Democratic National Convention in 1968. The only element lacking is trust.

title: Amex and OTC Prices Rise 4th Day
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthe counter market ended higher yesterday for the fourth consecutive session in active trading.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: I find it disturbing that some of the Democratic Presidential candidates were taken in by President Nixon's new peace plan. Although Mr. Nixon did not mention it in his speech, point five of the eightpoint proposal would require North Vietnam to withdraw all its forces from South Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia. This is in essence the same sixmonth mutual withdrawal plan offered by President Johnson. He also offered free elections.

title: Nixon Economic Aide Cautions Congress on Cutting U.S. Deficit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1One of the Administration's top economists told Congress today that it should not try to reduce next year's budget deficit significantly, not even by closing tax loopholes.

title: Moscow Is Seeking to Exploit Hanoi's Uneasiness Over China
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1The Soviet Union today took a new step in what appears to be campaign to exploit North Vietnam's uneasiness over President Nixon's forthcoming visit to China and thereby increase Moscow's influence in Hanoi.

title: Rep. Garmatz of Maryland Says He Won't Run Again
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 1Representative Edward A. Garmatz, chairman of the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries for the last six years, announced today that because of poor health he would not seek reelection.

title: S. KINGSLEY SHULL
description: NORTH CALDWELL, N.J., Feb. 1S. Kingsley. Shull, director of engineering planning and practices for the Western Electric Company, died yesterday He was 61 years old and lived at 41 Brookside Terrace.

title: Employe Health Course Offered
description: One out of every three men in this room will likely die of heart attack, was the preamble to a news conference here yesterday.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: There is much in the Indochina proposals of President Nixon for peace lovers to rejoice over, but there remains one discrepancy which leaves their acceptance much in doubt.

title: Nixon Affirms Welfare View After Reagan Hints Shift
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Gov. Ronald Reagan of California suggested today that President Nixon no longer believes in his own plan for a guaranteed income for the nation's poor.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: F.T.C. The President signed an Executive order permitting H. Everett Maclntyre to continue as a member of the Federal Trade Commission until Feb. 28, 1973, despite compulsory retirement provisions of Federal law. Mr. MacIntyre will be 71 Thursday.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: In his address to the nation on the Vietnam peace negotiations, President Nixon said the following: Honest and patriotic Americans have disagreed as to whether we should have become involved at all nine years ago.

title: Recycled Newsprint Used
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 1 (UPI)The Chicago Daily News was printed today entirely on recycled newsprint. The publisher, Field Enterprises, Inc., which has a plant in Alsip, 111., that reclaims old newspapers, said 50 per cent of every day's editions of The Daily News and The SunTimes were printed on recycled paper.

title: Trust Case Charges Dairy Group With MilkPrice Manipulations
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Justice Department filed suit today against one of the nation's three largest milk marketing cooperatives, charging it with a variety of illegal actions designed to keep milk prices high for its members and low for nonmembers.

title: City Tax Rise, Linked to Fleischmann Proposals
description: The chairman of the Board of Education's finance committee said yesterday that if the proposals of the special state education commission were enacted, residents here would pay more in higher taxes than the city would receive in additional school aid from the state.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan; Who's Above Politics?
description: Politicians base decisions on the politics of situations. All politicians, not just the President of the United States.

title: 13 Democrats, 3 Republicans Selected for Wisconsin Ballot
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 1Every Democrat who considers himself a Presidential contender and some who do not were entered today in the Wisconsin primary.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The contest between Senator George McGovern and Mayor Lindsay for the allegiance of the Democratic leftand hopefully, for part of its centeris beginning to take on the acrimonious overtones of the 1968 race between Eugene J. McCarthy and Robert F. Kennedy. Bad feeling between the two camps was evident almost as soon as Mr. Lindsay entered the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination in late December, almost a full year after Senator McGovern had begun his campaign.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Sol Hurok made a personal appearance yesterday at the City Center to say that last week's bombing of his office would not change any of his plans to present talent, Soviet or other, wherever he can.

title: CELTICS CONQUER BULLETS, 115108
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 1 (UPI)Dave Cowens scored 32 points and pulled down 21 rebounds for the Boston Celtics, who pulled away in the final two minutes for a 115108 victory over the Baltimore Bullets in the National Basketball Association tonight. It was Boston's fourth victory in a row.

title: Dublin Aide, Here, Hints Moves to Oust British
description: Dr. Patrick Hillery, Ireland's Foreign Minister, said last night that it was possible his country might take action to remove British soldiers from Northern Ireland.

title: German Passenger Jet Crashes on Test Flight
description: BONN, Feb. 1One of two prototypes of West Germany's first jet passenger aircraft crashed at Bremen today. The Swiss test pilot, Hans Bardill, was killed when his parachute failed to open.

title: KNICKS VANQUISH PISTONS, 115106
description: After trailing by 13 points with one minute left in the third period, the Knicks rallied behind Dave DeBusschere and Bill Bradley for 40 points in the final quarter to overwhelm the hapless Detroit Pistons, 115106, last night at Madison Square Garden before a capacity crowd of 19,588.

title: TWO BANDITS SLAIN IN HOLDUP AT A. & P.
description: A police stakeout unit shot and killed two men who attempted to rob an A. & P supermarket at 357 Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn last night, the police said.

title: DUBLINERS ATTACK BRITISH EMBASSY
description: DUBLIN, Feb. 1 A bomb shattered some windows at the British Embassy here today and the Union Jack was burned as a wave of antiBritish demonstrations swept through the Irish Republic for the second day.

title: Killing of 13 Unites Catholics in Anger In a Sorrowful City
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Feb. 1  This city is consumed with sorrow. Stores, factories and Roman Catholic schools are closed. Mourning (flags flutter in the silent streets.

title: U.S. IS CONSIDERING MASSTRANSIT AID
description: A Department of Transportation official disclosed yesterday that the Nixon Administration was taking a new look at the possibility of subsidizing daytoday losses on the nation's masstransit systems. It has consistently opposed such subsidies in the past.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: Nothing is served by silence, said the President in his televised address, when the other side exploits our good faith to divide America and to avoid the conference table. Our nation's honor would have been served by silence.

title: House Reform in Danger
description: A serious move is afoot to undo one of the most important advances that Congressional reformers have managed to put through. Eighteen months ago they won a change in the rules of the House of Representatives allow just twenty members to demand a recorded teller vote when that chamber, sitting as a Committee of the Whole, considers amendments to pending legislation. The reformers did away, in effect, with that ancient hypocrisy whereby a Congressman could vote aye on bill, for the record, the day after he had anonymously voted to wreck it with crippling amendments.

title: Top Hughes Aides Facing Subpoenas In StateFederal Book Investigation
description: State and Federal investigators looking into the tangled case of the purported Howard R. Hughes autobiography are tentatively planning to subpoena top aides of the recluse industrialist rather than try to get Mr. Hughes himself before a grand jury.

title: Capital Reports Rise in Crime, Under Increasing Mafia Control
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)Organized crime in the nation's capital is on the rise, with narcotics; loansharking, gambling and hijacking under increasing control by the Mafia, according to a District of Columbia report to the Federal Government.

title: Advertising:
description: A couple of years ago there was a magazine called Quest that was sent free to the upperincome homes that were on Metromedia's Metromail Elite list. Although the magazine was independent of Metxomail, it went out of business when the list did.

title: Reactions to Peace Plan
description: President Nixon's new Vietnam peace proposal comes very close to an abject surrender to Communist aggression in Southeast Asia.

title: CREWS FOR U.S. TV ARRIVE IN PEKING
description: PEKING, Feb. 1A Trans World Airlines plane carrying 61 radio and television technicians landed of Peking's civil airport today, becoming the first United States commercial aircraft to fly into China in more than 20 years. It brought the broadcasting crews that will relay live coverage of President Nixon's visit here later this month to the outside world.

title: Princeton Plans $600,000 Stage Project
description: Princeton University is expanding and enlivening its participation in the professional theaterat a cost of $600,000. The core of the expansion will be the reinstitution next fall of a professional repertory company at the university's McCarter Theater. According to Daniel Seltzer, professor of English and chairman of Princeton's Committee on Theater, the new company will be on as high a level as possible.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on defining aggression10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Enemy Gains in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 1 (AP) The Pathet Lao and North Vietnamese forces were reported today to have expanded their control of part of the northern Laotian road linking Vientiane with the royal capital of Luang Prabang.

title: Lawyers Calticized
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI) Virginia H. Knauer, President Nixon's consumer adviser, accused the American Trial Lawyers Association today of selfish and devious opposition to nofault auto insurance. Mrs. Knauer, in turn, was accused of using Nazilike tactics.

title: PHONE RATE RISE IS DUE TOMORROW
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1The Public Service Commission said today that the increase in telephone rates it approved Jan. 17 could go into effect at 12:01 A.M. Thursday.

title: Jets: Barkum May Get Sauer's Job or Lammons's
description: In an attempt to replace George Sauer, who passed the game by, and Pete Lammons, whom the game has passed by, the Jets drafted Jerome Barkum yesterday and touched off a possible realignment of their receiving corps.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 1 (Reuters)  Information Minister Long Boret denied today that the Cambodian Government itself had so far undertaken any contacts, direct or indirect, with a view to starting peace talks with North Vietnam.

title: Barbers, Beauticians and Others Debate Unisex Salons at Hearing
description: The question under discussion at a public hearing held yesterday by John P. Lomenzo, New York Secretary of State, was this: Should men be permitted to have their hair cut and styled in beauty parlors?

title: SPERRY DISPLAYS CARE IN LIEDER
description: Paul Sperry is not a tenor of great vocal power or electricity, but his success with Schumann's Dichterliebe at Alice Tully Hall Monday night showed that one need not have the resources of Consolidated Edison to be an interesting lieder singer. Mr. Sperry, aided by Martin Katz's warm but lightly graded piano accompaniment, scaled the Schumann down to fit his own needs, working with the utmost care and never pushing beyond a moderately loud tone.

title: Cougars Beat Rockets
description: DENVER, Feb. 1 (AP)Wendell Badner and Joe Caldwell scored clutch baskets in the final minute tonight, lifting the Carolina Cougars to a 117108 victory over the Denver Rockets.

title: FrontDoor Thefts Are Called Cargo Industry's Greatest Peril
description: Truck hijacks make the headlines, but they only account for 20 per cent of the $1.5billion lost annually in transportation crime, a top official of the United States Department of Transportation said yesterday.

title: Giants Take a Long Step, But in What Direction?
description: After all the drafting, just what have the New York Giants accomplished?

title: Extra Police Protection For Murphy, 2 Others
description: Special security measures were ordered yesterday to protect Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, Chief of Patrol Donald Cawley and John Kiernan, president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, following anonymous telephone threats against the three.

title: CRITIC WINS POINT AT A.E.C. HEARINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Atomic Energy Commission's hearing into the safety of the nuclear reactors of the future opened today with about six hours of wrangling over legal issues.

title: Taylor Upsets Okker
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 2 (UPI)Roger Taylor upset Tom Okker, 7.6, 63, in the opening round of the $50,000 Fidelity World Championship Tennis tournament today.

title: Advertising:
description: Since everybody and his brother, it seems, eventually gets into magazine publishing and since there seems to be little written to help a fledgling publisher, we thought it might be helpful if we asked a few folks already in the business how they'd do it differently if they were starting again.

title: Chief Analyst at Bache Quits to Join Sartorius
description: Monte J. Gordon, formerly senior vice president and a chairman of the investmentpolicy committee for Bache & Co., has resigned and will join Sartorius & Co., another brokerage firm, Feb. 14, Mr. Gordon said yesterday.

title: Notes on People
description: W. Averell Harriman has given a major collection of paintings by 19th and 20th century European masters to the National Gallery of Art in Washington.

title: Chess: Columbia Team Trimphs In Pan American Tourney
description: The Columbia University chess team, an aggregation of four men and an alternate, won the 1971 PanAmerican Intercollegiate Tournament at Toronto with 7 match points. Western Ontario was second and a tie for third, with 6 points, was shared by Massachusetts Institute of Technology, City College of New York and Chicago.

title: For Mary Lindsay, Candor Is the Key
description: Some time in the next week or so, Mrs. John V. Lindsay will campaign for her husband ln Florida, presumably speaking from platforms, shaking hands and plunging into the indignities of public life.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Ma Bell is distributing millions of new Yellow Pages editions, each weighing five pounds, and not collecting the discarded ones for recycling. Everywhere I go I see great piles of these big, fat books awaiting the garbage collectors. How come?

title: Reserve Board Sets Guidelines To Speed Clearing of Checks
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) The Federal Reserve Board adopted today guidelines aimed to speed up the nation's checkprocessing system, saying that the revised system would make it possible for Americans to use deposited pay checks sooner.

title: Birth Notice 1  No Title
description: Birth Notice 1  No Title

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Feb. 2State Senator Harold C. Arcaro Jr., a 36yearold Providence lawyer, announced today that he would oppose Gov. Frank Licht in the Democratic primary in September.

title: Photos of Mars Disclose a Giant Volcano
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2A volcano with a base 500 miles broaddouble that of any such feature on earthand a height of at least four miles has been photographed on Mars.

title: The U. of Montana Branches Out Here To Find Funds to Preserve a Forest
description: The University of Montana, whose 28,000acre Lubrecht Experimental Forest near Missoula contains dozens of species, came here yesterday in search of a species whose natural habitat is believed to be New York.

title: SADAT IN MOSCOW IN QUEST FOR ARMS
description: CAIRO, Feb. 2  President Anwar elSadat flew to Moscow today to press the Soviet leaders for more weaponry and active support to enable Cairo to fix a zero hour for an assault against Israel.

title: VIEW IN WALL ST, IS GUARDED HOPE
description: The initial reaction in Wall Street to the proposals made yesterday by the Securities and Exchange Commission on the future structure of the securities markets was guardedly optimistic.

title: RICHARD MESSNER OF PRINTING FIRMI
description: TEANECK, N. J., Feb. 2 Richard Messner, president of the Marbridge Printing Company of New York; a division of the Adams Group, Inc., died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 64 years old and lived here.

title: Herbert Marcus Jr. Dead at 58; Served New York Life in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Feb. 2  Herbert Marcus Jr., third son of the cofounder of the NeimanMarcus department store, and an executive here for the New York Life Insurance Company, died today at his home. He was 58 years old.

title: In Grief and in Anger, Londonderry's Catholics Bury Their Dead
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Feb. 2Weeping and vowing vengeance, the Roman Catholic community of Londonderry bade an anguished firewell today to the 13 men kiled by British soldiers in a civil rights demonstration here on Sunday.

title: Science Talent Search Names 12 in City Region
description: Forty high school seniorsincluding 10 from New York City, one from Long Island and one from New Jersey  were named yesterday as the most promising young scientists in the 31st annual Westinghouse Science Talent Search.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Miss Reichel Wed To David Bronner
description: Miss Miriam Reichel, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. 0. Asher Reichel of New York, was married here last evening to David Bronner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Chaim Bronner of Antwerp, Belgium.

title: New Hampshire Drive for Mills Opens
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb. 2 The opening phase of a fiveweek writeIn campaign for Representative Wilbur D. Mills in the Democratic Presidential primary here has presented a new challenge to Senator Edmund S. Muskie.

title: No U. S. Role in Ulster
description: Even if the United States had not made such a mess of most of its recent interventions abroad, it would seem obvious that the last place for this Government to become involved is in the Northern Ireland catastrophe. Such talents as official Washington has for resolving highly complicated problems can find full employment in coping with neglected domestic ills and in extricating this country from its tragic military adventure in Indochina.

title: 24th Designated the First Model Precinct
description: The 24th Precinct, headquartered at 151 West 100th Street, was formally designated yesterday as the city's first model precinct by Police Comthissioner Patrick V. Murphy, who said he hoped it would be the beginning of the new Police Department that is my dream.

title: Hundreds of Copies of Hughes Memos Are Readily Available in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Feb. 2Personal papers of Howard Hughes have been widely circulated here over the last few years, and hundreds of copies of memorandums about his thoughts and business affairs are easily available.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your San. 19 editorial entitled  and Sad Plan for Colleges termed the State University of New York tuition increases proposed by Governor Rockefeller protective tariffs to make highcost private colleges appear more competitive. You gave no evidence that private institutions are highcost, and In general they are not, as compared with New York's public colleges.

title: HusbandandWife Team of Anthropologists Urge a New View of Marriage
description: George O'Neill was a Columbia student and Nona, his wifetobe, was a Barnard girl when they began to date. And when they were wed mtlre than a quartercentury ago, the institution of marriage generally implied a set of customs and rules that were inviolate.

title: 5,000 Japanese Welcome ExSoldier
description: TOKYO, Feb. 2 After 31 years of exile and privation, Shokichi Yokoi returned to an emotional welcome in Japan today, bringing with him his World War II rifle, tears of joy and an apology to Emperor Hirohito.

title: Later Calcutta! Curtain
description: Beginning next Monday, the curtain for Oh! Calcutta! at the Belasco Theater, will go up at 8 P.M. instead of the current 7:30.

title: Winter Olympics Open In Splendor at Sapporo
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Thursday, Feb. 3  The Winter Olympic Games, torn after 48 years by fierce controversy over commercialism in skiing, were declared open today by Emperor Hirohito in this northernmost island of Japan.

title: Irish Foreign Minister Terms British Ulster Policy Lunatic
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 2The Foreign Minister of the Irish Republic, Dr. Patrick J. Hillery, declared here today that the United States and other allied governments must use moral pressure to get Britain to give up her lunatic policies in Northern Ireland.

title: Conclusions of S.E.C. Policy Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Following is the text of the conclusions of the policy statement by the Securities and Exchange Commission on the future structure of the securities markets:

title: Personal Finance,
description: Some lenders call it an impound account. Others call it a trust account. Still others refer to it as an escrow account.

title: DRAFT NUMBERS CHOSEN FOR 1973
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The nearly two million men born in 1953 were assigned Selective Service lottery numbers today determining the order in which they will be subject to the military draft.

title: Bengalis in Dacca Coping With Problems
description: DACCA, Pakistan  In the narrow, teeming, warshattered streets of the Old Section of Dacca, Mohammed Aman Ulla Azim, a youthful Bangladesh Red. Cross field officer, and a volunteer team of Dacca University students lifted boxes of canned milk from an overloaded jeep and stacked them inside a dank little streetfront building.

title: Berlinger Acts in Welfare Chaos Here
description: The State Welfare Inspector General, George F. Berlinger, has called on the state deputy commissioner in charge of New York City welfare affairs to fix responsibility for asserted chaos in the city's welfare administration.

title: F.T.C. Backs Occidental On Hooker's Stock Sale
description: The Federal Trade Commission approved yesterday the Occidental Petroleum Corporation's proposed divestiture of certain fertilizermanufacturing facilities to the Beker Chemical Corporation for more than $18.9million.

title: KASHMIR EXCLUDES WIFE OF ABDULLAH
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 2Begum Abdullah, wife of the exiled Kashmiri leader, Sheik Adbullah, has been barred from entering her home state for six months, it was officially announced today.

title: Tenants in Building Owned by the City Heatless in Strike
description: Office workers in a 20story building at 1 Liberty Street found their offices without heat yesterday as a result of the strike of operating engineers.

title: Nixon Yields, Will Accept Test Of His Guaranteed Income Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Bowing to pressure from Senate critics, the White House said today that it would accept testing of President Nixon's income maintenance program for the poor so action could be obtained this year on his broad welfare reform proposals.

title: Dubious Emergency
description: President Nixon's warning that the West Coast dock strike is spiking progress toward economic recovery might cause more concern in Congress if this Administration had not worked so hard in earlier years to persuade the country that the impact of waterfront tieups is always grossly exaggerated.

title: O.E.O. Atlanta Chief Named
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. (AP)William L. Walker, a Federal housing official in Arkansas, was appointed today director of the Office of Economic Opportunity's Atlanta region.

title: Hapless Trail Blazers Drop Todd as Coach
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. (UPI)Rolland Todd, coach of the floundering Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Association, was dismissed today. The player personnel director, Stu Inman, was named coach for the balance of the season. Inman is a former head coach at San Jose State.

title: CELTICS TROUNCE BULLS BY 124100
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2 (AP)The Boston Celtics, led by John Havlicek and Dave Cowens, streaked to a 6244 halftime lead tonight and rolled to a 124100 victory over the Chicago Bulls in the National Basketball Association. The Celtics fifth victory in a row gave them a sixgame lead over the New York Knicks in the Atlantic Division.

title: Lobster Cantonese? They May Think You Mean Americanese
description: The trouble with Chinese restaurants is that they don't serve Chinese food. That, at least; is the frequent suspicion of every nonChinese who has looked up from his moo goo gal pan to see a Chinese family of 12 across the room eating strange and delectablelooking dishes that he, the Occidental, could never get the kitchen to prepare for his coarse, Western palate.

title: 'The Visitors' Portrays Ordeal of a Threatened G.I.
description: Elia Kazan's "The Visitors," written by his eldest son, Chris Kazan, and shot in 16-mm, entirely in and around the Kazan country home in Newton, Conn., concerns the ordeal of Bill Schmidt (James Woods), an ex-G.I. who, with Martha (Patricia Joyce), the unwed mother of his baby, is threatened for 16 hours by two former buddies against whom the G.I. brought evidence of war crimes during their tour of duty in Vietnam.In the course of a routine patrol, the two former soldiers, along with other members of their squad, had first raped a young Vietnamese girl, who might possibly have been a Vietcong sympathizer, and then bayoneted her to death.It is one of the oddities of "The Visitors," which is otherwise not exactly shy of exposition, that although Schmidt remains a shadowy character, the very fact that he can't explain why he turned in his two friends is one of the most interesting and meaningful aspects of the movie. It's as if it had been an unconscious impulse, a dim vestige of the kind of honor that today is as practical as an appendix."The Visitors" is a far from great film. It insists on saying too much about large issues when it should keep quiet and it's ambiguous when one has a right to expect explicit answers. Yet it is an extremely moving film, partly, I think, because everythingfrom the physical production to the melodramais kept in small scale, as if not to get in the way of, or to confuse, its very legitimate expression of a major American sorrow.I must emphasize, however, that I find "The Visitors" moving not only because I happen to share the Kazans' political and moral concerns. As anyone who squirmed through the idiocies of "Johnny Got His Gun" knows, the sharing of such concerns can often be a fate worse than death. Chris Kazan's screenplay sometimes has all of the grace of the Dalton Trumbo non-classic, especially in speeches that persist in spelling out simplistic points that, with any luck, we've already gotten."The Visitors," however, is very much an Elia Kazan film and he is still a first-rate director, particularly of actors, in this case of four new young actors who possess the mystery and self-assurance of much more experienced performers. Especially effective is Steve Rails-back as the more murderous of the two visitors, a young man who looks like the sort of a nice, clean-cut, small-town American boy who could eat a piece of apple pie with one hand and cut a friend's throat with the other. However, I also liked Chico Martinez as the other visitor and both Miss Joyce and Mr. Woods, whose performances  mannerisms, movements, ways of touching each othermust supply explanations that Chris Kazan was apparently too busy to develop.The nominal star of the film is Patrick McVey as Miss Joyce's novelist-father, and it may be that my reaction to him is as much influenced by the unpleasant character he plays as by his performance, which does seem a bit broad even for a football-loving whisky-guzzling, right-wing fool. Says Miss Joyce at one point: "My mother couldn't stand himand neither could his other two wives."For the most part, the elder Kazan keeps "The Visitors" remarkably unfancy and untricky. There is one almost nostalgic moment that recalls Mr. Kazan's best work of the 1950's, when, as in certain scenes in "A Streetcar Named Desire" and "On the Waterfront," he employs highly theatrical melodramain this case, a scene in which Miss Joyce allows herself to be sexually drawn to one of the terrifying visitorsin such a way that the theatricality becomes real dramatic substance, and not a substitution for it."The Visitors," which opened yesterday at the Little Carnegie, repeatedly reminded me of Sam Peckinpah's more flamboyant "Straw Dogs," and although I don't think it ranks higher in any appreciable respect, I'd much rather argue about itwhat's right with it as well as what's wrong with it.

title: BOND PRICES UP BY THIN MARGIN
description: The bondmarket recovery that sprang to life Tuesday afternoon failed to continue yesterday, but most prices did not fall back, either.

title: BRUINS TRIUMPH OVER RANGERS, 20; LEAD BY 8 POINTS
description: For the fourth straight time this season, the Rangers failed to halt the redoubtable Boston Bruins and suffered a 20 defeat at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: MOST STOCKS RISE AS VOLUME BOOMS
description: Most stocks surged higher in heavy trading yesterday, with buying interest ranging all the way from lowprice speculative issues to some of the bluest of blue chips.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Though The Times urges voters to concentrate their efforts behind the man they regard as best, we voters would do better to concentrate on the person we regard as bestone who is not only qualified but unfailingly true to his or her convictions and absolutely straight with the American people.

title: Miss Devlin's Flat Invaded
description: LONDON, Feb. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)  Intruders tonight broke into and wrecked the London apartment used by Bernadette Devlin.

title: Bridge: Sectional Tournament Is Set For Weekend in Local Clubs
description: New York enthusiasts have their annual opportunity this weekend to compete in a sectional tournament without going beyond the confines of their local club.

title: Gen. Joseph McNarriey, 78, Dies; Succeeded Eisenhower in 1945
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Feb. 2 (UPI)Air Force Gen. Joseph T. McNarney, retired, who succeeded General of the Army. Dwight D. Eisenhower as United States Commander hi Europe after World War II, died yesterday at Scripps Memorial Hospital here. He was 78 years old.

title: SHIP AND 35 MISSING OFF COAST OF TEXAS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 2 (AP)  The United States Coast Guard reported today that a 572foot tanker with 35 persons aboard was missing off the coast of Galveston, Tex.

title: Bowie Snowed Out, OTB Action Shifts To Gulf stream Park
description: Offtrack bettors here switched horses in midstream yesterday after a snowstorm forced cancellation of the thoroughbred racing program at Bowie Race Course in Maryland.

title: Hollings Calls Wallace Bona Fide Democrat
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Senator Ernest F. Hollings of South Carolina, taking issue with Lawrence F. O'Brien, the Democratic National Chairman, said today he would set a plate for Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama at party fund  raising dinner here tomorrow.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Shop Talk
description: The playhouse made from recycled corrugated fiberboard that George Jensen shoppers are more than a bit surprised to find on the store's lower level, is indeed more decorative than that old standby the cardboard carton. And, at $15, it's more expensive, too. The price may be worth it to a father seeking at least an hour of challenge and tantalizing pleasure in assembling the 5footdiameter dome, using the sometimes difficult to decipher directions and some murky photographs to guide him. After it's up, the rest of the family can have a great time refitting the base corners to the frame every time the lightweight structure is moved.

title: 2 Relief Agencies Announce Projects for East Pakistan
description: The board of directors of the International Rescue Committee approved yesterday a medical and educational program for the people in East Pakistan.

title: Sports of The Times
description: To the vast relief of Japan's Olympic Organizing Committee and America's National Broadcasting Company, the 11th Winter Olympic Games will adhere to schedule because the onetime threat of mass withdrawal by mutinous skiers has failed to materialize. This was brinkmanship a very high order, a battle of principle between the fundamentally amateur International Olympic Committee and the shamelessly nonamateur Federation Internationale de Ski. The F.I.S. has been fighting a rearguard action for years in trying to protect its semipros and outright professionals against the relentless vigilance of both the I.O.C. and its archdisciple of pure amateurism, Avery Brundage. The 8hyearold Olympic president even has won a new nickname in refrigerated circles. They call him the Abominable Snowman. Even if he had wanted to look the other way, though, Avery hardly could have missed observing that the skiers did more than wax their skies. The best of them also waxed rich. They bought resort hotels and banked $50,000 a year, which is pretty adroit financing for fellows who don't even have jobs. The highminded Brundage drew up a list of the most blatant offenders and picked about 40 for getting the old heaveho.

title: Air Strikes Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 2 (UPI)  The United States command reported today that two more air strikes had been made on North Vietnam yesterday, raising to seven the total for the day.

title: 2 BANK TAKEOVERS ON L.I. ARE ALLOWED
description: The New York State Banking Board announced yesterday its approval of two proposals by bank holding companies to acquire affiliates on Long Island.

title: Advertising:
description: R. J. Reynolds, the nation's No. 1 cigarette manufacturer that hasn't been too big in cigars, has a cigar now that looks a lot like a cigarette and Is prepared to take it national.

title: Big Bands Sound At Roseland Again
description: The big name bands are coming back, says Louis J. Nrecker, who has seen bands come and go for 53 years at Roseland Dance City, the huge ballroom he owns on 52d Street just off Broadway. There is more than wistful nostalgia behind his statement.

title: Kennedy Fears New Pakistan Arms Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, said today that there was cause to believe that the Administration was planning to resume arms shipments to Pakistan.

title: Buckley Asks Ulster Pullout
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) Senator James L. Buckley, Conservative  Republican of New York, urged the Senate today to adopt a resolution calling for the United States to aid in the orderly withdrawal of British troops from Northern Ireland. He said the killing of 13 demonstrators in Londonderry on Sunday, underscores the horror of the developments now taking place in Northern Ireland, and the need for United States settlement efforts.

title: LENNEN IS SEEKING A REORGANIZATION
description: Lennen & Newell, Inc., which ended 1970 as the nation's thirteenth largest advertising agency with domestic billings of $140million, filed under Chapter XI here yesterday listing $10,993,000 in liabilities, much of that owed to the media.

title: Chief Analyst at Bache Quits to Join Sartorius
description: Monte J. Gordon, formerly senior vice president and a chairman of the investmentpolicy committee for Bache & Co., has resigned and will join Sartorius & Co., another brokerage firm, Feb. 14, Mr. Gordon said yesterday.

title: Leading Guerrilla In Mexico Reported Killed in Car Crash
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 2The man regarded as the spiritual leader of Mexico's guerrilla movement  Genaro Vasquez Rojaswas killed today in an automobile accident, according to the Minister of the Interior.

title: PLAN FOR HOUSING IN BROOKLYN CUT
description: To avoid the kind of confrontation generated by the plan for lowincome housing in Forest Hills, Queens, a compromise scattersite proposal for the East New York section of Brooklyn was presented yesterday to the City Planning Commission.

title: STATE MIGHT FILE BROKER SUIT TODAY
description: Charles Plohn & Co., a former member of the New York Stock Exchange, which is in liquidation, is expected to be named in an action to be filed today by the New York State Attorney General's office.

title: Muskie Peace Plan Bids Saigon Settle or Lose Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Senator Edmund S. Muskie outlined today a twopoint plan to end the war in Vietnam. He declared that President Nixon's peace proposals were no more than an attempt to win at the conference table what we have not won and cannot win on the battlefield.

title: 'The Jerusalem File' Arrives
description: The dedication of idealistic Israeli and Arab youth to achieve understanding and stop internecine strife in the Holy Land after the six-day war is merely indicated melodramatically in "The Jerusalem File," which opened yesterday at the R.K.O. 59th Street Twin Theater.The importance of the issues and the character of its principals are, sadly enough, only shadowy footnotes to the sporadic shootings and Raoul Coutard's color photography of teeming Jerusalem and the sun-drenched, arid archeological digs where it was shot with the vivid authenticity he captured in "Z" and some of the Godard films."The Jerusalem File" is a manhunt, essentially, despite Troy Kennedy Martin's script, which bristles with implications but cries for fuller explanations and John Flynn's energetic direction. Involved are Bruce Davison, as a seemingly apolitical American archeology student caught in the literal and political crossfire; Zeev Revah, once his classmate at Yale and now an Arab leader on the run from rival, dissident Arab terrorists, and Donald Pleasence, as an Israeli itelligence officer trailing Revah and Davison in order to end the clashes.There also are Nicol Williamson, as a dourly realistic archeology professor anxious to achieve peace among the embattled; Daria Halprin, as a curvaceous Israeli student-activist amorously torn between Williamson and Davison, and Koya Yair Rubin, as the Israeli student-militant leader seeking a clandestine meeting with Revah through Davison, in order to settle all the unpleasantness.Aside from their seriousness of purpose, they are largely two-dimensional characters, with the exception of Donald Pleasence, who emerges as a convincingly human, if implacable, sleuth. A basic weakness of "The Jerusalem File" is perhaps underlined best by Mr. Williamson, when he snaps, "You're playing at politics and you're no good at it."The politics, the disparate motivations and the implicit drama of youth defeated by a world they don't want are only vaguely projected and are secondary to the chase and shoot-em-up action of "The Jerusalem File."

title: Rockets Top Stars
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Feb. 2 (AP)The hotshooting Denver Rockets, led by Ralph Simpson's 23 points, beat the Utah Stars, 122116, tonight.

title: KISSINGER LINKS AID BILL TO TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Henry A. Kissinger has expressed the view that the Senate defeat of the foreign aid bill last Oct. 29 was among a number of factors that led to the suspension of the secret negotiations between the United States and North Vietnam in November.

title: Saigon Says Its Jets Destroyed 4 Tanks Just Inside Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Feb. 3 (Reuters) The Saigon command said today that South Vietnamese jets destroyed four North Vietnamese tanks yesterday in the border area where Laos, Cambodia and Vietnam meet.

title: Stans Sees Slow Growth in China Trade
description: Some expansion in trade may result from the President's trip to Peking, but commerce between China and the United States is likely to develop at a much slower rate than with the Soviet Union, Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said here last night.

title: PETER KASIUS, 78, EXSTATE OFFICIAL
description: Peter Kasius, former deputy commissioner of the State Department of Social Services for New York City, died yesterday at his home, 25519 Walden Avenue, Great Neck, L.I. He was 78 years old.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2After awhile the children cease being children and become people. New people, as it were. One day, looking around the house, you notice that the children are all gone, and in their place are these new people. Big new people, very often. Great big new people.

title: Cougars Beat Chaps
description: DALLAS, Feb. 2 (AP)Jim McDaniels and Joe Caldwell scored 16 points each in the second half tonight to lead the Carolina Cougars of a 110101 victory over the Dallas Chaps in the American Basketball Association.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Rheingold Corporation, a New Yorkbased management company, in a toplevel realignment, has elected Robert W. Beeler, 49 years old, as president: He had previously been president of the company's softdrink division. John E. Halgney, 59, who Mr. Beeler succeeds, continues as chief executive officer and chairman of the board. Robert P. Hyde, 41, was elected president of the Rheingold Breweries, Inc., a subsidiary. He succeeds Theodore Rosenak, 69, who becomes chairman of the board of the subsidiary and continues as a director of the parent organization in charge of legislative programs and special projects. Before joining Rheingold in 1968, Mr. Beeler held marketing posts with Procter & Gamble and ColgatePalmolive. Mr. Hyde joined Rheingold in 1970 and before that had been vice presidentmarketing of the Stroh Brewery Company, Detroit.

title: BLACK CAUCUS PLANS FORUM ON PRIORITIES
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 2  The Congressional Black Caucus announced today that it, along with the Harvard Institute of Politics and four major newspapers, would sponsor a conference here in April aimed at establishing new domestic priorities for the nation.

title: Egypt Discounts Action
description: CAIRO, Feb. 2 (Reuters)Egypt tonight dismissed Israel's acceptance of the United States proposal for talks to reopen the Suez Canal, the official Middle East News Agency reported.

title: New Headmaster to Take Over At Riverdale as It Turns Coed
description: A new headmaster will take over at the Riverdale Country School in June amid a major institutional shift.

title: Policeman Killed in Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 2 (UPI)  Terrorists hurled handgrenades at two military police posts in markets here today, killing a policeman and wounding 11 other persons.

title: U.S. GROUP ACCUSED IN SOVIET INCIDENT
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 2A Soviet newspaper charged today that 11 American university students and their theology professor had tried to sneak religious literaIture into the Soviet Union recently but were stopped by customs officers, who seized the material.

title: L.I. Bridge Financing Beyond Tolls Urged
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2A financial analysis of the proposed Oyster BayRye Bridge across Long Island Sound strongly emphasizes that the project needs financial security beyond the planned tell revenues.

title: Mayor Meets With Jewish Aides on Housing Issue
description: Mayor Lindsay held a private, threehour meeting yesterday with 18 leaders of Queens and citywide Jewish organizations that have strongly opposed the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills.

title: The Negotiation Way
description: As a result of President Nixon's disclosure of the secret peace talks and the publication of Hanoi's ninepoint plan and Washington's counterproposal, Americans and the world for the first time can examine the real negotiating postures taken by both sides in secret, rather than public proposals framed with an eye to propaganda advantage.

title: Rockets Triumph, 11188
