description: KENITRA, Morocco, Feb. 3 A military court was told here today that rightwing army officers tried to overthrow the Moroccan monarchy last summer because they were outraged by the corrupt and rotten regime of King Hassan H.

title: The New Malthusians
description: The new Malthusianism, rapidly becoming a major intellectual current in the West, fundamentally challenges traditional wisdom about the desirability of gowth, progress and expansion. That challenge finds dramatic expression in A Blueprint for Survival, just issued by a group of British ecologists. Longterm human survival on this planet, they argue, requires reversal of the trends that have dominated the earth since the Rev. Thomas Malthus first sounded his warning about population growing faster than the food supply. Under their prescription, populations must be cut, standards of living reduced, much of modern technology abandoned and the great urban concentrations of humanity replaced with a multitude of small communities. The goal would be a stable society and an economy which could persist indefinitely in equilibrium with earth's resources.

title: John H. Pratt Jr. Dies at 77; ExPitneyBowes Executive
description: John H. Pratt Jr., a retired vice president of PitneyBowes, Inc., producer of mailing meters and other busines equipment, died of a hart attack yesterday in Martinique. He had been on a vacation cruise on the Queen Elizabeth II. Mr. Pratt was 77 years old and lived on Ridge Acres Road in Darien, Conn.

title: Irving's Researcher Subpoenaed To Face Inquiry in Hughes Case
description: The Federal authorities issued yesterday a subpoena requiring a grand jury appearance by Richard R. Suskind, the researcher who worked for Clifford Irving at the time the novelist contends he assembled the autobiography of Howard R. Hughes.

title: FORDHAM QUINTET TRIUMPHS, 8575
description: Fordham and Manhattan, the Bronx rivals whose campuses are about three miles apart, scored victories last night in an allmetropolitan college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden.

title: Webster, Coach of Giants, To Undergo Ear Surgery
description: RED BANK, N. J., Feb. 3 (AP) Alex Webster, coach of the New York Giants football team, was admitted to Riverview Hospital today for surgery to correct an ear problem.

title: FIGHTING RETURNS TO U MINH FOREST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Feb. 4 (UPI) Military spokesmen said today that South Vietnamese troops clashed with guerrillas in four sharp battles yesterday in sudden outbreak of fighting in the U Minh Forest, a longtime enemy base area at the southern tip of the country.

title: New Zealanders Set 4Mile Relay Record
description: Feb. 3 (UPI)A New Zealand fourmile relay team broke the world record for the event by 6.2 seconds tonight with a time of 16 minutes 2.8 seconds. The old record was held by a University of Oregon team.

title: NO. CAROLINA FIVE TRIUMPHS, 7169
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Feb. 3 (AP)Fourthranked North Carolina broke open a tight defensive struggle in the second half tonight and went on to a 7159 Atlantic Coast Conference victory over the Wake Forest five.

title: Merger News
description: A spokesman for Montedison, formerly Montecatini Edison, said yesterday in Milan, Italy, that the company was discussing a takeover of SniaViscosa, Italy's largest producer of synthetic fibers. Terms were not disclosed. This was the first time that Montedison, Italy's largest chemical group, had confirmed persistent reports that it planned to acquire SniaViscosa, which has sales of approxi mately $340million a year A takeover would make Montedison the major Italian producer of synthetic fibers, since, it already controls three other concerns in the fieldChatilIon, Polymer and Rhodiatoce. SniaViscosa's full name is Societa Nazionale Industria Applicazioni Viscosa.

title: ROBERT A. ECK
description: YARDLEY, Pa., Feb. 3Robert A. Eck, a vice president and member of the board of directors of the Goodall Rubber Company of Trenton, N. J., died Wednesday evening at his home in Lower Makefield Township after a long illness. He was 61 years old.

title: Gerhard Samuel Conducts Mozart and 2 Premieres
description: The group with the polyglot timeAmerican Symphony Orchestra da Camerawas heard in Town Hall Wednesday night. Why not Orchestra da Camera della Sinfonica Americana? Or Chamber Orchestra of the American Symphony? Anyway, Gerhard Samuel conducted it, He has made a sizable reputation on the West Coast as conductor of the Oakland Symphony and, more recently, associate conductor of the Los Angeles Philharmonic.

title: Legislator Joins Grandfatheri
description: PELHAM, N. H., Feb. 3 (AP) John Richardson, 23 years old, was elected to the New Hampshire legislature in a special election yesterday. He will serve the town with Representative Arthur Peabody, 81, his grandfather. Both are Democrats.

title: National Airlines Machinists Back $6Million Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) The International Association of Machinists announced today that its members had approved a settlement of $6million in back pay from National Airlines, which the union called the biggest such settlement in labor history.

title: Savard Rejoining Canadians
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 3 (AP) Serge Savard, Montreal Carladiens defenseman out of action for more than a year because of a fractured left leg, left for Los Angeles today to return to active duty with the club.

title: FRANCIS BELLAMY, AUTHOR, WAS 85
description: BOSTON, Feb. 3 Francis Rufus Bellamy, author and magazine editor, died yesterday in a nursing home in Waltham, Mass. He was 85 years old and lived in Castine, Me.

title: Rogers Denounces Muskie's Comments on Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3Secretary of State William P. Rogers accused Senator Edmund S. Muskie today of jeopardizing the prospects for a negotiated peace in Vietnam by rejecting the President's latest peace proposals before the enemy replied formally.

title: SALES AT RECORDS AT RETAIL CHAINS
description: The nation's large chain organizations completing their fiscal year in January reported record sales yesterday for the month and the year.

title: Books of The Times
description: THEARNHEITER AFFAIR. By Neil Sheehan. 304 pages. Illustrated. Random House. $7.95.

title: Times Pressman Killed
description: Anthony Marabito, a 55yearold pressman who had worked for five years for The New York Times, was killed by a hitandrun driver on Wednesday at 6:20 P.M., at 14th Avenue and 79th Street, Brooklyn, while walking to the subway on his way to work. Mr. Marabito, who lived at 1344 79th Street, in the Bay Ridge section, leaves his wife, Josephine, and three children. The police have asked that anyone with information about the incident call 3720220.

title: Penguins Win on Carom
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 3 (UPI)Bryan Hextall scored on a rebound in the third period tonight to give the Pittsburgh Penguins a 43 triumph over the St. Louis Blues.

title: RUSSELL SCORES 36 AS WARRIORS ROMP
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 3 (UPI)Cazzie Russell scored 36 points and Nate Thurmond and Clyde Lee controlled the boards tonight, powering the Golden State Warriors to a 132115 National Basketbal I Association victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: College Sports Notes
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association will be going to court in the near future to defend its 1.6 academic eligibility rule for athletes and its penalty of indefinite probation against the University of California.

title: Soviet Reforms Work at Test Bakery
description: MOSCOW, Feb 3  Our bread sticks won a Government award for quality last year, Miss Yelena T. Degtyaryuk, manager of the Moscow Experimental Roll and Biscuit Bakery, announced proudly.

title: WAGE SUIT LABELS EXEMPTION SCANTY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 The International Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers filed suit against the Cost of Living Council today, charging that the council had unlawfully restricted exemptions front wage controls to workers earning $1.90 an hour or under.

title: 5 Americans Die in Action In Week in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 3 (UPI)Five Americans were killed in action last week in South Vietnam, the United States command reported today. It was the 17th consecutive week in which there were fewer than 10 American cornbat deaths.

title: Meat Loaf in Biscuit Dough
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Himalayan Hypocrisy
description: The Indian Government, which recently went to war to uphold democracy and the right of selfdetermination in East Bengal, has approved an order forbidding the return to Kashmir of the wife of the popular Kashmiri leader, Sheik Abdullah. Abdullah himself, the Kashmiri counterpart of Sheik Mujibur Rahman of Bangladesh, has been barred from the predominantly Moslem state since before last year's Indian elections.

title: Bridge:
description: To lose one partner may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose two lookelike carelessness was more or less the verdict of Lady Bracknell in The Importance of Being Earnest.

title: EXAMINER FAVORS AIRMAIL RATE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3A hearing examiner for the Postal Rate Commission recommended a 2cent increase in airmail rates today but said that most other mail rates should remain unchanged.

title: RIBICOFF RESUMES WELFARE EFFORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3His differences with the White House largely resolved, Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff officially resumed a key role today in President Nixon's fight for broad welfare reforms.

title: May Chairman Is Leaving; Babcock Named President
description: Morton D. May, chairman of the May Department Stores Company; announced his retirement yesterday following a meeting of the company's board here.

title: New Books
description: A Week to Kill, by David Delman; The Saint and the People Importers, by Leslie Charteris; To Kill a Witch, by Bill Knox (Doubleday, $4.95 each). Crime Club detective stories.

title: State Plans Reforms
description: ALBANY, Feb. 3Inmates at all of the state's major correctional facilities will soon be able to confer with prison officials on ways of improving conditions at the institutions and on ways of improving custodial, housekeeping and treatment prograins, the state's Corrections Commissioner announced today.

title: Superfecta Pays $19,001 To 8 Westbury Bettors
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 3 A record superfecta payoff of $19,001.80 was recorded at rainswept Roosevelt Raceway tonight with eight lucky fans holding tickets on the combination of 3518. The OTB letters were CEIH.

title: New Ruling on Cable TV Limits Its BigCity Growth
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3Moving cautiously toward a new era of diversity and mass participation in television, the Federal Communications Commission issued rules today designed to stimulate the growth of cable TV from its rural base into the nation's smaller cities.

title: Scouts Mark 62d Birthday, Seeking Greater Relevance
description: The Boy Scouts of America is celebrating its 62d birthday this month amid plans to become more relevant and responsive to its 4.5 million young members and prospective members.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon and Yevgeny Yevtushenko, who share a publisher, exchanged views of each other's countries yesterday during a 70minute White House meeting.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: ACTIVITIES. The President met separately with United States Ambassadors Kenneth Keating of India and Ellsworth Bunker of South Vietnam. He also greeted athletes who had participated in antidrug radio and television commercials and met with yevgeny yevtushenko, the Russian poet. He conferred the rank of ambassador on Joseph Martin Jr., a consultant to the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, and designated him to serve as chief United States representative to the conference of the Commission on Disarmament, which begins its annual meeting Feb 29 in Geneva. The President departed for Key Biscayne, where he will spend the weekend.

title: Excerpts From Revised Vietcong Peace Proposals
description: PARIS, Feb. 3Following are excerpts from the revised Vietcong proposals presented at the session of the Vietnam peace talks today:

title: Maryland to Study A Sports Complex For Baltimore Site
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Feb. 3 (AP)  Gov. Marvin Mandel announced plans today to study the feasibility of building a multisports complex hi downtown Baltimore as a means of keeping the National Football League Baltimore Colts in Maryland.

title: U.S Chess Official Seeing Icelanders About Match
description: THE HAGUE, Feb. 3  The chairman of the American Chess Federation, Ed Edmundson, flew today from Amsterdam to Reykjavik to discuss, with the Icelandic Chess Federation the site of the world championship chess match between Bobby Fischer of the United States and Boris passky of the Soviet Union.

title: ALBANY JOB LIST IS MADE PUBLIC
description: ALBANY, Feb. 3 A number of persons who are rarely seen in Albany are listed as employes of the Legislature and are receiving salaries as high as $12,000.

title: Fact Finder to Submit Plan In Madison School Dispute
description: MADISON TOWNSHIP, N. J., Feb. 3The Board of Education and the Madison Township Education Association agreed early today to let a state factfinder submit proposals for settling the 10dayold teachers strike that has shut down one school and sharply curtailed education at 18 others in this suburban district.

title: RAIL TRAFFIC OFF; TRUCK TONNAGE UP
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3Freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended Jan. 29 was below the volume in the corresponding week of last year. Intercity truck tonnage in the period registered an increase.

title: Who Shot Ron porambo? A Puzzling Newark Case
description: NEWARKI love this city, said Ron Porambo, surveying the little bars and boardedup houses in the heart of Nel,Vark's battered and heavily black Central Ward. I love these people.

title: Thant Accepts Fellowship With Institute in Chicago
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 3Former Secretary General Thant has accepted senior fellowship with the Adlai Stevenson Institute of International Affairs in Chicago, it was announced here today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is regrettable that John J. McCloy (letter Jan. 24) neglects to make reference to the one defect in our court system most responsible for its present difficulties. My judgment is based upon more than onehalf century of active and close observation of the courts of New York. I have also had the opportunity to observe and engage in litigation in other states, affording me the opportunity to make comparisons.

title: Miss Proell Dominates Downhill Field
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 3If anything is certain in such a precarious sport as skiing, it's that Annemarie Proell will win Saturday's downhill, opening event of the Olympic Alpine program.

title: Laver Easily Ousts Pilic And Ashe Averts Upset
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 3 (AP)Topseeded Rod Laver of Australia advanced easily in today's second round of the Fidelity World Championship Tennis tournament, but thirdseeded Arthur Ashe of Richmond narrowly missed being upset.

title: SKIERS ARE BARRED FROM SHOWING BRAND
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Friday, Feb. 4 (Reuters)The International Ski Federation acted tor day to deny ski manufacturers free publicity from gold medal winners in the Winter Olympics here.

title: DRUG PRICE LISTS URGED AT HEARING
description: Charging that buyers of prescription drugs in New York City get less pricing information than buyers of soap flakes, Consumer Affairs Commissioner Bess Myerson yesterday held a oneday hearing on whether pharmacies should be required to display prices of the most commonly prescribed drugs.

title: BRONX WIFE RAPED; SUSPECT, 24, SEIZED
description: A 24yearold automobile repair man was arrested yesterday after he allegedly raped and robbed a young woman at gunpoint in her apartment in a Bronx housing development.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Commission on Human Rights, working group on South Africa10:30 A.M.

title: Man in the News
description: In December, 1962, Frank J. Rogers was prosecuting an extortion case in State Supreme Court at 100 Centre Street.

title: Little Man Gives Knicks Big Woe
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 3Preparing for a Slate of three games in the next three days, the Knicks, were still a big groggy today from the oneman beating inflicted upon them last night by Nate Archibald of the Cincinnati Royals.

title: VIETCONG PRESENT REVISED PROPOSAL AT TALKS IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Feb. 3  The Vietcong presented at the peace talks here today a revised version of their sevenpoint peace plan of last July that appeared more conciliatory to the preslent South Vietnamese Government.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 President Nixon is apparently going to allow the members of his Cabinet to get deeply involved in the controversies of the Presidential election campaign, and this raises some obvious difficulties and dangers.

title: Blacks, in Shift, Forming Unit for Mrs. Chisholm
description: A number of prominent black political figures who had previously sought to name a black male for the Democratic Presidential nomination have agreed to support the candidacy of Representative Shirley Chisholm of Brooklyn.

title: Jackson Seeks Early Tennessee Primary
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3Senator Henry M. Jackson's strategists, fearing that his chances in the pivotal Florida primary have been sharply curtailed by the candidacy of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, are renewing their effort to push forward the date of the Tennessee primary.

title: TV: C.B.S. Adapts Capote's The Glass House
description: With few exceptions, madefor television movies are sorry excursions into the predictable and the banal. One of the exceptions is being presented tonight, between and 10:30, on the The New C.B.S. Friday Night Movies. Although its official title is Truman Capote's The Glass House,' I suspect that Tracy Keenan Wynn's adaptation retains little material from the original story by Mr. Capote and Wyatt Cooper.

title: Store Sales Advance
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The Department of Commerce reported today that departmentstore sales for the week ended Jan. 29 were an estimated $579million, an increase of per cent from $543million in the corresponding week last year. Retailstore sales for the latest week were an estimated $7,137,000,000.

title: 2 Players Injured as Kings And Canadiens Play 11 Tie
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 3 (UPI)Butch Goring of Los Angeles and Larry Pleau of Montreal traded secondperiod goals tonight as the Kings and Canadiens played to a 11 tie in an injurymarred match.

title: 2 A.W.O.L. U.S. Seamen In Turkish Police Custody
description: ANTALYA, Turkey, Feb. 3 (AP)Two American seamen, reported missing from a destroyer that called at this Mediterranean resort town, have been taken into custody in a hotel, the police reported today.

title: Thrift Units Are Divided On Conversion to Stock
description: Savings and loan associations and mutual savings bank interests throughout the United States remained divided yesterday in their reaction to a decision by the Federal Home Loan Bank Board permitting West Coast savings and loan association to convert to stock corporation.

title: U.S. and Canada Advance In Team Handball Trials
description: ELHKART, Ind., Feb. 3 (AP) The United States and Canada scored easy victories in the opening round of the Western Hemisphere eliminations in Olympic team handball last night.

title: Price Changes
description: The Reynolds Metals Company announced new price schedules yesterday that the large producer said were aimed at increasing selling prices of a dozen aluminum commodity lines. The changes were being made, the company said, to bring list prices more in line with market conditions. In some cases the new list prices will be higher than current listings, and in some cases lower, but all will rep resent increases over current selling levels, the company said in a statement from Richmond, Va.

title: Mystery Cloaks the Methadone Death Of Youth Here Who Posed as Addict
description: More than six months passed after his arrival from Puerto Rico before Rene Ramos figured out how he could survive here: He would become a welfare recipient by pretending to be a heroin addict.

title: Liquori Tests New Training Theory Tonight
description: TORONTO, Feb. 3Eager to test a new training theory but apprehensive about expecting too much too soon, Marty Liguori will take his first step toward Munich tomorrow night in the onemile run, at the Maple Leaf Indoor Games.

title: SALES AT RECORDS AT RETAIL CHAINS
description: The nation's large chain organizations completing their fiscal year in January reported record sales yesterday for the month and the year.

title: GREENVALE, L. I., Feb. 3C. W. Post College, led by Pete Haubner's game high of 27 points defeated the City College five, 7773, tonight.
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Feb. 3C. W. Post College, led by Pete Haubner's game high of 27 points defeated the City College five, 7773, tonight.

title: Modern's Picasso Show One of Finest Ever Held
description: The Museum of Modern Art, which is in possession of the world's greatest public collection of the works of Pablo Picasso, has for the first time brought together the bulk of this collection in a single exhibition. Organized as a birthday tribute to the artist, who was 90 years old last Oct. 25, the exhibition opened yesterday in the museum's firstfloor galleries at 11 West 53d Street.

title: U. S. Bars In in Ulster
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3Secretary of State William P. Rogers told Ireland today that the United States was not in position to intervene in the crisis in Northern Ireland.

title: The London Symphony Is Led By Previn in Brahms's Fourth
description: Andre Previn is no longer wunderkind; which is not necessarily a misfortune. It seems to have been that fearsome wit Leopold Godowsky who first pointed out that in the case, of the average wonderchild, the wonder disappears with age and the child remains. Mr. Previn, who conducted the London Symphony Orchestra at Carnegie Hall Wednesday night, is well past the wonder stage but he also has taken on signs of maturity, perhaps promising, perhaps not.

title: 3 Soviet Stars in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 3 (AP)Three Soviet athletesYevgeni Arzhanov, unbeaten at 800 meters the last two years; a high jumper, Juri Tarmek, and a sprinter, Boris Izmestez  will compete Saturday in the Knights of Columbus track meet.

title: 3 Share Lead With 65's On Ideal Hawaiian Links
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 3Spectators want to see birdies and eagles, suggested Lee Trevino after he carded a 68 in the $200,000 Hawaiian open tournament today. Otherwise they will go and play golf themselves. Let the pros tear up the course. That's What the public wants to see.

title: F.T.C. Is Told Bergdorf's Was Offered to 3 Retailers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3  Andrew Goodman, the president of Bergdorf Goodman of New York, told a Federal Trade Commission hearing today that he had made fruitless overtures to sell his company to three of the country's largest retail chains before approaching Broadway  Hale Stores Inc., of Los Angeles. He identified the chain as Federated Department Stores, Inc., of Cincinnati; the DaytonHudson Corporation of Minneapolis, and Marshall Field & Co., of Chicago.

title: Wide PentagonBusiness Links Discounted in Contracts Study
description: WASHINGTON, Feb: 3  Of the nation's 500 biggest corporations, 73ido a large amount of business with the Defense Departmentthat is, rank among the top 100 defense contractors a study disclosed today.

title: 3 FROM PLOHN FIRM ACCUSED IN COURT
description: Louis J. Lefkowitz, the State Attorney General, announced yesterday that he had filed an information in the New York City Criminal Court, charging three principals or former principals of Charles Plohn & Co., a defunct brokerage firm, with having illegally pledged customers securities for bank loans.

title: U.S. Boxer on Prison Leave Helps U.S. Beat British
description: LONDON, Feb. 3 (AP)Louis Slaughter, a lightheavyweight from Portsmouth, Va., and Duane Bobick, a heavyweight from Bowlus, Minn., won the last two bouts to give the United States amateur boxing squad a 64 victory over Britain today.

title: Mrs. Muriel Vanderbilt Adams, Society Leader, Dies in Florida
description: MIAMI, Feb. 3Mrs. Muriel Vanderbilt Adams, noted society woman, died today after being stricken, apparently with a heart attack, in a doctor's office. She was in her early seventies and had been staying with her sister, Mrs. Consuelo Vanderbilt Erle, at Golden Beach.

title: Executive Changes
description: James P. Gallatin has been elected senior vice president, Hugh A. Egan, vice president and controller, and David A. Plum, auditor, of the Fiduciary Trust Company of New York.

title: CONSUMER CREDIT UP IN DECEMBER
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 3 (AP)  Americans increased their installment debt by $8.4billion in 1971, up sharply from the 1970 growth, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: Bank Rates Remain Steady
description: The First National City Bank and the Irving Trust Company, two of the four major banks that have adopted a form of floating prime rate, announced yesterday that their rates for the week beginning next Monday would remain unchanged at 4 per cent. The banks moved to this level a week ago in response to further declines in the rate for commercial paper in the open market.

title: ItalianAmericans Mull Ethnic Roles
description: Nine Italian  Americans came together yesterday to discuss what it means to be both Italian and American. They were for the most part young and liberal, and they were interested in their past, but more concerned about their future.

title: OLIVER WILSON
description: Oliver Wilson, who had been a stereotyper for The New York Times from Dec. 31, 1941, until he retired on May 1, 1963. died on Wednesday. He was 83 years old and lived at 93 Thayer Street.

title: SCIENTISTS OPPOSE NEW RAIDS ON NORTH
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (UPI) An organization of scientists, social scientists and engineers expressed new opposition today to United States air raids on North Vietnam.

title: COLUMBIA VICTOR OVER YALE, 8569
description: Foley Jones and Ron Boyd scored 15 points each in the second half last night to lead Columbia to an 8569 victory over Yale before 1,034 fans in Alumni Gymnasium.

title: Suns End Warriors Streak
description: PHOENIX, Ariz, Feb. 4 (AP) The Phoenix Suns outscored Golden State, 146, midway through the third period tonight as they rallied to hand the Warriors their first defeat in 12 games, 113105.

title: Eagles Hire Richardson
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4 (AP) The Philadelphia Eagles hired Jess Richardson, a former National Football League player and coach, as defensive line coach. The club announced today that Richardson would succeed Jack Zilly.

title: Bridges Threatens Defiance of a Law On Dock Arbitration
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The leader of the striking West Coast longshoremen, Harry Bridges, threatened today to defy pending Congressional legislation requested by President Nixon ordering his union back to work.

title: STATE UNIT IS ASKING $4MILLION FROM OTB
description: ALBANY, Feb. 4 (AP)The State Tax Commission has asked the Off track Betting Commission to make up more than $4million in tax revenue the state says it lost last year because of offtrack betting on horse races.

title: MISS NATAL BEGINS STAND AT GASLIGHT II
description: Nanette Natal, a promising young singersongwriter, opened at the Gaslight II Wednesday night. Miss Natal's singing, big and outgoing at times, sweet and kittenish other times, is a superb vehicle for her original material. In addition, she is a far better than average guitarist, even though a firstnight nervousness seemed to bring on a certain amount of rhythmic uncertainty in her strumming.

title: Piston Depth Pays Off
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4 (AP) Jim Davis, who was pressed into service when Bob Lanier reported with a sore back, scored 31 points and grabbed 15 rebounds tonight as the Detroit Pistons defeated the Philadelphia 76ers, 118113.

title: KENNECOTT SUES CHILE ON NOTES
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation announced yesterday that it had brought two suits against Chile on 111 notes that the company holds in the expropriated El Teniente Mining Company in Chile.

title: Kletzki Is Unable to Keep Feb. 1617 Booking Here
description: Paul Kletzki will not conduct the Cleveland Orchestra in its Feb. 1617 concerts in Carnegie Hall as scheduled, because of illness.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a recent news article you reported that thirty leading British scientists warned that to avoid a world environmental catastrophe Britain should, among other measures, eventually cut her population by half.

title: BRITISH SOLDIERS SEAL OFF NEWRY IN HUNT FOR ARMS
description: NEWRY, Northern Ireland, Feb. 4British troops, in one of the biggest operations they have ever mounted in Northern Ireland, today sealed off all approaches to the border town of Newry, where a civilrights march is planned for Sunday.

title: TOPPER IN PACT WITH CREDITORS
description: The Topper Corporation, a financially troubled toy manufacturer, announced yesterday it had reached preliminary agreement with its secured lenders and that it expected its 1971 loss would wipe out its net worth, which was estimated at between $16  million and $17million as of Sept. 30:

title: Susan Corrock of U.S. Takes Third Place
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Saturday, Feb. 5 (AP)Marie Therese Nadig of Switzerland won the women's downhill ski race today as Susan Corrock of Ketchum, Idaho, finished third and gained the first medal for the United States in the 11th Winter Olympic Games.

title: MUSKIE DEFENDS HIS PEACE PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Democratic Presidential aspirants clashed with Republicans and one another today over Senator Edmund. S. Muskie's criticism of President Nixon's eightpoint peace proposal for Vietnam.

title: Dispute Over Hughes Book: Law Professor's Dream Case for Examination Day
description: The voice that came over transcontinental telephone Jan. 7, saying it was Howard R. Hughes and denying any part in Clifford Irving's The Autobiography of Howard Hughes, has raised as many legal questions as factual ones, as many theories about legal rights and liabilities as theories about the book's authorship.

title: A HOTDOG MAKER DEFENDS PRODUCT
description: Joseph Hagler, the scion of a family of kosher frankfurter makers in Brooklyn, yesterday defended the wholesomeness of hot dogs against recent attacks by Consumer Affairs Commissioner Bess Myerson and the magazine Consumer Reports.

title: Broken Cable Spoils Royal Welcome for Ark Royal
description: The Royal Navy's proudest ship, the aircraft carrier Ark Royal, churned into the Hudson River for a goodwill visit to the city yesterday and then churned out again, victim of a broken mooring chain.

title: Ulster Killings Spur Catholics To Resign Government Posts
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 4A widespread withdrawal of Roman Catholics from public office in Northern Ireland has picked up momentum with the killing of 13 civil rights demonstrators in Londonderry last Sunday.

title: Drives in Western Laos Seen as Threat by Thais
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 4 (UPI)A Government spokesman said today that new Communist offensives in western Laos posed a serious threat to Thalland.

title: O.E.O. LEGAL AIDE PLANS TO RESIGN
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 4The director of, the Federal Legal Services program, which is currently under investigation by Vice President Agnew, announced today, that he intended to resign today but had agreed to delay his departure for, about a week to avoid hurting the program.

title: Ard Schenk: Speed and Power on Ice
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 4The Olympic men's 5,000meter speedskating event turned out to be treat for the Dutch.

title: Decorators Respond to Call of the Wild by Bringing It Indoors
description: Nature has taken root inside the home as an international decorating trend.

title: BRITISH ESTABLISH BANGLADESH TIES
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Feb, 4 Britain and nine other Western countries recognized Bangladesh today. And this country, formerly East Pakistan, announced that it was seeking membership in the Commonwealth, a loose community of former British territories.

title: U.S. STEEL TO OPEN YOUNGSTOWN PLANT
description: The United States Steel Corporation announced yesterday that it would reopen its Youngstown, Ohio, steel plant within two weeks. The company said it would reopen five of the mill's 12 openhearth furnaces on Feb. 13 or 14, and one blast furnace on Feb. 18. Rollingmill operations are scheduled to resume on Feb. 16.

title: South African Editor Fined After Seizure of Documents
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Feb. 4 (AP)Benjamin Pogrund, night editor of The Rand Daily Mail, was fined $130 today and given a suspended ninemonth jail term. He was convicted of theft and subversion under the Suppression of Communism Act, which has often been used against opponents of the Government's policy of racial separation.

title: MURPHY IN FAVOR OF HEROIN CLINICS
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that he favored a limited, medically supervised heroin maintenance program for all drug addicts whose habits cannot be controlled with methadone.

title: Columbia College of Pharmacy May Be Forced to Shut Down
description: The 143yearold College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, an affiliate of Columbia University, is facing a $500,000 deficit in its $1million operating budget and may close its doors this June, college officials said yesterday.

title: Roaches on a Sub Tender?
description: NEW LONDON, Feb. 4 (UPI) The Navy has ordered an investigation into possible cockroach infestation aboard the submarine tender Fulton, it was reported today. Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut, asked the Navy to determine if there were cockroaches aboard the 530foot vessel, now moored at State Pier in New London.

title: Red Champagne? Hopes High
description: TBLISI, U.S.S.R.  In land of harddrinking, hardliving, bigeating Georgians who love spicy foods, Vasily Chirakadze is a maverick. He never drimcs cognac, never smokes, often skips breakfast and carefully avoids using pepper on his food.

title: Surrogate Candidate Picked in Bronx
description: Reform Democrats in the Bronx, looking to the June primaries, began a campaign yesterday with the announcement that Judge Lawrence H. Bernstein would be a candidate for nomination to the Surrogate Court in the Bronx.

title: L.I. Police Seeking Identity Of a Woman Found Slain
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., Feb. 4The burned body of a young woman who had apparently been stabbed to death was found early this morning beside a rural road here.

title: The Talk of Villeneuve SurLot
description: VILLENEUVE  SUR  LOT, FranceIn Paris an official at the Ministry of Justice apologetically ruled out a visit to the prison here. You see, she explained, nothing's happened there yetand if the inmates heard that a reporter was there, it might set something off.

title: Ruling by F.A.A. Sets Back The Stewart Jetport Plan
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority lost a major round yesterday in its fight against environmentalists and community groups to convert Stewart Airport, near Newburgh, N. Y., into a fourth major jetport for the New York area.

title: Raise the Roof!
description: Secretary of the Treasury Connally has gone before the House Ways and Means Committee to plead the Administration's case for an increase in the statutory ceiling on the public debt from $430 billion to $480billion. This $50billion increase, the largest ever requested by any Administration, will still not be big enough to last beyond February 1973.

title: Aides Split on Protection for Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The men who must decide which 1972 Presidential candidates will get Secret Service protection are still divided over whether it can or should be offered to Senator Edward M. Kennedy.

title: Soviet TV Interviews 18 Jews Seeking to Return From Israel
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 4Apparently trying to discourage the continued departure of Soviet Jews, Moscow television presented interviews today with 18 who had gone to Israel and now wanted to return.

title: TRUCKER SAID TO USE BANK CARD TOO WELL
description: A New Rochelle truck driver was accused yesterday of visiting 32 branches of the Chemical Bank of New York in five hours and 10 minutes one day and using a privilege card to withdraw $100 from each.

title: U.S. Sent Arms to Pakistan Despite Pledge to Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 4 A Government study showed today that the United States Air Force was airlifting to Pakistan on a priority basis more than half a million dollars worth of aviation spare parts in July, after Government spokesmen had assured Congress that arms shipments had been stopped. The shipments were said to include spare parts for F104 Starfighter jets.

title: Vachon Out Rest of Season
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 4 (UP1)The Los Angeles Kings goalie, Rogatien Vachon, was lost to the club today for the remainder of the National Hockey League season when Xrays disclosed torn ligaments in his left knee. He will undergo surgery tomorrow. Vachon was injured last night when the Kings played the Canadiens to a 11 tie.

title: City Suspends 26 Guards As Carriers of Pistols
description: Twentysix guards at city welfare centers and hospitals were suspended from their jobs yesterday for allegedly purchasing and possessing handguns.

title: Blues Thomson in Crash
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 4 (UPI)Floyd Thomson, a left wing for the St. Louis Blues of the National Hockey League, was injured today in a car crash in West St. Louis County. The Highway Patrol said Thomson's car rammed into the rear of an auto parked on the shoulder of U.S. 40. Al Arbour, the Blues coach, said the injury apparently was not serious.

title: New Meetings Set
description: PARIS, Feb, 4 (Reuters)Chile and her chief creditor nations agreed today to meet here again on Feb. 16 and Feb. 17 to continue talks on methods of rescheduling the most pressing of Chile's overseas debts.

title: Heath in New Appeal
description: LONDON, Feb. 4  Prime Minister Heath and the Northern Ireland Prime Minister, Brian Faulkner, issued a lastminute appeal tonight for cancellation of the planned civilrights march in Newry.

title: Polaris Missile Tested
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 4 (AP)The George Washington, a missilefiring submarine, successfully launched a Polaris A3 rocket down the Atlantic test range today.

title: The Risks of Development
description: LONDON  Environmentalists In growing numbers on both sides of the Atlantic are calling for a total reexamination of the world drive for economic development. It is ecologically insane and morally irresponsible, the argument goes, to encourage every country upon paths of exponential economic growth when finite limits such as climate change, due to energy use and resource depletion, are beginning to loom. Is this doomish view all fantasy?

title: STOCKS MOVE UP ON BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market, buoyed by some good news from Europe, moved higher yesterday across a fairly broad front. Lowprice issues continued their weeklong gain, although volume slackened on the New York Stock Exchange. Select glamour stocks moved steadily ahead.

title: Ecology Agency Admits Study Was Nonexistent
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency, which has been citing a California study to back up its skepticism about requiring the use of returnable cans and bottles to help solve the nation's waste and litter problems, has now conceded that such a study never existed.

title: LIQUORI IS THIRD IN SLOW MILE RUN
description: TORONTO, Feb. 4Marty Liguori came up short in the stretch tonight, just as he thought he might.

title: Notes On Metropolitan Corttaressnien
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Representative Robert H. Steele, a freshman Republican from Connecticut, was planning to call a news conference next Tuesday to announce the introduction of package of bills to aid local firemen with Federal grants for training, equipment and the like. The plans were upset abruptly last Friday morning when Mr. Steele's staff members picked up the Congressional Record artd read that parts of the Representative's package had been introduced individually by seven other House members.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Feb. 4A hundred years ago John Stuart Mill urged human society to limit its population and wealth and seek the stationary state. He had a vision of a cramped and depleted earth. He sincerely hoped, he said, that men will be content to be stationary long before necessity compels them to it.

title: George Benneyan, an Executive In Newspaper Promotion, Dead
description: WILLOW, N. Y., Feb. 4 George Benneyan, a newspaper and magazine promotion executive for 40 years until his retirement in 1960, died today in Kingston Hospital, after a brief illness. He was 77 years old and lived here.

title: Merger News
description: The American Zinc Company announced yesterday it has agreed in principle to acquire for approximately $11million the drilling equipment division of Westinghouse Air Brake Company, a wholly owned subsidiary of American Standard, Inc.

title: Opera: Berlioz Trojans
description: BOSTON, Feb. 4Hector Berlioz regarded his opera The Trojans, as his masterpiece, and he could have said of it, as was later said of Debussy's Pellas et Mlisande, that he did not compose it to be successful. In two sectionsThe Sacking of Troy and The Trojans at Carthagethe opera runs a little longer than Tristan and Isolde. There are no bangup arias, the action is minimal, the chorus plays an important role, the libretto is permeated with Virgil, and the music is of a noble, classic, postGluck quality.

title: Notes on People
description: On his 75th birthday, Ludwig Erhard, the man considered the architect of West Germany's postwar economic recovery is still warning his countrymen of the dangers of excessive consumption of economic goods leading to inflation and a breakdown of social order.

title: Group's New Chief Sets 1972 Plans
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 4Sam Karoll, who will take over tomorrow night as president of the Menswear Retailers of America at its annual convention here, has a clearly defined task in mind for the next year.

title: JENO BARTAL, CELLIST AND CONDUCTOR, DIES
description: Jeno Bartal, a cellist and conductor, died of influenza yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 151 West 54th Street.

title: Northeast Is Lashed By Storms
description: The winter's worst storm flailed inland areas of the Northeast yesterday with up to 18 inches of snow and violent winds. Bitter cold besieged the Middle West and penetrated all the way south to the Gulf Coast.

title: HAITIAN MINISTER GAINING IN POWER
description: PORTAUPRINCE, HaitiHaiti doesn't have the office of Premier, but many residents of this sometimes turbulent nation have bestowed that title on Luckner Cambronne.

title: Phone Workers Will Vote On Proposal to End Strike
description: Proposed terms for settling the nearly sevenmonthold strike against the New York Telephone Company will submitted to the 38,000 craftsmen for a mailballot ratification vote, the Communications Workers of America announced yesterday.

title: Leslie Bacon Trial Date Set On FireBombing Charge
description: A Federal judge said today that Leslie Bacon, would stand trial beginning May 15 on charges of conspiring to firebomb a branch of the First National City Bank at Madison Avenue and 91st Street.

title: An Answer to Blueprint
description: LONDONBritain is being assaulted by the environmentalists. The new magazine The Ecologist published what it called A Blueprint for Survival which reflects and sometimes amplifies a good many of the halfbaked anxieties about what is called the environmental crisis. On this occasion, the doctrine that dog should not eat dog notwithstanding, the magazine deserves to be taken to task if only for having recruited a statement of support from 33 distinguished people, many of them scientists, at least half of whom should have known better.

title: Lakers Set Back Bucks;
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 4 (AP)Jerry West scored 37 points and Wilt Chamberlain won his personal duel with Kareem AbdulJabber tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers moved five games ahead of Milwaukee in the loss column with a 118.105 victory over the Bucks in the National Basketball Association.

title: 5 ARRESTED HERE ON A DRUG CHARGE
description: Five Americans were accused yesterday of plotting to smuggle 10 pounds of cocaine into the United States from Bogota, Colombia.

title: 65,000 in New Orleans Mourn Mahalia Jackson
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 4 (Reuters)Mahalia Jackson, gospel singer, was honored today by her native city in memorial services.

title: Extortionist's Bomb Found At Disney World in Florida
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 4 (AP)  A bomb planted by an extortionist demanding $90,000 was found on the grounds of the giant Disney World amusement complex, sheriff's officers said today.

title: Pennsylvania Fails to Meet Deadline on Nursing Homes
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP)  All states except Pennsylvania have met the Feb. 1 deadline for correcting paperwork deficiencies in certifying skilled nursing homes in the Medicaid program, the Government announced today.

title: $967,550 Seized in Bronx As Drug Agents Arrest 2
description: A green suitcase containing almost a million dollars in cash was seized by narcotics agents when they arrested two men who were charged here yesterday with a conspiracy to distribute heroin.

title: Murphy's 135 Leads by. Stroke
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 4Bob Murphy found golf mentally tiring in the weird streak of weather that struck the players in the $200,000 Hawaiian open tournament today. Nevertheless he finished with a 70 for a 36hole aggregate of 135 to lead Fred Marti by one stroke.

title: ENIPLOYMENT UP AS JOBLESS RATE DECLINES TO 5.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The nation's job situation improved somewhat in January, although total unemployment remained high, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Independence Hall Losing Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4 Under plans announced today, Independence Hall will lose the Liberty Bell it has sheltered for more than two centuries.

title: DR. TITO CECCHERINI, MASONIC SOVEREIGN
description: ROME, Feb. 4  Dr. Tito Ceccherini, one of the sovereigns of the International Masonic Organization and physician to the family of the late Pope Pius XII, died here of a heart attack last Friday. He was 65 years old.

title: Armed Lads in Militia in Saigon Find Duty Is Fun
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 4  Vinh, a goodnatured 17yearold who likes American cigarettes and cowboy movies, carries an American carbine on his post when he is not snoozing or playing cards in the lobby of an apartment building on Tu Do Street.

title: SUBMARINE TO AID STUDY OF WALRUSES
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 4 (UPI) The Air Force says it is flying a little yellow submarine to Alaska so scientists will be able to study the habits of walruses under the Arctic ice cap.

title: Pakistan and Bangladesh
description: President Bhutto's decision to take Pakistan out of the Commonwealth in anticipation of Britain's recognition of Bangladesh yesterday was largely symbolic, designed to appease those Pakistanis who still have not accepted the loss of their eastern province.

title: Greeks Deny They Blacklisted 124 Books as AntiGovernment
description: ATHENS Feb. 4The militarybacked Greek Government denied today that it had blacklisted 124 books branded by the security services as Communist and antiGovernment.

title: White Rhodesians Cooling to Pact, Party Chief Says
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 4 A leader of Rhodesia's governing party, the Rhodesian Front, today expressed growing white opposition to the proposed settlement with Britain.

title: Peking Condemns Nixon's Proposal on Vietnam
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 4An official statement issued by the Chinese Government today, condemned President Nixon's eightpoint proposal for ending the war in Vietnam and reaffirmed China's support for the Communist cause in Indochina.

title: Knicks Await Results On Reed's Examination
description: BUFFALO, Fob. 4The Knicks awaited word tonight on the results of an exammation of Willis Reed, their ailing captain, conducted in Oklahoma City today by Dr. Don O'Donoghue, the noted orthopedic surgeon.

title: U.N. RHODESIA STEP VETOED BY BRITAIN
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Saturday, Feb. 5 Britain last night vetoed a United Nations Security Council resolution condemning the terms of the independence settlement that she worked out two months ago for Rhodesia.

title: Wilkens Paces Sonics
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 4 (AP)Coach Lenny Wilkens took command in the closing minutes tonight and led the Seattle Supersonics to a 118112 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers. Wilkens had 25 points, 6 in the final minute and a half.

title: Army Six Halts Williams
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 4 Matt Eaton and Ed Roubian broke a 22 tie, with thirdperiod goals to lead the Army hockey team to a 42 victory over Williams College tonight. Eaton knocked in a rebound at the 10minute mark to score what proved to be the winning goal.

title: BOULEZ RETURNS FOR SECOND SERIES
description: Back with the New York Philharmonic on Thursday night for his second series of concerts this season, Pierre Boulez plunged right into the Liszt survey that is taking up a large portion of the orchestra's programs. He led one of the composer's late works, the Via Crucis (Stations of the Cross) for chorus and organ.

title: Bulls Triumph, 110108
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 4 (UPI)Bob Love's baseline jump shot with six seconds left gave the Chicago Bulls a 110108 National Basketball Association victory over the Baltimore Bullets tonight.

title: Senator Allott Plans Bill To Allow Gold Ownership
description: DENVER, Feb. 4 (AP) Senator Gordon Allott plans to introduce a bill that would give individuals the right to own gold, he said today at the 75th Western Mining Conference.

title: 2 SUSPENDED BY S.E.C. UNDER STOCK LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP)The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today it had suspended two persons from association with any broker or dealers on grounds of violating Federal securities laws.

title: Princeton Is Upset
description: HANOVER, N. H., Feb. 4A sophomore guard, Bill Raynor, made a pair of jump shots and two foul shots in the final 90 seconds as Dartmouth held off favored Princeton and scored an 8179 Ivy League basketball victory tonight at Alumni Gym.

title: JAMES W. COOPER
description: James Wallace Cooper, vice president and treasurer of Glenoit Mills, Inc., died yesterday of cancer, in Tarboro, N. C. His age was 62.

title: Celtics Roll On, 122109
description: BOSTON, Feb. 4 (AP)The Boston Celtics outscored Cincinnati, 165, in the last three minutes of the third period tonight and went on to defeat the Royals, 122109, for their sixth straight National Basketball Association victory.

title: U.S. and Common Market Agree on Trade Package
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 4Negotiators for the United States and the Common Market reached a provisional agreement today on trade, breaking a deadlock that had threatened to cause serious deterioration in Atlantic relations and renewal of currency uncertainties.

title: COSTS OF CONCORDES PUT AT $60MILLION
description: PARIS, Feb. 4The first commercial models of the Concorde, the supersonic jetliner, will cost nearly $60million each, it was reported yesterday by Pierre D. Cot, the chief executive of Air France.

title: Cash and Walker, On BestBall of 55, Lead Astrojet Golf
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Feb. 4 (UPI)A Detroit combination, Norm Cash of the Tigers and Wayne Walker of the Lions, carded w 17underpar, bestball round of 55 today to take the firstround lead in the $30,000 Astrojet golf tournament.

title: MRS. GIOVANNA LAWFORD
description: Mrs. Giovanna Calastri Lawford, an artist, wife of Geoffrey Noel Lawford, architect, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. Her age was 62.

title: Sadat Arrives in Yugoslavia
description: PULA, Yugoslavia, Feb. (AP)President Sadat arrived here today from Moscow for twoday visit and talks with President Tito.

title: ISSEL TALLIES 36 AS COLONELS WIN
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 4 (AP)Dan Issel scored 36 points to lead the Kentucky Colonels to an easy 131111 American Basketball Association victory over the Pittsburgh Condors tonight.

title: BUILDERS UTILIZE TAX EXEMPTIONS
description: Construction is under way on four private apartment developments, taking advantage of a new city program of partial tax exemption that will enable the builders to hold rents to a range of $50 to $60 room a monthsubstantially lower than today's market rates for new construction.

title: Record of a Little Ice Age Is Discovered
description: From a study of ice extracted from deep within the Greenland ice sheet it appears that 89,500 years ago something catastrophic changed the climate from being warmer than today's to that of a fullfledged ice age.

title: RECORDS SOUGHT ON WILLOWBROOK
description: The Staten Island District Attorney's office yesterday requested that it be given transcripts of the testimony and exhibits offered at the current hearing on conditions at the Willowbrook State School for the retarded.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 29yearold resident of the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn was convicted yesterday of killing an assistant supermarket manager last August when the latter failed to obey a command to open the store safe.

title: Arts Leaders Rally for State Budget Aid
description: Nearly 500 New York State art leaders, their numbers but not their determination dimmed by upstate snows, met yesterday to plan a statewide appeal for passage of Governor Rockefeller's $13million arts appropriation.

title: Saigon Rejects Proposal
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 4 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Tran Vam Lam today rejected the Vietcong's peace formula, presented yesterday in Paris, which calls for the immediate resignation of President Thieu.

title: Arms Talks End in Vienna, Reopen March 28 in Finland
description: VIENNA, Feb. 4The United States and the Soviet Union ended today the sixth round of their talks on limiting strategic nuclear arms, with sonic progress reported toward drafting a treaty covering antiballistic or defensive missiles.

title: GWLADYS BENMOSCHE I
description: Mrs. Gwladys Levy Goodman Benmosche, a former actress under the name of Gwladys Elvey and a director of the Ziegfeld Club, died Thursday at her home, 172 West 79th Street.

title: Law Upheld on Residence Of Jersey Uniformed Men
description: NEWARK, Feb. 4 (AP) A controversial state law requiring policemen and firemen to live in the towns where they work was upheld today by threejudge Federal appeals court.

title: Cougars Nip Pros, 106100
description: MEMPHIS, Feb. 4 (AP)Jim McDaniels, Carolina center, scored with 24 seconds left to break a 100100 tie and the Cougars went on to defeat the Memphis Pros, 106100, tonight.

title: New Coach for Xavier
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 4 (AP)Richard Selcer resigned today as Xavier's head football coach and was immediately replaced by Thomas A. Cecchini.

title: North Koreans Said to Sink Fishing Boat, Seize 5 Others
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. (AP)North Korean gunboats sank one South Korean fishing boat and forced five others to North Korea today in a raid in the Yellow Sea, the South Korean counterespionage command said.

title: Mr. Nixon's School Plan
description: President Nixon appears determined to change the nation's public school financing pattern by letting the pendulum swing from totally inadequate Federal subsidy to major Federal funding. This is to be accomplished by lifting the burden off the backs of local propertytax payer's and substituting instead a new and therefore only vaguely understood national valueadded tax. Such a scheme has the ring of political magic that promises to give much by taking away little.

title: VON RUDEN'S 3:57.9 FASTEST MILE OF 72
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Feb. 4 (AP)Tom Von Ruden streaked to the nation's best time in the mile this year and Al Feuerbach stung the Olympic shotput champion, Randy Matson, again tonight in the 11th Coaches indoor track meet.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent editorial in your newspaper [Jan. 20] seized upon some minor modifications in basic trainingthe first eight weeks in a soldier's lifeto conclude that the entire Army is retreating from its efforts to forge new ways and suggested that we were never really committed to any substantial change in the first place.

title: Art:
description: Things change rapidly enough in New York to make you wonder how a onetime favorite, not seen for a few years, is going to look after reentry to the scene. Lee Gatch, who died in 1968, and whose last exhibition I somehow managed to miss, is now the subject of a retrospective at the Newark Museum while the Staempfli Gallery, 47 East 77th Street, is holding a show of the stones that brought the artist to prominence during the last 10 years of his life.

title: Brown Stops Cornell, 8973
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Feb. 4The foul shooting of Arnie Berman led Brown to an 8973 victory over Cornell tonight and earned Brown a share of the Ivy League lead with Penn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Surely, people of every faith and national origin must be appalled at the cruel suggestion in your Feb. editorial that the United States has no role to play in helping Britain to end the tragedy in Ulster.

title: 2 FORMER POLICEMEN GUILTY IN BRIBE CASE
description: Two former police detectives accused of offering to bribe policemen investigating an autotheft ring a year ago were found guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court in Queens of bribery and conspiracy.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Static electricity has been removed from many miles of carpeting with an invention for which a patent was granted this week. People can, walk over such floorcovering and reach for a doorknob without fear of a shock. The inventor, Thorhas B. McCune, is manager of engineering in the Ossining, N. Y., plant of the Hudson Wire Company, to which Patent 3,639,807 is assigned. Very fine copper wires, insulated with plastic film, are wound with nonconductive yarn. These composite strands are then woven or tufted with conventional materials to form the carpeting.

title: Antiques: Wide Variety in Early Quilts
description: Collectors of patchwork quilts are beginning to discover the whole range of quilted bedcovers made in the 18th and 19th centuries.

title: Stars Trim Pacers, 121110
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Feb. 4 (AP)Austin (Red) Robbins scored 34 points to lead the fastbreaking Utah Stars to a 121110 victory over the Indiana Pacers tonight. The Stars opened with a fastbreaking attack and were never headed. They led by as many as 21 points.

title: Knicks Trounce Braves By 10384
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 4The New York Knickerbockers walked over the Buffalo Braves tonight in a National Basketball Association game by a count of 10384. That's a 19point margin. The Knicks are slipping.

title: London Symphony Plays Rachmaninoff In Carnegie Concert
description: For its Thursday concert at Carnegie Hall, the London Symphony Orchestra, led by Andre Previn, offered two big works composed in the 20th century but not really representative of it.

title: For the Poor Hidden in Midst of Affluence, a Helping Hand
description: ANNANDALE, Va. Sprawled over the rolling landscape of Virginia's Fairfax County, within half an hour's drive of Washington, Annandale seems typical of other affluent suburbs around the country.access to the minishopping centers and enormous shopping malls that are the real centers of activity in the community.

title: Men's Fashion: A Return to Elegance
description: They called it the Peacock Revolution when flamboyance hit men's fashions in the nineteensixties. But the peacock has tucked in its tail feathersa victim of what one fashion leader calls toomudhism.

title: Chaparrals Down Rockets
description: DALLAS, Feb. 4 (AP)Donnie Freeman fired in 41 points and the Dallas Chaparrals got 75 points from their three guards to beat the Denver Rockets, 118102, tonight.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW INCREASE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market finished higher yesterday in slower trading.

title: OUTPUT OF COCOA IS SEEN CLIMBING
description: A record world cocoa production of 1,618,000 long tons (each 2,240 pounds) In 197172 was forecast yesterday by Gill & Duffus, Ltd., London cocoa merchants, whose reports are highly regarded In the trade.

title: Mrs. Brown Married
description: Mrs. Ruth Davidson Brown and Matthew Schoenwald, both of New York, were married here yesterday by Rabbi Gunter Hirschberg at the home of the bride. The bridegroom is a vice president of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union and manager of the Undergarment and Negligee Workers Union, Local 62. The bride's first husband and the bridegroom's first wife both died.

title: Drug Dealers Denounced
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 4 (AP)State Representative Julian Bond said today that black people should take the law into their own hands and inflict physical punishment, if necessary, on drug dealers who sell dope to black youngsters. I'm not advocating murder, the civil rights leader said in an interview. I am advocating community action. Drug dealers act outside the law and the police seem unwilling or incapable of dealing with them.

title: Bill to Be Sent Next Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The chairman of the House Banking Committee announced today that the Administration would send Congress next week the legislation raising the official price of gold from $35 to $38 an ounce. He said hearings would begin Feb. 29.

title: Step Termed Unfriendly
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Feb. 4 (AP)A Pakistani Foreign Office spokesman called the British and West German recognition of Bangladesh today an unfriendly act.

title: and a New York Blueprint
description: The objective of New York State's Fleischmann Commissionto assure equal educational opportunity to all public school pupils whether they live in suburb or slum is admirable. The troubling question about the commission's blueprint, however, is the extent to which fiscal equality would degenerate into educational standardization.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: George Harsh states in his Jan. 15 OpEd article on capital punishment that murderers who have talked to over 100 other murderers are best qualified to discuss problems of capital punishment. Following up this logic, lunatics who have talked to hundreds of colleagues should be best qualified as experts on asylums or as psychiatrists, school dropouts should be fine educators, and so forth.

title: 100 Here Picket Office Of British Over Killings
description: More than 100 IrlshAmerscans demonstrated yesterday outside the British Consulate to protest the killing Sunday of 13 persons in Northern Ireland by British soldiers.

title: Finally Off the Hook?
description: After nearly seven months on the picket line, striking telephone workers in this state will vote next week on settlement terms recommended by J. Curtis Counts, director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: OPPOSITION PARTY BANNED IN ZAMBIA
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Feb. 4President Kenneth D. Kaunda banned one of Zambia's two Opposition parties today, arrested its leader, former Vice President Sirnon M. Kapwepwe, and ordered the arrest of 133 other leaders of Mr. Kapwepwe's United Progressive party.

title: Bridge:
description: The standard procedure in leading against a grand slam is to make a passive selection, endeavoring not to give the declarer any help by leading away from a significant honor. But a bold player can sometimes depart from this rule advantageously to force the declarer to make premature decision.

title: Walker Foresees Rates Stability, Even Some Drops
description: Treasury Under Secretary Charls E. Walker said here yesterday that the slack nature of the American economy would keep interest rates basically stable despite the high Federal budget deficits anticipated for the current and 1973 fiscal years.

title: Rogers Calls In Dobrynin To Discuss Nixon's Visit
description: WASHINGTON, Fdb. 4 While President Nixon was in Florida preparing for his trip to China, Secretary of State William P. Rogers called in Ambassador Anatoly F. Dobrynin today to begin discussion of the agenda for Mr. Nixon's visit to Moscow in May.

title: COOKE SETS GOAL OF $I3.4MILLION
description: Cardinal Cooke said yesterday that the 10county Archdiocese of New York would require more than $13.4million this year to finance special communityoriented programs in health, welfare and education.

title: Screen: Amateur Skill
description: Judging by a batch of movie shorts from the Young Filmmakers Foundation, a local workshop, these youngsters, primarily teenagers and younger, are a hip lot. Fourteen of their works, ranging in length from 4 to 8 minutes, compose today's new program at the uptown Film Forum, 256 West 88th Street. As fragments made by film amateurs, the pictures demonstrate considerable freshness, inventiveness and skill.

title: NICHOLAS C. CULOLIAS
description: BOSTON, Feb. 4Nicholas C. Culolias, a former legal counsel to the CocoCola Export Company, died today at his home in Brookline. He was 80 years old.

title: 3 PANTHERS GUILTY IN POLICE SHOOTING
description: HIGH POINT, N. C., Feb. 4 (UPI)  Three of four Black Panthers charged in toe shooting of a policeman were given prison sentences of from seven to 10 years here today after being found guilty by a Superior Court Jury.

title: Fewer Tax Returns Audited In 1971 Than Year Before
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP)  Fewer individual and corporate tax returns were examined last year than in 1970 under the audit program of the Internal Revenue Service.

title: DEBAKEY ATTACKS NIXON'S 73 BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (UPI)  Michael E. DeBakey, the heart surgeon, told Congress today that President Nixon's proposed budget was inadequate to meet the country's medical needs.

title: Price Watch a Task for a Stoic
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Lester Kavan, an Internal Revenue agent, was having a somewhat uneven time of it.

title: Market Place:
description: And now a bit more on the critical subject of finding a good broker.

title: Western Electric And Pacific Phone Increase Income
description: The Pacific Telephone and Telegraph Company reported yesterday gains in revenues and net income for 1971. The utility is 89.7 per cent owned by the American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: Gallery in the Village Seeks to Inspire Black Artists
description: It was a butcher shop, in a tenament house on Bedford Street until it was converted three years ago into Acts of Art, a small, affable vest pocket of an art gallery. Its owners, Nigel Jackson and Pat Grey, both artists without a gallery, opened Acts of Art as a showcase for their own paintings as well as for the work of friends and any talent they chanced upon. But the owners soon realized that the gallery needed more focus in its exhibition policy. Believing that black artists had inadequate gallery space in New York, Mr. Jackson and Miss Grey turned Acts of Art two years ago into what they maintain is the only gallery in the city specializing in black art outside the ghetto.

title: Blazers Win for Inman
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 4 (AP)Geoff Petrie's jump shot with 27 seconds left gave Portland a 114113 victory over the Houston Rockets tonight in Stu Inman's debut as coach of the Trail Blazers.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President was at his home in Key Biscayne, Fla., for the weekend. He sent his District of Columbia bicentennial message to Congress.

title: Lynch Urges Protesters to Stay in South
description: DUBLIN, Feb. 4Prime, Minister John Lynch appealed to supporters of the Northern Ireland civilrights movement today not to join in the demonstration scheduled by the movement Sunday in the Ulster border town of Newry.

title: Deadline Set for Rikers Island Reforms
description: The State Commission of Correction has given New York City six months to improve housing, health and education conditions at the Correctional Institution for Men on Rikers Island or face the possible loss of state certification.

title: F.B.I. Investigating Production Testing Of Army M16 Rifle
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP) The Justice Department has ordered an F.B.I. investigation of allegations that Colt, Inc., has cheated on Government qualitycontrol tests for its M16 rifles.

title: LEON DALVA IS DEAD; EL DIARIO PUBLISHER
description: Leon Dalva, associate publisher of El DiarioLa Prensa, the Spanishlanguage newspaper in this city, died last evening of a heart attack in San Juan, P. R., where he had been visiting with his wife, the former Jean Caswell. He was 65 years old and lived at 1067 Fifth Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In recent months, the question of offshore oil drilling leases has received increasing public attention, particularly on the East Coast. This has resulted from conflicting reports emanating from the Interior Department and deep public concern for preventing a recurrence of disasters such as that at Santa Barbara.

title: 71 State Road Toll Record
description: ALBANY, Feb. 4 (AP)  A record 3,227 persons were killed on the state's highways last year, Vincent L. Tofany, State Motor Vehicle Commissioner, reported today. This was an increase of 27 deaths over the previous record high in 1969 and 75 more than in 1970, Mr. Tofany said. He blamed the increase on the greater number of vehicles on the highways.

title: U.S. Jets Destroy An Enemy Missile In Southern Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Feb. 5 (AP)  American fighterbombers destroyed an enemy surfacetoair missile and the vehicle transporting it through southern Laos in daylight yesterday, the United. States command said today.

title: Sadat, in Soviet, Joins Call For New U.N. Peace Move
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 4  Despite past Egyptian talk of war with Israel, President Anwar elSadat joined with the Soviet Union today in a new appeal for immediate resumption of United Nations diplomatic efforts to arrange a political settlement in the Middle East.

title: Sports of The Times
description: His father was a motorman on a Buenos Aires trolley car. To switch tracks, his father would climb down with a big iron bar and use it to wrench the tracks into alignment.

title: LEWIS R. BEERS
description: NORWALK, Conn., Feb. 4Lewis R. Beers, retired sales manager of the New York Telephone Company, died this morning at Norwalk Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 4 Lewis Street.

title: TOLD TO KILL, SAYS A BRITISH SOLDIER
description: DUBLIN, Feb. 4 (Reuters)A British soldier said here today that he had deserted his Northern Irelandbased parachute unit because its troops were ordered to shoot to kill before the Londonderry Sunday march when 13 civilians were shot to death.

title: Strikes Challenge Cost Council On Concept of Working Poor
description: A union of unskilled and semiskilled factory workers began a series of strikes here yesterday in a confrontation between a section of organized labor and Congress, on the one hand, and the Cost of Living Council on the other.

title: NIXON PLANS ROLE FOR D.C. IN 76 FETE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 President Nixon outlined today what he called an action plan to spur the District of Columbia's participation in the 1976 bicentennial observance.

title: N.Y.U. Dance Group Performs 4 Works In Traditional Idiom
description: The New York University Dance Ensemble, a professional company that was formed last year by graduates of the university's school of the arts, presented four new works Thursday night at the school's theater, 111 Second Avenue.

title: GEORGE H. KEIM
description: CARMICHAEL, Calif., Feb. 4 George H. Keim, who had been with the Chicago advertising office of The New York Times for 25 years before his retirement in 1963, died today in Mercy San Juan Hospital after a brief illness. He was 74 years old.

title: Dilts's Voice Heard On a Wiretap Tape Played at His Trial
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Feb. 4 The suspended prosecutor of Bergen County, who is on trial herb on charges of conspiring to solicit bribes from convicted criminals, was heard on a ninemonthold tape recording today in a telephone conversation's with his alleged coconspirator.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Scores Nixon On His Social Legislation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (UPI) The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations accused President Nixon today of trying with some successto get Congress to approve narrow, conservative concerns of big business rather than social legislation to benefit most Americans.

title: $2.34Billion Foreign Aid Backed by Senate, 4523
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The Senate passed legislation today that would provide an appropriation of $2.34billion in foreign economic and military aid in the current fiscal year, which ends June 30.

title: Judge Malcolm Hay, 65, Of Pittsburgh Court, Dead
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 4Common Pleas Judge Malcolm Flay died today in St. Margaret Memorial Hospital after complications following surgery. He was 65 years old.

title: John Litel, 77, Character Actor On Stage, in Films and TV, Dies
description: WOODLAND HILLS, Calif., Feb. 4 (AP)John Litel, the character actor whose career spanned the stage, movies and television, died last night at the Motion Picture and Television Hospital here. He was 77 years old.

title: Changes Hinted as Polish Writers Meet
description: LODZ, Poland, Feb. 4  The first congress of Polish writers to be held since Edward Gierek took power as Communist party leader opened in this textile town today amid speculation on a major shift in cultural policy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Percy Sutton is quoted in retaliating to Parisian travel agents as saying there's their wine problem over there. [News story Jan. 25.]

title: ANDRETTI FERRARI GAINS POLE SPOT
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 4 (AP) Mario Andretti of Nazareth, Pa., drove a flamered Ferrari at an astonishing 131.606 miles an hour today to win the pole position for Sunday's sixhour Daytona Continental auto race.

title: Enright Is Named Coach of Football At. U. of Oregon
description: EUGENE, Ore., Feb. 4 (AP)  Dick Enright, offensive line coach at the University of Oregon, was named today to succeed Jerry Frei as head football coach at the university.

title: Like Ships at Sea, Skysciapers Creak on a Gusty Day
description: Welcome to swinging Morgan Stanley, said the receptionist on the 48th floor of 140 Broadway.

title: REP. HECHLER PLANS HOUSESENATE RACE
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Feb. 4 (AP)Representative Ken Hechler, Democrat of West Virginia, announced today his candidacy for reelection to the House and said he would also run for the Senate.

title: Executive Changes
description: The S. S. Kresge Company has elected Robert H. Griffin executive vice president for store management. The former vice president for K Mart operations succeeds Fred K. Nieman, who retires on March 1 after 44 years of service.

title: Books of The Times
description: Although the subtitle of Philip Young's attractive collection of essays fits into comfortable pigeonhole, there is greater variety in it than the category American fiction indicates. The essays range from analysis of single works to his own involvement in the making of the modern canon. He is formidably learned as the papers on the legend of Pocahontas and Rip Van Winkle show. But what comes through more than the learning Is the man, modest, bemused, occasionally astonished at the antics of the literary profession, one who is both actor and spectator and who enjoys both roles. In fact, he may be stirring up once again the troubles that got such play in the columns of The New York Review of Books between Edmund Wilson and Lewis Mumford on the one hand and the gentlemen of the Modern Language Association on the other, over the new and authoritative texts of American writers. Although Mr. Young's essay was written in 1965 before the altercation, its publication now in book form may scratch open wounds that have not yet healed. He presents a picture of furious scholarly activity, of Hawthorne's high standing on the campuses and of the outpouring of books and articles on the man. Everybody wants a piece of the action, he writes, a phrase not usually applied to professorial activity. But in the rush, Hawthorne somehow gets lost.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 4 (AP) Tom Edlefsen of Los Angeles ousted the favorite, Illie Nastase of Rumania, 26, 63, 76, and Erik van Dilien of San Mateo, Calif., knocked off secondseeded Clark Graebner of New York, 62, 64, tonight in the Greater Kansas City tennis tournament.

title: A Blueprint for Survival
description: LONDONThe principal defect of the industrial way of life with its ethos of expansion is that it is not sustainable. Its termination within the lifetime of someone born today is inevitableunless it continues to be sustained for a while longer by an entrenched minority at the cost of imposing great suffering on the rest of mankind. We can be certain, however, that sooner or later it will end (only the precise time and circumstances are in doubt), and that it will do so in one of two ways; either against our will, in a succession of famines, epidemics, social crises and wars; or because we want it tobecause we wish to create a society which will not impose hardship and cruelty upon our childrenin a succession of thoughtful, humane and measured changes.

title: PENN OVERPOWERS HARVARD, 84 TO 60
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 4 Pennsylvania cashed in on eight of its first 11 fieldgoal attempts to build up a 162 advantage and then coasted to an 8460 Ivy League victory over Harvard tonight. The Quakers now share the Ivy lead with Brown.

title: Pakistan Airline to Begin U.S.China Flights in April
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 4 (UPI)Pakistan International Airlines will start service between New York and two cities in China in April, the airline's manager here said today.

title: Art:
