description: Bobby Sherwin scored eight of Army's last 10 points that enabled the cadets to register a 7370 upset victory over St. John's in the closing seconds last night at St. John's. The Army triumph all but knocked the Redmen out of consideration for a berth in the National Collegiate championship tournament this season.

title: Bangladesh, Links to Pakistan Cut, Snips. Label
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Feb. 5 (UPI)Even the omelette has not escaped the changeofname fever now that East Pakistan has been proclaimed Bangladesh by the Bengalis.

title: ROLLICKING WINS BOWIE HANDICAP
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 5Rollicking, owned by Robert A. Leonard, a veterinarian from Frederick, Md., rolled to victory today in the inaugural running of the $25,000 Goss L. Stryker Handicap at Bowie. The 5yearold son of Rambunctious turned back eight other. Marylandbred horses in the seven  furlong event when he sped the distance in 1:22, one second off the track standard.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I find it difficult to explain how my compact car (a standard, twowheeldrive vehicle) reached the top of Volcan Boqueron in El Salvador in one hour, while Mr. Allen took three hours in his fourwheel  drive vehicle, and thereupon intoned, LandRover truly magnificent. Generally speaking, I think his article was slanted to discourage travel to either Guatemala or El Salvador. In fact, these are lovely countries, where any nonpolitical tourist is welcomed by all, and both are badly in need of more tourism.

title: Western Welcome Scores As Cougar II Runs Second
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 5Western Welcome spoiled the 1972 debut of Cougar II today as he raced to a 1length victory in the 35th running of the $57,100 San Pasqual Handicap at Santa Anita.

title: Shaper of Subtle Images
description: A writer with the dazzling ability to describe things as if she were observing them for the first time and with a remarkable talent for subtle imagery, Marianne Craig Moore was one of the country's most laureled poets and among its most ingenuous talkers and public personalities.

title: Sharif and M. Khan Gain, But Hashim Khan Loses
description: Hashim Khan was a firstround loser in the David C. Johnson Jr. Memorial open squash racquets doubles competition yesterday, but his son, Sharif, and a nephew, Mo, gained today's semifinals. Another Khan, named Yusuf, also advanced, He is not related to Hashim.

title: Casino in Nevada Closes; World Money Crisis Cited
description: CARSON CITY, Nev. Feb. 5 Kings Castle, a multimillion dollar casino on the shore of Lake Tahoe, has closed, a victim in part of the international money crisis.

title: The Physiology of Taste
description: One day during lunch, at the age of 94, BrillatSavarin's sister cried out to her butler, I fear I am dyingbring on the dessert! Had not Jean Anthelme me BrillatSavarin, country lawyer, violinist exiled in New York during the French Revolution, advocate and judge in Paris during the succeeding Thermidor, Directory, Empire and Restoration, had not this author of the greatest treatise on gastronomy, this high priest of kitchen and table with millions of oysters, a ton of caviar and thousands of chickens behind him, had he not already left the world like a satisfied diner leaving the banquet room (as one admirer put it), he would surely have applauded his sister's remark. For his fourth and most famous aphorism reads, Tell me what you eat, and I shall tell you what you are.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I would like to say how much I enjoyed William Shannoh's article.

title: Horse Show News
description: The final Olympic dressage trials of the United States Equestrian Team have been rescheduled for April 14 and 15 at the American Dressage Institute, Saratoga Springs, N. Y.

title: Staubach Player of Year
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 5 (AP)Roger Staubach, the Dallas Cowboys quarterback, has been named offensive player of the year in the National Football Conference by the 101 Committee, Jack Wheeler, the general committee chairman, announced today, Wheeler said Staubach would attend the 101 dinner Feb. 14 for Kansas City's third annual salute to professional football.

title: Edward Miller, Janet Henning Plan Marriage
description: SYOSSET, L. I., Feb. 5Mr. and Mrs. George Henning have made known the engagement of their daughter, Mis's Janet Ruth Henning, to Edward Murphy Miller. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. J. Norris Miller of Oyster Bay.

title: Breakaway From City Is Urged For Queens
description: ALBANYAll power to the people, from the Midtown Tunnel toll booths to the potholed paths toward Nassau, from threatened Sound to oilflecked sea.

title: Stars, Sabres Tie, 33
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 5 (AP)  Dennis O'Brien and Dennis Hextall, both defensemen, scored their first goals of the National Hockey League season in the third period tonight to give Minnesota North Stars a 33 tie with the Buffalo Sabres.

title: Let the Voter Beware!
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Feb. 5  A reader in Chilmark, Mass., wants to know how on earth we are all going to get through the long Presidential elecdon of 1972, and asks whether there is any sensible and amiable way to endure it.

title: 10 Jersey Bus Lines Refuse to Pay Fees At Terminals Here
description: The commuter bus lines from New Jersey that use the Port of New York Authority's Manhattan bus terminals are refusing to pay any fees to the bistate agency for the use of the terminals, at 40th Street and Eighth Avenue and at the George Washington Bridge.

title: Student Fined for Uniform
description: HOMEWOOD, Ala., Feb. 5 (AP)  A 25yearold Vietnam veteran has been fined $100 for wearing his army uniform. Kevin Doherty of Oak Ridge, N. J., a prelaw student at the University of Alabama, was found guilty in City Court Wednesday of violating a state law prohibiting civilians from wearing military uniforms or any part of them. He was wearing a uniform jacket.

title: The American
description: LAST summer, President Nixon, while commenting on the pseudoclassical architecture of American public buildings, went on to suggest that America might be heading for the same fate as ancient Greece and Rome. As they became wealthy, as they lost their will to live, to improve, he pointed out, they became subject to the decadence that destroys the civilization. The United States is reaching that period.

title: Vatican Reveals Message To the Primate of Ireland
description: ROME, Feb. 5The Vatican dislosed today the text of a message sent by its Secretary of State, Jean Cardinal Villot, to William Cardinal Conway, Primate of all Ireland, whose, diocese is in Belfast.

title: Child for Washburns
description: A daughter was born Jan. 31 in Doctors Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. A. Lawrence Washburn Jr. of New York.

title: The Nation
description: Two weeks ago, the nation's largest marketing cooperatives were hailed Into court by consumer advocate Ralph Nader on charges that they had made large contributions to Republican political committees in exchange for favors from the Government. Last week, one of those cooperativesAssociated Milk Producers, Inc.was back in court on another charge, this one brought by the Justice Department.

title: Marshall Beats L.I.U., 70 to 61, and Montclair State Tops Fairleigh, 57 to 55
description: Marshall's runandshoot offense was slowed yesterday by Long Island University, but not enough to change the result.

title: Art:
description: NEWARKA bus rider entering Newark can get off at a point a few steps from a couple of small grassy areasMilitary Park and Washington Parkso oirninaculately kept and so quiet that, if it is his first visit to the city, he may think that he hasn't ended up where he wanted to go.

title: A taste for heroism and a talent for farce
description: This is an entertaining account of a hilarious and yet deeply disturbing episode of the Vietnam war: the circumstances surrounding the abrupt dismissal of Marcus Aurelius Arnheiter, commanding officer of the U.S.S. Vance, an overage DER (destroyer escort radar) assigned to coastal patrol off Vietnam in 1966.

title: Lowe, Hoyt Taylor Gain In Squash Racquets Here
description: Topseeded Art Lowe of the Downtown Athletic Club advanced yesterday to the semifinals of the Lone Star Boat Club Class B squash racquets tournament with a 159, 1511, 1512 victory over Gene Kellner of the Union Club.

title: French Yachts to Start Cup Training
description: The lengthy preparation involved in an America's Cup yachting challenge was reflected at Newport, R.I., last week when the 12Meter sloops France and Constellation emerged from storage sheds at the Newport Shipyard.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Come to St. Louis with us tomorrow, Josh Gibson once said to his sister, Annie.

title: ST. JOHN'S WINS IN 4TEAM TRACK
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 5St. John's, displaying superior balance, captured a quadrangular track meet with Colgate, Georgetown and Rutgers today in Jadwin gymnasium.

title: Loopholes Attacked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP) Liberal Democrats in the House hope, to, force President Nixon to offer legislation to close tax loopholes as the price of their support of his request for a $50billion increase in the Federal debt ceiling.

title: Ferraris Are Favored in SixHour Continental Auto Race at Daytona Today
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 5A team of three bloodred Ferrari prototype sports cars entered by the Italian Factory is the strong favorite to win the sixhour Daytona Continental here tomorrow.

title: Judge Rules Newspapers May List Job Ads by Sex
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 5 (UPI) Newspapers that divide employment advertisements into male and female classifications are not violating the civil rights laws, a Federal district judge says.

title: Announcements 5000
description: Announcements 5000

title: Westminster Fixture A Show of Champions
description: Of the 3,093 dogs entered for the 96th annual Westminster Kennel Club show Feb. 14 and 15 in Madison Square Garden, 44 per cent are champions, according to Dr. Lyman R. Fisher, show chairman.

title: She Makes Things Happen
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. In winter or summer in this graceful village of steady habits there is scarcely a cocktail party or dinner of note that does not include Mrs. Jeanette Edwards Rattray, the proprietor of, and perennial weekly columnist for, The East Hampton Star.

title: FILION RESUMES VICTORY PATTERN
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 5It did not take Herve Filion too long tonight to find the winner's circle at Roosevelt Raceway for the first time this season. Following two unsuccessful attempts in his local 1972 debut the previous night, the FrenchCanadia ace, who has led all North American harness racing drivers the last four years, rediscovered the golden area by winning the $20,000 Hi Lo's Forbes Pace.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: The fact that Clayton Riley is an iconoclast just for the sake of it does not bother me. There are, after all, people who are not secure unless they are bathing in the waters of iconoclasm. More power to these people: most of us can see through their facades and, from their commentaries, get a chuckle or two.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: In Country Inns: A Quiet Revival (Travel section, Jan. 16) we looked in vain for a mention of the White Horse Tavern in Newport, R.I., which is the oldest tavern in America, dating to 1673. [The article said that Longfellow's. Wayside Inn in South Sudbury, Mass., and the Beekman Arms in Rhinebeck, N. Y., dating to the early 18th century, both claim to be the oldest operating inns in the country.] Although the Wayside Inn has been beautifully restoredit burned down not much of the original remains. The White Horse does not have rooms but serves good food and drink. It is now owned by The Preservation Society of Newport County.

title: U.S.L.T.A. Will Open 91st Meeting Tuesday
description: HOUSTON, Feb 5 (AP)The United States Lawn Tennis Association must grapple with the sticky problem of the International Lawn Tennis Federation's ban of contract pros in open tournaments when the U.S.L.T.A. begins its 91st meet ing Tuesday.

title: GAMBLING DRIVE IS PUSHED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The Justice Department is in the midst of an intensified campaign against gambling operations run by organized crime, according to a department official.

title: A CITY PATROLMAN HELD IN ROBBERY
description: BABYLON, L.I., Feb. 5A New York City patrolman assigned to the 106th Precinct was arrested here at his home late yesterday by Suffolk County detectives and charged with conspiracy to commit robbery.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Sufficient time has elapsed since the beginning of the crackdown on Croatian nationalism and separatism in December of 1971 for an attempt at assessing the recent developments in Yugoslavia. This is all the more urgent since Yugoslavia represents the most significant longrange experiment in developing a possible socialism with a human face, an increasingly decentralized and open society with expanding boundaries of legality and freedom.

title: Not a great war, a thesaurus no treasure
description: This is a fascinating, thoroughly researched account of how Americans went to war in 1917, and of the price they paid.

title: Miss Anderson to Wed
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Feb. 5The engagement of Miss JoLinda Anderson to Albert Lawrence Greene, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Greene of Wappingers Falls, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Alvin P. Anderson. Mr. Anderson is vice president and treasurer of Zion Foods Corporation in the Bronx. Her fianc's father is supply officer of the Franklin DeLano Hospital in Montrose. The couple plan to be married Sept. 3.

title: Cosmetics Safety: Admittedly a Problem, but What's the Solution?
description: Most women assume that cosmetics are a harmless way of trying to improve on nature. It isn't always so.

title: Tales of Hughes Proving Elusive
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 5 What impressed Clifford Irving's editors and many other people who dealt with him over The Autobiography of Howard Hughes was the wealth of detail that he was able to offer in the manuscript; and in his stories of his purported meetings with Mr. Hughes.

title: Brooklyn's Amboy Street Is Now Nobody's Turf
description: Amboy Street, Brownsville, 30 years ago:

title: WHITE HOUSE SCORES DOCK STRIKE LEADER
description: KEY BISCAYNE, lib., Feb. 5 (UPI)The White House today accused Harry Bridges, head of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, of intransigence and urged Congress to force settlement of the West Coast clock strike before the Lincoln's Birthday recess next week.

title: Pupil Busing Plans Offered in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Feb. 5The possibility of busing students between Detroit's schools and the suburban schools moved a step nearer reality this week.

title: New China Policy In Rock Glade, N.J.
description: WE dropped in the other day on Mr. and Mrs. Harry T. Wallower, a with it couple in suburban Rock Glade, N. J., who are doing the most heavenly job of recognizing China. Mrs. Wallower met us at the door wearing a kneelength pongee housecoat decorated in a pattern of jumping carp.

title: Law Students Facing a Job Shortage
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 5The televisionenhanced image of the glamorous young lawyer, intelligent, dedicated and employed, may soon change for the worse unless jobs are found for the thousands of young people who are now thronging the nation's law schools, leaders of the American Bar Association fear.

title: Road Man Oaklawn Victor
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., Feb. 5 (AP)Road Man, beat highly regarded Barbizon Streak and Staunch Avenger in the $20,000 King Cotton Handicap at Oaklawn Park today. The winner returned $18.40, $5 and 3.20 for $2 across the board.

title: Apple Crop a Record
description: BOSTON, Feb. 5 (AP)New England's apple crop in 1971 was up 6 per cent over the previous year, making it the biggest crop since 1966, according to the United States Department of Agriculture. However, a large part of the crop was dumped because of a labor shortage, lack of containers, poor storage, low prices and a competing crop from other states.

title: Firemen Attacked Less Often in 71, Department Says
description: The Fire Department yesterday reported a sharp decrease in hostile acts against firemen responding to and fighting fires in various parts of the city in 1972.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Virginia Hunt
description: WYTHEVILLE, Va.Sweet as lost youth, evocative as a cherished melody, the pungent smell of wood smoke greeted me as I arrived at Briarpatch Lodge in southwestern Virginia.

title: Education Board to Enter District 1 Ethnic Dispute
description: The central Board of Education will try this week to resolve a conflict that has split the Community School Board in District 1 along ethnic lines, led to the retirement of the district's superintendent and resulted in violence at a local board meeting.

title: Free for the Taking: PierClogging Styrofoam
description: PORT NEWARK  The Shimazaki Corporation here, which imports Honda cars, among other things, has problems: 6,000 pieces of unsinkable, waterproof, fireproof, 3by5foot and 2by3foot panels of Styrofoam, 4 inches thick, that it is trying to give awayfree.

title: FAMILY RESISTING DRAFT IN ALABAMA
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Feb. 5 A 45yearold mother will appear in Federal court here Wednesday to Oppose a sanity test in the latest development of a rightwing family's draft resistance battle that has brought prison terms to her son and husband.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Glen Jay scored a game high of 23 points, 11 in the second half, to pace Hunter to an 8471 victory over Lehman College, at the losers gym last night. Hunter now has a wonlost record of 14.4 while Lehman dropped to 78.

title: lona Beats Wagner, 8268, To Halt Loss Streak at 7
description: Iona College halted a sevengame losing streak last night with an 8268 victory over Wagner College at the losers court on Staten Island.

title: Science/ Medicine
description: PORTOFSPAIN, Trinidad  At about 9:45 A.M. three Sundays ago, a large, sleek rat scampered behind the breakfast counter at this city's most expensive hotel, ate several pieces of a muffin that had been dropped on the floor and disappeared into a space between a cabinet and some piping.

title: Catholic Protesters Flock To March in Tense Newry
description: NEWRY, Northern Ireland, Feb. 5Thousands of Roman Catholics poured into this tense border town tonight, the eve of a mass protest against the Protestantdominated government and British Army policies.

title: Maravich Scores 50
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 5 (AP)It took a 50point output by Pete Maravich for the Atlanta Hawks to put down the cellardwelling Cleveland Cavaliers, 120117, tonight.

title: QUEENS COLLEGE MAY CUT COURSES
description: Queens College will not be able to reopen next fall without cutting the number of courses a student can take, unless Governor Rockefeller relents on his nogrowth budget to increase the state's contribution to City College, to cover unavoidable cost increases, the college's president said today.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Use of one's own children to demonstrate the validity of one's theories in child rearing is indeed risky. However, William V. Shannon in his article, What Code of Values Can We Teach Our Chldren Now? (Jan. 16), apparently was willing to take that risk. Exemplary behavior of his own three children, the oldest being 9 years of age, is his primary proof that an authoritarian approach to child rearing, protection from such evils as television, stern attention to table manners, and other techniques will result in children that parents can be proud to display.

title: WALL STREET
description: Along with everything else, volume in the put and call market has been booming, and that must mean something about the present state of the stock market.

title: Recordings
description: THE musical theater has apparently finally come to a watershed that many people have been anticipating through most of the sixties. At first it was a question of when, if ever, the theater would recognize and use the contemporary music of this day as it had used the contemporary music of earlier days. The theater had seemed to shut its ears to everything musical that was going on around it. But then a few shots of safe contemporaneity began to penetrate  Burt Bacharach's rhythmic patterns in Promises, Promises, Stephen Sondheim's taut, acerbic score for Company, a touch of soul in Purlie and, of course, Hair, which, for all the flurry of excitement it raised, is an essentially traditional score that is dressed up in current sounds.

title: GOVERNOR BACKS 9 CONSUMER BILLS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5 Governor Rockefeller called on the Legislature today to approve a package of nine consumerprotection bills dealing mainly with the sale of prescription drugs and the relationship between consumers and their creditors.

title: Real cops and robbers
description: I'm getting old, Eddie Coyle tells young Jackie Brown, from whom he is buying some guns. I spent my whole life sitting around in one crummy joint after another with a bunch of punks like you, drinking coffee, eating hash, and watching other people take off for Florida while I got to sweat how the hell I'm going to pay the plumber next week.

title: PLOT TRIAL PANEL IS NEARLY READY
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 5Sometime next week the Government will start unfolding its evidence to support charges that the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and the other antiwar activists of the Harrisburg Seven plotted to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, blow tip the heating system of Government buildings in Washington and destroy draft board records in several cities.

title: Sad at Ends Yugoslav Visit
description: PULA, Yugoslavia, Feb. 5 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt left here by air today for Damascus, Syria, after a twoday unofficial visit to Yugoslavia during which he had talks with President Tito. The two leaders lunched together at President Tito's island residence at Brioni near here after ending their discussions.

title: U.S. SAID TO AGREE TO SUPPLY ISRAEL 42 PHANTOM JETS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The United States has agreed to sell Israel 42 F4 Phantom and 90 A4 Skyhawk jets over the next two to three years, according to wellplaced Administration sources.

title: Susan Schnee Wed To Edward Smick
description: GREAT NECK, L. L, Feb. 5  Miss Susan Schnee, a marketing planner for Trans World Airlines, was married here today to Edward Lewis Smick, director of passenger strategy planning for T.W.A. Rabbi Marvin Savit performed the ceremony at Leonard's.

title: Cynthia Coulson Wed To Morgan Mitchell
description: RYE, N. Y., Feb. 5Miss Cynthia Ann Coulson, daughter of Mrs. Evelyn Stewart Coulson and Frank W. Coulson, both of Dallas, was married here this afternoon to Morgan Conklin Mitchell in the Rye Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Donald W. Poole. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. George C. Mitchell of Rye.

title: Cahill at Midterm: A Political Portrait
description: TRENTONMidway through his first term as Governor of New Jersey William T. Cahill has acquired a reputation as one of the most successful Republican governors in the United States.

title: Cat Show Here Drawing Throng
description: Thousands of visitors sat on the edge of their seats yesterday at Madison Square Garden viewing the contestants in the 55th annual Empire Cat Show, which will end tonight with the judging of best in each class.

title: HELP HUMAN NEEDS, MRS. ABZUG URGES
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug yesterday urged 400 demonstrators protesting conditions at the Willowbrook State School on Staten Island to demand that money now spent for highways, for the war and other military programs be spent instead for human needs.

title: The Quick Redd Foxx Jumps Into a New Kettle of Fish
description: SO, what's the story? When John Sanford reached puberty, he displayed his moxie. In American folkhero tradition, he ran away from home with his two best chums. Home had been St. Louis, Milwaukee, Chioago. The country, sporting a long face, was rousing itself from the Depression; Vmail, rationing and airraid blackouts were still a few years away.

title: Thoughts Of Chou
description: PEKINGThe slim, 73yearold dynamo of a man with a crimson Serve the People lapel badge on his plain gray tunic received us the same east room of the massive Great Hall of the People where the American tabletennis players were received last April. The time midnightwas not an unusual hour for our host. Chou Enlai works customarily through, the night, until dawn, sleeping only between 5 A.M. and 10 A.M., and then returning to his daily 16 to 18hour stint.

title: TRIUMPHS IN 1,600
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Sunday, Feb. 6  Japan captured its first Winter Olympic gold medal ever and Ard Schenk of the Netherlands flashed to an Olympicrecord victory for his second speedskating gold at the 11th Winter Games today.

title: TO OUR READERS
description: The New York Times today begins additional Sunday edition coverage of New Jersey. The supplementary report, consisting of news and features of special interest to readers in the state, appears in the main news section of all copies distributed in New Jersey and in Richmond, Rockland and Orange Counties.

title: Mitchell to Appeal Ruling Enjoining Engineers Corps
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (UPI)  Attorney General John N. Mitchell has announced that the Justice department will appeal a Federal court ruling enjoining the Corps of Engineers from issuing any permits for the discharge of refuse into nonnavigable waterways.

title: Packard Gives $1Million In Stock to Black College
description: HAMPTON, Va., Feb. 5 (AP) Hampton Institute has announced that it has been given stock valued at more than $1million by David Packard, former Deputy Secretary of Defense.

title: Pop
description: THE TROUBLE with masterpieces is that nobody buys them. Not only that, but having made one, people expect you to keep coming out with them one after another. Just ask the Firesign Theatre.

title: Half Bitter, Half Sweet
description: The story of the ItalianAmerican experience is a monumental and sometimes brutal saga which, until now, has been unavailable to the general reader in all of its major ramifications. At long last, thanks to Alexander DeConde, who is both a historian of stature and a writer of alluringly lucid prose, we have been blessed with an objective study that interweaves the evolution of the Italian Americans with a comprehensive history of our country's political and cultural encounters with Italy. Considering how dismally ignorant most Americans are about one of its largest ethnic groups (Americans of Italian descent constitute about 11 per cent of the total population), Mr. DeConde, who teaches at the University of California, Santa Barbara, has performed a truly noble service for our culture, one that may help banish some of the stereotyped concepts that have been promoted throughout the land by the allAmerican obsession with Mafia folklore.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: A biography of the Apache warrior. This wellresearched account (with bibliography and notes) traces Geronimo's movements and guerrillalike tactical defense of his homeland until his surrender in 1886. Although Adams does not provide much information about the personal life of his subject, the book is replete with documentation of the connivances, blunders, savagery and heroism that characterized the removal of the Apaches from their New Mexico lands.

title: Yacht Race of 430 Miles Begins With a Fleet of 92
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. (UPI)A fleet of 92 yachts made a spectacular spinnaker start today on the 12th annual 430mile St. PetersburgtoFort Lauderdale yacht race.

title: Flyers Stop Leafs, 31
description: TORONTO, Feb. 5 (UPI)The Toronto Maple Leafs missed an opportunity to acquire sole possession of fourth place tonight as the Philadelphia Flyers scored their first road victory since Oct. 26 and defeated the Leafs, 31.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Jan. 26 editorial on the President's peace proposals states that they appear to offer a basis for serious negotiations in Paris.

title: News of Dogs
description: Although the Sunday before Westminster for years has been known as Specialty Day, with more than a dozen breed clubs holding their shows here, Saturday, long was a relatively quiet day. Only the Rhodesian. Ridgeback Club of the United States chose that day for its specialty.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 5 (AP) Dan Issel scored 33 points and Cincey Powell added 24 as the Kentucky Colonels defeated the Denver Rockets, 117106, in the American Basketball Association tonight.

title: The World
description: Three months ago, as Pakistan faced a rebellion in its eastern province, Zulfikar All Bhutto journeyed to Peking to seek aid as a special envoy of Pakistan's then President Yahya Khan. Last week, with Pakistan truncated by the secession of the eastern sector, now Bangladesh,. Mr. Bhutto again visited Pekingthis time as President.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Protestantism in the U.S. from colonial times to the present, with particular emphasis on evangelical efforts to create an American society that conformed to Protestant religious, moral and ethical standards. The author, a Union Theological Seminary professor, shows how some 19thcentury progress toward this ideal was countered in the 20th century by differences among the churches, by immigration that diluted the country's Protestant majority and by the industrialization  urbanization that encouraged the growth of secularism. The author gives a good account of Protestantism's busyness and secular stances, but not enough of its spiritual qualities.

title: AROUND THE
description: If it's a mild day, start pruning grapevines. Cut back geraniums, lantanas, impatiens and other border plants which are wintering indoors; root the cuttings for additional plants to be set out in May. . Sow coleus seed for bedding plants Sow lettuce in the coldframe for crunchy salads.

title: MARGIN IS 6 TO 5
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 5In a wildscoring National Hockey League game, the St. Louis Blues broke a 55 tie in the final minute and 19 seconds tonight to beat the New York Rangers, 65, before a crowd of 18,570 in the Arena.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: There is not a word of truth in either of the letters signed Diron Frieders and Mark Hamburg, purporting to explain my differences with Vladimir Nabokov.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: Permit me to leaven the scholarly tedium of the NabokovWilson exchanges (concerning butterflynets and cupcakes or privies, I hardly know whidh) featured so often in this space.

title: Coins
description: THE Ancient Coin Society of NOW York will hear a report of the latest research on the coinage of Alexander the Great, at its monthly meeting on Wednesday evening in Room 304 of the West Side Y.W.C.A., 840 Eighth Avenue, at 51st Street. The session will begin at 7:30.

title: At the Barricades
description: CROOKSTOWN. Northern Ireland. What Britain must do is take her troops out of Northern ireland now People will ask: What will happen when the troops come out? After last Sunday in Derry that's a pretty sick question.

title: Travel Notes: Visitors From Abroad, Cruises to China, Weekend Bargain
description: DESPITE the fact that Frenchmen have been warned by the Paris newspaper L'Aurore that New York City is a perilous place to visit, more than 160,000 of them are expected to brave Manhattan this year, according to the United States Travel Service. The agency said that the visitor influx from France would be 25 per cent greater than last year's total and that this was directly attributable to the recent devaluation of the United States dollar. The predicted overall total of overseas visitors to the United States will exceed 3 million in 1972, a record number and a 26 per cent increase over last year. In addition, some 10 million visitors are expected to arrive from Canada this year and 1.3million from Mexico. Japan will lead all overseas countries in the number of visitors450,000 it sends to the United States this year, a 45 per cent increase over last year.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONThe credibility of the Federal Government's, budget has sunk so low thatin the, theory of the swing of the pendulumthe time may have come to take it seriously again.

title: ExChief of A.B. A. Says Agnew Raises Old Issue on Aid to Poor
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 5Bernard G. Segal, a former president of the American Bar Association, charged today that Vice President Agnew was disinterring an old issue if he had, as reported, questioned the right of federally funded legal aid lawyers to sue local officials on behalf of poor clients.

title: Movies
description: GENE HACKMAN, a harddriving cop in both The French Connection and Cisco Pike, will play a harddriving driver in his next film, Sprinter. What's a sprinter?

title: N.Y.U. FENCERS WIN 27TH MEET IN ROW
description: The New York University fencing team extended its threeyear undefeated dualmeet streak to 27 yesterday in routing Harvard, 1710, at the Washington Square gymnasium.

title: Cowboys, Colts, Bills, Raiders and Cards Look Like Winners in Draft
description: The National Football League's annual draft of college players was designed originally to help the poor teams get rich. But the Dallas Cowboys 36 years later seem to have turned the draft into a richgetricher proposition.

title: MEDICAID SCORED ON PAYMENT LAGS
description: Leaders of the Medical Society of the County of New York urged yesterday that responsibility for making Medicaid payments be taken away from the city Department of Social Services and turned over to private, nonprofit insurers.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: CINCINNATI, Feb: 5 (AP)Nate Archibald had 7 of his 45 points in overtime as the Cincinnati Royals defeated the Detroit Pistons, 133132, tonight in a bruising National Basketball Association game that saw five players foul out.

title: New & Novel
description: Two great revival movements in fiction converge here: the comeback of sentiment and the return of the 1930's. And imagine, if you will, this juncture taking place on a street in Montmartre, where the protagonist is a 10yearold urchin. Formidable!

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I was delighted to read the article on country inns, but how amazing it is that the Algonquin in Manhattan was not even mentioned, since we are the only urban hotel in the book on which the piece was based  Country Inns and Back Roads. If an urban hotel is distinctive enough to warrant inclusion in the top guide to country inns, it must have taken a mighty effort of will to exclude some mention of this charming anomaly. Frankly, as a New York hotelier, I am beginning to feel discriminated against. I recall another article in which one of your writers unfavorably contrasted his theatergoing experiences in New York with the delights of theatergoing in several foreign capitals. (Travel section, Dec. 5). If you think it about time to point up some of the pleasant things in New York City, I hope you will consider an article on the Algonquin's 70th anniversary this year.

title: Versions of Paris TalksSeetn to Differ on Key Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Hanoi and Washington appeared today to be completely at odds in their public versions of at least two crucial points in last year's secret negotiations in Paris to settle the Vietnam war.

title: Civic Groups Spurring Prison Reform
description: NEWARK  The Attica prison revolt and inmate uprisings at Railway Prison and Yardville Reformatory have given anew spirit of urgency to work of private groups interested in penal reform.

title: LAMPO IS VICTOR IN COUGAR BOWLING
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 5 (UPI) Gus Lampo, an Endicott, N, Y., pro who captured his first bowling title, two weeks ago at Las Vegas, made it two out, of, three today as he led all the way to win $10,000 and new automobile in the $85,000 Mercury Cougar open tournament.

title: YearRound Commerce On Great Lakes Studied
description: SAULTE SAINTE MARIE, Mich., Feb. 5The possibility of navigating the Great Lakes the year round has long been a dream of shipowners, but the problems of doing so are far more complex than navigation alone. A $6.5million study of these problems, authorized by Congress last year, is now under way.

title: A 9cent radio and guerrilla architecture
description: There are 35 million pets in the United States. The owners of these pets spend $350 million a year on pet food, but only $35 million a year on pet things. No one has offered the owner a thing to buy for Rover. It is probably possible to get mink collars at NeimanMarcus, but no such merchandise crosses America.

title: U.S. REPORTS ACCORD IN GREEK PORT TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP)  United States officials said today that agreement had been reached in principle for providing a home port in Greece for some units of the United States Sixth Fleet.

title: Egypt, Rome and ancient Africa
description: Prehistorythe archaic pastis too often a more tempting site to a fiction writer than to his readers. There he will have plenty of leeway for his novel, he thinks, there he can do anything, invent everything, with no awkward arbitration by reality. He not only will have the same godly powers that are ordinarily associated with his craft; he can even make gods. But what will it all be about, the reader asks, and what will it matter? This ideal simplicity and freedom to move backward through time is too much like a blank page, and the whole project from the beginning smells of allegory, that hortatory farm which is dearer to writers than readers, again. The fellows who write science fiction, moving forward instead, tend not to have read so much, not to be so solemn, but to tell their story without drawing a moral.

title: Announcements 5000
description: Announcements 5000

title: The World
description: The World

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONOver the two and a half years since President Nixon first proposed a Federally guaranteed minimum income for poor families, one question has never stopped haunting both his supporters and critics: Did he really mean it? Or, was he only playing welfare politics, pleasing the liberals with his words and the conservatives with inaction?

title: Stewart, Fittipaldi Break Lap Records for Practice
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Feb. 5 (UPI)Three of the world's top racing drivers screamed past the deserted stands at Kyalami racing circuit this week, breaking official lap records with only technicians to cheer them on.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: If the airlines are losing money, why add expensive items like caviar and Trader Vic cuisine, and the socalled fun things? Sure, lots of people enjoy exotic food, rock music and continuous noise, but I object to being a captive audience on a plane. Could we have with and without planes? I mean really without, not as the no (?) smoking sections are on planes now.

title: Art:
description: TRENTONThe State Coun cil on the Arts is now accepting applications from local arts councils for grants under a $250,000 joint Federalstate funding program.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: On July 1, 1916, thousands of Allied troops climbed scaling ladders and poured out of their trenches in a grand and foolhardy attack on the German lines. British high command had hoped that this thrust would break German resistance and end the war. Instead the wave was pushed back, at the cost of 60,000 British casualties; and nothing remained but a ghastly war of attrition. Mr. Middlebrook has interviewed 500 survivors and provides a very vivid picture of what the ordinary Tommy's life was like on that fateful day.

title: Small Towns Show Sharp Census Gain
description: Fortysixth among the 50 states in size, yet a big eighth in population, New Jersey can be described as:

title: ADELPITI FIRST IN 3 OF 6 RELAY RACES
description: Adelphi University dominated the 16th annual relay carnival of the Collegiate Track Conference yesterday, even though the four members of the school's worldrecord onemile team were missing.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The article by William V. Shannon describes what is wrong with our relationships with our children more clearly and accurately than anything I have ever read. It expresses in plain, simple, direct terms the essentials of parentchild interactions which promote emotional growth and responsibility. plain, simple, direct terms the essentials of parentchild interactions which promote emotional growth and responsibility.

title: TV Maillbag
description: To THE EDITOR: IWAS astonished and dismayed by the article, Serious Issues In a ReCreated Documentary, in which John J. O'Connor described my first two shows in the Appointment With Destiny TV series on CBS as pure fiction cleverly masquerading as reality. Not once does he report that the factual accuracy of The Plot to Murder Hitler was attested to by our consultant, William L. Shirer, a leading expert on the Nazi period. Not once does he mention that our facts on The Last Days of John Dillinger were reviewed by no less than three authoritiesVirgil Peterson, former head of the Chicago Crime Commission; Joseph Pinkston, Dillinger biographer; and Dr. Karl Menninger, famed psychiatrist and advocate of penal reform.

title: CANISIUS FIVE TOPS MANHATTAN, 88.86
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 5Canisius, led by Mike Norwodd's secondhalf freethrow shooting, defeated Manhattan, 8886, despite Richie Barnet's 25 points, 13 assists and nine rebounds at the Buffalo Memorial Auditorium tonight before 4,125.

title: Case, Up for a 4th Term, Sees No Threat of Purge
description: WASHINGTON  Picture this political situation: an Eastern liberal Republican Senatdr who supportedPresident Nixon's legislation less than half the time last year is up for reelection. Could this invite a replay of the 1970 Senate election in New York, where the Nixon Adpinistration worked to defeat an incumbent Republican critic, Charles E: Goodell?

title: The Nation
description: LORDSTOWN, OhioDale Sirakis catches hold of one of the hooks and in one skillful motion guides it under the body of a Vega, which then begins its long journey through a gantlet of welders and assemblers at the huge General Motors plant here.

title: Science/ Medicine
description: Here was a yawning pit upon whose floor the armies of Russia could camp, and have room to spare, wrote Mark Twain in 1866, on his visit to the giant volcano that rises from the sea, forming the island of Hawaii. The greater part of the crater floor, he said, was inky black, but over a square mile of it was ringed and streaked and striped with a thousand branching streams of liquid and gorgeously brilliant firel It looked like colossal railroad map of the state of Massachusetts done in chain lightning on a midnight sky.

title: NIXON'S TAX PLAN INCLUDES REBATES TO MOST FAMILIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The Administration's tentative plan for a valueadded tax includes an unusual feature that would provide rebates of at least part of the tax not only to poor families but also to others ranging well into the uppermiddle income categoryfor example, a family of four with an income of $20,000 a year.

title: Qpposition to ScatterSite Housing Transcends Racial and Economic Lines
description: A majority of the scattersite housing projects now being planned by the city for the nonelderly poor are in areas that bear little resemblance to the white, middleclass Forest Hills community, where a controversy has raged over construction of an 840unit lowincome complex.

title: Catherine McGay Wed to Officer
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Feb. 5Miss Catherine, Marie McGay and Lieut. Barry Chester Robinson U.S.A.F., who was graduated Thursday from the Officer's Training School at Lackland Air Force Base, San Antonio, Tex, were married here this afternoon in Our Lady of Poland Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Vitalis B. Pedzik.

title: PLAYGROUND WORK AIDED BY BEQUEST
description: A halfacre playground on Manhattan's West Side will be reconstructed and another playground in Central Park refurbished with contributions from the estate of the late Mrs. Mary Flagler Cary, Parks Administrator August Heckscher announced yesterday.

title: CHARLES GOODMAN SR.
description: Charles Austin Goodman Sr., father of Julian Goodman, president of the National Broadcasting Company, died yesterday in Glasgow, Ky., where he lived. His age was 88.

title: Volks Sales Hold
description: Holding our own seems to be the catchword at the Englewood Cliffs, N. J., headquarters of Volkswagen's operation in the United States.

title: Shock, Vibration and Noise
description: Spurred by two recent Federal lawsthe 1970 United States Occupational Safety and Health Act and the revised 1969 WalshHealy Public Contracts Act both regulating industrial noise, the shock and vibration control Industry is enjoying a boomlet.

title: JERSEY WILL LIMIT INSURERS YIELDS
description: TRENTON, Feb. 5The New Jersey Commissioner of Insurance ruled today that automobile insurance companies in the state should be limited to a profit of 2 per cent on their underwritings and 6 per cent on their investments.

title: Ski Federation Will Sponsor World Alpine Championship
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 5 (UPI)  The International Ski Federation formally announced today that a world Alpine men's ski tournament would be staged later this year.

title: LAYER TOPS ASHE AND GAINS FINAL
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 5 (AP) Rod Laver, his incredible strokes at their finest, defeated Arthur Ashe, 62, 76, today and advanced to the final of the $50,000 Fidelity tennis tournament.

title: Miss Wallace To Be a Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. James J. Wallace of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Coreen Elizabeth Wallace, to George Sheldon Scharfe, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Scharfe Jr. of Babylon, L. I.

title: To Revive the Countryside
description: Since the 1890's, when the nation's destiny became irrevocably industrial and urban, men have increasingly praised the virtues of life on the farms and in the small towns. In his message to Congress the other day on rural development, President Nixon had recourse to this rhetoric of nostalgia: From the very beginnings of our history, the vitality of rural America has been at the heart of our nation's strength.

title: Big Seizure of Marijuana
description: CAPETOWN, Feb. 5 (Reuters)  The police confiscated nearly 9.4 million pounds of marijuana in the year ended last June, Police Minister Lourens Muller has told parliament. He estimated the drug's value, if sold illegally, at more than $43million.

title: MARQUETTE ROUTS DE PAUL, 79 TO 61
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 5 (AP)Unbeaten, secondranked Marquette stretched its winning streak for this season to 17 games by trimming De Paul, 7961, today.

title: The World
description: Following are excerpts from the debate in Parliament last week on the violence in Northern Ireland:

title: Nixon Expected to Sign 71 Campaign Funding Act Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is expected to be signed into law by President Nixon on Monday, starting what some here think may be a revolution in American political financing.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The story of the voyage of the Glomar Challenger, which sailed from Texas on Aug. 11, 1968, to explore the geology of the ocean. Drilling for core samples several thousand feet beneath the ocean floor, the geologists went back millions of years in time and revealed considerable data to support the continentalshift theory. Mr. Briggs, who was along on the voyage, knows his subject and has written about it very well.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: No Saturday Review reader will need an introduction to this usually witty, and occasionally strained, columnist (as well as exgagradioTVwriter). Mr. Ace can be relied upon to entertain, sometimes to inspire, whether he's reporting on his latest meeting with the OneEyed Monster, advising politicians how to better their performance even if it interferes with their image, or sending a charter member of the A.M.A. to stand in the corner.

title: EVENT #26 GIVEN BY CUNNINGHAM
description: For their performance Friday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, Merce Cunningham and Dance Company presented a program billed as Event #26.

title: Massachusetts U. Students Asked to Record Valuables
description: AMHERST, Mass., Feb. 5 (AP)In an effort to halt a rising incidence of dormitory thefts, the University of Massachusetts asked students this week to list all their valuables with the police.

title: HANOI RULES OUT A PARTIAL ACCORD
description: PARIS, Feb. 5North Vietnam's chief delegate to the Paris peace talks said today that the military and political conditions for a settlement of the Vietnam war were separable last summer, when the Vietcong presented their sevenpoint proposal, but were separable no longer.

title: Barbara Jean Steinmetz Engaged
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Feb. 5Mr. and Mrs. William J. Steinmetz have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Jean Steinmetz, to John W. Kirshon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul H. Kirshon of New York.

title: AIR FORCE CONQUERS GEORGIA TECH, 7553
description: AIR FORCE ACADEMY, Colorado Springs, Feb. 5 (AP) The Air Force Academy snapped a sixgame losing streak by beating Georgia Tech in basketball today, 7553.

title: Ghana Junta Nullifies Currency Devaluation
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Feb. 5 (Reuters)Ghana today nullified last December's devaluation of the cedi and announced a revaluation of 42 per cent against the dollar.

title: Miss Annette Duffy Betrothed
description: BRONXVILE, N. Y., Feb, 5 Mr. and Mrs. Thomas A. Duffy have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Annette Elizabeth Duffy, to David Bingham Odell, son of Mrs. Benjamin Barker Odell of Northfield, Ill., and the late Mr. Odell, a former vice president of Moore, Case, Lyman & Hubbard, Chicago insurance brokers.

title: Gardens
description: MANY sorts of twining, tendrilclimbing and trailing vines can be used to bring variety and freshness to indoor gar dens. Climbers clasp or twine around string or wire to frame a window, or form a living mural on a suitable wall. And they can be trained around small bamboo or plastic trellises. Trailers are effective on stands or shelves, suspended from brackts or planted in hanging baskets.

title: Blacks Gain In Census For Nassau
description: While the black population in Nassau County is still slightly less than 5 per cent of the total, its increase during the nineteensixties was greater than for any county in the state outside New York City except Monroe County, which includes Rochester.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Nobody in his right mind would suggest that all of the programing produced on home screens is excellent or even good. However, there are many educational and emotional.. ly rewarding programs available to children.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONCamden, N. J., has tried to fight back against urban decay so pronounced that, the Mayor says, the city is down to its last picture show. For 18 months, city agencies have been ready to build two major downtown redevelopment projests.

title: MINGUS CONCERT FEATURES FRIENDS
description: The mercurial Charles Mingas has exhibited many sides of his variegated musical personality during his long career. But on Friday evening at Philharnionic Hall, giving his first concert in New York in 10 years, he exhibited a characteristic that has never before been associated with his work.

title: OFFICERS FEEL FOE WON'T STRIKE NOW
description: HUE, South Vietnam, Feb. 5 Despite predictions to the contrary, South Vietnamese and American officers in the far north of South Vietnam are not expecting a major enemy offensive here this month.

title: Bomb Hoax at Newry Hotel
description: NEWRY, Sunday, Feb. 6 (Reuters)About 100 guestsmostly journalistswere evacuated from the Ardmore Hotel in Newry early this morning after the management received a bomb threat that proved to be a hoax. After a 20minute search by the police, guests returned to their rooms.

title: Going Straight Wins by 9 Lengths in $61,900. Donn Handicap at Gulfstream
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Feb. 5Donald Ball's Going Straight upset heavily favored Mr. Pow Wow in the $61,900 Donn Handicap at Gulfstream Park today and he did it with style.

title: Clark's 2 Goals Help Yale Subdue Princetoh Si, 31
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 5Phil Clark, a sophomore, scoreel twice in the first period and Mark Fitzsimmons made 39 saves in goal tonight as Yale defeated Princeton, 31, in an Ivy League hockey game.

title: 5 CHILDREN SAVED IN BROOKLYN BLAZE
description: Firemen working in heavy winds and an 18degree cold early yesterday morning rescued five children trapped in a burning 11thfloor apartment in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: ANGELO J. CALIENDO, BROOKLYN SURGEON
description: Dr. Angelo J. Caliendo, an attending surgeon at the Lutheran Medical Center in Brooklyn, and former chief of rectal and Colon surgery, died there Friday of a heart attack. He was 64 years old and lived at 7606 Narrows Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Son Born to Mrs. Yates
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Timothy Yates of 345 East 86th Street on Jan. 29 in the Lenox Hill Hospital.

title: Doctors Tell Knicks Reed He's Through for Season
description: Willis Reed will not rejoin the New York Knicks this season, but should be able to resume his career next season if his ailing left knee responds to a new program of rest and rehabilitation.

title: North Vietnamese Reject Nixon's Proposal Officially
description: HANOI, North Vietnam; Feb. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)North Vietnam today formally rejected President Nixon's eightpoint peace plan for Indochina, terming it deceptive.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The Super Bowl interlude in New Orleans served as an alumni reunion of sorts for the New York Giants. It was by accident rather than by design and yet the underlying significance of the joyous gatherings of the Old Grads carried a poignant message that might have been overlooked amid all that nostalgia.

title: AID FOR CHARITIES SENT TO NEEDIEST
description: Love of neighbor does not know sectarian or racial differences, Mrs. Gertrud A. Mellon of 1035 Fifth Avenue, wrote as she asked that her $200 contribution to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund be divided among Catholic, Protestant and Jewish charities.

title: Glenn Sharfin Fiance of Phyllis Cohen
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Feb. 5Mr. and Mrs. Bernard J. Cohen have announced the engagement of their daughter Miss Phyllis M. Cohen, to Glenn Sharfin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin Sharfin of Bayside, Queens.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Most of Stanley Kubrick's films are protests, motivated by a metaphysical hunger. A Clockwork Orange is no exception. What Professor Hoxie Neale Fairchild said of William Blake, the English poet, could be applied to Kubrick: He saw that man's brain had been shaping a world that was not fit for man's spirit to live in.

title: Art
description: TO visit the new exhibition called Abstract Expressionism: The First and Second Generations at the AlbrightKnox Art Gallery in Buffalo is to take a trip in time as well as space. The time is the 1950's and the panoramic view, 56 paintings by 51 painters, is of Abstract Expressionism  the homegrown movement that swarmed out of postwar New York to storm the worldat its roughest and readiest. It is an absorbing and, in a complicated way, a nostalgic spectacle, even though the lesser works in it hardly merit a nostalgic response and the greater works, in their undiminished vigor, to scorn one.

title: Allen Ginsberg Remembers Mama
description: THERE was once a little girl named Naomi Levy. She was brought by her family from Russia to America in 1905, following a pogrom. She learned English on Orchard and Rivington Streets. She grew into a beautiful young woman who loved art, nature and justice. She tried to paint, played the mandolin, went to the opera, to poetry readings, to lectures, became a communistbohemian of the twenties and thirties, got involved in the Paterson, N. J., silk strikes, became secretary of her Communist Party cell, became a teacher of retarded children, and went to the radical Camp NichtGedeigit where she threaded flowers through her long hair and to Woodstock where she won a prize for designing the most original and beautiful dress.

title: Press Club on Coast Keeps Ban on Women
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 5 (UPI)  Women will remain banned from full voting membership in the San Francisco Press Club.

title: SHOP TALK
description: COPIAGUE, L.I.  The townspeople here almost named their community Marconiville after World War I, but they settled for Marconi Boulevard instead. And since the days when Guglielmo Marchese Marconi, inventor of the wireless, spent summers here with friends, farms and estates have given way to housing developments and small manufacturing concerns.

title: Canadian Troops Leading the Way in Nation. Building
description: OTTAWACanada's armed forces have widened their role to include such unwarlike but necessary missions as environmental security and the opening of North America's last frontier in the Arctic.

title: Nicholas LeGrand to Marry Miss Jean Faith Ehrenkranz
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Feb. 5The engagement of Miss Jean Faith Ehrenkranz to Nicholas Wilcox LeGrand has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Ehrenkranz, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Clay LeGrand, an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the State of Iowa, and Mrs. LeGrand of LeClaire, Iowa.

title: MRS. JOSEPH POPE
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Feb. 5Mrs. Charlotte Leavitt Pope, the widow of Joseph Pape, senior, vice president of Stone and Webster, Inc., an engineering concern, died yesterday in a nursing home in White Plains. She was 85 years old and lived at 16 Hamilton Avenue.

title: Recordings
description: WHAT Shaw described, as the religion of the pianoforte in the 19th century still flourishes, though nowadays it is a rare young follower of the keyboard cult who does not slip away for an occasional revel in the backsliding heresies of harpsichord or clavichord. Some even experiment in the Black Mass thrills of synthesizer or electronic organ. But Mother Piano continues to command the devotion of an astonishing number of talented young artists. In fact, they flood out of the conservatories and onto records at a rate that can be distressing in view of the severely limited number of virtuosos able to make concert careers at any one time.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Now that the sound and resulting fury over your article on passengers being bumped off planes (Travel section, Dec. 26) has subsided, this satisfied traveler would like to defend the airlines and I own no airline stocks. I have found that United, Eastern and Pan American bend over backwards; and in my particular case, this presents some problems. For the past three years I have been a stroke victim, btit this has not deterred my taste for travelthanks to the aforementioned airlines. From the time when I was a wheelchair passenger until the present I now use a cane the airlines have consistently made allowances for my condition (going ahead of the crowds, preferred seat, exceptional inflight attention by airline personnel, etc.).

title: Julia P. Bell Will Be Wed
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Feb. 5 Mr. and Mrs. William Hersey Bell have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Julia Parker Bell, to Peter Donnelly Cowen, son of Mr. and Mrs. George N. Cowen of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: Bruins Subdue Red Wings, 32, and Extend Unbeaten Streak to 13 Games
description: BOSTON, Feb. 5 (UPI)Eddie Westfall's second goal of the game and 14th of the season today gave the streaking Boston Bruins a 32 victory over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: The Nation
description: The tangled and bewildering saga of Clifford Irving and his alleged autobiography of billionaire industrialist Howard R. Hughes took some new and unexpected twists last week.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: It is time to shift from concern with producing new housing units to the legitimate needs of truly lowerincome families.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To ME EDITOR: Maybe I am not the only one to have walked out of A Clockwork Orange somewhat deadened. Often the impact of a great film will leave us speechless, but I found myself empty. I do not pretend to know Kubrick's intentions but he did succeed in producing a film not only completely devoid of sentiment (no small achievement) but also devoid of heart.

title: KENTUCKY DOWNS VANDERBILT, 8580
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Feb. 5 (AP)Kentucky defeated Vanderbilt, 8580, in overtime today and maintained the lead in the Southeastern Conference basketball race. The Wildcats wonlost record is 72 in the league.

title: Herbert Samuel, 55 Executive Of Chock Full o Nuts, Is Dead
description: Herbert Samuel, vice president in charge of personnel of the Chock Full o Nuts Corporation, the restaurant chain and coffee producer, died Thursday of a heart attack n Rome, Ga., where he was visiting relatives. He was 55 years old and lived at 243 Carolina Avenue, Hempstead, L.I.

title: The Nation
description: Under the pressure of mounting crime and public apprehension about crime, politicians and law enforcement agencies seem increasingly anxious to assess responsibility for the crisis, to place the blame where it belongssomewhere else.

title: Chiefs to Oppose Jolters Next Sunday at the Garden
description: The Chiefs will return to Madison Square Garden next Sunday, meeting the Jolters in an International Roller Derby League game beginning at 1 P.M. The Jolters, led by Ann Calvello, are the Chiefs prime challengers for first place. They are presently three games in back of the local club.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Pleasant reminiscences by the veteran Western history writer. Terrell tells of his first sight of the. West as a boy, the profound emotion it stirred in him and his resolve to devote his life to the region and its history. He worked as sheepherder and ranch hand, among a number of occupations, and tells once again a lot about a cowboy's life you won't find in Westerns. The book is full of tales, anecdotes and authentic Western types.

title: F.P.C CURB ASKED IN WASTE CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The Federal Power Commission has been asked to let the Environmental Protection Agency decide whether water should be stored and released by the proposed Blue Ridge hydroelectric project to dilute the pollution of the Kanawha River caused by the chemical complex at Charleston, W. Va.

title: The Old Shell Game
description: SANIBEL ISLAND, Fla.Some years ago Sanibel's sea shells inspired Anne Morrow Lindbergh to write the bestseller Gift From the Sea. Admittedly, shelling does not turn everybody into a philosopher or a writer, but if you spend any time at all here, you've almost got to become some kind of conchologist. And when you do you can enter the annual Shell Fair (this year March 24) and exhibit your own collection and look at other people's and see just how much you've learned.

title: Bill to Aid Crime Victims
description: PROVIDENCE, R. L, Feb. 5 (UPI)  A bill has been introduced in the state Senate that would provide up to $25,000 compensation for victims of criminal violence. Awards would cover the cost of injury, pecuniary loss due to incapacity and payments to dependent survivors in the event of death.

title: Movies
description: PARIS. YOU take a hasty look at Louis Malle's career as a director, starting with his 1958 The Lovers (the act of love in loving detail) and ending up with his 1971 Murmur of the Heart (motherson incest) by way of a couple of films featuring Brigitte Bardot, and you might figure you could slot him as one of the consistent forerunners of sexual permissiveness  presented with all due high artistic sobriety  in the cinema.

title: The World
description: MOSCOWA cutting joke that mocks the deepseated Egyptian fear of fighting Israel, despite Cairo's bellicose talk of war, has been circulating lately among Soviet intellectuals. In it, Egyptian President Anwar elSadat comes to Moscow in quest of a large new shipment of Soviet tankswith one forward gear and three in reverse.

title: Weekend In 33
description: To readers of the right vintage (vide the Sabatier novel, above) there's a special fascination about the 1930's. Away back then (in retrospect) identities seem larger and clearer, and past villainies have eroded into nostalgia. Weekend in 33 is a case in point, as Bob Thomas, a biographer of studio biggies (Thalberg and Selznick, King Cohn), dips into movie mythology for a novelized Byzantine interlude, starring greats of the silver screen.

title: Vachon Undergoes Surgery
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 5 (AP)Rogatien Vachon, goaltender for the Los Angeles Kings, underwent successful surgery today for removal of cartilage and repair of torn ligaments in his left knee, the Kings reported. Vachon was injured Thursday in a National Hockey League game against Montreal.

title: jersey Transport Seeks to Run Lindenwold Rail Commuter Line
description: MAPLEWOOD  Transport of New Jersey, which has been cutting service and manpower on its bus lines around the state, is seeking to take over the Lindenwold rail commuter service between South Jersey points and Philadelphia.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The Shannon family says grace before every meal. For what, please, is thanks offered by the Shannon family? For food full of additives, for air full of pollution, for hillbillies on the moon while millions of Americans, including many children the same age as Mr. Shannon's, go hungry with little relief in sight?

title: Yugoslav Beaten
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 5 (AP)Erik Van Dillen of San Mateo, Calif., continued his surprises by defeating Zeljko Franulovic of Yugoslavia, 60, 46, 63, in the semifinals of the $15,000 Kansas City international indoor tennis tournament tonight.

title: RENT AID ABOUNDS IN BELLEVUE AREA
description: A twobedroom terraced coop apartment on Manhattan's East Side for $100 a month with no equity, or down payment?

title: Boat Show to Begin oh Saturday
description: Nautical fans, still reeling from the mindboggling display atthe National Boat Show at the Coliseum last month, will get no respite in, February.

title: YEW PARTY MAKES A DEBUT IN DENVER
description: DENVER, Feb. 5The Libertarian party, a new political party stressing opposition to big government and dedication to civil and economic freedom, has made a quiet national debut in Denver.

title: Pyles Wins in Series
description: ASPEN, Colo., Feb. 5 (AP)Rudd Pyles of Frisco, Colo., captured the men's downhill in the Roch Cup ski competition yesterday to move from third to second place in the CanadianAmerican Ski Trophy series.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Mr. Shannon's tender reference to the Ten Commandments neglects to account for the fact that although we decry killing we applaud heroism in war; although we disapprove of lying we hush our children who make frank and unflattering statements, not understanding the thin line between truth and tact; although we condemn adultery, we acknowledge that a marriage which can be smashed couldn't have been too strong to start with. What a child needs is not precept but explanation, not condemnation but encouragement.

title: SYRACUSE DOWNS UMASS, 90 TO 85
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Feb. 5 (AP) Syracuse took the lead with 10 minutes left in the first half and never relinquished it as the Orangemen rolled to a 90.85 basketball victory over Massachusetts today.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: You achieved a new record; in the competitive field of official euphemism by saying in the Notes Column that Amtrack had curtailed its service between Buffalo, Cleveland and Chicago (Travel section, Jan 16). So were the Ten Little Indians curtailed. Till Jan. 3, there was one train a day in each direction between these cities; now there is none.

title: A New Push For a Bus Terminal In Flushing
description: When Leonard P. Stavisky first ran for an Assembly seat in 1965, he placed a major emphasis on the need for a bus terminal in downtown Flushing.

title: IN THE NATION
description: MANCHESTER, N. H.On the sur face, the similarity is strikinga virtually unknown antiwar candidate running against a powerful President of his own party in the first primary of an election year. Under the surface, however, there is not much resents, blance between Representative Paul N. (Pete) McCloskey's New Hampshire primary campaign against President Nixon and Eugene McCarthy's spectacular effort against President Johnson in this state four years ago.

title: G. L. Estes 3d, Laura Roberts Plan Nuptials
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill., Feb. 5 William S. Roberts, a senior vicepresident of the stockbrokerage firm of Kidder Peabody & Co. In Chicago, and Mrs. Roberts have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Laura Katharyn Roberts, to George Lawton Estes 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Estes Jr. of West Hartford, Conn. A summer wedding is planned.

title: A Wise Child Flunks Out
description: WHAT would you say this play was about? A parentless boy of 19 or so, blond and mussy, spots an older man who is wanted for a crime. He blackmails him. He won't turn him in provided the older man comes home with him and does what he wants. He wants him to dress up to play the part of his mum. He has bras and earrings and wigs and wedgies waiting in the closet for the purpose.

title: the traveler's world
description: ST. GEORGE'S, Grenada, West Indies At the halfway point in our eightday motorsail through the Grenadine Islands, our 143foot, threemasted wooden schooner Sundowner left tiny Petit St. Vincent Island for Bequia, pronounced Bekwee and one of the loveliest of the many Grenadines. Our twisting course under power through thickly reefed waters skirted Carriacou Island, cut eastward between Union and Prune Islands, then north and northeast to pass between Mayero and Catholic Islands with Baline to starboard, then past Cannouan on the north side of Bequia and on to anchorage inside the protective horseshoe of Admiralty Bay.

title: FINCH BARS RACE FOR CONGRESS NOW
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 5Robert H. Finch, counselor to the President, says he will not run for Congress this year.

title: Miss Mary Brooke Carmichael Betrothed to Richard Wooster
description: CHAGRIN FALLS, Ohio, Feb. 5Mr. and Mrs. Donald S. Carmichael have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Brooke Carmichael, to Richard Willet Wooster, son of Mr. and Mrs. John T. Wooster of Upper Montclair, N.J.

title: Export Management
description: The huge deficit that the United States registered in its balance of trade last year, the first since 1888, is expected to add strength to the forces that oppose growing imports.

title: Illinois Triumphs
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Feb. 5 (AP)C. J. Schroeder converted 10 straight free throws in the final eight minutes today to help Illinois to a 68.59 victory over Northwestern.

title: Mostly PartTime Sales Staffs Mainstay of Big Bergen Stores
description: PARAMUSTen years ago, when she was 48 years old, Helen Janowitz of Glen Rock kissed her dentisthusband, got into her own car and drove five minutes away to Alexander's Department Store in Paramus, reentering the working world as a saleslady after more than 20 years at home.

title: Gardens
description: IF, as Robert Frost said, good fences make good neighbors, good hedges make even better ones. What is more pleasing to, both sides of a property line than the thick, feathery mass of wellkept hemlock hedge, with its abundance of neighborly greenery, its nesting places for small birds and its winter cover for juncos, chickadees and cardinals?

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: S.M.U. Tops Baylor, 7470
description: DALLAS, Feb. 5 (AP)Larry Delvell made both shots in a oneandone foul situation with 12 seconds to play today, giving Southern Methodist a 7470 Southwest Conference basketball victory over Baylor.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: NORTH EASTON, Mass., Feb. 5 Stonehill College, led by Mike Allocco's 32 points, defeated visiting C. W. Post, 7776, in basketball tonight.

title: Coming Attraction: The Bags With A Musical on City's Foibles
description: What has 10 feet, uses cardboard cartons, strips of newspaper and appeals to both youngsters and adults?

title: Music
description: NEGLECT, illness and disaster have marked the life of Stefan Wolpe, who has been something of a legend among the musical avantgarde for the poetry he infuses in the new language. Wolpe applied ten times for a Guggenheim before receiving one, and then he was almost 60 years old. Nine years ago he was stricken with Parkinson's disease, making it virtually impossible for him to read, write, or talk much of the time. Then, in 1969, just after he moved into his present apartment, a defective lamp wire caused it to go up in flames, damaging his scores and destroying his uninsured Mir, Kline and de Kooning paintings. Students and friends have worked tirelessly to restore his manuscripts and to raise money for a nurse who attends Wolpe every day.

title: MADISON AVE
description: A few weeks ago, Robert David wrote a muchneeded article for this column entitled The Boors of Business. I read it and gleefully sent a copy to a remiss agency, knowing I could kiss the account goodby and then sent a letter to Mr. David to tell him how much we film producers needed those words. In fact, we needed to see them almost as much as the advertising agencies needed to read them.

title: Motorcycle Gangs Clash; One Dead and 4 Injured
description: MARSHALTON, Del., Feb. 5 (AP)A territorial war between rival East Coast motorcycle gangs near here left one dead last night and four injured, according to the Delaware Slate Police.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Unlike Stanley Kubrick, I mustas I feel we all musthave more faith in man's greater sensitivities and not be bound to a grotesque vision of the world such as that portrayed in A Clockwork Orange.

title: Last Word
description: Parents want their children to become happy, compassionate and constructive adults. That is not going to happen unless fathers and mothers teach positive values and set good examples. Their children are not going to get this crucial help from television or from other children, and parents cannot expect school to do the whole job for them. Parents have moral responsibility for children, and it is not authoritarian or unrealistic to expect them to discharge that responsibility. Not all parents have the same values, but each should act upon those beliefs which he she does have.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Public and private economic development efforts appear to have reached nearly every, part of the country. No hamlet, it seems, has been overlooked in the rush to uplift individual localities or, for that matter, entire regions that have lagged and continue to lag behind the pace being set and being well publicized elsewhere.

title: Harold Henry Marries Anne Wythe Donaldson
description: HAMPTON, Va., Feb. 5Miss Anne Wythe Donaldson, a student at the. Institute of Fine Arts of New York University, and Harold Stirling Henry, a graduate student in history at Columbia University, were married here at noon in the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. John Craven, House of Delegates of the Virginia State Legislature.

title: Tanker, Missing 4 Days, Is Hunted
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 5 The Coast Guard continued today to search for the tanker V.A. Fogg and her 39 men, missing in the Gulf of Mexico since Tuesday. The search craft comprise six planes and three ships.

title: James D. Schine Weds Miss Pigott
description: LYME, Conn., Feb. 5Miss Penelope Eleanor Pigott and James Daniel Schine were married today in the Lyme Congregational Church by the Rev. Bruce B. McLucas.

title: In the Mailbox:
description: To the Editor: The trade of Fran Tarkenton to the Minnesota Vikings represents a major blunder by the Giant organization, which has only succeeded in creating dark cloud over the future of the Giants.

title: Fight to Curb Rent Growing Statewide
description: FORT LEEThe battle of rent stabilization is moving to a peak in New Jersey. With emotions as high as the next rent check or property tax bill, the hostilities have engulfed thousands of tenants, landlords and homeowners in heated debate.

title: Dowdy's Wife to Seek Office
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP) Mrs. John Dowdy, wife of the Texas Representative who was convicted of accepting a $25,000 bribery, plans to seek election as his successor in the House, Dowdy's office said today. Dowdy, Democrat, has announced his retirement from Congress at the end of this session. He faces a possible maximum penalty of 40 years in Jail for his bribery conviction.

title: Books:
description: By the author's reckoning, there are between 190,000 and 200,000 businesses owned by blacks in the United States, or about one business for every 100 black citizens. This works out to an ownership ratio of 1 per cent. Other businesses, he continues, total 8 million, or one for every 22 white citizens, an ownership ratio of about 4.5 per cent.

title: Jersey Guide
description: MEADOWBROOK  Forty Carats, with June Lockhart (through Feb. 27); Come Blow Your Horn, with Bill Bixby (March 2 through 26). At Meadowbrook Theater Restaurant, 1050 Pompton Avenue, Cedar Grove, Thursday through Saturday, dinner from 6:30 P. M., showtime 8:40 P. M., Sundays one hour earlier; dancing until closing. Tickets:. $8.95 to $13.45, except Saturdays from $9.95 to $14.75. (201) 2560087 1455.

title: Letter to the Editor 3  No Title
description: The report on housing in the southeast Bronx was an accurate description of the current situation.

title: San Franciscans Determined To Hold Back Flood of Cars
description: SAN FRANCISCOGuards are posted on the San FranciscoOakland Bay Bridge these days to look for motorists riding with dummy human beings beside them. Since Dec. 8, autos carrying three or more people have been able to cross the bridge free during morning rush hours  and a few drivers have tried to evade the 50cent toll by carrying dummies as passengers.

title: Atlantic Coast Pro League Adds Westchester Eleven
description: The Atlantic Coast Football League, at its annual winter meeting in the Americana Hotel yesterday, approved a franchise for the Westchester Crusaders. The team will play at Memorial Stadium in Mount Vernon.

title: Movie Mailbag
