title: Burns Defends Easy Money Policy;
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 Arthur F. Burns vigorously denied today the allegation, made both at home and abroad, that the Federal Reserve Board, by its easy and expansionary monetary policy, was undermining the Smithsonian agreement establishing a new pattern of currency exchange rates.

title: Colonels Conquer Cougars
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb, 9 (AP) The Kentucky Colonels dominated play under the basket tonight and posted a 126106, American Basketball Association victory over the Carolina Cougars.

title: CHILE'S LEFTISTS CONCEDE FAILINGS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 9Chile's governing leftwing parties acknowledged today that they had failed to involve majority of the people in the process of revolutionary transformation here.

title: Chess:
description: Andrew Soltis, a manytime Marshall Chess Club champion and a topechelon metropolitan player, recently won the ReggioEmilio, Italy, 12man roundrobin tournament with an 81/23% score. A Yugoslav grandmaster, M. Damjanovich, was second with 71/231/2.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Phelps Dodge Increases Prices of Copper Tubing
description: The Phelps Dodge Tube Company announced yesterday it would increase prices by 5 per cent on copper water tube, copper drainage tube, and refrigeration and other highgrade tube in sizes 4 inches nominal and less, effective immediately. The company said distributor discounts would be unchanged.

title: School for Drugs
description: In a recent report on the spreading use of hard drugs in the New York City school system, City Controller Abraham Beame labeled some schools as marketplaces for drug sales. Members of his research staff studied the problem intensely for several months, circulating within the schools and interviewing administrators, teachers and students. They found some schools to he gripped in an absolute atmosphere of fear. Drug pushers seemed to have taken over.

title: Lawyer Says Seale Was Upset By Holirnan's Actions in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 9  Bobby Seale, the Black Panther leader, defied Judge Julius J. Hoffman at the Chicago conspiracy trial because he was emotionally upset over the judge's refusal to allow him a lawyer of his choice or to defend himself, his attorney declared today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The recent announcement by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority that the Long Island Railroad will cease to honor tentrip tickets after March 1 is an outright attempt to mislead the public.

title: Egyptians Feeling Pinch Of Austerity Measures
description: CAIRO, Feb 9  The first signs of imposed austerity, especially for the privileged middle class, have begun to appear in Egypt as the war economy Cabinet of Premier Aziz Sidky drives to reallocate resources and to transform the country into an earlytobed, workoriented society.

title: Judge Continues Order Barring L.I.R.R. Strike
description: Federal Judge Mark A. Cosstantino in Brooklyn continued until today a 10  day temporary restraining order barring the Long Island section of the United Transportation Union from striking the railroads. The order was to have expired yesterday.

title: Europeans Confident on Currencies
description: PARIS, Feb. 9European central bankers are looking at the monetary situation this year with a good deal more confidence than would seem justified by the recent renewed agitation in the financial markets.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 Sometime this week, the Michigan Legislature will almost certainly pass a bill establishing a 1972 Presidential primary, probably on May 16, in that state. Soon thereafter, Gov. William. G. Milliken, a Republican, is expected to sign the bill. That will resolve a question that has been Vexing Michigan Deinocrats for more than two years: how to choose the state's 132 delegates for the 1972 Democratic convention.

title: The Receiving End of the Bombing
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.The 1,000sortie bombing raids which President Nixon ordered against North Vietnam extended into Thanhhoa Province only one hundred miles from Hanoi. Military targets, the President's spokesman saidthe same terminology used during the three and a half years of Mr. Johnson's bombing of the North.

title: Trinidad Gas Deal Links Peoples, Indiana Standard
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 9 (UPI)The Peoples Gas Company and the Standard Oil Company (Indiana) announced today a $490million deal to produce and market vast, amounts of liquefied natural gas off the coast of Trinidad in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Michigan U.A.W. Endorses Muskie for the Presidency
description: LANSING, Mich., Feb. 9 (UPI)The United Automobile Workers of Michigan has overwhelmingly endorsed the Presidential candidacy of Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine.

title: CenterLeft Parties in Italy Unable to Form Government
description: ROME, Feb. 9Leaders of the four centerleft parties that have been governing Italy for most of the last 10 years found today that they were unable to set up a new coalition cabinet.

title: HOUSE PANEL VOTES AID TO RURAL AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) The House Agriculture Committee approved today a program of Governmentbacked loans and direct Federal grants to spur economic development and the creation of new jobs in rural areas.

title: German Assails U.S. Role In the I.M.F.'s Operations
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Feb. 9One of Europe's leading central bankers took the United States to task here today for unjustifiably and unwarrantedly hampering the operations of the International Monetary Fund.

title: MRS. JOHN H. CROCKETT
description: TORRINGTON, Conn., Feb. 9 Mrs. Rosa Addle Johnson Crockett, a teacher in New York City nursery schools, who retired about 10 years ago, died today in a nursing home here. She was 91 years old and had lived at 208 West 23d Street in New York until recently. She was the widow of John H. Crockett.

title: Candidate Curb Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 9 (AP) Candidates for Federal office would be required to resign any other elective job that they hold under legislation introduced today by Representative C. W. Bill Young, Republican of Florida. The measure, to become effective Jan. 1, 1973, also would require candidates for Federal office to resign from local, state or Federal elective posts if terms of the two offices overlap.

title: Mrs. Gillian Spreckels Fuller And Composer Wed in Aspen
description: ASPEN, Colo., Feb. 9The marriage of Mrs. Gillian Spreckels Fuller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew P. Fuller of New York, to Eugene (Gino) Piserchio, a composer and pianist, took place at the Paragon restaurant here Monday. The ceremony, written by the couple, was performed by the Rev. Thomas Benton of the Church of Truth.

title: Dr. Sullivan Campbell, 49, Dies; A Founder of Graphic Concern
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn. Feb. 9Dr. Sullivan G. Campbell, board chairman of Graphic Sciences, Inc., of Danbury, died yesterday in Danbury Hospital of injuries received Jan. 25 in an automobile accident. He was 49 years old and lived at 149 Main Street and also in Rochester.

title: Merger News
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc., yesterday announced plans to broaden its Interest in the musical instrument field by acquiring Steinway & Sons, the New York piano manufacturer. Under terms of the proposed transaction, shareholders of Steinway would receive 375,000 shares of C.B.S. common stock in return for their Steinway shares. Based on yesterday's closing price of C.B.S. on the New York Stock Exchange, 54, the transaction is valued at $20,437,750.

title: Helicopters Invading Paul Bunyan Country
description: MARYSVILLE, Calif.  As the chopchop sound of its whirling rotor reverberates softly over the treetops, a helicopter hovers above a steep mountainside that bristles with Douglas fir trees 150 feet high: The pilot delicately threads a cable down through the trees.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: One has to wonder who is making the uproar over the 24th Precinct's ticket policy. If there is any question how it is working, one has only to walk through the area and hope for the same in his own neighborhood.

title: Stars Triumph, 154131
description: UNIONTOWN, Pa., Feb. 9 (AP)Willie Wise and Zelmo Beaty combined for 70 points tonight as the Utah Stars outscored the Pittsburgh Condors, 154131.

title: Fleischmann Panel Urges Busing for Racial Balance
description: A pecial study commission recommended yesterday that 54 school districts in the state, including New York City, be compelled by the Legislature to bring about racial balance in all of their schools, using the busing of pupils as a tool where necessary.

title: Diplomats Attend Service For Thompson in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 Llewellyn E. Thompson, former Ambassador to the Soviet Union who died Sunday, contributed as much as any one diplomat could to peace, his lifelong friend Charles E. Bohlen said today.

title: IN THE NATION
description: From its beginnings, the Nixon Administration has insisted that the way to judge its civil rights activities was to watch what we do, not what we say. The implication was that, while talking one way to mollify a conservative constituency, the Nixon men would accomplish a great deal in the other direction.

title: Seals Halt Flyers, 32
description: OAKLAND, Feb. 9 (UPI)Gilles Meloche, the California goaltender, got his first National Hockey League assist tonight on what proved to be the winning goal as the Golden Seals defeated the Philadelphia Flyers, 32.

title: School Panel Asks End of Parochial Aid
description: A halt in any further public aid for parochial and private schools in the state was recommended yesterday by the commission studying the quality and financing of schools in New York.

title: Notes on People
description: The French connection used by Leon Uris as the basis for his popular novel, Topaz, is the prospective recipient of at least $352,350. In Los Angeles Superior Court, Judge Howard H. Schmidt ordered the author to pay that amount, plus interest, to Philippe de Vosjoli, the former head of French Intelligence in the United States.

title: Excerpts From State of World Report
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9Following are excerpts from United States Foreign Policy for the 1970's: The Emerging Structure of Peace, President Nixon's third annual message to Congress on foreign affairs:

title: M'GOVERN URGES HEALTH REFORMS
description: BOSTON, Feb. 9  Senator George McGovern proposed today reforms In emergency health services that he said could save 100,000 lives a year at an annual Federal cost of less than $300million.

title: Miss Holum Defies Critics Who Said 1,500 Meters Was Not Her Distance
description: SAPPORO, Feb. 9Dianne was only 14 when she came home from Norway, said Mrs. Arlene Holum. Mummy, she said, they, told me that Americans were soft. Some day I'm going to show them.

title: JULIAN GUMPERZ, 73, AN INVESTMENT AIDE
description: Julian Gumperz, an investment counselor and former publisher in Berlin, died of a heart attack while dining in a Manhattan restaurant on Tuesday evening. He was 73 years old and lived at 75 East End Avenue.

title: St. Peter's Wins, 10382
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 9Ted Martiniuk scored 31 points and Tony Holm contributed 11 assists to lead St. Peter's College to a 10382 triumph over Le Moyne College tonight at the Jersey City Armory. St. Peter's wonlost record is now 611.

title: What 40 Years of Counseling Taught Psychologist About Saving Marriages
description: The more married couples that Dr. Gerald Albert, a psychologist, counseled over a 40year period, the more he became convinced that he was working with the wrong people. Or at least with people at a wrong stage in their lives.

title: Mrs. Marian Bellard Is Dead; Was Head Usher at Town Hall
description: Mrs. Marian Leishman Bellard, head usher at Town Hall and a member of the staff there since 1921, died of a heart attack yesterday at Polyclinic Hospital, where she had been taken after being stricken at the hall. She was 70 years old. Mrs. Bellard resided at 2033 McGraw Avenue in the Bronx with her husband, Charles, who has been a night tickettaker at the hall for many years.

title: THOMAS W. WALKER, ADVERTISING AIDE, 73
description: NAPLES, Fla., Feb. 9Thomas White Walker, one of the founders of the SawyerFerguson  Walker Company, which represents newspapers for advertising sales in many cities, died yesterday while playing golf. He was 73 years old and had lived here since he moved from Old Lyme, Conn., on his retirement 10 years ago.

title: Bridge: LifeMaster Rank No Longer The Summit of Achievement
description: The rank of life master, attained by some 16,000 players in this country, is no longer the summit of, bridge ambition: The World Bridge Federation recently prepared its own masterpoint scheme, based on performance in international events.

title: Essex County Judge Is Shot in a Newark Motel
description: NEWARK, Feb. 10 (UPI)An Essex County Court judge was shot and wounded seriously late tonight in a downtown Newark hotel, the police reported.

title: Iona Tops Army, 7169
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 9Iona, paced by Ray Hyland's 34 points and 26 rebounds, upset Army, 7169, tonight at the Westchester County Center.

title: Staten Island Mall Is Called Commitment to City's Future
description: In a part of Staten Island that has long been isolated from the hustle of today's commercial movement, seven municipal agencies are working with private developers, departmentstore executives and merchants to build the largest enclosed shopping center in the metropolitan area.

title: Library Is Aided by a Concert Of Items From Cary Collection
description: One library indirectly helped another Tuesday night. It worked this way. The Clarion Concerts program in Tully Hall was made up of items from the Mary Flagler Cary Music Collection of the Pierpont Morgan Library. Some tickets to the concert were donated by the Clarion Music Society for sale at special prices. With extra contributions connected with the event, more than $2;500 was raised for the hardpressed music division of the library at Lincoln Center.

title: S.E.C. Suspends All Trading In the Shares of Topper
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) Trading in the securities of the Topper Corporation was ordered suspended by the Securities and Exchange Commission today on the American Stock Exchange and in overthecounter markets. Trading had been halted on the Amex since Feb. 3.

title: BRISK GAINS MADE ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market yesterday made good gains in active trading.

title: SYRACUSE TRIPS FORDHAM, 90 TO 89
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 9A driving layup by Chuck Wichman, with two seconds left in overtime tonight gave Syracuse a 90.89 victory over Fordham.

title: 70 Made Homeless by Fire In Brooklyn Apartments
description: Seventy persons were made homeless last night by a threealarm fire that destroyed 14 apartments of a 20apartment, fourstory building at 539 Dean Street, near Sixth Avenue, in downtown Brooklyn.

title: Nader Aides Call for Ban On 2 Meat Preservatives
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) Associates of Ralph Nader petitioned the Government today to ban certain uses of two meat preservatives and coloring agents that they said had been linked to cancer.

title: WagePrice Plea Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) The Cost of Living Council announced today that it had refused to exempt from price and wage controls the shipping rates to and from Puerto Rico and the prices of goods shipped to the island. These denials were among eight requested exemptions that were turned down by the council.

title: Press Attacks Brushed Off By Aide to French Premier
description: PARIS, Feb. 9Lo Hamon, the spokesman for the Premier's office, brushed aside today questions about attacks in the press on Premier Jacques ChabanDelmas charging him with using loopholes to avoid income taxes for 1966 through 1970.

title: Indignant Protesters Keep Base Rent Unit Busy
description: Visitors, mostly Irate, at the rate of 500 a day, and telephone callers, mostly indignant, at the rate of 1,000 a day, are keeping things busy at the new quarters of the city's Maximum Base Rent Unit at 280 Broadway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: So the stagehands at Kennedy Center are said to earn up to $1,500 a week.

title: MUJIB WILL VISIT MOSCOW IN MARCH
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 9  The Soviet Union signed an agreement today to help rebuild the economy of Bangladesh and announced that Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the new nation's Prime Minister, would visit Moscow early in March.

title: Katharine Beach, 64, Dies; Republican Finance Aide
description: Katharine Lucy Beach, for many years an executive secretary of the New York Republican Finance Committee, died yesterday in New York Hospital. She was 64 years old and lived at 45 Sutton Place South.

title: Theater: Love Suicide at Schofield
description: A play called The Love Suicide at Schofield Barracks opened at the ANTA Theater last night, and I only wish I liked the play as much as I liked its sentiments. But the play takes a long time to say very little, carries unlikelihood to even more unlikely lengths and leaves it there, and makes unduly portentous that normally viable dramatic vehicle, the military inquiry.

title: News of Dogs
description: One of the oldest continuous sports events in America is the Westminster Kennel Club show. It has been held every year, since 1877. Only twice in that span has standard poodle been named best in showin 1935, the Blakeen Kennels Ch. Nunsoe Duc de la Terrace of Blakeen, and in 1958, the Puttencove Kennels Ch. Puttencove Promise. Now, poodle fanciers have their hopes raised anew for next Tuesday night William W. Brainard Jr. of Marshall, Vawill be choosing the best of 3,093 dogs at the conclusion of Westminster's 96th edition. It was Brainard who selected Promise, 14 years ago.

title: Blast Blows 2 From House
description: TAUNTON, Mass., Feb. 9 (AF)A woman was critically injured when she and her husband were blown from their house today in what firefighters said was an explosion of natural gas. Francelina Gonsalves, who was found by fire fighters in the yard of the home, was reported to be in critical condition at Morton Hospital. Her husband, Manuel, was less seriously hurt.

title: Man in the News
description: To Beverly Jane Loo, executive editor of McGrawHill, Inc., Richard Raphael Suskind is a gentle, mild, totally, nonaggressive individualthe absolute opposite of his appearance.

title: Meredith, as a Republican, Seeks to Unseat Eastland
description: JACKSON, Miss, Feb. 9 (UPI) James H. Meredith, who in 1962 was the first black student at the University of Missisippi, announced today that he would run against Senator James O. Eastland, Democrat of Mississippi.

title: Big 6 Mayors Plead for Aid in Annual Albany Visit
description: ALBANY Feb. 9  The Mayors of the Big Six cities made their annual legislative pilgrimage today in a joint quest for aid to meet the awful mathematics of the local, budgetary process.

title: PHONE COMPANY FACES AN INQUIRY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 9The Public Service Commission announced today that it had ordered an unprecedented far reaching investigation into the capita/ construction Program of New York Telephone Company.

title: Elizabeth Visits Thailand At Start of 7Nation Tour
description: UTAPAO, THAILAND, Feb. 9 (UPI)Queen. Elizabeth of Britain arrived today for the start of a sixweek tour of seven nations. The Queen's jetliner touched down at the air base here where United States B52s were taking off for raids on Indochina.

title: Rare La Tour Found in Museum Attic
description: LONDON, Feb. 9A previously unknown painting by Georges de la Tour, a French 17thcentury artist whose work is coming to be almost as highly regarded as that of Vermeer, has been found in the attic store of a tiny museum.

title: Overture to India
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 President Nixon offered India today the prospect of a serious dialogue on improved relationsprovided she remained nonaligned and independent.

title: ALBERT KINNEY
description: Albert S. Kinney, president of A. S. Kinney & Co., money brokers in Wall Street, died last evening in New York University Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 2 Tudor City Place and in Stroudsburg, Pa.

title: Other Points in Review
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9Besides the major news points of the President's foreign policy, message, other highlights included the following:

title: GILBERT CHINARD; TAUGHT FRENCH
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 9Gilbert Chinard, Pyne Professor emeritus of French at Princeton University and a past president of the Modern Language Association, died yesterday in Princeton Hospital. He was 90 years old and lived at 93 Mercer Street.

title: $430Million City Goal Set For Sale of Savings Bonds
description: The 1972 payroll savings campaign for United States Savings Bonds in the New York City area is aiming for $430million in sales, David L. Yunich, vice chairman of R. H. Macy & Co., Inc., said at lunch at the Plaza Hotel yesterday to kick off the drive.

title: Soviet Ideologists Are Putting New Emphasis on Psychology
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 8Faced with the increasingly complex problems of modern society. Soviet ideologists have decided to give freer rein to psychology as a research and teaching discipline, particularly In study of the unconscious aspects of the human, mind.

title: Coed Safeguards Ordered After Oregon State Slaying
description: CORVALLIS, Ore., Feb. 9 (UPI)Oregon State University coeds were warned today to lock their dormitory doors and to travel in pairs after the stabbing death of a California student yesterday.

title: GREEKS TELL OF ARMS SMUGGLED TO CYPRUS
description: ATHENS, Feb. 9The Greek Government has decided to press the President of Cyprus, Archbishop Makarios, to surrender a large consignment of Czechoslovak arms clandestinely brought to Cyprus last month.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Aide to Run
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 9 (AP) Philip H. Savage, director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People in Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Delaware announced today that he would seek the Democratic nomination for the Second Congressional District seat. His opponents will be Robert N. C. Nix Sr., the incumbent; and State Representative Melton Mitchell, who announced his candidacy several weeks ago.

title: Setback for Mr. Brandt
description: The temporary defeat in the Bundesrat for West Germany's treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland means just one thing: the Christian Union parties thus far are maintaining solidarity in opposition to the pacts negotiated by Chancellor Brandt's Government; and Bonn's ratification will consequently be more difficult than many observers had anticipated. The Bundesrat (Federal Council) is now committed by a onevote margin to reject the treaties unless the Government can provide satisfactory clarifications on many points.

title: NEWFILM SERIES TO OPEN MARCH 3
description: The Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art will present a program of 10 feature films made by unheralded European, South American, Cuban and American directors starting March 3.

title: Alcan Aluminium Begins Management Realignment
description: The directors of Alcan Alu minium, Ltd., announced yesterday the election of a chairman and a new president as part of a planned program to broaden the top management structure.

title: U.S.Steel Fined for Pollution
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 9 (AP)The United States Steel Corporation has been fined for using contaminated water to quench hot coke. Magistrate John Chandler fined the company $300 plus costs yesterday on three counts of violation of Allegheny County's air pollution code at the Clairton Works.

title: BILL TO INCREASE GOLD PRICE TO $38 GOES TO CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The Nixon Administration sent to the Congress today legislation formally devaluing the dollar by raising the price of gold and also announced major trade agreements with Japan and the European Common Market.

title: Social Security Rise Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) Senator Frank Church, Democrat of Idaho, asked the Senate Finance Committee today to increase Social Security benefits by 12 per cent. Today, more than 4.7 million persons 65 and older fall below the poverty, line, nearly 100,000 more than in 1968, he said.

title: Militancy of Urban Indians Spurs Hope for Change
description: CHICAGO  There are some faint stirrings of hope among the more than 300,000 urban Indians who have left their reservations and are living in a wretched stew of poverty and squalor in the darkest slums of the nation's cities.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President made a morning radio broadcast on his foreign policy message.

title: Hundreds of Homeless Romans Besiege City Hall the Night Long
description: ROME, Feb. 9Several hundred homeless Romans, many of them women and children, besieged the city government on Capitoline Hill all last night, clamoring: Houses! Houses!

title: Maniago Stops Kings
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 9 (AP)The Minnesota goalie, Cesare Maniago, making stops on four clean breakaways, ran his wonlosttied record against the Los Angeles Kings to 1201 over the last two seasons as the North Stars scored a 41 victory tonight.

title: Indian Aides Withhold Comment on Message
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 9Indian officials declined to comment tonight on President Nixon's State of the World Message. They said they were studying it.

title: AMPEX SEES LOSS ABOVE ESTIMATES
description: The Ampex Corporation indicated yesterday that previous estimates of a loss of $40million for the fiscal year ending April 29 would be substantially larger than forecast.

title: Competition Increasing
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Feb. 9 Senator McGovern and Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine are developing a competitive edge in their campaigns in the March 7 Democratic Presidential primary in New Hampshire.

title: Scott Stars for Squires
description: NORFOLK, Va., Feb. 9 (AP)Charlie Scott poured in 33 points tonight to pace the Virginia Squires to a 124111 victory over the Denver Rockets. The Squires got 38 points in the first quarter.

title: Examination Needed
description: The thoroughly inadequate administration of drug treatment programs in this city, which has seen millions of dollars poured into unaudited antiaddiction efforts, may be perpetuated if the Board of Estimate yields to Mayor Lindsay's request for hasty approval of a complicated contract that has been more than a year in the drafting. The contract establishes new relationships between the city's Addiction Services Agency and the Phoenix House Foundation.

title: 40 Injured in Gas Tank Blasts in Tewksbury, Mass.
description: TEWKSBURY, Mass., Thursday, Feb. 10 (AP)Approximately 40 persons, eight of, them firemen, were injured last night in a series of explosions at a field of liquid propane gas tanks, fire authorities said.

title: Cahill Commutes Term Of Warden's Rescuer
description: TRENTON, Feb. 9 (UPI)Gov. William T. Cahill commuted today the sentence of an inmate who was credited with saving the warden's life during the Thanksgiving Day rebellion at Rahway State Prison farm.

title: Charles A. Henderson, 64, Public Relations Consultant
description: Charles A. Henderson, a public relations and sales consultant and former director of corporate projects for the National Broadcasting Company, died Tuesday in University Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 360 East 55th Street.

title: Letters to the Editor; Utopia: But At What Cost?
description: Your publication of a series of four articles on China by John S. Service was very timely and the articles were most interesting. Having, like. Mr. Service, myself been born in China I was particularly carried back by many of the pictures he painted.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CROSS, S. C.A cold rain was falling before dawn as we made our way from our rooms to the tackle shop and restaurant at Jones Boat Landing, where we learned from Jackie Jones, the proprietor's son, that there had been excellent fishing for striped bass the previous few days.

title: Egypt Says U.S. Is Using A Pretext to Aid Israelis
description: CAIRO, Feb. 9Egypt's Premier, Dr. Aziz Sidky, accused the United States today of using a pretext of increased Soviet support for Egypt to increase military aid to Israel.

title: Celtics Crush Braves
description: BOSTON, Feb. 9 (AP)  The Boston Celtics had seven scorers in double figures tonight as they overpowered the Buffalo Braves, 139112, for their eighth consecutive victory.

title: Vote to Unify Set On Britain Markets
description: LONDON, Feb. 9Sir Martin Wilkinson, chairman of The Stock Exchange, today set Feb. 29 as the date for voting on a plan to amalgamate all seven of the stock exchanges now operating in Britain and Ireland.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The state of the worldor at least the state of American foreign policyis portrayed in fairly bright hues in President Nixon's third annual dissertation on the subject.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I wonder how many Americans are fooled by the oratorical flimflam of those Democratic leaders in the Congress who supported the war in Southeast Asia when Democratic Presidents committed our troops, who backed appropriations for its continuance and who are now so saintly horrified at the situation they helped to create.

title: Florida Politicians Foresee a Strong Lindsay Showing
description: Six months after he became a Democrat and six weeks after he became a Presidential candidate, Mayor Lindsay is viewed by many Florida politicians as an unexpectedly strong candidate in that state's key Presidential primary.

title: 2 in G.O.P. Ask Tax Credit For Private School Tuition
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) Two Republican leaders of the House introduced today legislation to give up to $800 a year in tax credits to the parents of students in private and parochial schools.

title: Disruptions Are Sporadic In Day of Protest in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 9Roman Catholic demonstrators sporadically blocked streets, picketed police stations, closed post offices and staged rallies across Northern Ireland today in a protest that disappointed civil rights leaders.

title: Unusual Arts Center Is Taking Shape
description: An unusual arts center housing several experimental groups in different fields is taking shape in an abandoned church in the garment district.

title: House Votes Increase In National Debt Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) The House passed today, 248 to 147, a $20billion interim increase in the national debt limit to cover Treasury borrowing through June 30 to pay the Government's bills.

title: Miss Henning Skates to Victory
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Thursday, Feb. 10The American skating superstar, Anne Henning, won the Olympic 500meter Sprint today, but for a dreaded second or two the issue was in doubt.

title: Barbette Tweed And Peter Hunt Marry on Coast
description: Miss Barbette Tweed, daughter of Mrs. Harrison Tweed of New York and the late Mr. Tweed, the noted lawyer, was married in San Francisco last Sunday to Peter Hunt, who directed 1776 on Broadway and is now working on the motion picture version of the musical. The ceremony in the chapel of the Swedenborgian Church of the New Jerusalem was performed by the Rev. Erwin Reddekopp.

title: Maine Businessman Runs
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Poll 9 (AP) L. Robert Porteous Jr., a Portland businessman, today became the second announced Republican candidate for the first District House seat held by Representative Peter M. Kyros, a Democrat. The other Republican is Clifton H. Young of Pamaquid, a retired army officer.

title: Snug Harbor
description: After 166 years the historic Sailors Snug Harbor home for retired seamen on Staten Island appears headed for change. Though legal complications are not settled, the home may be on the point of winning court approval for a move to North Carolina.

title: A.S.P.C.A. Objects to Law
description: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals has asked the state to repeal the law that requires the agency to provide animals for medical research, it was announced yesterday. The society said the Public Health Law requires pounds to give unwanted animals to approved scientific laboratories. The public pound in New York City is operated by the A.S.P.C.A.

title: Major British Consumer Body Offers Advice on Acupuncture
description: LONDON, Feb. 9  Among recommendations on bicycles, cooking gas, electric appliances and stereo record players, the magazine of Britain's largest consumer group offers advice this month on acupuncture.

title: Hussein Replaces 5 in Jordan's Cabinet
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 9A Jordanian Cabinet shuffle was announced in Amman today under decrees issued by King Hussein.

title: ERWIN SCHARF DIES; STAGE SET DESIGNER
description: Erwin Scharf, a set designer for plays and films in Europe and, later a director of documentary films in this country, died Tuesday apparently of a heart attack on Fifth Avenue. He was 71 years old and lived at 72 Park Terrace West.

title: S.E.C. IS OPPOSED ON MEMBER ISSUE
description: The PhiladelphiaBaltimoreWashington Stock Exchange indicated yesterday that it would oppose the Securities and Exchange Commission on the controversial issue of institutional membership.

title: Joffrey Ballet to Present 4 New Works in Season
description: The City Center Ballet will present four new productions in its season at the City Center from Feb. 23 through April 2.

title: Knicks Set Back Pistons On 2dHalf Surge, 126102
description: DETROIT, Feb. 9For the 11 minutes of the third quarter tonight at Cobo Arena, the New York Knicks played nearperfect basketball while their opponents, the Detroit Pistons, did everything wrong. The Knicks outscored the Pistons, 4018, in the period and rode that burst to a 126102 victory before 4,921 fans.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 17 per cant decline in active tuberculosis cases in the last too years will lead to the closing of TB wards in many municipal hospitals and the phasing out of specialized Health Department TB clinics, the oity's Health Services Administrator reported yesterday.

title: KENNEDY AND MILLS LISTED IN NEBRASKA
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Feb. 9Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts and Representative Wilbert D. Mills of Arkansas were among 12 Democrats proposed today by the Nebraska Secretary of State, Allen J. Beermann, for the state's May 9 Presidential preference primary ballot.

title: 6 Democrats Say Albany Majority Plans 2 Primaries
description: ALBANY, Feb. 9Six New York City Reform Democrats charged today that the Republican majority leaders of the Legislature were considering having two primary election daysin June and September to favor incumbents.

title: President at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., (UPI)President Nixon flew to Camp David today to continue preparation for his trip to Peking. He will return to Washington some time tomorrow and then he will depart for his second weekend in a row at Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: RACING GROUPS CONCEDE ON OTB
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Feb. 9  More than 200 horsemen, racing commissioners, track presidents, computer experts and at least one selfconfessed bettor gathered here today, presumably to hear a diatribe against offtrack betting.

title: Building Trades Leaders Voice Worry as Nonunion Hiring Rises
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 9 Leaders of the building and construction trades department of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations say that they are faced with a growing problem resulting from contractors use of nonunion labor particularly in the South and Southwest.

title: BONN'S UPPER HOUSE REJECTS SOVIET PACT
description: BONN, Feb. 9Despite appealt by Chancellor Willy Brandt arid Foreign Minister Walter Scheel, West Germany's goodwill treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland failed to win the approval of the conservativedominated Bundesrat, the upper house of parliament, today.

title: Walter W. Finke
description: PALM DESERT, Calif., Feb. 9 . Walter W. Finke, former president and chief executive officer of the Dictaphone Corporation, died in the Eisenhower Memorial Hospital today after a brief illness. He was 64 years old and lived here.

title: Bills Hire Dooley
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 9 (UPI)Jim Dooley, former coach of the Chicago Bears, was named yesterday linebacker coach of the Buffalo Bills. Jim Ringo, who played 15 years in the National Football League, was hired as offensive line coach.

title: BOND PRICES GAIN IN HEAVY TRADING
description: With Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, saying lie hopes for a decline in longterm interest rtes, the bond market advanced yesterday while handling a heavy volume of financing.

title: Meskill Asks for a SalesTax Rise to 7% And 10Year Program to Pay Off Deficit
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 9  Gov. Thomas J. Meskill proposed to the General Assembly at its opening today an increase in the state sales tax from the present 6.5 per cent to 7 per cent and a 10year program for paying off the state's $244million deficit.

title: PRO SOCCER PICKS 35 COLLEGE STARS
description: Thirtyfive collegiate soccer players, 31 of them American citizens, were drafted by the eight franchises of the North American Soccer League here yesterday. The first choice was Alain Maca, a fullback from Brockport State, selected by Miami, which traded for Montreal's pick.

title: American Charges U. S. Jets Bombed A Hospital in North
description: An American correspondent who reesntly returned from a twoweek trip to North Vietnam has charged that American planes bombed a North Vietnamese hospital compound on Dec. 26 near Thanhhoa, a city 80 miles south of Hanoi.

title: Thomas C. Gillis, Director Of Funds for Lincoln Center
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Feb. 9Thomas C. Gillis, former director of fundraising for the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, died yesterday in North Adams Regional Hospital. He was 58 years old and had resided in Spain and here since his retirement.

title: N.E.T. Panel of Black Leaders Cites Need for Quality Education
description: The president of Howard University, Dr. James Cheek, warned Tuesday night of the danger that the quest for school integration could lead to the destruction of black colleges and universities.

title: Reduced Tension Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9President Nixon encouraged the Chinese Communists and Nationalists today to settle directly the fate of Taiwan.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It was a welcome relief to see baseball players flitting attractively on a screen instead of the schussers, jumpers, sitzspinners and other escapees from deepfreeze lockers. Their televised antics in the Winter Olympics have been a current distraction to folks who don't even understand what they're looking at, That's why the familiar sight of ballplayers was so reassuring.

title: Tass Only Mildly Critical On Foreign Policy Report
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 9 (AP)The Soviet press agency, Tass, carried a long and only mildly critical dispatch tonight on President Nixon's State of the World Message.

title: Wagner Halts Kings Point
description: KINGS POINT L, I, Feb. 9Tom Miller got 24 points as Wagner defeated the United States Merchant Marine Academy, 11289, tonight in O'Hara Hall.

title: California Angels Infielder Is Killed in Highway Crash
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 9 (AP)Chico Ruiz, an infielder for the California Angeles, was killed today in a highway accident.

title: PENGUINS DEFEAT MAPLE LEAFS, 41
description: TORONTO, Feb. 9 (UPI)Ken Schinkel scored a goal and two assists and Jim Rutherford was superb in the Pittsburgh net tonight as the Penguins beat the Toronto Maple Leafs, 41, in the National Hockey League.

title: Three Rob Brooklyn Store
description: Three holdup men entered a Robert Hall clothing store at 176 Livingston Street in Brooklyn, shortly after 9 o'clock last night, handcuffed four employes together, tied up two others and fled with $830, according to the police.

title: Only 4 of 53 Youths Win Jersey School Elections
description: TRENTON, Feb. 9  As a group, New Jersey's newly eligible school board candidates 18, 19 and 20 years old fared poorly in their first attempt to win seats in yesterday's elections. Only four of 53 won.

title: U.S. REINFORCING B52'S IN PACIFIC
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) Administration sources reported today that the United States was moving to reinforce its B52 force in the Western Pacific to protect the remaining American troops in Vietnam in the event of an enemy offensive.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Special Committee on Colonialism11 A.M.

title: LISBON WON'T PAY FOR AFRICA TALKS
description: LISBON, Feb. 9Portugal served notice today that she would not contribute to financing the United Nations Security Council meeting held last week at Addis Ababa on the ground that it was a pure propaganda operation.

title: Stennis Questions a Rise Of $6Billion for Defense
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9Senator John C. Stennis, chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, questioned today the need for increasing the defense budget by $6.3billion, as proposed by the Nixon Administration, while the Government has a large deficit.

title: Wallace Says He Has Two Jewish Relatives
description: MIAMI, Feb. 9Speaking to 60 members of Jewish youth groups here yesterday, Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said that he had Jewish cousin and a Jewish uncle.

title: Ethnic Entities
description: The sharply divisive and ethnicallyoriented attack on the city's Forest Hills housing project by the presidentelect of the New York Board of Rabbis is hardly calculated to make easier a solution of this vexing problem.

title: Japan Dispatches An Official Mission To North Vietnam
description: TOKYO, Friday, Feb. 11 (UPI)Japan has dispatched two diplomats to Hanoi in the first official mission sent to North Vietnam by the Japanese Government, the Foreign Office said today. Government sources said the move was undertaken with the knowledge and cooperation of the United States.

title: Philadelphia Gets Deadline for Bicentennial Plan
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 10Philadelphia was given a deadline of March 15 today to come up with an acceptable plan for a bicentennial exposition.

title: STOCKS REGISTER A MODERATE GAIN
description: The stock market closed with a modest gain yesterday after profit taking and other internal pressures drove prices down from their boom levels at midsession.

title: Music: Thomas's Reading of Mahler
description: A conductor who understood Mahler clearly at a precocious age might not be the mast attractive sort of person. It should require a certain weathering and peeling of the psyche before the Viennese composer's great symphonic visions can come into full focus, with all their painful memories, bizarre pleasures and apparent paradoxes accepted and reconciled. Intellectually, however, an early grasp of the worth of what might be called Mahler's creative decadence (also epitomized in some works of Joyce and Beckett, for instance) is certainly possible, and Michael Tilson Thomas seems to have the necessary intellect in large measure.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Personnel. The President announced the appointment of a chairman and 21 members to the President's Commission on Personnel Interchange. The commission established by Executive order on Jan. 19, 1969, is charged with developing an executive interchange program under which promising young executives from Federal departments and agencies and the private sector will be placed in positions offering challenge and responsibility in the other sector. Herman Weiss of Connecticut was reappointed chairman of the commission.

title: Complaint in Zurich
description: GENEVA, Feb. 10Peter Veleff, the Zurich District Attorney, said at a news conference today that he could not help much in the Irving case because I myself seem to get all my information unfortunately from America.

title: New York Port Notes
description: Steamship operators have responded to the currency revaluations touched of by the Nixon Administration's new economic policy with requests for rate increases. One of the first major moves in that directiona 6.32 per cent surcharge demanded by the United States Atlantic & Gulf/AustraliaNew Zealand Steamship Conference ha s brought swift opposition from the Federal Maritime Commission.

title: NIXON TELLS MORE OF PLANS FOR TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10President Nixon filled in some of the blank spaces about his plans for visiting China today, announcing that he would leave here next Thursday and arrive in Peking at 11:30 A.M. Monclay, Feb. 21.

title: Thanks to Prefabs, Out of the Slums and Into Their Own CoOps
description: NEW HAVENThe first thing Abraham Flynn did in his cooperative duplex was to paint the living room walls five shades of red.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The sparrows in Central Park are starving. Won't your readers please give them a handout? They huddle by the hundreds, cold mid hungry, on benches and railings, at their congregation center59th Street, Avenue of Americas, northwest corner.

title: OPTIONS EXCHANGE FORMED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 9 (AP)The Chicago Board Options Exchange, the first central marketplace for trading securities options, formally came into existence today.

title: Executive Changes
description: The election of Albert L. Mansell as president and chief executive officer of Shulton, Inc., a subsidiary of the American Cyanamid Company, was announced yesterday. He will continue as general manager of the company's consumer products division and president of another subsidiary, John H. 13reck, Inc. George L. Schultz, formerly chairman of the board, president and chief executive officer of Shulton, will continue as chairman of Sh'uiton and as a director of Cyanamid. He also will be a consultant on all Cyanamid activities in the consumer field. Mr. Munsell was appointed general manager of Cyanamid's consumer products division and president of Brock in July, 1968. Prior to that he had been vice president of another Cyanamid subsidiary, the Formica Corporation, for four years. Mr. Schultz the son of the late William Lightfoot Schultz, founder of Shulton.

title: Smith Defends Detention Of Leaders in Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 10  Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia accused African nationalists today of intimidating wouldbe supporters of the BritishRhodesian settlement. He also defended the detention of political figures, including Garfield Todd, a former top official, and Mr. Todd's daughter, Judith.

title: METHADONE CITED IN 7 DEATHS HERE
description: Seven persons with either a history or a presumption of methadone use were among 11 fatalities from drug abuse in the city last weekend, Dr. Milton Helpern, the Chief Medical Examiner, disclosed yesterday.

title: F.D.A Urges Ban on Chemical Used as a Drink Preservative
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 10The. Food and Drug Administration today proposed banning a, chemical preservative from use in beverage manufacture on the ground that it might he a cancer hazard.

title: Nixon Tells of Data On Anderson Source
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10President Nixon told newsmen this afternoon that we have a lot of circumstantial evidence on the identity of the source of colmumnist Jack Anderson's collection of secret documents about the Administration's position during the IndianPakistani war.

title: Hockey Ace Suspended For Taking a Pep Drug
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Friday, Feb. 11 (Reuters) The International Ice Hockey Federation today suspended West Germany's captain. Alis Scholoder, for taking drugs before an Olympic match.

title: Soviet Wrestlers Beat U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 10 (AP)The Soviet Union defeated the United States, 71, last night in a freestyle wrestling meet in Tiflis. Dan Gable provided the only United States victory, according to Tass, the Soviet press agency. Gable, world champion in the 150pound class, outpointed Nodar Khokhashvili.

title: President Orders a Study To Devise Antibusing Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10President Nixon said today that he had ordered a study to determine whether a constitutional amendment or legislation was needed to negate the trend of recent Federal court decisions requiring extensive busing to achieve integration.

title: CINCINNATI BEATS RUTGERS BY 8474
description: Derrek Dickey, a highjumping 6foot7inch forward scored a career high of 40 points last night in leading Cincinnati to an 84.74 victory over Rutgers in the second game  of a college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: That thirteen people could get killed in the confusion, baiting and melee of civil disobedience is not at all unusual nor difficult to understandespecially in the charged atmosphere of Londonderry.

title: PRESS SUBPOENAS DECRIED IN STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10A national survey of about 1,000 news reporters and editors showed a strong belief among them that virtually all press subpoenas are issued in unnecessary circumstances, when the reporter has no important information to contribute to an official factfinding body.

title: MISSING PUT AT 6,000 IN IRANIAN BLIZZARD
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 10 (AP) Thousands of Iranian villagers were unaccounted for today after a weeklong blizzard that dumped 10 to 26 feet of snow in outlying areas after four years of drought.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Toots Shor was explaining baseball to Chub Feeney, president of the National League, when a mugger set,upon him from behind, clamping a forearm like an iron bar across the Adam's apple. Released before rigor mortis could set in, the victim recognized his assailant as Joseph Michael Medwick, of Carteret, N. J., and the Cooperstown Hall of Fame. This was yesterday at the WaldorfAstoria, where the baseball clan was assembling to hear Brooks, Robinson saluted as the player who best typifies the game on and off the field. Creep! Shor said cordially, and turned back to Feeney. Around 1938, he said, poking a thumb into Medwick's abdomen, this bum said he'd give me half his salary if I get the Cardinals to trade him to the Giants. That's how bad he wanted to play opposite Joe DiMaggio. Those days we had to have the best players, because visiting teams always played twice as hard in New York as anywhere else because this is where the publicity was.

title: U.S. COURT EASES RULES FOR VOTING IN PRIMARIES HERE
description: A Federal District Court judge in Brooklyn yesterday declared unconstitutional New York State's requirement that prospective voters in a primary election must have been registered in the preceding general election.

title: Oscar T. Kappes is Dead at 81; Headed Life Savers Concern
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y., Feb. 10Oscar T. Kappes, president of the Life Savers Corporation from 1937 to 1949, died yesterday in United Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 37 Browndale Place.

title: Taylor Joins Bradley at 1,000
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Feb. 10The torrid shooting of Brian Taylor led Princeton to a 9669 rout of Cornell tonight at Barton Hall.

title: PARIS OPERA STAGES SUD BY KENTON COE
description: PARIS, Feb. 10Sud, an opera in three acts by Kenton Coe, the 41yearold Tennessee composer, based on the play by Julien Green, had its official Paris premiere at the Opera tonight. The unusual presentation of a work by a littleknown American composer at France's leading opera house was intended mainly to honor Mr. Green, the Parisborn American author who is the first foreigner ever to have been admitted to the Academie Francaise.

title: Relief Families in Hotels Here Cut to Fewer Than 300
description: The Human Resources Administration said yesterday that fewer than 300 welfare and relocated families were now living in hotels, compared with 1,346 last March, and that an estimated $9.7million in relief costs was being saved annually.

title: McNeel Goes to Mississippi
description: WACO, Tex., Feb. 10 (UPI)Taylor McNeel, defensive backfield coach at Baylor since 1964, said today he had accepted a similar post on the University of Mississippi stuff.

title: ANN FAIRBAIRN AUTHOR, WAS 70
description: Ann Fairbairn, an author whose real name was Dorothy Tait, died apparently of a heart attack on Tuesday at her home in Monterey, Calif. She was 70 years old.

title: Youths Laud Cooper Union Adult Art
description: A real, adulttype art opening occurred at the Cooper Union yesterday, but instead of champagne the guests sipped cherry soda and instead of canapds. They nibbled on brownies. The works on view  a group of boxes and collages by the celebrated artist Joseph Cornell were displayed at a child's eyelevel, no more than three feet off the ground.

title: STRUTHERS WELLS TO END LITIGATION
description: The Struthers Wells Corporation and its subsidiary, the Struthers Scientific and International Corporation, have agreed with the General Foods Corporation to settle all litigation between them and their subsidiaries now pending in the United States and abroad, Struthers Wells announced yesterday.

title: Thieu, Criticizing Rogers, Rejects New Concessions
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 10President Nguyen Van Thieu, in an interview broadcast over the Government television network tonight, affirmed that the latest eight point allied peace proposal was as much as he would be willing to concede and criticized Secretary of State William P. Rogers for his statement that the United States would be flexible.

title: Blount in Convention Race
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Feb. 10 (AP)  Winton M. Blount, former United States Postmaster General, filed today for a delegateatlarge position to the Republican National Convention in the party's May primary.

title: NIXON REASSURES TNIEU ON U.S. OFFER AT PARIS SESSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10President Nixon sought today to reassure President Nguyen Van Thieu about his intentions at the Paris peace talks and simultaneously to warn North Vietnam that the allies would make no new offers until Hanoi responded to his latest proposal.

title: Shumsky, Violinist, Plays Strongly in His Return
description: Since Oscar Shumsky has never really been away, it would be stretching a point to say that the violinist made a comeback at Tully Hall on Wednesday night, but his recital there was, in fact, the first he has given in New York since 1963, and nine years is a long time.

title: Bridge:
description: Balancing is everyday stuff for gymnasts, but it is a dangerous occupation for bridge players.

title: BOROWIAK VICTOR IN U.S. PRO TENNIS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 10(AP) Jeff Borowiak of Berkeley. Calif., scored the first upset of the United States professional indoor tennis championship today by defeating John Newcombe of Australia, 61, 57, 64, to reach the quarterfinal round at the Spectrum.

title: NEW TOIL PLAZA TO BE BUILT ON S.I.
description: The Port or New York Authority will build a $9million toll plaza on the Staten Island, side of the Outerbridge Crossing to New Jersey.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The idea is beginning to get around that the VicePresidency of the United States is too important a job to be left to the personal decision of the men who are nominated for the Presidency. In the indifferent Throttlebottom days, the VicePresidency was regarded as a treadmill to oblivion, and ambitious men ran away from it. Now they're actually running for it.

title: Talks Put Off in a U. S. Protest
description: PARIS, Feb. 10The United States refused at the Vietnam peace talks here today to agree to a date for the next session. It accused the North Vietnamese of organizing a threeday rally in nearby Versailles to place intolerable pressure on the negotiators.

title: Notes on People
description: At City Hall, Mayor Lindsay paid tribute to U Thant, the former Secretary General of the United Nations, all the world's chief architect of peace and presented him with the city of New York's Highest honor, a gold medal.

title: General Phone Profit Up
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation reported yesterday new highs In revenues and sales and net income for 1971. Leslie H. Warner, chairman and chief executive, said that combined telephone revenues and manufacturing sales had risen by 12 per cent to $3,836,792,000 from $3,439,219,000 a year earlier.

title: Waldheim Bars Reinstatement of 2 Chinese Nationalist Newsmen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 10  Secretary General Waldheim declared today that there was no legal basis for reinstating Iwo Chinese Nationalist correspondents who were ousted from United Nations headquarters last December.

title: PEKING AIDE SAYS LIN IS PURGED BUT ALIVE
description: PARIS, Feb. 10 (UPI)Lin Piao, the Chinese Defense Minister, has been eliminated politically but is still alive, according to a Chinese Foreign Ministry official.

title: VOLUME HIGHER IN COCOA FUTURES
description: Reflecting heavy speculative liquidation after recent price advances, trading in cocoa futures totaled 1,798 contracts yesterday on the New York Cocoa Exchange, the highest volume since last October.

title: High Iraqi Officials Leave for Moscow; Arms Bid Is Hinted
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 10A highranking Iraqi civilian and military delegation flew to Moscow today for talks with Soviet leaders.

title: CANADA HOPEFUL ON TRADE TALKS
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 10The Canadian Government, disappointed by the Nixon Administration's rejection of Ottawa's offers to compromise United StatesCanada trade disputes, is awaiting further clarification from Washington before making any new moves.

title: Strike Closes El. Mundo
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Feb. 10 (UPI)  A Newspaper Guild strike prevented El Mundo, Puerto Rico's largest newspaper, from publishing today. Pedro Juan Dumont of the Union of Reporters, Graphic Arts and Allied Branches, said 10 of the 440 strikers had been arrested, four of whom he said were beaten by the police. The police said the Puerto Rico Civil Rights Commission had ordered investigations into the incident.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Assemblyman Stephen S. Gottlieb announced yesterday that he would challenge the State Senate minority leader, Joseph Zaretzki of Manhattan, in the June 20 Democratic primary.

title: Market Place:
description: Let's say you're a small investor and you've been watching the action in such institutional favorites as Bausch & Lomb, Levitz Furniture, Tool Research, Tropicana and the airline stocks.

title: I.M.F. Seen Backing U.S. Gold Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The executive directors of the International Monetary Fund are expected to approve early next week a United States proposal that the I.M.F. take back $544million of gold that it has deposited with the United States.

title: Attack on the Mayor Divides Jews Here
description: In a stormy reaction to Wednesday's attack on Mayor Lindsay by Rabbi William Berkowitz, presidentelect of the New York Board of Rabbis, other Jewish spokesmen yesterday condemned and defended the rabbi.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 3 editorial No U.S. Role in Ulster raises false alternatives and comes to conclusions which I doubt The Times would want applied in other comparable situations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The presence of a Christmas story by Charles Dickens in the issue of The Times for Christmas Day is commendable. Without forgetting the other sides of his literary personality, it is fitting on at least one day of the year to give the Yuletide Dickens his due.

title: MURPHY DEFENDS ACCUSATION OF 9
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy rejected outright yesterday the suggestion of some city prosecutors that he had hindered law enforcement by announcing Tuesday that the police were searching for nine members of a Black Liberation Army in the recent slayings of policemen.

title: In 2 Koestler Books, a Scientific Challenge
description: LONDON  Matter and antimatter, time flowing backward, black holes and white holes in the universe, particles flying faster than light and passing through the earth without bumping all these concepts that are shaking the world of physics don't faze Arthur Koestler at all.

title: WOMEN ARE GIVEN CORPORATE POSTS
description: The election or appointment of a number of women to high management posts was announced yesterday.

title: Bond Prices Show Gains;
description: The bond market, continuing a move that started Tuesday afternoon, tiptoed yesterday toward higher bond prices and lower interest rates.

title: Leader of Jesuits Acts to Stem Public Criticism of Pope Paul
description: ROME, Feb. 10The Society of Jesus, the largest order of the Roman Catholic Church, expressed concern today over public criticism of Pope Paul VI.

title: GAP IN MEDIAN PAY OF SEXES WIDENS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10American women not also only earn less than men but the gap between the sexes has also widened in the last 15 years, the Government reported today.

title: Mrs. Meir Talked With ExJordan Aide
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 10  Israeli Government spokesmen said today that Premier Golda Meir conferred about a month ago with a former Jordanian Cabinet Minister and confidant of King Hussein who has retired and is living in an Arab neighborhood of Jerusalem.

title: John J. Flaherty Jr., 78, A Track and Field Official
description: John J. Flaherty Jr., a wellknown track and field official, was found dead yesterday by a friend at his home, 129 Magnolia Avenue, Jersey City. He was 78 years old.

title: Study of Radiation Dangers From Ovens and TV Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 10 (AP)The Federal Government is starting a fiveyear study to determine if humans are endangered by electromagnetic radiation from such devices as television sets and microwave ovens.

title: Lindsay Speaks In Roston
description: BOSTON, Feb. 10 Mayor Lindsay of New York renewed his attack on the Nixon Administration tonight for not speaking out against the British for the fatal shooting of 13 Roman Catholics during a demonstration in Londonderry or against the Pakistani slaughter of the people of Bengal.

title: Czechs Hold Italian Newsman; Trial for Subversion Expected
description: PRAGUE, Feb. 10Czechoslovak authorities have arrested an Italian journalist and taken actions against two others as part of a crackdown on underground circulars and dissident literature.

title: The Environmental Awakening
description: In the range and complexity of its proposals, President Nixon's annual message on the environment reflects the growing sophistication of what he properly calls the environmental awakening. From urban parks to agricultural pesticides, from wetlands to treatment of industrial wastes, the problems of the environment are manysided and their solutions are interdependent.

title: NIXON AIDES BACK VALUEADDED TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 The Administration unveiled today its ideas concerning a valueadded tax to a crosssection of government officials from all over the country and ran into criticism from virtually every point of the political and geographical compass.

title: HIGHER MORTGAGE AT CADMAN VOTED
description: Despite impassioned pleas from a parade of irate purchasers of apartments in Cadman Towers, the Board of Estimate last night approved an increase of nearly $6million in the mortgage of the developer of the Brooklyn Heights project.

title: Books of The Times
description: People are beginning to write good novels about sex again. And it's about time. Before the sexual revolution, there were, of course, good novels on the theme but they treated it in a more or less classical way, you might say. Then the courts opened Pandora's box and every other novelist started to unbutton himself or herself.

title: DR. HOWARD W. BLAKE
description: Dr. Howard William Blake, a dental surgeon here from 1914 until his retirement last year, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 563 Park Avenue.

title: Irving Reported Seeking Deal to Testify In Federal Court on Hughes's Memoirs
description: Clifford Irving has expressed willingness to cooperate with the Government in the investigation of the purported autobiography of Howard R. Hughes in exchange for assurances that no legal action would be taken against his wife either here or in Switzerland, sources close to the case said last night.

title: Nets to Open Nassau Coliseum Tonight in Game With Condors
description: The nation's newest big league indoor sports arena opens tonight in partly completed form when the New York Nets face the Pittsburgh Condors in an American Basketball Association game at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: Gatewood Weighs Legal Option
description: The New York Giants are holding an orientation program this weekend for the rookies they acquired in last week's pro football draft. In most cases the young athletes will be selling themselves, especially when it comes to contracts.

title: Penguins Beat Kings, 61
description: PITTSBURGH Feb. 10 (UPI) Pittsburgh broke out of lastplace tie with Los Angeles in the West Division tonight by blitzing the Kings, 61, behind the aggresive play of Ron Schock and Bryan Hextall.

title: BROKERAGE GROUP BACKS S.E.C. PLAN
description: The Securities Industry Association has formally endorsed the position of the Securities and Exchange Commission on the controversial issue of institutional membership on the nation's stock exchanges.

title: No U.S. Bequest to Japan.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (UPI) A State Department spokesman said today that the Japanese mission had not been requested to undertake any negotiations or discussions on behalf of the United States. He said the Japanese very kindly kept us informed throughout, the stay of the two envoys.

title: Anaconda Shows a Loss;
description: The expropriation of its Chilean investments seriously affected operations or the Anaconda Company last year. The report yesterday also cited costs and writeoffs necessitated by the basic revisions in the company's continuing operations resulting from the expropriation.

title: Muskie, Running in Nearly All of the Primaries at Once, Finds His Resources Thinning
description: DOVER, N. H., Feb. 10The manager of the Ramada Inn was all set to welcome Senator Edmund S. Muskie today when in walked Sam Yorty, the Mayor of Los Angeles, who is one of the Senator's rivals in the March 7 New Hampshire Presidential primary.

title: 10 VIETNAMESE HERE ARRESTED AT SIT.IN
description: The police arrested 10 SOUth Vietnamese students here yesterday on charges of criminal trespass after they forced their way into the offices of the South Vietnamese Consulate, at 866 United Nations Plaza, and held a threehour sitin.

title: STATE WILL ENTER IRVING CASE TODAY
description: A second largescale investigation of the tangled Howard R. Hughes autobiography case will be initiated today by a New York County grand jury, the District Attorney's office announced yesterday.

title: FORMER HUGHES AIDE SEEKING 17.5.MILLION
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 10 (UPI) Robert A. Maheu, former head of Howard R. Hughes's casino and hotel interests in Las Vegas, Nev., filed a $17.5million libel and slander suit today against the Hughes Tool Company and the concern's public relations agency.

title: Sonics Fatten Streak
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 10 (AP)The Seattle Supersonics continued their domination of the Central Division tonight with a 11896 victory over the Cincinnati Royals. Seattle has a 130 mark against Central teams.

title: British Steel Output Ebbs
description: LONDON, Feb. 10 (UPI)Steel production in Britain last month averaged 429,000 tons a month, down 18.1 per cent from the yearearlier 525,000, the stateowned British Steel Corporation reported today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: SHIRAZ, IranOne of history's oddest confrontations is that of the grandiosely arrogant ruins of Persepolis on an arid plateau north of here and, amid a grove of sapling evergreens below, a cluster of geometrically spaced, permanently anchored tents giving the impression of a garish and de luxe motel.

title: Scuba Girl Subpoenaed
description: MIAMI, Feb. 10 (UPI)  A Federal grand jury in New York has subpoenaed Ann Baxter, a scubadiving instructor acquainted with Mr. Irving, The Miami Herald reported in its Friday editions.

title: Black Mortgage Bankers Discuss Problems
description: Dempsey J. Travis, a 52yearold dynamo who runs the biggest and most prosperous black mortgagebanking firm in the country, played a dominant role yesterday as the United Mortgage Bankers of America, the trade association he founded, began its annual midwinter meeting here.

title: U. S. Toll Is 2 In Week
description: SAIGON, Feb. 10 (UPI) The United States command reported today that two Ameritans died in combat in Indochina last week, or three fewer than the week before.

title: A Late Surge in 1971 Puts American Airlines in Black
description: American Airlines, Inc., which operated at a loss in the first 11 months last year, ended 1971 in the black as predicted last May by its president, George A. Spater.

title: TV: The White House and Public Programing
description: As director of the Office of Telecommunication Policy, Clay T. Whitehead is President Nixon's chief adviser and spokesman on the broad area of telecommunications. His statements, obviously, are not to be taken lightly. And in the area of public television, mired in supplications for longterm Federal financing, they must be taken very seriously.

title: News of Skiing
description: HANOVER, N. H., Feb. 10 The fourstoryhigh, turrettopped ice and snow castle seemed destined to weathe Dartmouth's winter carnival this weekend without a bead of moisture. The finishing touches were applied to the structure on the campus today. Unlike some recent carnivals, during which works of ice sculpture threatened to float down to the nearby Connecticut River, this year's snow castle seems In no jeopardy. It was 10 degrees this afternoon and the thermometer was expected to plunge tonight.

title: Both Are German, At Least in Name
description: Restaurants reviwed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) arid for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: State's Hurd Panel To Present Options On Education Funds
description: ALBANY, Feb. 10The State Task Force on the Financing of Higher Educationthe socalled Hurd Commissionwhich was expected to make specific recommendations, will present only a list of options, a member of the panic said today.

title: April Trial Set for Gronouski
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 10 (UPI) A county Judge today ordered former Postmaster General John A. Gronouski tried April 18 on charges of drunken driving. Mr. Gronouski now is dean of the Lyndon B. Johnson School of Public Affairs at the University of Texas. He was arested Dec. 26 in front of the Texas Capitol.

title: Advertising:
description: Wells Rich Greene is losing the American Motors account, which bills about $18million.

title: WALTER CROSBY
description: Walter Crosby, a former reporter and founder of the Headquarters News Service, died yesterday in Long Island College Hospital of a coronary ailment. He was 59 years old.

title: Pentagon Aide Says Officials Must Adhere to Rights Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The Pentagon's newly appointed civil rights chief said today that performance in the civil rights area would be a major consideration in determining the efficiency and competence of Defense Department personnel, especially officials and office managers.

title: &Good Advice on Church Schools
description: In opposing any increase in public funding for nonpublic schools, the Fleischmann Commission notes that virtually all such recent aid programs have been in violation of the Constitution. Furthermore, the commission's majority argues convincingly against the view of those who favor additional support of the parochial schools as a way of reducing the taxpayers burden. Considering the severe fiscal restraint on the public schools, it is difficult to justify any aid that would benefit only a chosen handful.

title: For Chinatown, Year of the Mouse Roars In Tuesday
description: In Chinatown, New Year's candles and incense already burn before the handsome yellow image of the Dragon. Mother, the goodluck centerpiece of the elaborate family shrine in Mrs. Tam Bing Yung's kitchen.

title: 35Hour Week Rejected
description: BOSTON, Feb. 10 (AP)The Massachusetts House rejected a bill today that would have set a 35hour work week for state employes.

title: Morton Says Court Rulings Have Delayed Alaska Pipeline Action
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 Interior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton said today that the decision on whether to build the transAlaska oil pipeline had been delayed at feast two months by court decisions that halted the sale of leases for the drilling of oil off the coast of Louisiana.

title: OSWALD REJECTS PRISONERS UNION
description: ALBANY, Feb. 10  State Correction Commissioner Russell G. Oswald today rejected a demand by a union that he recognize it as the exclusive bargaining agent for the Inmates at Green Haven prison, saying that state law prevented him from doing so.

title: New Chief Is Due At Shell Transport
description: LONDON, Feb. 10The top job in British oil will change hands at the end of June when Sir David Barran steps down as chairman of the Shell Transport and Trading Company, to be succeeded by Frank S. McFadzean, a lawyer and economist and former civil servant who joined the concern in 1952.

title: Charlie's Happy Return
description: If a nation could collectively blush, the United States had good reason to do so when its officialdom ruled two decades ago that Charles Chaplin could not come back to these shores until he offered proof of his moral worth. Happily, the guardians of this country's virtue appear to have matured sufficiently not to fear for America's political and moral safety when, on April the creator of the beloved, pathetic and funny Tramp returns from his European exile.

title: The Talk of Thief River Falls
description: THIEF RIVER FALLS, Minn. Feb. 10  An eerie humming sound, much like the buzzing of bees in their hives, fills the crisp air around Thief River Falls these nights. Uriusual lights, resembling fireflies, dance across the flat fields, which carry the smooth, meander ing tracks of some monster dragging its weight through the deepening snow.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  Following is the transcript of President Nixon's news conference today, as released by the White House:

title: KNICKS AND BUCKS HAVE SICK LISTS
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 10Both the New York Knicks and the Milwaukee Bucks were concerned about injuries to star players today as they prepared for tomorrow night's National Basketball Association game at Milwaukee Arena, A capacity crowd of 10,746, the Bucks 14th of the season, will watch the contest.

title: CAPT. BAYSINGER, 45, NAVY QUARTERBACK
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) Capt. Reaves Baysinger, quarterback on the Naval Academy football teams in 1946, 1947 and 1948, died last night of Hodgkins disease at the Naval Hospital in nearby Bethesda, Md. He was 45 years old.

title: Guerrilla Moves Worry Lisbon As Blast in Mozambique Kills
description: LISBON, Feb. 10The Portuguese are troubled over an upsurge of nationalist guerrilla activity in western Mozambique, where the vast Cabora Besse hydroelectric dam Is being built on the Zambezi River.

title: A Model for Diplomats
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The eighteenthcentury English writer, Sir Richard Steele, once wrote in The Spectator, The noblest motive is the public good. This seems to me to epitomize Llewellyn Thompson's attitude toward his life and work. He had a full, successful and, I think, satisfying life.

title: Bruins Rout Canucks
description: BOSTON, Feb. 10 (AP) Fred Stanfield scored two goals and Bobby Orr scored one and assisted on three others tonight as the Boston Bruins defeated the Vancouver Canucks, 91.

title: WAR INTENSIFIES IN SHIA AREA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 10  Communist forces increased their attacks on South Vietnamese positions in the Central Highlands today, and American fighterbombers retaliated with their heaviest air strikes in six months.

title: HAPPINESS & VEPALITY; ve Teach It; Arica Institute (212) 4897130  Advt.
description: HAPPINESS & VEPALITY; ve Teach It; Arica Institute (212) 4897130  Advt.

title: Blast Kills Israeli Scientist
description: HAIFA, Israel, Feb. 10 (AP)An explosion during a rocket experiment ripped through an underground jetpropulsion laboratory today, killing an Israeli scientist, Dr. Amnon Chervinsky, 34 years old.

title: PENN FIVE DOWNS COLUMBIA, 6959
description: Penn had a little more trouble with Columbia's basketball team than it expected last night but was never in real trouble in defeating the Lions. 6959. The victory gave the Quakers sole possession of first place in the Ivy League.

title: Elizabeth, Philip and Anne, on Visit to Thailand, Get Key to Bangkok
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 10 (Reuters)Queen Elizabeth received a golden key to the city of Bangkok today after stepping ashore onto a carpet of flowers at the start of a sixday state visit to Thailand.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We wish to join in the protest about the recent killings of thirteen people in Derry, which resulted from an attempt to interfere with a civil rights protest.

title: State Acts to Outlaw Companies Selling Theses
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz began court action yesterday to put out of business a company that produces term papers, essays and theses for college students.

title: Blackfin Moves Into Lead In Yacht Race to Acapulco
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 10 (AP)Continued light winds caused shakeup in the San DiegotoAcapulco yacht race today as Blackf in bumped Windward Passage out of the lead for the first time since the 1,430mile event began Sunday.

title: Continental Can Appeals Monopoly Ruling on Unit
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 10 (UPI)The European holding company of the Continental Can of New York today appealed a European Common Market Commission ruling it had achieved a monopoly position in Europe.

title: KENNEDY CENTER REVISES CONTRACT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The Kennedy Center announced today revision of a contract that was letting some stagehands earn as much as $1,500 a week.

title: Subway Graffiti Here Called Epidemic
description: Subway graffiti are fast reaching what an IRT conductor has called the epidemic stage here.

title: Anne Henning Is 3d in 1,000 Skate Final
