description: THE coinage of Iran is in the spotlight this month at the Museum of the American Numismatic Society to commemorate the 2500th anniversary of the Persian Empire. The exhibit will run through March.

description: Alphonso DiLeo pointed to photographs depicting Bensonhurst and said, These pictures give a slanted view of the community. They're not beneficial to the community. Would you send picture postcard of this to a relative?

title: 18 CITY HOSPITALS SEEK $820MILLION FOR NEXT BURET
description: The City Health and Hospitals Corporation asked yesterday for $820,311,000 for the next fiscal year while acknowledging that it had tried to achieve too much too quickly when it took over the 18 public hospitals In 1970.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I hope that a great many labor union leaders read the article Do It Yourself Addiction Causes Pain and Joy [Jan. 23] by Marian Denby Freedman. I wonder if they would consider how many manhours of labor the Freedmans saved by not employing organized labor. And certainly they are not alone.

title: St. John's Swim Team Tops Long Island U., 9411
description: Taking first place in 12 of 13 events, St. John's University's swimming team routed Long Island University, 9411, at the Alumni Hall pool in Jamaica, Queens, yesterday.

description: WATERTOWN, N. Y., Feb. 12Miss Ann Catherine Johnson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John B. Johnson, was married here this afternoon in the First Presbyterian Church to George Stephen Sturtz Jr. of New York, son of Dr. and Mrs. George S. Sturtz, also of Watertown.

title: GANGS FACE DRIVE IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 12 Gang violence is giving Philadelphia a bad name, Mayor James H. J. Tate said in 1969. Killings and stabbings by young gang members have not abated since then, and forme Police Commissioner Frank L. Rizzo, who succeeded Mr. Tate as mayor last month, has announced a crackdown.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (Al') Four manufacturers of car seats for children have agreed to take corrective action for sonic 55,000 seats that fail to comply with new Federal safety standards.

title: Son to Mrs. Louria
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Feb. 12  A son was born Feb. 2 in Greenwich Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Lee K. Louria. Mrs. Louria is the former Miss Barbara Morris of Greenwich. Her husband is corporate labor relations manager for the Singer Company. The child has been named Myles Gregory.

title: Overkill of Animals Laid To Huntsmen in 9000 B.C.
description: A University of Arizona scientist believes that some 11,000 years ago a thin, grim line of hunters marched from Alaska to Tierra del Fuego, exterminating within less than 1,000 years most of the exotic and innocent large mammals then inhabiting the Americas.

title: Stamps
description: THE Philatelic Advisory Panel of the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission is making its own moves to acquaint Americans and Europeans with the 1976 bicentennial of the American Revolution and the founding of the United States. It is to participate in at least one exhibition in the U.S., and others in Belgium and Brazil.

title: Track Team of Brooklyn Fails in Bid for Record
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Feb. 12 With Olympian Larry James out of the lineup, the Brooklyn Over the Hill team failed in its efforts to crack a world record in the nile relay in the Indian Invitation indoor track meet at the College of William and Mary.

description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Feb. 12 (UPII)Hal King, catcher, and Roy Foster, outfielder, both of whom were obtained in offseason trades, were among seven players announced as signed by the Texas Rangers today.

title: Storm Delaying Transport After Rescue in Antarctic
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, (AP)The Piloto Pardo, the Chilean Navy transport that rescued the passengers yesterday from the grounded Norwegian cruise ship Lindblad Explorer inmocu heavy Antarctic seas, lay at anchor 600 miles south of Cape Horn today, waiting for a storm to end.

title: Japanese Reds Due Here
description: TOKYO, Feb. 12 (AP)  The Japanese Communist party says it will send a fourmember delegation to the 20th convention of the Communist party of the United States in New York, Friday to Feb. 21. Sanzo Nogaka, chairman of the Central Committee, will head the first Japanese delegation to attend an American party convention.

title: SCHOOLING STRESS PUT ON RELIGION
description: Mrs. Penny Schwartz grew up in the Flatbush and Manhattan Beach sections of Brooklyn and attended New York City public schools and Hunter College.

title: Remapping May Hurt Democrats Here
description: ALBANY, Feb. 12  Republican officials here have agreed on plans to redraw the state's Congressional districts so that a number of incumbent Democrats would bo forced to run against each other In primaries this year or resign.

title: Elegant austerity
description: When students of design look back on the sixties and seventies, one trend will stand out  the simplification of furniture. This highrise apartment in Milan illustrates the new austere aesthetic. Faced with its banal rooms, architect Gae Aulenti opted for practicality and comfort  important factors for the owner, a politician who needed a place to live and do the entertaining that is part and parcel of political life. Furniture was reduced to the essentials  soft, comfortable seating, an extralong dining table that can accommodate a crowd, and builtin lighting. All the upholstery is vibrant red; the walls (inset with hidden lighting) are cool white, the carpeting a deep gray. The dining chairs and the lamp (one design is used throughout the apartment) add flashes of chrome and mirrored glass.

title: New Novel
description: The runaways are a boy and a girl. The boy is an English 15yearold who has gone over the hill from a reform school; the girl is an escaped cheetah from a private zoo in Wiltshire. Animal lovers will identify closely with Yarra as she stalks the Salisbury plain, picking off small game and eventuallywell, wait and see. Sentimentalists will empathize with the plucky youth, nicknamed Smiler, whose circuitous path crosses with Yarra's. Boy and beast have a common cause, so to speak; both are outcasts living off the land.

title: Desert Bighorn Sheep Traded to New Mexico
description: LORDSBURG, N.M., Feb. 12A trade between New Mexico and the Mexican Government has been completed with the arrival of five rare desert bighorn sheep in exchange for 50 antelope.

title: Available in the Drugstore
description: elt at the office or the splitlevel ranch house, with glass in hand and cigarette in mouth and momentarily distracted from an orgy of violence on their television set, older Americans sometimes find their thoughts drifting to youth and its addiction to marijuana, heroin and LSD. Twenty million in the thrall of pot! Why do they use these drugs? their elders ask plaintively. What can we do to rescue them?

title: Model of the Sikorsky S69 helicopter, designed with coaxial rigid rotors and outboard Jet engines
description: With $9.9million from the United States Army, Sikorsky Aircraft is building a research helicopter incorporating at ambitious combination of design concepts.

title: Voices Still Sing Out At Bayside Glee Club
description: The Once thriving and active world of male chorus singing on Long Island has been dying out in recent years, but one hardy group, the Bayside Glee Club, is still managing to make its voices heard.

title: Has the Catholic Church Gone Mad?; 13y John Eppstoin. 173 pp. Arlington. $6.95.
description: This English Catholic author deplores the changes and trends in the church that have followed Vatican IL To these he ascribes the blame for the dropoff in priestly and religious vocations in the Western world and other statistical evidence of religious decline. He argues that doctrine has been diluted or distorted, the services vulgarized and demystified, and that an excessive involvement in political and social affairs has only aided world Communism and weakened the church's spiritual influence. He condemns what he calls the sneers and abuse of the modernist, antipapal campaign by the media and some church leaders, and the sacrifice of traditional Christianity to the worship of that willo'thewisp, Modern Man. This is a wideranging and knowledgeable statement of the conservative Catholic position written with fever. style and skill.

title: Seal Hunting by Plane
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Feb. 12 (Reuters)A travel agency at the Finnish port of Kokkola is to offer tourists threeday sealhunting trips by plane off Western Finland at a cost of $200.

title: Chess
description: UNTIL quite recently, the annual British championship tournament (although a perfectly respectable affair as one would expect any British tournament to be) didn't inspire any widespread interest abroad or outside the circle of the players themselves. Usually there was at least one very talented player taking part in the years following the end of World War II, C. H. O'D. Alexanderand more recently, Jonathan Penroseof whom it was said that if they would devote full time to the game, they could become grandmasters, but they never did. The rest of the field was mediocre.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: BRIGGS, HARVARD, DEFEATS REESE
description: Peter Briggs of Harvard upset the No. 3seeded player, John Reese yesterday and gained the semi final of the 26th annual Harry Cowles invitation squash racquets tournament.

title: Is Newark Rent Strike Near End?
description: NEWARKThe city Housing Authority believes the nation's longestrunning public housing rent strike is beginning to wind down after 22 months.

title: BIG JOB POTENTIAL IN SEAS FORESEEN
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 12  Leaders of the maritime trades meeting here are worried about the unemployment problem in their currently depressed industry. But Howard W. Pollock, deputy administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, envisions a great potential for employment, although in the distant future, as man seeks to wrest more food, oil and minerals from the

title: Letters:
description: To THR EDITOR:

title: Writing Plays Is Abs lutely Sense ss, Arthur Miller Says, But I Love It I Just Love It
description: ROXBURY, Conn.

title: Ulster Catholics and Army: Impasse of Hate
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 10  Roman Catholic housewives and children gathered on Cromac Square In Belfast's markets area, shouting and shaking fists at the helmeted British soldiers in two armored cars nearby.

title: William Cullen Bryant
description: Except for school children no one much reads Bryant's poems today, although, as any literary history of the U.S. points out, he was the first poet of talent to write of nature in American rather than British terms. But his extraliterary career, now almost forgotten, was also important. When he died in 1878, he was considered New York's first citizenremarkable in an age when wealth was the main mark of prominence. On his way up, he had an interesting time, starting out in western New England as a lawyer, then editing magazines in New York and eventually running the influential N. Y. Post. He was generally on the rightor, rather, liberalside of causes and an important supporter of Jackson and Lincoln. Mr. Brown writes in the spirit of his subjectevenly, judicioushis materials. (Bryant was a man of considerable selfcontrolpublicly he is known to have lost his temper only once, when he horsewhipped a rival editor on Broadway.) There has been no biography since 1883.

title: A Ruddy Day At Sea With South Shore's Frostbite Fleet
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I.  They are called frostbite sailors, an apt description for a hardy breed of Long Islander whose idea of fun on a bonerattling February Sunday is to bundle up in thick clothing, drive over a blustery dock and then sit for hours in a damp boat.

title: U,S.LT.A. AFFIRMS STAND FOR ACCORD
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 12 (AP)The United States Lawn Tennis Association, at the final session of its annual meeting today, decided to try to get Lamar Hunt's contract pros back into open tournaments within the framework of the International Lawn Tennis Federation.

title: Ahould LADIES Pilot Jumnbo Jets?
description: IM MARVIN. Fly me. If some of the sexdiscrimination suits pending against the airlines wind up with verdicts for the plaintiffs, you could be seeing ads like that in the newspapers and on television.

title: A permanent disaster, reported with love and anger
description: In March, 1966, as Calcutta lay paralyzed under a general strike, sat with the managing director of a British firm Sin his woodpaneled office on a narrow street off Dalhousie Square. Outside, khakiclad police, their long bamboo kithis splayed across their shoulders, stood guard before the neoclassic facade of the Writer's Building, where an ineffectual, corrupt Congress Party Government was spastically trying to put down rioting led by the Chineseoriented Communists.

title: 23 TERM PAPERS SOLD AFTER THEFT
description: Nearly 200 term papers were stolen from professors at Columbia and Harvard during the last three weeks, and Minuteman Research, a Queensbased, termpaper supply service, says it bought 23 of them.

title: 3YEAR B.S. OFFERED BY NORTHWESTERN U.
description: EVANSTON, Iii., Feb. 12A limited number of Northwestern University students will soon be able to receive a bachelor's degree in three years.

title: Ann Howe Billings Is Betrothed
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 12Dr. and Mrs. Frederic Tremaine Billings have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Howe Billings, to Coleman Alexander Harwell 2d, son of Mrs. Robert Ewing Harwell of Franklin and the late Mr. Harwell.

title: Francis Andrew Florin, 67; Jersey Banking Consultant
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., Feb. 12Francis Andrew Florin, deputy superintendent of the New York State Banking Department from 1952 to 1959, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital in Summit, N.J. He was 67 years old and lived at 910 Highland Avenue here.

title: Law
description: Ten years ago, a new magazinea high quality hard cover quarterly devoted to the subject of Love and Sexmade its much publicized debut. Appropriately entitled Eros and mailed from Middlesex, N. J.mailing privileges from the Pennsylvania towns of Intercourse and Blue Ball had been deniedit boasted that the imprimature for its publication had come from recent decisions of the Supreme Court.

title: Pender Tops Meriwether
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. Feb. 12 (UPI)  Mark Winzenried, former Wisconsin star now running for Club West of Santa Barbara, Calif., broke the world indoor record for the 1,000yard run tonight with a time of minutes 5.1 seconds in the MasonDixon Games.

title: Barbara Logan Ellis Wed to Peter Cascio
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Feb. 12Miss Barbara Logan Ellis, daughter of Mrs. Harlan Montgomery Ellis and the late Mr. Ellis, was married here this afternoon to Peter B. Cascio of West Simsbury, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter J. Cascio of West Hartford. The Rev. Dr. Charles Wilding, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's mother.

title: NEW LEAGUE EYES PLAYERS IN N.H.L.
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Feb. 12National Hockey League stars Pit Martin, Gerry Cheevers, Mickey Redmond, and Roger Crozier were maong players selected today as the World Hockey Association went through the second phase of its draft.

title: Again, Lincoln's Tomb Is the Focus
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Feb. 12 It is not terribly difficult to discern this city's main claim to fame.

title: EASING OF QUOTA ON MEATS HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12The Nixon Administration may ease quota restrictions to allow more imported meat to enter the country as a means of slowing the rising spiral of retail meat prices, Donald Rumsfeld, director of the Cost of Living Council, disclosed today.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Pennsylvania Panel Allocates $418,411 For Reform of Bail
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 12The Governor's Justice Commission has taken the first step toward eliminating professional bondsmen in Pennsylvania by allocating $418,411 in Federal funds for bail bond reform programs in Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

title: Tobacco Sales Rise Sharply Despite the Ban on TV Commercials
description: Antismoldng crusaders who breathed a sigh of relief when the last cigarette commercial was aired Jan. 1, 1971, are holding their breath these days.

description: To THE EDIT

title: The Bonds
description: A portrait of Julian Bond's family, from Julian's greatgrandmother to Julian today, the Georgia legislator and national political figure. As a chronicle of how one black family overcame the obstacles of racism, the book has significance, but not on the general level that the author indicates was his intention for the book.

title: HIGHRISE CEMETERY IS PLANNED FOR RIO
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 12Brazilians are about to pioneer a new kind of realestate development  vertical, highrise cemeteries.

title: 20 Shows Today List 2,000 Dogs At 9 Sites
description: In this age of specialization, there will be enough specialty shows around New York to satisfy even the most demanding fancier. There are 20 shows listed, at nine sites, with a total entry of 2,009.

title: Villanova Tops Temple
description: PHILADELPHIA. F?b. 12 (AP) The clutch shooting and ballhawking of Chris Ford carried Villanova from a 10point deficit to an 8066 victory over Temple tonight at the Palestra. It was the first city series loss for Temple (177).

title: New Headmaster Named
description: MERCERSBURG, Pa., Feb. 12 (AP)Walter Ff. Burgin Jr. of Exeter, N. H., has been named as the fifth headmaster at Mercersburg Academy. Mr. Burgin, a 37yearold mathematics instructor at Phillips Exeter Academy, succeeds William C. Fowle, whojeretired.

title: Phelan's Manuscript Was Viewed by Many
description: The manuscript on Howard R. Hughes prepared by James Phelan, the investigative reporter, underwent an odyssey in and out of several publishing concerns, according to people who came into contact with it. One of those persons was 1Stanley Meyer, a financial backer of films who knew both Mr. Irving and Mr. Phelan.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: RAWALPINDI, PakistanPresident Zulfikar All Bhutto is looking to an odd couple, namely Mao Tsetung and Richard Nixon, to keep Pakistan and, incidentally, all Asia from sliding down the drain. A social reformer without ideological pedigree, Bhutto is philosophically about midstream between the Chinese and American chiefs of state. But he thinks they are the only people who can straighten out a mess unusual even for this untidy continent.

title: AROUND THE
description: Keep the center core of bromeliads filled with water at all times. Remember: sand, fertilizer, kitty litter or wood ashes for icy walks and steps rather than salt crystals. Keep bird feeders well stocked daily. On very cold nights, move house plants away from window sills; cold drafts seep Order seeds for spring; planting is just around the calendar.

title: Ban on Predator Poisoning Clarified by Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI) Clarifying a mixup that sparked widespread protest, the Administration has said that its ban on Federal poisoning of predators would not stop the shooting and trapping of coyotes and other predatory animals.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: A collection of Mr. Viorst's profiles of various politicians and operators. Rusk, Javits and Dirksen; starlets McGeorge Bundy, Joseph Rauh, John Mitchell; also Bobby Baker, Robert Kintner, Arthur Burns, William 0. Douglas. Without achieving depth, Viorst provides good balance sheets on these men and is quite effective in describing their techniques of power. With a political reporter's fascination for the game, Viorst is basically sympathetic to his subjects; and, although he provides short introductions explaining how the pieces came to be written, his own personality does not intrude.

title: Swoboda and Eight Other Yankee Players Turn In Their Signed Contracts
description: Ron Swoboda, who will go to spring training for the first time with the Yankees this year, was one of nine players who returned their signed contracts yesterday.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: JENSEN BEACH, Fla., Feb. 12When two anglers whose combined years of dedication to the sport total more than threequarters of a century join forces on Florida's coastal waters, one might suppose that success would be theirs. Such, alas, was not the case.

Nevertheless, facsimile communication, using machines to send exact copies of documents to compatible remote receivers, is still more promising than ever.

description: IT'S melodrama. It's psychodrama. It's supersoap! It's Paul Bernard, Psychiatrist, the Canadian import originally packaged for the Canadian Broadcasting Company by those wonderful people who gave us The Galloping Gourmet. Weekdays at 1 P.M. on New York's Channel 2 (WCBS) we can see another halfhour in this series of psychiatric sessions recreated by professional actors, scriptwriters, directors, etc., and certified by the Canadian Mental Health Association as an authentic portrayal of one aspect of psychiatric treatment. Whatever that

title: Kathy J. Fein Married
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Feb. 12  Miss Kathy Joyce Fein and Rick Stephen Bierman, 1971 graduates of New York University, were married at the Hilton Inn here this evening by Rabbi Maurice Davis. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Fein of Scarsdale and Bonaire, the Netherlands Antilles, and Mr. and Mrs. Sam Bierman of East Meadow, L. I.

title: Stars Belt Flyers, 51
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 12 (AP)Gump Worsley, a lastminute goaltending choice, defended brilliantly and even contributed an assist during threegoal, 76second Minnesota outbursti n the second period that powered the North Stars to a 51 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers tonight.

title: Brumby Set to Attend His 50th Westminster
description: Leonard Brun:by Jr. will be attending his 50th consecutive Westminster show, which starts tomorrow in the Garden.

title: COLIN M. M'LEOD, A MICROBIOLOGIST
description: LONDON, Feb. 13 (AP)Dr. Colin M. MacLeod, an American microbiologist and former White House science adviser, died today in an airport hotel here. He was 63 years old.

CLEVELAND CUTS CITY EMPLOYE PAY

description: NEW BRUNSWICK  A Rutgers University study is examining the impact of New Jersey's lagoon home developments on the coastal environment.

description: LONDON, Feb. 12Thousands of workers were laid off today as British industry moved to comply with Government orders for a threeday week because of the national coal strike.

title: Stage: Elegant Hamlet
description: NEW HAVEN  Do not rush to the Long Wharf Theater to see Stacy Keach in Arvin Brown's staging of Hamlet. It ended Saturday, but all occasions had informed against us and it had not been possible to get to New Haven until the previous evening. So this review is a commemoration for the record of a performance and production that do the regional theater all honor.

title: Wisconsin Six Wins, 51
description: MADISON. Wk., Feb. 12 (AP) Wisconsin erased a 10 deficit rtnd went on to best Notre Dame, 51 tonight in hockey.

title: New Jail for Miss Todd
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 12 (Reuters) Mrs. Garfield Todd said today that her daughter, Judith, a politictildeTalire was moved yesterday, the eighth day of her hunger strike, to a jail where medical attention was available. Miss Todd and her father, Prime Minister of Southern Rhodesia when it was a British colony, were arrested Jan. 18 and Miss Todd is protesting detention without trial.

title: ARMY BOWS, 1542, TO N.Y.U. FENCERS
description: Sparked by Sal Virgili, an epee man, the New York University fencing team defeated Army, 1512, yesterday at the Violets Washington Square gymnasium. It was N.Y.U.'s 29th consecutive dualmeet triumph since February, 1969.

title: LOAN SHARKS LINKED TO INDIANA SLAYINGS
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 12 (Reuters) The police investigated reports today that three young Chicago businessmen had been executed by the crime syndicate because they failed to meet extortionate interest payments levied by loan sharks.

title: Walking an androgynous knifeedge
description: The subject of this powerful, inordinately charming first novel is its narrator, Lindya young English girl for whom the sustenance and progress of being reside in thinking. For her the management of daily living is a categorically separate matter, alien and, finally, positively inimical to the life of the mind. Thinking, by Lindy's definition, is disinterested: its function is emphatically not to serve as a prerequisite for action. This is an article of faith she embraces the more tenaciously the more deafeningly her situation roars its dissent, as, for instance, when her husband, in token adieu, kicks her downstairs: I sat on the bottom stair and considered. But only for a moment My specialty, it must be admitted, was pure thought Nothing empirical. Nothing applied. My acts, I have to own, were spontane

title: William Brannigan Weds Miss Prophet
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12Miss Rosalind Prophet and William Brannigan were married here this morning. The Rev. James F. Meyers performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Matthew's Roman Catholic Cathedral.

title: The Valentine
description: Tomorrow, February's midpoint, is St. Valentine's Day, with its nosegays, its love notes and its celebration of the vernal passions. The early Romans were responsible for it. Perhaps they, too, wearied of winter about now and needed a reminder of better days ahead; so they established Lupercalia, which were feasts and celebrations to honor Pan and Juno. In its adaptation pagan rites to Christian ritual, the church established new festival at the time of Lupercalia, a more sober celebration honoring a priest who ministered to the Christian martyrs and himself was martyred, St. Valentine. But the old romantic trappings of Lupercalia, with its love feasts and sentimental notes, persisted even under the

title: On San Francisco's Broadway, Accent Is Now on Total Nudity
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 12 It's the same now at the clubs all along Broadway. At Big Al's. The Condor, the Roaring Twenties, El Cid, The Hungry I, and on down the line. Business is booming.

title: A death story, a love story
description: This unusual Houghton Mifflin Literary Fellowship Award Novel is told by two narrators. Mary Moody Schwartz, the first narrator, awakens in her hospital room after a mastectomy. As she looks at the other patients in the room she intuitively knows that they are Buddies at death's door but they aren't the buddies she would have chosen. I had to think about the spot I was in, how to get out of it and whose fault it was. That was important. Find out who's to blame. That's the first manifestation of her paranoia, which develops with the electric, eccentric log

title: Suns Rout Royals, 11795
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Feb. 12 (AP) The Cincinnati Royals, with three players missing because of injuries, hit only 28 per cent from the floor in the first period and lost to the Phoenix Suns, 11795, tonight.

title: The February Calendar
description: ASHOW of forced bulb flowers and artistic arrangements will be staged on Wednesday by the Horticultural Society of New York, Inc. at its headquarters, 128 West 58th Street. Hours are from noon to 4 P.M. Admission is $1. Free to members and guests.

title: EMPLOYERS NOTIFIED OF DOMESTICS TAX
description: Householders in New York who employ domesticservice workersmaids, cooks, gardeners, chauffeursnot only have to pay the Federal Social Security Tax, but they also must pay the State Unemployment Insurance Tax.

title: Migrants, Sharecroppers, Mountaineers
description: Children of Crisis, appeared in 1967 and immediately received enormous acclaim. Now volumes two and three have been published simultaneouslyMigrants, Sharecroppers, Mountaineers and The South Goes North. The author of all theseand more to come, since he says he is moving on to interview Chicano and Indian children in the Southwest and eventually go North to the Eskimosis a child psychiatrist named Robert Coles, connected with Hatyard and with considerable hospital experience behind him, who has been out in the field since 1958 talking to people who were rarely, and then only in an accidental his patients.

title: STATE CRITICIZED 011 OFFICE SPACE
description: ALBANY, Feb. 12A legislative commission said this week that state office space was increasing twice as fast as the number of office personnel and recommended a thorough review of the entire state office construction process before any contracts were let on new state buildings now in the planning stage.

title: Movies
description: HOLLYWOOD, California

title: 17 Years After Defecting From Hungary, an ExPrima Ballerina Believes in Fate
description: 'I believe in fate, says Nora Kovach And with reason.

title: One gets the blood of the narrative on one's hands
description: Flannery O'Connor died in the late summer of 1964, in Milledgeville, Ga., at the age of 39. The daughter of a pioneer Roman Catholic family, she had attended Georgia State College for Women and the Graduate College of the State University of Iowa, where she had taken its justly celebrated degree in creative writing. Paul Engle was her teacher; she dedicated to him her master's thesis, which consisted of six short stories.

title: Food Pollution By Gene Marine and Judith Van Allen. 385 pp. Holt, Rinehart
description: Two books on food. Food Pollution is a wildswinging, muckraking job on the food industry, the F.D.A., and food that contains one or another kind of poisonwhich, according to the authors, is just about everything we eat Rather sloppily put together. Nutrition and Your Mind is a report on curing psychological disorders through diet changes. It veers close to food faddism.

title: JOHN N. CORDICH, 73; MARINER AND ARTIST
description: John N. Cordich, a former sea captain, who became a professicinal painter, died Friday of a heart attack while swimming off Puerto Escondido, Mexico. He was 73 years old and lived in Rockport, Mass.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The story of a WelshCanadian gamekeeper and his job in an Ethiopian national park. There are many trials and tribulations with the local bosses; the anecdotes are told with a touch of Hemingway. Nicol truly loves animals, and in one particularly moving passage tells how he hates to see them die. This unsentimental apologia of a dedicated man is a fine book of its kind. One wishes Nicol well.

title: The Avocado Story Revisited
description: Dear Mr. Canaday:

title: OBOE HAS SPOTLIGHT IN CHAMBER CONCERT
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center has been using its recent programs to spotlight its members. On Friday night in Tully Hall it was the turn of the ensemble's oboist, Leonard Amer. He was given a chance to shine in three of the four works performed; Mozart's Serenade IV in C for Three Melodic Instruments, Bach's Concerto in C minor for Oboe and Violin, and Schumann's Three Romances for Oboe and Piano.

title: Styrofoam Glut in Newark Quickly Transformed Into Shortage
description: PORT NEWARKA week ago, the Shimazaki Company had a problem: trying to give away largo pieces of Styrofoam that clogged a pier area needed to store the Hondas distributed by the company. (The protective Styrofoam panels came wrapped around the Hondas.)

title: Latonia Races Canceled
description: FLORENCE, Ky., Feb. 12 (AP) Hazardous track conditions, caused by thawing of the ground, forced cancellation of the last seven of nine scheduled races today at Latonia Race Course. Track stewards and jockeys decided to halt racing after the second race. One rider was thrown from his mount in the first race but was not badly hurt.

title: Harness Writers Will Cite Baldwin, Simpson Tonight
description: Ralph Baldwin and John Simpson Sr., recently elected to the United States Harness Writers Association Living Hall of Fame, will be honored at the writers annual awards dinner tonight at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: OLYMPIC MEET ATTRACTS STARS
description: I Nothing can approach an Olympic Games in global scope, but the fourth edition of the United States Olympic Invitation meet which will be held next Friday, is as international and as talentloaded as a Madison Square Garden track meet can get.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 12 (AP)Mike Murphy and Brian Lavender combined with Terry Crisp for three thirdperiod goals lifting the St. Louis Blues to a 54 triumph tonight over the Vancouver Canucks.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Morristown Park: A Look Back to 1776
description: MORRISTOWNThe handwriting in the leatherbound ledger is precise and deliberate, and brown with age. Written by an orderly of Sir William Howe, commander of the English forces in the Colonies during the Revolutionary War, the entry covers the events of one day, Feb. 22, 1776, as the British Army paused on Staten Island during its retreat from New Jersey;

title: Brooklyn Educator Avoids Flourish
description: It is, as college presidents offices go, somewhat of an austere chamber. The wood panels are polished a dull brown and the book shelves are barely halffilled. The walltowall carpeting is academic neutral, which means you can't really tell what color it is. The two paintings that adorn the walls are modernist and united.

title: Mrs. Resnick Has Son
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Feb. 12A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Burton Resnick of Harrison on Feb. 1 at the Lenox Hill Hospital in New York. The child has been named Peter Ian.

title: Problems Seen in Women's Bias Fight
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 12  The women's liberation movement is going to have to work out some problems very soon if it 13 not to lose impetus, Sheila Tobias, asasociate provost of Wesleyan University, told an audience at Trinity College here this week.

title: B'N AI B'RITH PLANS TO HELP ELDERLY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 B'nai B'rith acted today to involve its 500,000 members throughout the country in volunteer services for the isolated Jewish elderly.

title: Daughter to Mrs. Keith
description: A daughter was born on Feb. 2 at Lenox Hill Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Norman Clinton Keith of New York and San Juan, P. R. The child has been named Normandie Clinton. Mrs. Keith is the former Miss Kathleen A. Hanley of Philadelphia. Her husband is president and chief executive officer of Commonwealth Oil Refining Company of San Juan and New York.

title: BRAZIL SHUNNING POLLUTION CURBS
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 12Brazil, a country with thousands of miles of bright tropical bays and beaches and hundreds of millions of acres of virgin forests, has decided to import industries from abroad for the jobs they generate and the economic progress they bring, even though the industries will result in pollution.

title: STANDARDS BOARD WIDENS ITS ROLE
description: When the City Board of Standards and Appeals ruled last week against a highrise apartment project in Queens in response to community protests, It was acting under a comparatively new policy that has given tenants and other Interested parties a voice in its proceedings.

description: MIAMI, Feb. 12 (AP)The American Basketball Association Floridians today asked waivers on a 6foot5 rookie forward, Rick Fisher of Colorado, who came to the team only two weeks ago.

The World
description: AU r the candidates for the Presidency have a right to say what they want but I am suggesting now that we have made a proposal that fair, it is forthcoming, it should be negotiated on, and the responsibility for the enemy's failing to negotiate may have to be borne by those who encourage the enemy to wait until after the election.

title: HARTFORD DOG SHOW AIDS STUDENTS AGAIN

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 12 (Reuters)  The civil rights movement is planning Its third successive weekend protest march tomorrow against internment policies in Northern Ireland.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Pollution and Iron Curtain

title: Francis Gallagher Dead at 43; Harrisburg 7 Defense Lawyer
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 12 (AP)Francis X. Gallagher, attorney for two defendants in the Harrisburg Seven antiwar conspiracy trial, died last night in Johns Hopkins Hospital of a massive heart attack. He would have been 44 years old on Feb. 25.

title: Movies were important in themselves; What Is Cinema?; Volume II By Andre Bazin. Essays selected and translated by Hugh Gray. Foreword by Francois Truffaut. 200 pp. Berkeley and Los Angeles: University of California Press. $6.95.
description: In the beginning of his essay on Chaplin's Monsieur Verdoux Andre Bazin describes the fatal mistake that Landru, the real Verdoux, made when he took his wives to the country house in Normandy where he murdered them. Against the date of the trip in his account book, Landru noted the purchase of two railroad tickets: one roundtrip and the other oneway. Comments Bazin, in this we see that there is a boundary beyond which method and system can place their creator in jeopardy.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: An appraisal of the narcotics problem by the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Although much of the material here can be found in the raft of recent narcotics books, Seymour does offer an extensive description of how the heroin market really works, how law enforcement agencies have attempted to control it, and how the addiets activity affects urban areas. Some will argue with the author's suggestion that the logical response to the spread of narcotics is stiffer penalties by suggesting that if the use of heroin is the result of selfdestructive impulses (as some psychologists maintain) emphasizing its negative consequences won't do much.

title: Music
description: SOME people involved with the Festival of Two Worlds were discussing it the other day, and one of them remarked that it ought to be called the Festival of One World.

title: Jesus Freaks and Other Devouts
description: Religion is the quest for the Real. It is, as the sociologist Peter Berger has observed, a pact that men make against chaos and death. In times of socia: trouble and confusion, manythough by no means allresort to it. And, as at least one study has demonstrated, although persons reared in less devout families in their younger years are not as religious as those whose parents are devout, later on they catch up with those from more devout backgrounds.

title: 12 CHINA VISITORS EMERGE DIVIDED
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 12Twelve members of the Committee for a New China Policy, an American group that advocates recognition of Peking by Washington, disclosed today that they split into two rival factions after they went to China last month.

title: Highway 287, a Midtown Tunnel?
description: MORRISTOWN  If this town has its way, when Interstate Route 287 passes throughout midtown, all that will be noticeable will be the swish of cars as they speed through a tunnel.

title: Fleming Appointed to Post With Motor Sports Group
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Feb. 12 .G. William Fleming was appointed today as general manager of the International Motor Sports Association, a racing club that has its headquarters here.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Agatha Christie, who needs no introduction, recently finished a mystery story featuring her spinsterdetective Jane Marple, who also needs no introduction. Christie started writing in 1915. When NEMESIS (Dodd, Mead, $6.95) was published late last year, it was her 81st bookin the 81st year of her life.

title: U.S. Move to Defer Peace Talks Is Seen As Implicit Warning
description: PARIS, Feb. 12The indefinite postponement of the Paris peace talks by the United States in protest against a threeday antiwar assembly in Versailles is understood to constitute a warning to North Vietnam that Washington is losing interest in the weekly meetings.

title: Five Bruins Score in 51 Rout of Sabres, With Esposito Notching 46th Goal
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (AP)Phil Esposito, the National Hockey League's leading scorer, collected his 46th goal and a pair of assists today in helping the Boston Bruins post a 51 victory over the Buffalo Sabres.

title: SprucedUp Hall Awaits Public At Jersey Boat Show Saturday
description: For the 19th consecutive year, the Jersey Coast Boat Show will open a nineday run next Saturday in oceanfront Convention Hall at Asbury Park. The event extends through Feb. 27.

title: U.S. Makes Its Best Showing In Winter Olympics Since 1952
description: SAPPORO, Feb. 12  I prayed a lot. I asked God to give me the right feeling. When I got on the ice, just tried to enjoy myself, to give everything I've got, and not to give up for one second.

title: A severe case of sycophantiasis
description: During the 1950's John Gruen was a composer as well as a critic of both music and art. His breathless account of the New York cultural scene, The Gruening of the Fifties, leads one to believe that he suffers from cultural emphysema complicated by a severe case of sycophantiasis. Sycophantiasis is a classic form of obsession frequently encountered in those with identity deficiency. It is often a source of envy, superficiality, and trite reminiscences in book form; the latter may constitute the more serious problem.

title: The Avocado Story Revisited
description: Dear Mr. Canaday:

title: Hanoi Claims 2 U. S. Planet
description: SAIGON, Feb. 12 (AP)The Hanoi radio reported today that two United States warplanes were shot down over North Vietnam Thursday and yesterday, but the United States Command said here that it had no reports of any American aircraft lost over the North.

title: American League
description: The American League enters spring training this week minus Frank Robinson and Washington, D. C., plus Dick Allen and Arlington, Tex., and still in possession of Alex Johnson.

title: Sallies Beat Blazers, 12597
description: SEATTLE. Feb. 12 (AP)Seattle's Supersonics moved to within onehalf game of the Golden State Warriors in the Pacific Division of the N.B.A. tonight with a 12597 victory over Portland's Trail Blazers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Caring for Troubled Children

title: Memoirs Of a Fugitive; America's First Antislavery Novel. By Richard Hilcireth. Adapted by Barbara Ritchie. 210 pp. New York: Thomas Y. Crowell Company. $4.50. (Ages 12 and Up)
description: In 1836, 16 years prior to the appearance of America's first millioncopy seller, Uncle Tom's Cabin, or Life Among the Lowly, by Harriet Beecher Stowe, America's real first antislavery novel was published. Because of its wildly radical premise, i.e. that Slavery was totally evil and should be abolished forthwith, the author, Richard Hildreth, young white lawyer, journalist, historian and lifelong abolitionist, was unable to have the novel published through the usual channels and was forced to settle for an unmarked release, without indication of author, publisher, nature or source.

title: Books:
description: LATERAL THINKING FOR MANAGEMENT. By Edward de Bono. American Management Association. 225 pages. $12.50.

title: Ch. Satan Captures Best of Breed in Dachshund Club Specialty Show Here
description: Ch. Satan of Knochnagree bedeviled the 253 other badger dogs at the Knickerbocker Dachshund Club specialty in the Hotel McAlpin yesterday, as the longhaired was named best of breed.

title: FashionA Lot of Pretty Styles in Search of a Party
description: People better give a lot of parties next summer or we're all in trouble, a retailer remarked during the showings of Seventh Avenue's high fashion collections last week. They were, without exception, heavy on the glamour, wafting memories of charity balls or senior proms, depending on your frame of reference.

title: Parseghian to Be Honored Here By Multiple Sclerosis Chapter
description: The first annual championship award of the New York County Chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society will be presented to Ara Parseghian, head football coach of the University of Notre Dame, at dinner May 17 at the New York Hilton.

title: Pooh and Pals in Paper
description: Where does a parent, or a child of any age, start in selecting a good paperback? Until recently the question would have been pointlessso few children's books of quality were available to the ordinary boolzbuyer in paper covers. But this year the field has burgeoned dramatically: There are now more than 3,000 titles on the market. To help in the selection, the children's book editors of this Review offer these choices of what they consider the outstanding paperback titles currently on the market.

title: A Dandy Gives His Name to a Men's Store
description: My betweenSundays job is reporting on the advertising business. I've been at it for more than five years and lately I've started noticing advertising. I've always been quick like that.

title: Connors Upsets Richey
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 12 (AP)Jimmy Connors of Los Angeles upset Cliff Richey last night, 67, 62, 76, and advanced to the semifinal of the $40,000 international open tennis tournament here.

title: Queens Five Tops Pratt As Gripper Collects 2
description: The Queens College Knights brought their wonlost record back up to 500 by defeating Pratt Institute, 9987, on the winners court last night.

title: Plain English foodhighspirited raps
description: An editor of Encounter, an author of four novels and five books of essays, D. J. Enright is a rather anomalous figure on this side of the Atlanticthe man of letters as poet. We're suspicious: Is he or isn't he a poet? Does he take his Poetic calling seriously?

title: Medicine
description: Two decades ago, epidemics of staphylococcal infectiona sometimesfatal illnesswere widespread among newborn infants in hospital nurseries. Then, suddenly, the disease all but disappeared. The reason for the dramatic reversal is not known, but among the favors cited is the wide use in most American hospitals of germicide called hexachlorophene.

title: New Pollution Rule on Trucks Eased
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (AP)The Environmental Protection Agency, bowing to objections from the auto industry, announced yesterday that it was softening its proposed antipollution limits on heavyduty vehicles and delaying their application for one year until 1974.

title: Stan Smith TopSeeded For Clean Air Tennis
description: Stan Smith, the United States Open singles champion, was awarded the topseeded position for the second annual Clean Air Tennis Classic Feb. 21 through 27 at the Seventh Regiment Armory at 66th Street and Park Avenue.

title: 12 L.I. School Units Integration Targets
description: Long Island was accorded a key role in the recommendations of a special state commission outlining steps for the desegregation of the schools in New York State.

title: Excerpts From the Interview With President Bhutto on His Plans for Pakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Feb. 8Following are excerpts from an interview with President Zulfihar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan conducted in English by C. L. Sulzberger of The New York Times.

title: JOB LOSS IS LAID TO GAS SHORTAGE
description: TRENTONNew Jersey is short 200,000 jobs and 200 million cubic feet of natural gas, and state officials fear there is a definite correlation.

title: CHURCHES COUNCIL SCORES TAX CODE
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Feb. 12The National Council of Churches charged the Internal Revenue Service today with attempting to prevent religious bodies from spelking out on public issues.

title: Gretchen Mercur Whitehead Is Bride of Roger Maynard Jr.
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 12 Miss Gretchen Mercur Whitehead, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Van Cleve Whitehead Jr. of Princeton, and Holderness, N. H., was married here this afternoon to Roger Maynard Jr., son of Mrs. Maynard of Wilton, Conn., and the hate Mr. Maynard, who was executive vice president of Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York.

title: EXPERT QUESTIONS ACCOUNT BY IRVING
description: They've got the most expensive dead horse there is.

title: 12 States VI/anted Of Loss of Funds On Billboard Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12The Department of Transportation has threatened to cut off $138million in highway funds for 12 states for alleged failure to comply with Federal guidelines on highway billboards.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon's Appointment In Peking.
description: DURING the palmy days of the European dynasties, kings and emperors, soVereigns of all titles and descriptions, were accustomed to visit one another's courts. Between jousting and feasting, they attended to their family affairsarranging royal marriages, launching intrigues against rivals, meddling in the management of small neighboring realms and discussing their financial and commercial troubles. Then gradually, beginning in the 15th century, systematic machinery was established to deal with most of this business. Under the leadership of Venice, the Italian citystates established permanent diplomatic missions in one another's capitals, and, with Spanish and French refinements, a modern apparatus for the conduct of intergovernmental business began to emerge, complete not only with permanent diplomatic missions but modern foreign offices, manned by diplomats of professional

title: Rediscovering Catalina Island: Hot Dog Stctncis, Hibiscus, Buffaloes
description: AVALON, Calif.There was a time, in the 1920's and 1930's, and even before, when Catalina Island, rising like some mountainous kingdom out of the Pacific, just 24 miles off busy, growing Los Angeles, was the big tourist attraction In Southern California.

title: Stevens Is Meeting New Social Needs
description: HOBOKEN  Born in the era of the Iron Horse, the Stevens Institute of Technology has entered its second century committed to make spaceago science meaningful to a society that has begun to question its worth. Most notable in the effort is the new curriculum Stevens will offer in the fall to bring advanced technology into the context of social needs.

title: Television
description: ONE of the best news hours on television has been the CBS Morning News With John Hart. Note, please, that has been, Tomorrow morning the program will be adopting a new format, and the result may or may not continue to be one of the best news hours on television. The change itself, however, provides some insight into the nature of TV economics and broadcast journalism.

title: State Police:
description: ATLANTA.When most Southern states bowed to external pressure in recent years and integrated their state police for the first time, only Alabama and Mississippi refused to break the color line.

title: Gardens
description: DECORATING the home with plants is no longer confined to a few indestructible tropical foliage specimens. Decorating with flowers is no longer restricted to shortlived florists gift plants or cut flowers.

title: The Avocado Story Revisited
description: John Canaday's personal account of his life with an avocado plant (Jan. 23) rewarded him with such a mountain of mail, Mr. Cancuiay is about ready to request a moratorium on avocado pen pals. Nonetheless, some of the mail has been enlightening, as follows beginning with a letter that Mr. Canaday describes as shattering.Ed.

title: Some Things Fierce And Fatal; Edited by Joan Kahn. 246 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $4.95. (Ages 12 to 16)
description: An hour or two spent curled up with Some Things Fierce and Fatal will serve to introduce young readers to the uneasy pleasures and anxious delights of suspense fiction. This collection of 14 stories ranges from ghost tales through true crime to fantasy. Best of the 14 is Edith Whartor's gothic, yet strangely moving, tale of a sequestered lady, her faithful dogs and the woeful ghosts of Kerfol. Equally atmospheric and thick with the menace of the marsh that forms its setting is Bret Harte's HighWater Mark. And Ray Bradbury's Invisible Boy is here to re; mind us again of that author's wild talent for embellishing psychological reality with the high color of his antic imagination.

title: Courage And Hesitation
description: To the Editor

title: She Wanted Wings and Won Her Own
description: BARRANQUILLA, Colombia, Feb. 12  Angelika Chand, a 31yearold widow and the mother of a 13yearold daughter, believes that she is the only woman airline pilot in Latin America and possibly in the Western Hemisphere, and one of the few anywhere in the world.

title: An Exiled Horseman Is Spending Another Winter of Discontent
description: The name of his ski lodge is Norway, but Howard (I3uddy) Jacobson considers it Siberia.

title: Queens Wins City U. Crown In Track 3d Year in a Row
description: Queens College swept eight of 10 events to capture the annual City University of New York indoor track and field championship for the third straight time yesterday. The meet was held at the Queens gymnasium.

title: Surgeon Cautions Public On Flowing Winter Scarfs
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (AP) Those long, flowing winter scarfs may be fashionable, but they can also be dangerous, according to a Boston plastic surgeon.

title: Stamps
description: CLOSE on the heels of the Winter Olympic Games in Sapporo, Japan, Canada will be host to the World Figure Skating Championships in Calgary, Alberta, March 612. On March 1 Canada will release an 8cent purple stamp, art by the Design Workshop, Toronto, in commemoration of the event, the third time the championships have been staged in Canada. Previous sites have been Montreal (1932) and Vancouver (1960).

title: Miss Haberle Becomes Bride
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 12Miss Mary Patricia Haberle was married here this morning to Michael Hart Davis, a student at the University of Baltimore Law School. The Rev. Perry C. Burton performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Redeemer.

title: St. Louis Airport Plan Stirs Dispute
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 12  Participants in a highly emotional dispute over the location of the St. Louis region's proposed new passenger airport have been urged by a key Federal official to settle their differences.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In an article about a Bronx landlord, Tom Cuevas [Jan. 23], the statement is made that Mr. Cuevas help was enlisted by the Bronx office of the Legal Aid Society, which collects rents while repairs were made at 850860 East 161st Street.

title: Hodgson Is Not Invited To A.F.L.C.I.O. Parley
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 12 (AP)For the first time in the 17year history of the A.F.L.C.I.O., its leaders have not asked the Secretary of Labor to speak at the annual minter meeting, Which opens here on Monday.

title: Literary Hoaxes Out of the Past
description: Literary hoaxes are a dubious but at least timehonored human endeavor, probably as old as literature itself.

title: John Crews, G.O.P. Boss In Brooklyn, Faces Fight
description: Another signal that a political era is ending.

title: A.C.L.U. Is Under Attack For New Activist Stands
description: The American Civil Liberties Union, which for nearly 52 years has been defending the rights of others to speak out freely on any issue, now finds, as it undergoes dramatic change, critics attacking its own right to take stands on such issues as the war in Vietnam.

title: The World
description: SAIGON  The Saigon Government came down with a severe case of nerves last week, so intense that President Nixon gave personal, reassurances to President Nguyen Van Thieu that the United States would not negotiate his country out from under him,.

title: Discharged Mental Patients Create Problems in State
description: Nearly 50,000 patients of state mental hospitals are being dischttrged every year, creating Increasingly severe social and economic problems for the communities to which they return.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.C.L.A. Wins in Rugby
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12 (AP) The University of California, Los Angeles, rugby team ran its 1972 record to nine victories and no losses today by heating the University of British Columbia, 227.

title: News of the Rialto
description: HIGH in the hills or Hollywood is a huge sign that spells out the name of that nolongerso legendary city it celebrates. It matters here because the sign has something to do with a girl named Mary C. Brown, a fictitious character, to be sure, yet symbolic of the legions of real young girls who rode into Hollywood with dreams of becoming a movie star. What happens to Mary C. Brown in her quest and how It came about that she fell or jumped from the letter H In the sign is the subject of a new musical by Dory Previn, former wife of conductorcomposer Andre Previn and, if you didn't know, a triplethreat talent in her own

title: New Novel
description: One somehow expects Peter Rabbitt to pop out of one of Miss Read's thatched cottages, and start chatting up the various applechecked parties who staff this Beatrix Potter world. Peter doesn't show, of course, but I feel he's hippetyhopping behind a convenient hedgerow, keeping a pink eye on Dr. Martin (that wise old friend), Mr. Patridge the vicar, Mr. Lamb the postmaster, and the other V.I.P.'s of Beech Green, where the action is in the latest Miss Read special.

title: Recordings
description: IN a season of concertgoing in any major city these days, the evenings devoted to the art of lieder are not exactly without number. Chances are that when they come around, the recognized jewels of Schubert, Schumann, Brahms, Strauss and Wolf will be taken out of their cases for everyone's rightful admiration. No one will ever complain about an authoritative Winterreise, Frauenliebe und Leben or the Itallenisches Liederbuch, but one wonders what lieder concerts might be like if they were as common as piano recitals. Would we get the equivalent of Alkan and Scriabin revivals? And just wbat relatively unfamiliar lieder riches await us if the challenge should be delivered

title: Nassau Expands Recreation Program
description: MINEOLA, L. I.County Executive Ralph G. Caso has announced that the county's mobile recreation program will be cm a yearround sC hedule.

title: Books:
description: CONFESSIONS OF A STOCKBROKER. By Brutus. Little, Brown & Co. 263 pages. $6.95.

title: NAVY FENCERS BEAT COLUMBIA, 14 TO 13
description: Navy's undefeated fencing team won seven of nine epee bouts to upend previously unbeaten Columbia, 1413, yesterday in University Gymnasium. The Lions fought from a 135 deficit, winning eight of the final nine bouts, but dropped the match when John Lasken of the Middies defeated Howard Perrone in epee. Bruce Soriano of Columbia and Lasken had perfect 30 afternoons.

title: National Commission to Propose Legal Private Use of Marijuana
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 The National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse has unanimously decided to recommend that all criminal penalties for the private use and possession of marijuana be eliminat ed.

title: Two Views of Jesus
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 12Following are the two controversial passages about Jesus in The Antiquities of the Jews, a firstcentury history by Flavius Josephus. The Greek text has long been dismissed by Christian scholars as a forgery. The Arabic text, newly discovered in a 10thcentury manuscript, has been called an earlier and more authentic version by two Hebrew University scholars.

title: Child to Justino Diazes
description: A daughter was born Jan. 26 to Justin Diaz, the Metropolitan Opera bass, and Mrs. Diaz of New York in Roosevelt Hospital, Mrs. Diaz is the former Anna Aragno. The child has been named Katya.

title: Pity the AlmostThere Playwright
description: THERE are funds available these daysfrom the Government, from endowed municipal theaters, from foundationsto help the playwright become a playwright. There aren't enough funds, and of course there never will be. But a sense of responsibility has been growing, and it's already helped a great deal. There is, however, one bad gap in all the giving. Almost nothing is available to the one man who might profit from it most: the playwright who is just on the point of making a professional breakthrough.

title: The Wonderful World Of Women's Wear Daily
description: A switchedon, withit history of Women's Wear Daily by Katie Kelly, who seems to be under the influence of Tom Wolfe. There is a good portrait of John Fairchild, heir to the Fairchild publishing empire, who is credited with jazzing up WWD's news coverage with gossip about what the very rich are wearing

title: Unitarian Church Wins Court Round For Course on Sex
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 12  A Unitarian church here has won a significant round in its court battle to start an explicit sex education course in its Sunday School.

title: Canadians Triumph, 6.5
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 12 (UN)Guy Lafleur scored the 22d goal, of his rookie season with just 22; seconds remaining today to break a 5all tie and give the Montreal Canadiens a 65 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: Japan's Economic Interest Seen Behind 2Man Mission to Hanoi
description: TOKYO, Feb. I2A Japanese mission to Hanoi is being interpreted as a move more in Japan's economic selfinterest than an effort to help President Nixon achieve a political settlement in Vietnam.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: It was a Friday evening, Several men huddled intently over a poker table. The last bet had been made and called. The time had come for the players to show their cards.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: BAD FAITH

title: Portions of Irving's Book Like Hughes Aide's Story
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 12Comparisons made today show that large sections of Clifford Irving's work about Howard R. Hughes are almost exactly like material presented in a manuscript based on the recollections of Noah Dietrich, who once worked for Mr. Hughes.

title: LAWRENCE S. JORDAN
description: DANBURY, Conn., Feb. 12Lawrence S. Jordan, former executive vice president of the Philippine Desiccated Coconut Corporation, died yesterday of a stroke. His age was 56.

title: Snowmobile Regulation On U.S. Land Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (AP)President Nixon has ordered four Federal agencies to regulate the use of snowmobiles and other offroad vehicles on Federal land.

title: Harris Forms Citizen Panel On Power of Corporations
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI)  Senator Fred R. Harris, Democrat of Oklahoma, announced today the establishment of a citizens board of inquiry to examine what he termed the growing concentration of political and economic power by large corporations.

title: Italy Announces Recognition
description: ROME, Feb. 12The Italian Government announced today that it had recognized Bangladesh and would establish diplomatic relations with the regime in Dacca at once.

title: Movie Theater Without Walls
description: Everything You Always Wanted to Know about film is now available in paperback. Or rather, almost anything previously reported in hard covers. Heretofore, film items had so little clout in the reprint market that Paperbound Books in Print could list them under Drama Screen 8t Television Plays  adding in the insult of association with an inferior form the injury of alliance with a rival. Now; mounting production figures have had their reward: PBP's latest edition lists film under Performing Arts.

title: Child for the Handlers
description: A daughter was born Feb. 4 to Mr. and Mrs. R. Arnold Handler of New York in the Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Handler is the former Miss Florence Smolen.

title: First Congressional Restraints Are Imposed on C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12The foreign aid authorization bill, signed by President Nixon on Monday, includes for the first time itt a quartercentury new controls on the operations, cost and personnel of the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: LITTLE WILLIE WINS FIRST TIME
description: READINGTON, N. J., Feb. I2Lori Villa of Scotch Plains, N. J., and her mount, Little Willie, captured their first championship today when they won the novice working hunter title at the Four Seasons Farm Horse Show.

title: Lafayette Five Wins
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Feb. 12 (AP)Tracy Tripucka scored 26 points today in leading Lafayette to an 8474 victory over Bucknell in a collge basketball game. Lafayette has a 173 wonlost record.

title: Teacher Is Fiance of Ellen B. Banash
description: SWAMPSCOTT, Mass., Feb. 12Mr. and Mrs. Leonard D. Banash of Swampscott and North Conway, N. H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Beth Banash, to John Frederick Boneparth. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Boneparth of New York. A wedding this spring is planned.

title: Elizabeth, on River Cruise, Is Nearly Mobbed by Thais
description: AYUDIIYA, Thailand, Feb. 12 (Reuters)Queen Elizabeth went on a twohour picnic cruise along the Chao Phraya river through this ancient capital today.

title: JAKARTA TIGHTENS AUSTRALIAN TIES
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 12 Deeper Australian involvement in Indonesia, this country's nearest neighbor and most recent enemy, is expected to follow the state visit this week of President Suharto, the first Indonesian head of state to come here.

title: Slips at the Summit
description: Two famous incidents illustrate the perils of summitry. In 1520, Henry VIII of England met Francis I of France at the Field of the Cloth of Gold near Calais for three weeks of games, feasting and negotiation. The preparations were elaborate, with Henry and his entourage lodged in a sumptuous temporary palace built especially for that purpose.

title: Happy St.Valentineis Day!
description: 1 To help redress some of the sexism built into the English language would you wince if the pronoun she were substituted randomly for the universal he? (Example: A citizen may vote if she s over 18.)

title: Steelers Bradshaw Marriesi
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 12 (AP)Terry Bradshaw, the Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback, married the former Melissa Babish, 19 yearg old. of Pittsburgh today. The bride was Miss Teenage America in 1969 and now is a student at the University of Pittsburgh.

title: New Novel
description: Jefferson McGraw is the kind of kid who lived in the old Clare Briggs cartoonsa frecklefaced, barefoot, catfishcatching, oldswimming hole, Huckleberry Finn kind of kid. Mr. Hill's idealized country boy lives in Cottonwood, Okla. in the summer of 1927. There are 341 folks in Cottonwood432 if you add a transient escaped convictbut the author's cast is various enough to make a 12yearold's life mighty interesting.

title: Miss Nancy Jay Reynolds Wed In Bronxville to Martin Whelan
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Feb. 12Miss Nancy Jay Reynolds, daughter of Warren J. Reynolds, publisher of Parade magazine, the Sunday newspaper supplement, and of Mrs. Reynolds of Bronxville, was married here this afternoon to Martin James Whelan, son of Mrs. John M. Whelan of Philadelphia and the late Mr. Whelan.

title: SWINDLE FEARED BY MY IN AKRON
description: AKRON, Ohio, Feb. 12It all started when an Akron lawyer, Don Lowers, promised a 30 per cent return on loans In 30 to 90 ddys.

title: On Bogota's Luxury Train, You Might Have to Get Out and Push
description: BARRANQU1LLA, ColombiaYou can fly the GOO miles from here to Bogota in an hour by jet, but my wife and I and our three children, aged 6, 9 and 11, did it the bard way28 hours by trainand we never had so much fun in our lives. It's roughand odd things happen, as you will seebut it's still one of the best ways in the world of getting to know Colombia and its people.

title: RUBINSTEIN GIVES A CHOPIN RECITAL
description: The minute I reach Chopin, said Artur Rubinstein in radio interview some years ago, there is a sort of magic coming out of the piano. Something becomes completely naturalthe fingers become natural, the sound becomes natural.

title: When the Guardians Sleep
description: Ever since an unwilling Congress was shamed into passing it in 1925, the Corrupt Practices Act has gone unenforced. Reports on campaign expenditures were filed by candidates for the House and Senate but they were often late and usually incomplete if not downright misleading. When no reports were filed  and many members of Congress regularly fail to file  the Clerk of the House and the Secretary of the Senate took no action. The Justice Department under successive Administrations of both parties invariably closed its eyes.

title: Sears Sees a Chance to Pioneer
description: BOONTON  New Jersey has such a great opportunity to pioneer, an opportunity to move out ahead of the rest of the country that we should not ignore it.

title: National League
description: Surrounded by the sights and sounds of winter sports, baseball will make its annual rise to the surface this week in 24 springtraining camps from Florida to California. The big question: Who gained most from a winter of the heaviest trading of players in history?

title: Photography
description: wNILE looking at Paul Caponigro's prints at the Witkin Gallery, I found myself thinking of them as gemlike. That word accurately describes my response to them, and pinpoints the source of an ambivalence I feel toward much of his work in this current exhibit.

title: Miss Claire Clark To Be Wed June 24
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 12Mr. and Mrs. Earl M. Clerk of St. Petersburg and Damariscotta, Me., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Claire Lee Clark, to Thomas Cress Distler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Waldemar J. Distler of Harbor Bluffs, formerly of Bronxville, N.Y.

title: Providence Wins Award
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (AP)The National Fire Protection Association has named Providence, R. I., as the American winner in its 45th Annual Fire Prevention Contest. The association said Tuesday that the award was given each year to the community judged to have the best yearround Community efforts to reduce fires and to educate the public in fire prevention practices.

title: Music
description: SCOTT JOPLIN is in the news again. The Joplin renaissance started about two years ago with the recording by Joshua Rifkin of a group of Joplin's piimo rags. Suddenly everybody woke up to the fact that Joplin was a real composer with something to offer. Those bittersweet rags, with their syncopations and evocative turnofthecentury melodies, and with their astont tingly imaginettive harmonies, and with their recreation of a period in American life, and as the work of a black composerall this added up to a phenomenon that was greeted with admiration and delight. In short order came more ragtime recordings, including a disk of Joplin himself in some pianola rolls he had cut in 1916. There were Joplin concerts, and the pianist Alan Mandel las been touring Europe with

title: The Nation
description: The battered Pay Board has spent its first three months slithering around blind corners, with no one yet sure whether the turns are carrying it closer to success or to collapse. The answer may become much clearer whenand ifthe wage controllers get around the slipperiest corner of all, a ruling on the fat settlement tentatively reached last week in the marathon West Coast dock strike.

title: Judge Voids Georgia Law Banning Mixed Marriages
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 12 (AP)A Federal judge has ruled that Georgia's laws against racially mixed marriages are unconstitutional.

title: The World
description: The crown of St. Stephen, the thousandyearold symbol of Hungarian nationhood, has deeply emotional significance to many Hungarians. At the end of World War II it was turned over to the United States Army for safekeeping and hidden in a place known only to the American President, the Pope and a few officials.

title: What Women Psychoanalysts Say About W m nits Liberati

title: Susan P. Galvin, Spencer Hall Jr. Are Wed Here
description: Miss Susan Patricia Galvin was married here yesterday afternoon to Spencer Gilbert Hall Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hall of Dillsburgh, Pa., and Chester, N. S.
