title: Do We Really Want a Space Shuttle?
description: OAKLAND, Calif.President Nixon's recent authorization of a $1Oto$14billion space shuttle has finally brought this budding program to public attention. More than $200 million has already been quietly appropriated for shuttle development. The $10to$14billion total required to purchase and run the system through the nineteeneighties represents a Federal outlay about twenty times that requested for the supersonic transport (SST) that was defeated by the Senate.

title: The Day a River Blocked Streams of Traffic
description: There were a few eerie moments at the confluence of Seventh Avenue and 40th Street during the rush hour yesterday morning. Crowds stood speechless on the sidewalks looking down into the water like Hindu pilgrims on the banks of the Ganges and the loudest sound was the whooshing of the water.

title: Hawks Win, 113105
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15 (AP)A surge in the third period powered the Atlanta Hawks to a 113105 victory over the Detroit Pistons in a National Basketball Association game tonight. Walt Bellamy and Don Adams paced the uprising, which broke up a tight battle after the Hawks had led at the half, 5653.

title: Key Senators Bar Busing Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (UPI) Senator Mike Mansfield of Montana and Senator Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania said today that an amendment to the Constitution was the wrong approach to deal with forced busing to desegregate schools. The two Senators agreed with Vice President Agnew, who has also opposed a constitutional amendment to resolve the problem of busing.

title: Manescu Reported to Deny All Knowledge of Execution
description: VIENNA, Feb. 15 (Reuters)The Rumanian Embassy here said that Foreign Minister Corneliu Manescu denied all knowledge today of the reported execution of a Rumanian general, Ion Serb, for having passed defense secrets to the Soviet Union.

title: U.S. BARS SESSION OF PEACE TALKS
description: PARIS, Feb. 15 (AP)The United States and South Vietnam formally advised the Communist side at the Vietnam peace talks today of their refusal to attend a conference session this week and left up in the air when they would participate again.

title: Lin Lerner Shares A Dance Program With Betsy Wetzig
description: An infusion of Tibetan culture, some interesting sculpture and improvisation were the elements used by Lin Lerner and Betsy Wetzig to create their joint program at the Cubiculo Monday evening.

title: Bill to Legalize Marijuana Gets A Little More Backing in Albany
description: ALBANY, Feb. 15For the third year in a row, a bill that would make marijuana as legal as liquor was announced today by a Democratic Manhattan Assemblyman. This time he had the backing of an organized lobby.

title: FRANKLYN I. STEINBERG
description: Franklyn I. Steinberg, founder and president of the Plymouth Securities Corporation, Exchange Place, Jersey City, died Monday of a heart attack while on vacation in Zermatt, Switzerland. He was 44 years old and lived at 45 Gurley Road, Stamford, Conn.

title: The China Trade
description: President Nixon's move to further broaden United StatesChinese trade opportunities on the eve of his departure for Peking was a timely token of his desire to normalize relations with the People's Republic China. On its side, China has indicated its own interest in economic mutual aid. There is a possibility of an emerging compatibility between Chinese and American political and economic interests.

title: PollutionControl System
description: The Union Carbide Corpora. tion said yesterday that it had begun marketing an airpollution control system to remove mercury from gas streams. Union Carbide mid that the system would help chlorine producers to meet the recently proposed Federal mercury airemission standard of five pounds a day per plant.

title: Israel Verifies Outside Bid for Talks With Egypt
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 15Premier Golda Meir's office in Jerusalem said tonight that an unidentified mediator had recently made an unsuccessful attempt through Dr. Nahum Goldmann to arrange a highlevel meeting between Israelis and Egyptians.

title: Dog Writers Elect Barcus
description: Harvey Barcus of the Detroit News was elected president of the Dog Writers Association of America yesterday.

title: BRUINS WIN, 63, PAD HOME STREAK
description: BOSTON, Feb. 15 (AP) Bobby Orr set up four of five firstperiod goals by Boston tonight and the Bruins went on to a 63 National Hockey League victory over the California Golden Seals in extending their home unbeaten streak to 23 games.

title: Details of the First Phase Of Nixon's Trip Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15The White House made public today a more detailed itinerary than the one announced yesterday, covering the early stages of President Nixon's trip to China.

title: Quarter Sales Also Dip
description: Sales and earnings of R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., de. cliried in the fourth quarter of 1971 but results for the full year advanced to a record, the company announced yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: At Young & Rubicam they tend to think of themselves as the best bill payers in the business. They'd like to be better, especially in the area of spot TV, which happens to be the biggest headache in advertising.

title: Rockefeller
description: ALBANY, Feb. 13Governor Rockefeller urged New York City's Board of Higher Education today to impose tuition at the City University. He conceded, as Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea Jr. did yesterday  that the Legislature would not impose it this year at the traditionally tuitionfree school.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mafia Raids on Business Outlined to Jersey Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Feb. 15  The State Commission of Investigation, seeking to show that organized crime was no longer concentrated in the big cities, heard testimony here today on how reputed Mafia leaders were trying to infiltrate business and government in such rural areas

title: Blue Is Offered $50,000 But He Wants $115,000
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 15 (UPI)Charles 0. Finley, owner of the Oakland Athletics, said today he had offered $50,000 contract to Vida Blue but the ace hurler wanted $115,000.

title: Edgar Snow Dies; Wrote About China
description: Edgar Snow, the American journalist who had been on cordial terms with China's Communist leaders since interviewing them as struggling revolutionaries in 1936, died of cancer yesterday at his home in the village of Eysins, Switzerland. He was 66 years old and had been living there since 1959.

title: RICHARD A. WILLIAMS
description: Richard A. Williams, retired marine claims manager of Frenkel & Co., insurance brokers of 156 William Street, died Monday at his home, 11525 84th Avenue, Richmond Hills, Queens, after a long illness. He was 68 years old.

title: Windward Passage Wins
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 15 (AP)Windward Passage crossed the finish line at Acapulco first today, winning the annual yacht race from San Diego.

title: In the N.B.A., Detroit Is a OneWhistle Stop
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15 (AP)Only one referee, Jack Madden, showed up tonight for the Detroit PistonsAtlanta Hawks National Basketball Association game at Cobo Arena.

title: In the Male World of Islam, an Occasional Feminist War Cry
description: KARACHI, Pakistanin a downtown hotel recently, a woman stepped to a podium and told an audience of other women that those fighting against changes in marriage laws were a reactionary group of people whose main aim in life seems to be the suppression of women.

title: Others Seen Following
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, the nation's largest bank specializing in wholesale banking for the corporate carriage trade, announced yesterday a reduction in its minimum businessloan rate to 4 per cent from 4 per cent.

title: Pentagon Offers Aid in F.C.C. Study Of A.T &T's Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15The Defense Department has offered to step in and help the Federal Communications Commission, which at one time said that it lacked the resources to investigate the giant American Telephone and Telegraph Company and then under pressure reversed its decision.

title: Something Different Tried in a Brahms Concerto
description: The two sides of Daniel Barenboim made a startling contrast in the Cleveland Orchestra concert Monday night in Carnegie Hall. For the Brahms D minor Piano Concerto, with Radu Lupu at the keyboard, it was Dr. Jekyll on the podium. For the Beethoven Seventh Symphony it was Mr. Hyde. Not since the famous

title: PAY BOARD MEMBER WAS HOST TO BOLDTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP) George H. Boldt, chairmanof the Pay Board, confirmedtoday that he and his wife had been guests of one of the

title: Asks Views on Brokers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15.The Securities and Exchange Commission told the nation's stock exchanges today that they would have to prove the validity of their case if they wanted to keep, as members, any brokerage firm that does more than 20 per cent of its business with an affiliated organization.

title: Incidental Slaughter
description: A Senate Commerce subcommittee has opened hearings on bills to protect ocean mammals. Chances for passage of an effective measure are still very much alive because of the wise refusal of the House last December to be stampeded into passage of a relatively weak bill favored by commercial fishermen and hunters.

title: Ellen S. Kitzis Fiancee of Steven Levy
description: WOODBURY, L. I. Feb. 19 Norma L. Kitzis of Woodbury and Dr. Donald Kitzis of Melville have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Sara Kitzis, to Steven Edward Levy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin FL Levy of New York.

title: Tony Ziluca Weds Mrs. Jeanie Brown
description: Mrs. Jeanie Renchard Brown of Darien, Conn., was married in Sun Valley, Idaho, last Wednesday to Tony Garibaldi Ziluca of Greenwich, Conn., senior vice president of Bache & Co., international stockbrokers. The ceremony at Sun Valley Lodge was performed by the Rev. Spencer Page, a Presbyterian minister.

title: Term Papers for Sale
description: Commercial trading in term papers, though by no means a new phenomenon, has become more brazen and apparently more profitable. Shady merchants of such papers advertise in student newspapers and, in their public statements, try to give the impression that they are engaged in a legitimate business.

title: L.I.U. Triumphs, 6I45
description: Harvey Smith scored 20 points and grabbed 10 rebounds to pace Long Island University to a 6145 victory over Northeastern University last night at Founders Hall Gymnasium, Brooklyn. The triumph was the 11th in 21 games for L.I.U., while the loss dropped Northeastern to a 99 record.

title: MILLS IN NEW HAMPSHIRE: Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Arkansas Democrat, with an admirer on the floor of the House chamber after addressing the Legislature.
description: CONCORD, N. H., Feb. 15.Representative Wilbur D. Mills said today that he would amend his revenuesharing bill so as to remove a clause that would penalize states with no income tax.

title: No Rest for the Dog Handlers
description: The grooming area for Jane and Bob Forsyth, two famed professional dog handlers, was the busiest place in the exhibition hall of Madison Square Garden yesterday. Work on preparing dogs for the Westminster Kennel Club show ring was being done in almost assemblyline fashion.

title: 5 Plays by Blacks Slated
description: Five Black Visions, a program of five oneactors by black playwrights, will be presented by the New York Shakespeare Festival at the Public Theater on March 12. The plays are by Ed Bulling, Neil Harris, Sonia Sanchez, William Adell Stevenson 3d and Richard Wesley. Gloria Foster will appear in the program, which will be directed by Novella Nelson and Kris Keiser.

title: Armed Forces Oust Ecuador President In a Bloodless Coup
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Wednesday, Feb. I6Military leaders overthrew President Jose Maria Velasco Ibarra in a coup d'etat last night.

title: Pennsy Lists Needs In Reorganization
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company told the Federal District Court in Philadelphia yesterday that it was their carefully considered conclusion that the carrier could be successfully reorganized.

title: Bordaberry Is Proclaimed Uruguay's PresidentElect
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 15 (AP)Juan M. Bordaberry, a wealthy, 44yearold conservative rancher, was officially proclaimed Presidentelect of Uruguay today. He will serve a fiveyear term beginning on March I, as successor to President Jorge Pacheco Areco.

title: Welfare Is.: A Problem For Housing
description: The citystate plan to develop Welfare Island into one of the most spectacular urban communities In the world has acquired so many problems during construction that questions are being raised about whether it should have been attempted.

title: A Correction
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15As a result of an error in transmission it was reported in yesterday's Washington Record that Robert Anderson had been confirmed as the United States Ambassador to Trinidad and Tobago. Mr. Anderson was confirmed as the United States Ambassador to Dahomey. Anthony D. Marshall was confirmed as the United States Ambassador to Trinidad and Tobago.

title: Stage: Goin a Buffalo
description: COIN A BUFFALO, a Play by Ed (Wilms. DIrectnd by Hurl') Gittens; selling by Bob Olson; costumes by Robert Tadlock; lighting by David Adams; production stage manager, Louis A. Rigler. Presented by W.P.A. (Workshop of the Players Art) at 333 Bowery (between Second and Third Streets).

title: Cyprus Delays Reply to Greece; Thousands Rally for Makarios
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Feb. 15Thousands of Greek Cypriotes loyal to their President, Archbishop Makarios. rallied today in the streets or the capital, as his Government withheld formal reply to Greece's demands for a stronger voice in Cyprus affairs.

title: INSTITUTIONS GET AVERAGE RATING
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 15 Two Wharton School professors who in 1970 concluded that the investment performance of mutual funds was no better than the stock market as a whole have expanded their thesis to include all Institutional investors.

title: SENATE REJECTS A POLICING ROLE BY JOB BIAS BIT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15The Senate reversed itself today and decided that the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission should not have enforcement powers of its own but should rely on the Federal courts to stop discrimination practices.

title: Cahill Signs Residency sill
description: TRENTON, Feb. 15 (AP) Gov. William T. Cahill signed into law today a controversial package of bills to permit policemen and firemen to reside outside the communities where, they are assigned to work.

title: INTELLIGENCE
description: Arica Institute (212) 4807430ADVT.

title: Huge Main Bursts, Flooding Times Sq. Area
description: A 48inch castiron water main cracked under Broadway and 40th Street yesterday morning, sending five million gallons of water cascading for two and a half hours through the lower Times Square area and causing massive disruptions.

title: Bombing Linked to Rise in Infiltration Rate
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 15Highranking sources report that the decision to bomb Communist base areas at the border of Laos and South Vietnam was based on intelligence reports showing that more North Vietnamese troops were moving south this month than in any previous month.

title: Lakers Beat Royals
description: . OS ANGELES, Feb. 15 (AP) Los Angeles got 82 points from three backcourt men tonight as the Lakers throttled the Cincinnati Royals, 125118. Gail Goodrich scored 31 points, Jerry West added 24 and Pat Riley, a reserve guard, scored 27, a career high.

title: Close to 1969 Outlay
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15The General Motors Corporation plans spending of $1.1billion in 1992, up from $1billion last year and in line with the company's capital spending in 1969.

title: ELDERLY PUPILS GRADUATE HERE
description: The ceremonies began with cheese blintzes and ended with potato pancakes. And, in between, 13 women in their sixties, seventies and eighties received certificates of completion for courses they took under the auspices of New York City Community College.

title: DR. A. W. SCHOENLEBER
description: Dr. A. W. Schoenleber, who retired in 1943 as medical director of Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died Sunday in Winter Park, Fla. He was 83 years old.

title: 6 PAINTINGS STOLEN FROM ZANUCK SUITE
description: A halfdozen paintings said by the police to be worth $30000 were reported stolen last night from the Plaza Hotel suite of Darryl F Zanuck, the movie producer.

title: Executive Changes
description: USLIFE Corporation announced last night that Marden Miller, president and chief administrative officer, has been elected to the added post of president and chief executive officer of the United States Life Insurance Company, a subsidiary. He succeeds Richard A. Hess, who joined the company about a year ago. USLIFE said Mr. Hess resigned for personal reasons.

title: Evaluating Drug Programs
description: One of the most pressing needs in dealing with the nation's drug abuse problem is for solid information and honest evaluation of the countless ongoing antiaddiction efforts. In New York City, as many as one hundred programs dealing with drug abuse continue receive public funds without an adequate accounting how these funds are being spent. Government, particularly New York City's government, has singularly failed to conduct the hard evaluation so essential to effectiveness and the retention of public confidence.

title: U.S. RENEWS RAIDS AFTER CEASEFIRE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 15 (AP)United States 852 bombers resumed their attacks in South Vietnam today shortly after the end of a 24hour allied ceasefire for Tet, the Lunar New Year.

title: Big WaterMain Breaks Inevitable,City Aide Says
description: A large water main breaklike the one yesterday at 40th Street and Broadway  is viewed by city officials as one of New York's inevitable and acceptable crises.

title: Only Muskie and McGovern Enter Full Slates of Delegates in Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 15 Of the 10 Democratic candidates who announced their intention last month to seek delegates in the Pennsylvania Presidential primary on April 25, ouly Senators Edmund S. Muskie of Maine and George McGovern of South Dakota entered full delegate slates at the filing deadline today.

title: 8 Named for PlaywrightinResidence Grants
description: The Rockefeller Foundation has set aside $200,000 to underwrite a threeyear program of assistance to playwrights in residence at selected regional and university theaters.

title: COURT CONTINUES ORDER ON PHONES
description: A temporary order barring new increases in telephone rates was extended in Federal Court here yesterday pending a further decision on the city's move to block higher telephone charges.

title: Copter Overturns In Rescue of Man Off Carnarsie Pier
description: A police helicopter flipped over yesterday while skimming over Jamaica Bay on a rescue mission. Passing patrolmen and a fireman pulled the craft's observer from beneath a pontoon, cut the pilot loose from his submerged bubble seat and pulled an unconscious manthe object of the rescue missionfrom the water.

title: Rutgers Beats Army
description: WEST POINT, Feb. 15Two free throws by Vin Roundtree gave Rutgers a 3point lead with eight seconds remaining and enabled the Scarlet Knights to register a 7372 victory over Army tonight.Roundtree set a career mark of 23 points to pace Rutgers, and Steve Kaplan got 18. Game honors went to Army's Bob Sherwin, with 25 points. Rutgers has a 109 wonlost mark and Army is 1010.

title: Job Training Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP) The Senate passed today a bill to assure continuation of job training programs through 1973. The bill, sent to the House, would extend the programs one year past the Dec. 30, 1972, deadline set in the manpower development and training law.

title: Barry Scores 50 Points But Nets Lose to Stars
Irish Alumni Digging for Digger
description: What do the alumni do to a winning coach who inherits a team with a winning tradition and then proceeds to lose two games by 65 and 56 points on the way to a 614 wonlost record?

title: When It Comes to Food, at Least, Chinese Still Cling to the Past
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Only one thing is perfectly clear about what will happen to President Nixon after he touches down on the Chinese mainland next Monday. He will be treated to a series of magnificent meals fit for a king in the world's most populous and otherwise most puritanical Communist state.

title: Notes on People
description: In a ceremony at St. Peter's Basilica marking the beginning of Lent, Pope Paul VI bowed to receive a cross of ashes. Then the Pontiff himself marked close aides with the symbolic ashes.

title: SENATE ASKS CURB ON SECRET PACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The Senate, in a step aimed at restricting secrecy by the executive branch on foreign commitments, unanimously approved legislation today that would require all international agreements to be submitted to Congress for its information.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the world's leading bridge personalities, Jesse! Rothfield of Melbourne, Australia, passed through New York this week en route to the MidAtlantic Regional Championships in Greenville, S.C.

title: Velasco in Panama
description: PANAMA, Feb. 16 (UPI)The deposed President of Ecuador, Jos6 M. Velasco Thom, who or rived here aboard an Ecuadorian Air Force DC6, refused to answer questions. I don't want to be an uncomfortable guest for the Panamanian Government, he said. Mr. Velasco has spent previous exiles in Argentina.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: London Cautious on Detente
description: LONDON, Feb. 16  The British Government issued new defense budget today based on the view that chances are slim for any early agreement by East and West on force reductions in Europe.

title: MRS. WILLICOM BE JR.
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Feb. 16 Mrs. Venice Bongiorni WilliIcombe, the wife of Joseph Willicombe Jr., a vice president of King Features Syndicate and former International News Service war correspondent, died of a heart attack last evening. She was 57 years old.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Most football followers are normally satisfied each year when election results are announced for the Pro Football Hall of Fame. The quality of the selections has been so consistently high ever since the shrine was established in Canton, Ohio, that the voices of criticism have been so low as to go unheard.

title: Reserve's Buying Touches Off Rally For Bond Market
description: The pace of the bond market's weeklong advance, goaded by the Federal Reserve, picked up speed yesterday. The central bank reportedly purchased Treasury securities maturing in more than a year, and this action apparently touched off a rally late yesterday.

title: Stars Defeat Wings
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 16 (AP)Jude Drouin, stretching his goal streak to four straight games, shoveled in a deflected centering pass with five minutes to play tonight as the Minnesota North Stars rallied for a 42 victory over the Dertoit Red Wings.

title: Ouko of Kenya Will Run in Garden
description: Robert Cuko of Kenya, who came to the United States for a track meet last year and wound up as a student at North Carolina Central University, will be among a field of international stars competing In the Olympic Invitational track meet at Madison Square Garden tomorrow night.

title: Pace Stays Brisk In Housing Starts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16Housing starts continued to boom in January, the Commerce Department reported today. The starts last month were at an annual rate of 2,549,000, a record for any month and 116,000 above December.

title: Northern Ireland Guerrillas Kill Soldier and Catholic Bus Driver
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 16Gunmen tonight killed a British soldier and a member of the parttime Ulster Defense Regiment.

title: War Among the Ruins
description: Cambodian Government forces have launched operations outside the ancient ruins of Angkor, apparently intent on trying to drive out Communist troops who have occupied that treasured national symbol since June 1970.

title: Marchers Win Court Delay
description: NEWRY, Northern Ireland, Feb. 16 (AP)Bernadette Devlin and 25 other Roman Catholics today won postponement of a court hearing on charges that they participated in an illegal march. Placardcarrying crowds cheered the decision.

title: UPSTATE CAMPUS SOLD BY SKIDMORE
description: Verrazzano College, which began as an idea in 1963 and has existed only on paper since then, moved closer to reality yesterday with the purchase of the incity campus of Skidmore College in Saratoga Springs for S3million.

title: ChabanDelmas's TV Speech Fails to Still Critics
description: PARIS, Feb. 16Aside from the praise of his Gaullist supporters, Premier Jacques ChabariDelmas got at best a lukewarm reaction today to his unusual defense on television last night against attacks on his personal integrity.

title: HEALTH CARE RISE IS CITED IN JAILS
description: Significant improvement in the health care of city prison inmates was reported yesterday by Gordon Chase, the city's Health Service Administrator.

title: Protestants and Catholics Observe Ash Wednesday
description: Protestants and Roman Catholics began observance of their most sacred season yesterday with Ash Wednesday services marking the opening of Lent.

title: Daniels Sets Back Carton In Squash Racquets Here
description: Dick Daniels of the University Club, seeded No. 2, rallied for a firstround victory last night in the Fowler invitation Class C squash racquets tournament at the Seventh Regiment Armory.

title: Deaths
description: ANFANGFay, beloved mother of Daniel and Irving Dear sister of Yetta Zinn and Sarah Adler. Loving grandmother. Services today 10:30 A.M. Nieberg's Midwood Cnapel, 162$ Coney Island Avenue, Bklyn.

title: Rehabilitated Drug Addict Finds New Values in Life
description: At the age of 37, Frank Gracia looked an unhealthy 57, his physiognomy a relief map of sunken cheeks and cavernous eye sockets. And it was no wonder, for he had been shooting heroin on and off for 22 years, 13 of which had been claimed by various penal institutions around the country.

title: U.S. Jury Here Subpoenas Friend of Ex ughes Aide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 16Stanley Meyer, a friend who advised Noah Dietrich on marketing his memoirs, has been subpoenaed to testify in the investigation of the origins of Clifford Irving's book The Autobiography of Howard Hughes.

title: Candidate Mills
description: The Democratic party needs another Presidential candidate about as much as it needs an immediate upsurge in the economy. Yet it has no choice but to welcome the addition of such a power as Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee and in his quiet way one of the movers and shakers on Capitol Hill.

title: Stolle, Pasarell Victors
description: TORONTO, Feb. 16 (UPI)Fred Stolle, Charlie Pasarell and Roger Taylor scored upset victories tonight in the second round of the $50,000 World Championship tennis tournament.

title: A Mechanical Heart Device Is Modified by Surgeon
description: Dr. Adrian Kentrowitz, the heart surgeon, said Tuesday that he and his Detroit team had modified their partly mechanical heart device and were preparing four persons with chronic heart disease for imimplanation of the pumpcontrolled balloon.

title: Poll Finds 4Point Gain in Nixon Support
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 Results of the latest Gallup Poll, which were released today, showed that 53 per cent of 1,450 persons polled said they approved of the way Nixon is handling the Presidency.

title: Special Weeks Proclaimed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) President Nixon today pro. claimed the week beginning March 5 as Save Your Vision Week and the week beginning March 19 as National Poison Prevention Week.

title: Mansfield Looks to China
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield of Montana, said today that he is seeking permission to visit mainland China. He told reporters he hopes to go after President Nixon returns from his visit with Chinese leaders.

title: Tubridy, a BassBaritone, Performs in ai Recital Here
description: Martin Tubridy, a bassbaritone who came to Town Hall on Tuesday night to give his second New York recital, performed songs by Beethoven, Schubert, Vaughan Williams, Britten and others. He was accompanied on the piano by Mitchell Andrews.

title: SADAT VOWS TO QUIT IF HE LOSES BACKING
description: CAIRO, Feb. 16  President Anwar elSadat vowed today that he would resign if the Egyptians lost confidence in his leadership during what he conceded would be a long political and military struggle to recover Arab lands occupied by Israel.

title: Military Junta Imposes Curfew And Tight Controls in Ecuador
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Feb. 16 (UPI)A threeman junta put Ecuador under virtual military control today after a bloodless midnight coup in which the armed forces overthrew President Jose M. Velasco Ibarra for the fourth time since 1933 and sent him into exile in Pa nama.

title: Clarke Agrees to Terms For 6th Year With Yanks
description: The Yankees signed four more players yesterday, including their regular second baseman, Horace Clarke, and now have 23 players under contract out of a list of 39. The others to sign were Mike Kekich and Don Schroeder, pitchers, and Fred Frazier, a second baseman.

title: BERRIGAN JUROR IS CALLED BIASED
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 13The possibility of a mistrial in the ease of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists was raised tonight when a state welfare official said he had heard a woman juror denounce priests and nuns who agitated for peace.

title: Scott Paper Plans Factory
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 16 (UPI) The Scott Paper Company said today that it would soon start building a $7million factory on an 80acre tract at Dover, Del., to use a new process to make paper fabrics with la clothlike appearance. The (plant will employ 100 at first.

title: Dr. Frank Graham Dies at 85; Civil Rights Leader in the South
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Feb. 16 (AP)Dr. Frank Porter Graham, formerly president of the University of North Carolina, United States Senator and United Nations mediator, died today in North Carolina Memorial Hospital. His age was 85. He had suffered a heart seizure Friday.

title: Lars Michael McSorley, MGM Publicity Director
description: Lars Michael McSorley, production publicity director of Metro. Goldwyn  Mayer film studio, died yesterday of cancer at St. John's Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 41 years old.

title: ANDREW ESTERLY, A CITY U. DEAN 50
description: Andrew H. Esterly, assistant dean of administration at the City University during its last seven years of expansion, died of cancer Tuesday in Doctors Hospital at Grymes Hill, S. I. He was 50 years old and lived at 26 Myrtle Avenue, West Brighton, S. I.

title: $3Million to Go to States For Breakfasts in Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP)  The Agriculture Department announced today that an additional $3million has been made available to provide breakfasts in poverty areas this year for 284,466 schoolchildren.

title: NEW CENSUS STUDY PROJECTS DECLINE IN RATE OF BIRTHS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The number of children that American women expected to bear dropped so sharply between 1967 and 1971, the Census Bureau reported today, that the nation is fast approaching zero population growth rates among younger women.

title: Clothing Makers Elec.
description: Chester Kessler, president of W. B. Kessler, In., has been elected president of the Clothing Manufacturers Association of the U.S.A. He succeeds Richard H. Adler, who retired as preseident of the 39yearold organization after four years in the post.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Asserts India Is Still a Nonaligned Nation
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 12Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has declared that her country's foreign policy remains firmly based on the principle of non.

title: Continental Oil's Chief Due to Retire on May 2
description: Leonard F. McCollum, a major driving force behind the growth of the Continental Oil Company over the last 25 years, announced yesterday that he would retire as chairman, effective May 2.

title: McGovern to Remake Robert Kennedy Tape
description: KEENE, N. H., Feb. 16 (UPI) Senator George McGovern said today that he would withdraw a controversial radio tape used in his New Hampshire campaign that includes an unattributed endorsement by the late Robert F. Kennedy.

title: Partners Purchase Art Dealer's Share In Knoedler Firm
description: Bernard Danenberg, the art dealer who last December teamed with Dr. Armand Hammer, the West Coast industralist, and several other associates to buy the prestigious art firm of Knoedler & Co., for several million dollars, has withdrawn from the partnership.

title: Soviet Voices Hope for Amity With China
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 16  The Soviet Government newspaper Izvestia published a review of past SovietChinese amity tonight and expressed. hope that good relations would again be restored between the two countries.

title: AUSSIES CAPTURE CATAMARAN RACE
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Feb. 16 (Reuters)Quest III of Australia retained the Little America's Cup for catamarans at Sorrento today, capturing her fourth straight victory over the American challenger, Weathercock, which failed to win a single race.

title: Coast Dackers Voting
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 16 (UPI)The rank and file of the striking longshoremen's union begin voting today on whether to approve a 17month contract recommended by local leaders. The recommendation came after a fourday caucus.

title: Ford Shortens Layoff
description: DEANBORN, Mich., Feb. 16 (AP)Some 3,300 Ford Motor Company workers will be laid off for only one week, rather than two weeks as originally scheduled, for an assembly line change at the Dearborn Assembly plant, the company announced today.

title: Fabulous Boston Mansion Is Setting for Benefit Ball
description: BOSTON, Feb. 16Things just aren't what they used to be. Guests at last night's spectacular Advent Masque Ball were to have been spirited away from dinner by horse and carriage to the enormous old Webster mansion in Back Bay, where they were to have snacked on flaming crepes to usher in Lent.

title: U.S. Jets Make New Attacks in the North
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 17The United States command here announced this morning that it had undertaken a limitedduration bombing campaign against North Vietnamese artillery positions in the southern province of North Vietnam and in the northern half of the demilitarized zone, which straddles the border between North and South Vietnam.

title: CHINA AFFECTING PENTAGON PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, told Congress today that the emergence of China as major nuclear power portended both new political alignments and new military requirements.

title: Sonics Win at Buzzer
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 16 (AP)Dick Snyder's 25foot jump shot at the buzzer gave the Seattle SuperSonics a 113112 victory tonight over the Boston Celtics.

title: U.S. to Brief Asian Allies Right After Talksin China
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The State Department today announced that high officials would consult with Asian and Pacific allies of the United States at the end of President Nixon's journey to China, which begins tomorrow morning.

title: Top Officers Are Named by A.T.&T.
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company promoted John D. deButts to chairman and chief executive officer yesterday. Since Feb. 1, 1967, the 156yearold executive had been vice chairman. He replaces H. I, Romnes, 64, who will officially retire from the posts of chairman and president on April 1.

title: Fire Razes Tufts Building
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Feb. 16 (AP).A fouralarm fire of undetermined origin destroyed 1North Hall of Tufts University tonight. The fourstory frame structure housed the psychology department and. other university offices

title: The British Coal Strike
description: Prime Minister Edward Heath's Government faces its gravest crisis as a result of Britain's first national coal strike since 1926. The walkout has now dragged on for six weeks, forcing widespread power cutbacks and throwing hundreds of thousands out of their jobs. Coming on top of the heaviest unemployment Britain has experienced since the war, the strike has now raised the jobless total to more than two and a half million. If it continues, there will be rapidly growing dangers of food shortages, river pollution and industrial paralysis.

title: Penguins Top Leafs
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 16 (AP)Bryan Watson set up two Pittsburgh goals with hard shots from the point tonight as the Penguins defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 42. The Penguins have won five of their last seven games.

title: Man in the News
description: The 10th chief executive officer in the history of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company had only enough time yesterday afternoon to gobble down a hamandcheese sandwich, drink a cup of coffee and pick at half a pink grapefruit.

title: The Electric Shave Defended as Better Though Not Closer
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI)The Federal Trade Commission today released documents from Schick Electric, Inc., and Remington Electric Shaver acknowledging that blades usually give a closer shave than electric razors.

title: Stronger U.S. Role Urged In Assisting Unemployed
description: A member of the President's Council of Economic Advisers was reported yesterday as suggesting that the Government take a strongerand broader role in assisting the unemployed.

title: DR. FRED L. ADAIR, 94, LED OBSTETRICIANS
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 16 (AP)Dr. Fred L. Adair, a founder and former president of the American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists, died Sunday at the age of 94.

title: Communists Protest U.S. Ban on Paris Session
description: PARIS, Feb, 16North Vietnam and the Vietcong protested today against the refusal of the United States to hold a meeting tomorrow and accused Washington of trying to sabotage the peace talks.

title: Six Yachts Finish Race
description: ACAPULCO. Feb. 16 (AP)Six vessels were in Acapulco today waiting for the remainder of the San DiegotoAcapulco yacht race fleet to arrive so the overall handicap winner could be determined.

title: VETO THREATENED FOR POVERTY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The House opened debate today on a revised bill extending a broad range of antipoverty programs, but Republican leaders said President Nixon would veto It in its present form.

title: HARRISINTERTYPE SELLING NEW DEVICE
description: The HarrisIntertype Corporation announced yesterday the development of a new video typewriter for use in newspapers that displays reporters stories. on a TVlike cathode ray tube rather than on paper.

title: Humphrey and Mushie Strongest In 3 Regional Polls of Unionists
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 16 Union officials reported today that polls of delegates to three recent regional conferences indicated that Senators Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota and Edmund S. Muskie of Maine were the union delegates top preferences for President. They reported only minimal support for President Nixon's reelection.

title: Excerpts From Interview With Prime Minister Gandhi on Indian Foreign Policy
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 12Following ure excerpts from an interview with Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India conducted by C. L. Sulzberger of The New York Times:

title: Briton With Knife Kills 3 Children in Hospital
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Thursday, Feb. 17 (AP)An intruder with a knife ran amuck through the children's ward of a Blockpool hospital early today, stabbing three children to death and wounding two nurses and another child.

title: GROUPS IDENTIFIED IN LATIN PROTEST
description: Puerto Rican militants who disrupted Federal civilrights hearings here this week came from two groups. One holds that independence alone can cure the troubles of Puerto Ricans. The other involves three organizations rallied by a former Lindsay administration official who now charges the city with institutionalized racism.

title: MARYLAND SINKS N. CAROLINA, 7947
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Feb. 16 (AP)Two free throws by Howard White with seven seconds remaining in overtime gave 19thranked Maryland a 7977 victory over thirdranked North Carolina in an Atlantic Coast Conference game tonight.

title: Senate Panel Asks Shultz to Testify on Charges of Usurping Pollution Agency Powers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The Senate Subcommittee on Air and Water Pollution today asked George P. Shultz, director of the Office of Management and Budget, to appear before it Friday to respond to charges that the executive group was assuming authority that Congress had given to the Environmental Protection Agency.

title: Warhol's 'Women in Revolt,' Madcap Soap Opera
description: Probably no man, not even Norman Mailer, will ever have the last word on women's liberation, but until ones does, perhaps the Andy Warhol-Paul Morrissey "Women in Revolt" will do. The movie is called a comedy, but it can be more accurately described as a madcap soap opera whose three manic heroines are played by female impersonatorswhich may be interpreted as the ultimate put-down of women's lib, as well as the ultimate endorsement.More particularly, "Women in Revolt" (as did "Trash") recalls Hollywood movies of the 1930's and 1940's, especially those slushy romances in which Alice Faye, Frances Langford and Patsy Kelly compromised everything except their virtue in their pursuit of husbands.Because Warhol and Morrissey deal in systematic reversals of everything, including sex, their heroines are involved in desperate attempts to get away from men. "You're mine! You're mine! You're mine!" cries an impetuous lover into the rather large ear of Holly Woodlawn, a high-fashion model from Bayonne, "Oh, God," answers the struggling Holly. "Women will be free!" She's sickto the point of always looking exhaustedof being a sex object.So too is the beautiful Candy Darling, "a society deb socialite" from Long Island who longs to become a movie star, mostly, I suspect, because she answers everything that is said to her with "I have a right to live!" Jackie Curtis, however, is a furtiveliberationist, a 21-year-old virgin who hires a lover through The East Village Other "to find out what we're fighting against."According to Warhol and Morrissey, each liberation demands a little doom. Candy becomes rich, famous and miserable by starring in a series of Italian movies in which she neither speaks, sings, dances nor acts. Holly is last seen wandering drunkenly on the Bowery, "making" (says an absolutely beautiful line in the film's official synopsis) "the sidewalks her necessity." Poor Jackie goes back to Bayonne with a baby, having been impregnated by a former Mr. America."Women in Revolt," which opened yesterday at the Cin Malibu, is not as consistently funny (and awful) as "Trash," but a lot of it is as hilarious as it is dirty. The film carries no screenplay credit, so I have no idea who is responsible for the dialogue, which often is foolish and occasionally inspired in the way that good parodies must be. "Come down off the trapeze and into the sawdust," Jackie says in trying to persuade Candy to join The Movement. "That," sniffs Candy, "is circus talk."Holly Woodlawn, in the Patsy Kelly role, is very funny in short takes, and, in longer ones, so grotesque that it's difficult to watch her. Jackie Curtis reminds me a good deal of an Elizabeth Taylor stripped of that fabulous face, while Candy Darling, who sometimes looks like Marilyn Monroe and sometimes like Mrs. Nixon, and often sounds like Kim Novak, comes very close to being a real actress. Of the apparently male performers, only Michael Sklar, who was so fine in "Trash," gives anything approximating a straight performance, as an actor's agent who finally catapults Candy to fame."Women in Revolt" is a comparatively elaborate Warhol movie with a limited intelligence, but unlike a lot of better movies, it uses almost all of the intelligence available to it. Thus, in a crazy way, it must be called a success.

title: Flyers Lose 30 Lead
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 16 (UN)Jim Peppin scored twice in six seconds and Stan Mikita added a goal in the third period tonight to wipe out a 30 lead of the Philadelphia Flyers and give the Chicago Black Hawks a 33 tie.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 16John Bennett, a senior forward. scored with 15 seconds remaining in suddendeath overtime tonight to give Brown a 32 hockey victory over Princeton.

title: Rofstra Routs Kings Point
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Feb. 16Quinas Brower scored 33 points, leading Hofstra to a 9665 basketball victory over Kings Point tonight.

title: Edgar Snow
description: No cause was dearer to Edgar Snow than the promotion of friendship and goodwill between the United States and China, especially the China we now call the Chinese People's Republic. In many. ways he played key role for decades in helping maintain an often tenuous link between the Chinese Communist leaders and the United States. The confidence he won in Peking undoubtedly helped in the process that finally resulted in agreement on President Nixon's trip to China. It especially tragic therefore that Edgar Snow died on the eve of the President's historic journey.

title: Judge Asserts Changes in Project Necessitate New Board Hearing
description: A halt in construction of the lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, has been ordered by Supreme Court Justice Irving H. Saypol.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: FLAMINGO, Fla.Anglers were having no trouble catching snook in Florida Bay, but all the way on the long drive south from New England to the Everglades National Park, where Flamingo is situated, could think only of tarpon.

title: New Fanny May Program Sells $10MiIlion First Day
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (Reuters)  The Federal National Mortgage Association announced today that it sold 7 per cent Governmentbacked home mortgages totaling $10million at an average yield of 7.4 per cent on Monday, the first day of its new openwindow sales program.

title: TIMES SQ. DAMAGE PUT ABOVE $100,000
description: Damage to merchandise and building equipment from the flash flood in the lower Times Square area after a watermain break Tuesday appeared yesterday to be running into the hundreds of thousands of dollars, according to a spot survey.

title: Tennessee Blocks Move
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 16The Tennessee House of Representatives killed yesterday an effort to move the state's Presidential preference primary to March 30 from May 4.

title: IN THE NATION
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 16The Florida primary, once heralded as makeorbreak for the myriad Democratic Presidential candidates, is rapidly turning more nearly into a referendum on the hot issue of busing to achieve school desegregation.

title: Courant Service Tomorrow
description: A memorial for Dr. Richard Courant, the distinguished mathematician, who died on Jan. 27 at the age of 84, will be held at 3:30 P.M. tomorrow in the David Tishman Auditorium of New York University's Vanderbilt Hall, 40 Washington Square South. At his death Dr. Courant was professor emeritus of mathematics and science adviser to the university. The speakers will include Dr. James M. Hester, president of N.Y.U.

title: Vote on Peterson Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI) The Senate Commerce Committee put off today a confirmation vote on Peter G. Peterson as Secretary of Commerce until his financial status was reviewed by the Justice Department. Mr. Peterson, a White House assistant for international economic affairs, was appointed by President Nixon to replace Maurice H. Stans, who resigned to serve as finance chairman in mr. Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: Aides of Lindsay Evolve a Compromise Proposal Taking in Lindenwood
description: A compromise plan to end the fight over the Forest Hills lowincome housing project has been worked out by top aides of Mayor Lindsay, including former Deputy Mayor. Richard R. Aurelio, and has been discussed privately with leaders of blacks and Jews and with highranking officials.

title: Leading That Brownie Troop, a Man
description: Men leaders of Brownie Girl Scout troops? Well, why not? Any parent who takes a 7 or 8 year old to her troop meeting is likely to get roped into helping out  and that's just how Harold Wilson and Lloyd Fitzhugh got involved with the littlest Girl Scouts.

title: Music: Fine Playing From Eastman
description: The Program

title: Renata Scotto Gives a Generous Song Program
description: Renata Scotto came to Philharmonic Hall in fine voice Tuesday night and, to put it in bullring argot, she cut two ears and a tail. The Italian soprano, whose vocal technique and cutting power have the capacity to turn her fans into screaming! idolators, gave an extraordinarily generous program: 16 songs and arias by Handel, Spontini, Rossini, Donizetti, Mercadente, Verdi, Berlioz, Debussy, Pizzetti and Meyerbeer. No doubt there were encores; too.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate Panel Sets Vote on Women's Rights Move
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 The Senate Judiciary Committee agreed today to vote at the end of the month on a constitutional amendment to prohibit discrimination based on sex.

title: U.S. BACKS EXPORT OF TOOLS TO SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Continuing to relax its policy on trade with the Russians, the Nixon Administration today approved 51 licenses for export of $367million of machine tools and other equipment to the Soviet Union.

title: 76 Medals Authorized
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) President Nixon signed a bill today to authorize coinage of commemorative medals for the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission. The medals, to be sold by the commission as souvenirs, will be coined by the Bureau of the Mint at no Icost to the Government.

title: N.Y Ile Fencers Beat Columbia For 30th Straight Victory, 207
description: Despite the absence of their coach, Hugo Castello, the New York University fencing team rposted a 207 victory over archrival Columbia in the victor's gym last night.

title: Amex Nominates Woman As a Member of Its Board
description: Julia Montgomery Walsh, senior vice president of Ferris & Co., a Washington, D.C., brokerage firm, yesterday was nominated for membership on the board of governors of the American Stock Exchange.

title: Hughes Is Reported Out of the Bahamas
description: Howard R. Hughes left Nassau in the Bahamas last night as secretly and mysteriously as he arrived there on Thanksgiving morning, 1970, informed persons said.

title: Advertising:
description: Many admen have in recent years been voicing their concern about the way unethical practices by some political candidates besmirch the image of the business.

title: HESTER SUPPORTS SALE OF CAMPUS
description: The proposed sale of the Bronx campus of New York University to the state would give the schol the financial relief it needs to continue operations, Dr. James M. Hester, the university's president declared yesterday.

title: Italian Party Bids Andreotti Form Minority Government
description: ROME, Feb. 16 (Reuters)A meeting of leaders of Italy's Christian Democratic party tonight authorized Premierdesignate Giulio Andreotti to form a singleparty minority government because of the impossibility of forming a coalition.

title: Advertising:
description: One of the great collectors of titles in the publishing business has done it again. John Mack Carter, who is 43 years old and has been editor (and formerly publisher) of The Ladies Home Journal, president of Downe Publishing and vice president of its parent company, Downe Communications, has now been named president and chief operating officer of the parent company.

description: To the Editor:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 16Mr. Laaman and Miss Holt will be questioned in the Jan. 5 bombing of a state office building in Butfaio, the police said today.

title: Challenger of Military Justice Sentenced to 25 Years in Rape
description: FORT LEAVENWORTH, Kan., Feb. 16A black Army prison trusty who pleaded guilty to a charge of raping the white wife of a lieutenant colonel was sentenced today to 25 years at hard labor, thus ending the first round of a courtmartial in which the defense raised what it called a major challenge to the constitutionality of the armed forces legal code.

title: Ingenious Solitaire Stands Out In an Evening for New Music
description: So much contemporary music relies on choice, chance or improvisation on the part of the players that it becomes a game for them This turns the listener into a kibitzer, who may or may not enjoy that role. There was at least one good game worth kibitzing in the Evenings for New Music program in Carnegie Recital Hall Tuesday night. This was Barbara Kolb's Solitaire, played by the pianistcomposer Richard Trythall against two tapes.

title: U. S. Studying Events
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI)  The State Department said that the United States would have to study the events in Ecuador before deciding whether the question of recognition of the new regime arose.

title: Smith and Nastase Gain In National Indoor Play
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 16 (AP)The two topseeded play ers advanced tonight in thirdround singles competition in the $55,000 national indoor tennis championships.

title: PRIMARY TESTS WON IN ILLINOIS DISTRICT
description: CHICAGO, Feb 16In a primary contest for the old 15the Congressional District seat vacated by Mrs. Charlotte T. Reid, the Republican nomination was won by Clifford Carlson, a wealthy Geneva industrialist, in last night's special election.

title: DR. BERT ROSENBERG, PSYCHIATRIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Bert Rosenberg, a psychiatrist and a graduate student at the division of psychoanalytic education of the State University of New York College of Medicine, died yesterday at United Hospital, Port Chester, N. Y., of injuries received in an accident on Saturday. He was 37 years old and lived at 55 Exeter Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: A FONTEYN TRIUMPH IN CRANKO'S BALLET
description: LONDON, Feb. 16  Dame Margot Fontcyn had a triumph at Covent Garden last night, dancing for the first time in London the role John Crank created for her in Poeme dr l'Extase. Nearly two years after the ballet was first given with the Stuttgart Ballet, the only change apparent in her performance is that she now looks, if anything, rather younger.

title: Mr. Nixon and Mr. Mao:
description: As Mr. Nixon reaches the orangetiled tranquility of Peking, what frame of mind will he find his hosts in? Rather buoyant, above all. The Chinese feel less threatened, as they look out from their backward but proud nation, than five years ago when the Vietnam war was at its peak, or twenty years ago when Korea was in flames.

title: Cougars Go to Court To Retain McDaniels
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 16 (UPI)The Carolina Cougars of the American Basketball Association have filed a suit asking a Federal judge to stop a Los Angeles attorney, Al Ross, from interfering with their 7foot rookie, Jim McDaniels.

title: Publishers Assess Biography by Irving
description: We found out we've been taken and we've had to take our medicine, says Harold W. McGraw Jr., president of the book division of McGrawHill, Inc.

title: 2 SEIZED IN BLASTS LINKED TO PRIMARY
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Feb. 16 (UPI)Three bombs, believed to have been planted by political activists in protest against New Hampshire's forthcoming Presidential primary, exploded in rapid order today, shattering windows at police and fire headquarters here. A fourth bomb was found unexploded at the office of the police chief.

title: Catholics Withhold War Tax
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 16 (AP)  A 60member Roman Catholic parish has voted unanimously to withhold payment of long distance telephone excise taxes in protest of the Vietnam war. The Rev. William Nerin said the decision by the Community of John XXIII was made about six months ago but announcement was delayed until the beginning of Lent, a time of reflection.

title: DiIts Is Acquitted; His CoDefendant Guilty of Bribery
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Feb. 16 Robert Dilts, the suspended Bergen County Prosecutor charged with conspiracy, bribery, obstructing justice and misconduct in office, was found not guilty on all counts this evening by a Superior Court jury here.

title: Richardson View on Busing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) A member of President Nixon's Cabinetlevel committee charged with seeking solutions to the problem of school busing frowned today on the constitutional  amendment approach.

title: China's Politicized Armed Forces Are Performing a Host of Civilian Tasks in Farms, Schools and Factories
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 16  In China the 2.8 million regulars in the army, navy and air force drill, maneuver, practice with weapons, guard the frontiers and when necessary enforce law and order, like servicemen everywhere.

title: Middleground Is Dead
description: KINGSVILLE, Tex., Feb. 16 (UPI)Middleground, winner of two parts of the Triple Crown of racing in 1950 and a halfbrother to Assault, the Triple Crown winner, died today on the King Ranch at the age of 25.

title: OwensIllinois Will Close Newark Box Unit May 31
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Feb. 16 (AP) OwensIllinois, Inc., said today it would close its corrugated box plant in Newark because of generally poor conditions in the business. The plant is scheduled to close May 31.

title: Marine Corps Nomination
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) President Nixon has nominated Lieut. Gen. Earl E. Anderson to become: assistant commandant of the Marine Corps, the Pentagon announced today. General Anderson, 52 years old, will be promoted to a fourstar fullgeneral rank. He would replace Gen, Raymond G. Davis, who will retire March 31.

title: Cornell Hockey Team Routs Yale, 73
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 16George Shields scored three goals tonight. leading Cornell to its 10th consecutive hockey victory over Yale, 73.

title: APOLLO 17 TO LAND IN A LUNAR VALLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16Apollo 17, the last scheduled United States manned flight to the moon, will have as its target a rugged area of steep Inountans and dark valleys where scientists hope to find clues to the ancient lunar past.

title: WEATHER IN PEKING NOW REPORTED HERE
description: On the eve of President Nixon's departure for China, the National Weather Service began yesterday to report the weather in Peking as part of its daily data on weather conditions around the world.

title: Outlook for U.S. Dollar Depresses Its Value in Currency Trading
description: PARIS, Feb. 16A prediction that the dollar would remain inconvertible for most of the nineteenseventies combined with the official disclosure of what everyone knew anyway, that the United States had a mammoth deficit in its balance of payments last year, depressed the dollar in the major trading centers today.

title: NAVY TO PAY PART OF DISPUTED BILL
description: The Navy has agreed to advance $25million to a Louisiana shipyard as provisional payment in connection with cost claim rejected last summer by a civilian board whose chief has complained of unreasonable pressure' in the case by four Louisiana Congressmen.

title: Ratelle Leads Streaking Rangers
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 16The New York Rangers flew into this southern California metropolis late today, riding the crest of a fourgame winning streak and still talking about Jean Ratelie's 150foot goal, his third in Now York's 51 victory over Vancouver last night.

description: To the Editor:

title: Chinese Leaders Praise Snow for Contributions
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 16 (Reuters)Chairman Mao Tsetung has praised Edgar Snow the American author, for making important contributions in promoting SinoAmerican friendship, the New China News Agency said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Drug Abuse in the Schools

title: CAB STRIKERS SAY
description: Striking taxicab drivers said yesterday that their walkout, while not officially condoned by the Taxi Drivers Union, Local 3036, was being coordinated by union officials.

title: Ritz Theater Makes Broadway Return
description: The Ritz Theater, which began life as a legitimate playhouse 50 years ago and since then has worked as radio and television studio and, most recently, as house for pornographic films, was welcomed back to Broadway yesterday.

title: 11.A. Issues to Co To the Membership For Vote March 8
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 16 Thomas W. Gleason, president of the International Longshoremen's Association, and James J. Dickman, president of the Council of North Atlantic Shipping Associations, announced tonight in a joint statement that master contract issues, including port conditions in the collective bargaining agreement, would be submitted to the membership of the I.L.A. on March 3 for ratification.

title: Senators StripMine Tour Criticized
description: LOTTS CREEK, Ky., Feb. 15A Senate subcommittee's tour of coal stripmining sites ended today with some residents of this area contending that the panel was not concerned with the human side of it.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16It used to seem dumb of the United States not to recognize China. It was there, wasn't it? How could any sensible country go on pretending that China was over on Formosa in the uninspiring hatband of Generalissimo Chiang Kaishek? The trouble with the generalissimo, Senator Tom Connally had once said, was not enough generaling and too much issimoing. Still, John Foster Dulles knew his business, didn't he?

title: CandleLit London: The Blitz Spirit
description: LONDON, Feb. 16Across Britain, the electricity blackouts, the heatless homes, the lines of customers at food shops evoke memories of the blitz. Pride overcomes anger.

title: 2 Seized Here in Art Theft
description: Federal Bureau of Investigation agents arrested two men Tuesday on charges of receiving an Andrew Wyeth painting stolen a week ago from the Berwick Academy m Berwick, Me. The paintin valued in excess of $5, was recovered, an F.B.I. spokea. man said. The two arrested were Francis De. Vanzandt, 23 years old, of Southbury, Conn., and Bruce Gordon Holley Patten, 22, of 1352 First Avenue. Is

description: Mrs. Aristale Onassis took the witness stand for two hours yesterday as a Federal Court hearing in Manhattan began on charges that she was preventing a freelance photographer from earning a living.

title: Executive Changes
description: David J. Culbertson has been appointed president and chief operating officer of the Xerox Education Group. He will report to Dr. Robert W. Haigh, formerly president, who now becomes chairman and continues as chief executive.

title: Justice Criticizes Officials For Publicity Before Trial
description: A State Supreme Court justice, hearing the trial of five Black Panthers charged with murdering a member of a rival party faction, chided high city officials yesterday for making public statements about suspects and defendants.

title: PRICES DECLINE FOR PORK BELLIES
description: All outstanding contracts of pork belly (bacon) futures had price declines yesterday on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. The cause, according to a Chicago commodity broker, was increased hog slaughter in February compared with January and consumer resistance to the rising price of bacon.

title: jackson's Busing Plan Arouses Skepticism
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson's strong suit is forthrightness. He tells his audiences that they may not agree with him, but that they will at least know where he stands. His campaign brochure in Florida says that he is neither glamorous nor spellbinding on the stump. He is simply, the brochure says, 'a good man. Dead honest.

description: To the Editor:

title: State Panel Told of Peril In Hospitals
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16  As hundreds of concerned parents listened, the director of Willowbrook State School told a legislative hearing today that he had warned state officials each year since 1964 of the overcrowded conditions that finally led to the current public furor over the sight of retarded children left naked and uncared for.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
FotoMem's Reorganization Has an Amended Provision
description: Directors of FotoMem, Inc. of Newton Upper Falls, Mass., announced yesterday a modification of the organization plans by the referee under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: ELECTRIC HEATING IN PROJECT SCORED
description: Milton Musicus, Administrator of Municipal Services, yesterday criticized the use in apartments being built on Welfare Island of electric heat and Window airconditioners at a time when we are facing the possibility of a powershortage crisis.

title: CANADIENS RAISE SKEIN WITH A TIE
description: MONTREAL, Feb, 16 (UPI)Pete Mahovlich scored a secondperiod power play goal tonight to lift Montreal into a 11 tie with the California Golden Seals as the Canadiens extended their undefeated streak to nine games in the National Hockey League.

title: Captured North Vietnamese Soldier Tells of His Hard March South
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, Feb. 16When Pvt. But Van Au left his native village near Hanoi last fall to begin the long march to South Vietnam, he says, his parents and relatives cried for a long time. For no soldier from their village had over returned after infiltrating into the South.

title: EMOVERNOR BACKS RHODESIAN ACCORD
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 16Sir Humphrey Gibbs, the last British governor of the breakaway colony of Rhodesia, Itas given his support to the proposals for a settlement of the independence dispute between the two countries.

description: Arica Institute (212) 997430Advt.

title: DANIEL B. SHEEHAN
description: EASTON, Conn., Feb. 16 Daniel B. Sheehan, assistant manager of the Mobil Oil Corporation's aircraft operations department, died yesterday at home, 27 Dogwood Drive, apparently of a heart attack. He was 50 years old.

title: Gun of Ambushed City Patrolman Recovered
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 16One of nine persons sought by the New York City police in the Jan. 27 slaying of two patrolmen was killed here last night in a street gun battle with St. Louis policemen.

title: J.D.L. Stages a SitIn At 6 Candidates Offices
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Seeking support for a plan to exchange inmates in the Attica prison with Jews in the Soviet Union, members of the Jewish Defense League staged a sitin today in the offices of major Democratic Presidential candidates.

title: Debts of Investment Operator In Ohio Are Put at $1.1.Million
description: AKRON, Ohio, Feb. 16Don Lowers, an Akron lawyer, owes $11million to some 1,400 investors in his getrichquick scheme.

title: Evidence of Liberation Army Said to Rise
description: The circumstances surrounding the gunplay in St. Louis on Tuesday night are regarded by detectives here as the hardest evidence to date of the existence and operations of the Black Liberation Army, a group described by the police as network of black terrorists gunning for policemen.

title: Mao and Chou at Pinnacle of an Apparatus That Controls Every Phase of Life in China
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 16Although Mao Tsetung formally heads neither the state nor the Government of China, President Nixon's meeting with him will be a high point of his visit to China, for Chairman Mao is the most powerful man in his country.

title: Zaire's People Must Adopt Authentic African Names
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Feb. 16 (Agence FrancePress)  The people of Zaire must henceforth drop their baptismal names and adopt authentic African names, the Political Bureau of the governing Popular Revolutionary Movement has ordered.

title: Soho Artists Are Divided on Jackson Pollock Place
description: The recent proposal of August Heckscher, the city's Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administrator, to rename a part of West Broadway in the Soho area Jackson Pollock Place has triggered emotions among local residents that range from howling laughter to hot rage. The proposal, meant as a tribute to the late American abstract expressionist painter, will be discussed by Planning Board Two this evening at St. Vincent's Church, 153 West llth Street.

title: AGNEW STRESSES CAREER TRAINING
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Feb. 16Vice President Agnew said today that the nation's educational system should put more emphasis on the pragmatic need to train and motivate young people for fruitful and needed careers.

title: News of Dogs
description: Three of the six group judges for the Westminster Kennel Club show, which ended a twoday stand at Madison Square Garden on Tuesday night, told members of the Dog Fanciers Club yesterday why they had made their selections. They were Mrs. Beatrice Godsol of La Jolla, Calif.; Robert A. Kerns of Philadelphia and Flaworth F. Hoch of Villa Ridge, Mo.

title: FIRM THREATENS TO SUE EXCHANGE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 16 The brokerage subsidiary of one of the nation's largest mutual fund organizations has threatened to sue the Philadelphia Baltimore  Washington Stock Exchange if it acts to restrict institutional membership, as requested by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: The Busing Distortion
description: President Nixon has obviously seized on school busing as a political issue during this election year. Regrettably, Senator Henry M. Jackson has chosen to join Mr. Nixon in this callous exploitation of the voters ignorance and fear.

title: Miss Marmur in New Post
description: Mildred Marmur has been appointed a vice president in the trade book division of Simon & Schuster. She will continue as director of subsidiary rights, position she has held since 1968. She was formerly an editor and manager of the foreign rights department.

title: Shoemaker Still Out
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 16 (AP) Bill Shoemaker missed his second day of racing at Santa Anita Park today because of a knee injury suffered while playing tennis. He said he expected to be able to ride Friday.

title: Adoption Bar Upheld for Couple Who Have No Religious Faith
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16The Court of Appeals ruled today that state law permitting the designation of the religious upbringing of an adoptive child did not violate the constitutional rights of potential adopters who have no religious affiliation.

title: News Analysis
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Feb. 16The President of Cyprus and the Government in Athens appeared to be pulling back from the brink today after a tense five days and a Greek power play that never came off.

title: It's Tet, and Saigon Is More Cheerful
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 16Mrs. Nguyen Thi Quy, a middleclass housewife, refuses to even mention the Communist offensive four years ago during Tot. She was upset by the idea of speaking about it during the threeday Lunar New Year holiday, which began yesterday.

title: AUGUST SCHOLLE, LABOR LEADER 67
description: DETROIT, Feb. 16 (UPI)August Scholle, a longtime power in Michigan politics and a former president of the state A.F.L..CI.O., died of cancer yesterday. He was 67 years old.

title: Miss Heldman Wins
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 16 (AP)Two upsets highlighted the opening round of the women's professional tennis tournament today.

title: Gov. Carter Buoys Georgia Busing Foes by Saying He May Endorse Boycott
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., Feb. 16A cold rain today cut demonstrations associated with the Augusta school boycott, but parents against busing were cheered by word from Atlanta that Goy. Jimmy Carter might endorse oneday statewide school boycott set for Feb. 2R.

title: The Cult of the Potomac
description: NEW HAVENAt the annual National Prayer Breakfast in Washington, D. C., the other day, Richard M. Nixon urged the nation to pray that he will be on God's side during his trips to Peking and Moscow. This is the most recent indication that the cult of the Potomac is a thriving religion.

title: Complaint on Nixon Party
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI) The Congressional Black Caucus complained today that no blacks were accompanying President Nixon to China and they urged him to correct this gross deficiency before your departure on Thursday.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The prices of pork chops and chuck roasts and lettuce are starting to create serious trouble for the Nixon Administration's price control program and, incidentally, to present the Administration with an almost classic political dilemma. The prices of some foods, especially meats and some produce, have been rising sharply in recent weeks, despite the elaborate mach in. cry of the eco nomic stabilization program. The increases are largely generated by the rising costs of raw agricultural products, which are exempt from economic controls.

title: C. PHELPS DODGE
description: SANTE FE, N. M., Feb. 16Clarence Phelps Dodge Jr., Istudent of western Americana and a former rancher in Evergreen, Colo., died at his home here on Friday. He was 65 years old.

title: Perspnal Finance
description: Thousand of New Yorkers who so far have been unable to buy their dream house, either because they don't have the down payment or can't meet the monthly charges, may soon discover that easier terms on home loans are around the corner.

title: SOVIET AIDE TO U.N. OUT ON $100,000 BAIL
description: With the consent of the United States, ball for a Soviet United Nations employe who is accused of espionage was reduced yesterday from $500,000 to $100,000.

title: Merger News
description: The McCrory Corporation, a subsidiary of the RapidAmerican Corporation, which last week acquired 48.8 per cent of the common stock of the J. J. Newberry Company, announced yesterday a proposal for a merger with Nknvbeny. Samuel Newnan, chairman of McCrory, said follow ing a directors meeting that the merger terms called for an exchange for each share of Newbdrry common either 0.7 share of McCrory common stock or $30 principal amount of a new McCrory 25year 7% per cent subordinated debenture.

title: G.M. Is Accused of Restraining Evidence of Defect in Corvairs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The Senate Commerce Committee heard sworn testimony today that the General Motors Corporation, in settling a lawsuit, had bottled up evidence of a safety hazard in the Chevrolet Corvair.

title: Seaver Lands a $120,000 Met Contract
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 16  The New York Mets opened spring training in the rain today and immediately made financial history by signing Tom Seaver for $120,000the highest salary ever paid New York baseball player.

title: CONNALLY BACKS POLICIES 011 JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally defended before Congress today the Nixon Administration's policies for creating jobs but said that reaching a goal of 4 per cent unemployment without inflation will be extremely difficult.

title: MICHIGAN TO HOLD PRIMARY MAY 16
description: LANSING, Mich., Feb. 16After ter 41 years without one, Michigan finally settled on a Presidential primary today.

title: Government Pension Funds Widen Holdings of Stocks
description: State and local government pension funds have increased sharply their holdings of common stocks in recent years, the New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 4  No Title
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 16 (AP)Bill Dunbar scored a pair of goals as Dartmouth rallied from a 20 first period deficit for a 43 Ivy League hockey victory tonight over Harvard.

title: A Novelist Glimpsed at Play
description: Books of The Times

title: SAVINGS INFLOWS SET A RECORD IN JANUARY
description: Deposits at the nation's savings and loan associations increased by a record $3.1billion during January, the United States Savings and Loan League estimated yesterday.

title: CourtMartial Delayed
description: TYNDALL AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., Feb. 16 (UPI)A twoweek delay has been granted defense attorneys in the courtmartial of M. Sgt. Walter T. Perkins, charged by the Air Force with espionage.

title: Lexicographers Find Regional English Is Flourishing Despite TV
description: MADISON, Wis.  American English is the language of plainspeaking, much of it plainly inimitable.

title: Space Chapel Bill Is Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Legislation authorizing the sale of land at the Cape Kennedy Space center in Florida for the site of a chapel of the Astronauts was signed today by President Nixon. It would authorize the National Aeronautics and Space Administrator to sell at fair market price up to seven acres of land to the Chapel of the Astronauts, Inc., a nonprofit corporation.

title: RACKETEER TELLS OF JERSEY MAFIA
description: TRENTON, Feb, 16A Federal investigation of a $4.5million stolen securities conspiracy and the existence of a loansharking ring that reputedly included some of Lakewood's most prominent citizens were revealed here today as the State Commission of Investigation held its second and last hearing into organized crime.

title: PHONE WORKERS RATIFY CONTRACT
description: Striking New York Telephone Company craftsmen have ratified a proposed new threeyear contract designed to end sevenmonth strike that has halted more than 200,000 new phone installations in the state. The vote was 13,769 to 9,193.

title: He Says Nation Cannot Afford the Move Until Payments Improve
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally told Congress today that the United States can't afford to return to the convertibility of the dollar this year.

title: A Regional Glossary Of American English
description: Here are some samples of the way people speak in different parts of the country, as gathered by the compilers of the Dictionary of American Regional English:

title: Roommate of Slain Woman in Protective Custody
description: The roommate of a young woman who was murdered before she could testify as a key Government witness in a narcotics case is being held in protective custody.

title: TODAY IS TIM LAST DAY TO Order The First Medal Ever Minted In Pure Irish Silver Sc. page 29  ADVT.
description: TODAY IS TIM LAST DAY TO Order The First Medal Ever Minted In Pure Irish Silver Sc. page 29  ADVT.

title: Hughes Takes TShirts to Court
description: And now it's Howard R. Hughes vs. the Tshirt.

title: Double Exposure to Bow At City Center March 3
description: Double Exposure, Joe Layton's new ballet for the City Center Joffrey Ballet will have its premiere on March 3 instead of next Wednesday, when the company opens its spring season at the City Center.

title: Marquette Beats Jacksonville
