description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 22The alleged antiwar conspiracy involving the Rev. Philip

title: BEATRICE FOODS CO. TO PAY, ENDING SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)  The Justice Department announced today that the Beatrice Foods Company, one of the nation's largest dairyproduct concerns, has agreed to pay $115000 in settlement of an antitrust suit.

title: Jersey Plias to. Double Tickets for Top Prize
description: TRENTON, Feb, 22 (AP)The New Jersey Lottery Commission, facing competition from lotteries tin New York and Connecticut, announced today that it would double the number of ticket buyers who will qualify for the special millionaire drawings, held about every five weeks.

title: Stalin's Daughter Leaves Her Husband
description: Svetlana Alliluyeva, Stalin's daughter, has separated from her husband of 22 months, William Wesley Peters, an architect, in disagreement over the way of life at the cooperative Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation, Taliesin West, at Scottsdale, Ariz.

title: MINNESOTA BEGINS DELEGATE VOTING
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 22In 3,800 precincts across the snowquilted, subzero state of Minnesota, thousands of members of the DemocratFarmerLabor partyand probably a good many nonmembers  caucused tonight to begin the fourstep process of selecting 64 delegates to the Democratic Presidential convention.

title: Faulty Charge Against Mrs. Onassis Admitted
description: Ronald E. Galella, the freelance phOtographer who is suing Mrs. Aristotle Onassis, conceded on the witness stand here yesterday that he had once signed a complaint against her for an incident that did not allegedly take place until nine days later.

title: Mane With Stolen Checks Escapes After Chase Here
description: A young man who tried to cash $3,600 worth of traveler's checks in an American Express office here seized a gun from an investigator wild was questioning him, stole a taxicab outside the office and led the police on a chase up the West Side Highway.

title: Sills and Mozart in a Joyful Concert
description: Mozart's concert pieces for voice and orchestra do not turn up ordinarily, and for a simple reason: Ordinary singers sometimes are foolish, but they are rarely crazy. Happily, Beverly Sills is neither ordinary nor crazy, and her appearance Monday night at Carnegie Hall with the Cleveland Orchestra proved to be a joyful event for Mozarteans.

title: INSTITUTIONS BACK STAND BY THE PBW
description: The PhiladelphiaBaltimoreWashington Stock Exchange which indicated recently that it would oppose the Securities and Exchange Commission on the thorny Issue of institutional membership, received yesterday an informal endorsement of its views from some 30 institutional niembers.

title: ROBERT J. KENT
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Feb. 22 Robert J. Kent, a former member of the underwater systems development department of the Bell Laboratories in Whippany, died on Saturday in Overlook Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 20 Evergreen Road.

title: TV Networks Schedule Today's China Coverage
description: The major networks have announced the following scheduled coverage today of President Nixon's visit to China. Each network emphasized that the schedules are subject to change. All times shown are New York time.

title: Phone Employes InWork Stoppage Over Suspensions
description: The New York Telephone Company said yesterday that nearly 1,000 employes refused to go to work when more than 20 union officials were suspended after holding a shop steward meeting during working hours.

description: Amnesty Seen Pointless

title: BHUTTO WELCOMES INDIA'S PROPOSAL
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Feb. 22President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan made it known today that he would reply to an Indian offer for talks after President Nixon has finished his trip to China.

title: Squires Bow to Rockets
description: DENVER, Feb. 22 (AP)Byron Beck and Mary Roberts came off the bench tonight to lead a strong secondhalf effort as the Denver Rockets de feated the Virginia Squires, 121.105, in the A.B.A.

title: MRS. EDGAR TAFEL
description: Mrs. Lucille Blair Tafel, wife of Edgar Tafel, an architect, died yesterday in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. She was 58 years old and lived at 14 East 11th Street.

title: WODYNSKI DANCERS GIVE TIDY PROGRAM
description: Jan Wodynski approaches choreography the way a watchmaker assembles a timepiece, carefully selecting each element to fit Into an operative whole. She hates untidiness and in her program, Chorcotronics, at the Cubiculo Monday evening, she presented a smooth, clean and enjoyable selection of dances.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: Information Storage Systems, Inc., an Itel Corporation subsidiary, has concluded an agreement to sell Storage Technology Corporation disks for use on International Business Machines computers. The reverse was reported inadvertently on Tuesday.

title: BusingA Code Word
description: DETROITThe great debate should be over how we can best achieve, in the shortest possible time, nondiscriminatory highquality education. In Brown v. Board of Education, the Su. preme Court mandated the elimination of racially segregated schools. I reaffirm my strong belief in that decision separate cannot be equal.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: DACCA, Bangladesh  Diplomats stationed in Asia are saying to each other nowadays that the Indian subcontinent's traumatic experience, including Pakistan's mass slaughter of Bengalis here and its subsequent defeat by India, proved three things: that Russia can be trusted, that America cannot be trusted, and that China need not be feared.

title: China Since 1949 Seeking the Road to National Greatness
description: When the Communists came to power in China in 1949 the nation was agonizingly weary of decades of strife and the backward economy was near collapse. The last half century had seen the abortive imperial Reform Movement of 1898, the Boxer Rebellion, the 1911 Revolution, the violent warlord era and the foreign and civil wars of the Nationalist rule. The Chinese nation was more than ready for a new order of things.

title: Webster, After an Ear Operation, Meets New Giants
description: Alex Webster, coach of the New York Giants, made his first public appearance yesterday Since undergoing ear surgery, a couple of weeks ago. He attended a gettogether luncheon for some of the new Giant players and members of the news media in the wine cellar at Mamma Leone's Restaurant.

title: Peking Students Recite Mao Doctrine in English
description: PEKING, Feb. 22 (UPI)The young girl with braided hair, a red plaid skirt and baggy blue pants stood by her desk and intoned, in clear English: We love our Chairman Mao, our great leader, the red sun in our hearts day and night.

title: Braves Top Bullets, 89.98
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 22 (UPI)Bob Kauffman scored after stealing an inboundspass with eight seconds left to give the Buffalo Braves a 9998 victory over the Baltimore Bullets in an N.B.A. game tonight.

title: H.U.D. Appointment Here
description: Grant Reynolds, 63 years old, of White Plains was appointed yesterday to be deputy regional administrator of the Federal Department of Houshig and Urban Development for New York, New Jersey, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Dr. Earl L. Butz, the Secretary of Agriculture, said today that the reason for rising food prices was consumers, with their increasing incomes, have bid these prices up.

title: New Medicaid Plan Proposed in Suffolk
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Feb. 22A major restructuring of the Medicaid program to cut down leakages in the system and save 10 per cent of Suffolk County's $40million annual Medicaid bill was proposed today by County Executive John V. N. Klein.

description: MIAMI, Feb. 22Following are the positions of candidates for President on the issue of busing children achieve racial balance in the public schools:

title: Ruling by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP) The elder Colombo, a reputed Mafia figure, won a new hearing today on an attempt in New York to prosecute him for criminal contempt.

title: Cruel and Unusual Penalty
description: The California Supreme Court has declared that capital punishment violates that state's Constitution which forbids the imposition of cruel and unusual. punishment. The decision, though final for Califorr where here it automatically commutes to life imprisonment the death sentences of 107 prisoners, does not directly affect the fate of some 580 men and women in death rows in other states; but the amiane and legally sound opinion does point toward elimination of this brutalizing penalty from the nation's judicial arsenal.

title: PENTAGON SHIFTS STAND ON SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Pentagon said today that it would continue to send its officers to the best qualified and most appropriate graduate school regardless of the institution's military posture and despite a pledge of retaliatory legislation by the chairman of the House Armed Services Committee.

title: Soviet Organizing Fete For Its 50th Anniversary
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 22As plans for the bicentennial of the American Revolution appear to be floundering on, the Soviet Communist party, which runs a tight ship, laid down the law today for an anniversary of its own,. and there were no ifs or buts.

title: KATY DETAILS OFFER TO NATIONAL STORES
description: The terms of an offer by Katy Industries, Inc., Elgin, Ill., to acquire all of the 1,362,708 outstanding common shares of First National Stores, Inc., Somerville, Mass., were announced in a joint statement.

title: Transport Sector Paces January Rise in Durable Goods

description: The Topper Corporation, a leading toy manufacturer, announced yesterday the signing of an agreement with its creditors committee regarding the payment of its trade and service debts.

title: Executive Changes
description: William J. Brennan has been appointed vice president; assistant to the chairman of the Teleprompter Corporation. He formerly was vice president, West Coast of Teleprompter's cable tv division.

title: COUP ATTEMPT FAILS IN CONGO REPUBLIC
description: BRAZZAVILLE, Congo Republic, Feb. 22 (Reuters)President Marien Ngouabi appeared to have regained full control in the Congo Republic tonight after loyal army units blocked an attempted coup by military dissidents against his leftwing regime.

title: Reporter's Notebook: All Peking's a Stage
description: PEKING, Wednesday, Feb. 23It was the Nixons evening at the theater yesterday, and there was the First Lady sitting beside Chiang Ching (Mrs. Mao Tsetung)  both women with modest stage experience  watching the flaming red banners triumph in ballet over the black running dogs of capitalism and the Nationalist Chinese.

title: Muskie May Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 Senator Muskie, accused of avoiding facetoface debates by some of his opponents in New Hampshire and Florida, has announced his willingness to take part in some.

title: The City's Drug Efforts
description: Drug abuse has continued to spread and to claim an increasing number of lives, but New York City's antiaddiction efforts have remained inadequate by almost any objective standard of measurement. Lack, of solid evidence of governmental accomplishment, particularly in such vital areas as program audit and evaluation, has persuaded a group of major foundations to finance private drug council to collect needed fundamental data. In a letter published on this page today, Commissioner Graham S. Finney of the Addiction Services Agency defends this governmental record, referring to evaluations not yet made public and evidence not yet substantiated by independent review. He also refers to contract with Phoenix House Foundation, which has been running a city program for rehabilitation of addicts. City Controller Abraham Beame has been sharply critical the old contract and, as a result of his comments, A.S.A. and the Foundation have been negotiating a new one.

title: Justices Agree to Rule on Record Judgment Against Company
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Supreme Court agreed today to rule on the validity of the largest default judgment on record the $145million judgment imposed against the Hughes Tool Company when its owner, Howard R. Hughe's, refused to appear for testimony in a suit brought by Trans World Airlines.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)  The Supreme Court agreed today to hear the Government's  first antitrust challenge to a. recent trend in which large banking organizations become dominant in the statewide banking business by acquiring leading small local banks.

Mundt, Republican of South Dakota, who has been absent front the Senate for more than two years because of a stroke.

title: Firestone Profits Increase
description: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company realized a 22.7 per cent increase in earnings in its first fiscal quarter, ended Jan. 31, on a sales gain 01'9.4 per cent, the concern's report disclosed yesterday.

title: U.S. Assistance Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The United Nations has asked the United States to provide a sizablealthough still unspecifiedshare of the $627million required for humanitarian relief in Bangladesh this year.

description: Whatever the Chinese may feel toward the Russians nowadays, one debt of gratitude (two, if you include the atomic bomb) remains. It was the Russians who made it possible for the Chinese to combine toe slippers and rifles, and with splendid effect.

title: Market Place: British Reserve On Stocks, Too
description: LONDON, Feb. 22It is foggy here and the City of London, as the financial district is called, is jumping or slumping, depending on whether the establishment in question is being run by candle or electricity.

title: JOHN K. QUAD, EDITOR IN NEW BRUNSWICK
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Feb. 22John K. Quad, who retired in 1970 as executive editor of The Daily Home News here, died today in St. Peter's Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived in Highland Park.

title: P. S. C Schedules Hearing on Service By Western Union
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22The Public Service Commiision said today that it would hold a public hearing next month in its investigation of complaints about service provided by the Western Union Telegraph Comany in the state. The time and place of the hearing will be announced later.

title: Notes on People
description: Joseph Monserrat, a member of the Knapp Commission investigating alleged police corruption and a past president and present member of the Board of Education, was fined $250 in Manhattan Supreme Court and ordered jailed unless the fine is paid.

title: Mrs. Nixon Witnesses Acupuncture at Commune
description: PEKING, Wednesday, Feb. 23 (UPI)Warmly dressed in a furlined coat, Mrs. Richard M. Nixon strolled through a light snow today on a tour of a Chinese farm commune. She saw a demonstration of acupuncture medical treatment and heard children sing the praises of Chairman Mao Tsetung.

title: 2 Unseeded Players Gain In Squash Racquets Event
description: Art Kaiser of the Columbia Club and Vince Agnello of the 7th Regiment Squash Club, both unneeded, advanced to the semifinals of the 24th annual Fowler Memorial Class C invitation squash racquets tournament last night at the 7th Regiment Armory.

title: And Now a Chinese Description of the U.S.
description: The writer of the following articlethe wife of Gerald Tannebaum, an American who lived in mainland China for 26 years before returning to the United States last month,is a citizen of China and is believed to be the first to take up residence here directly as a private citizen.

title: Broken Ice
description: A  Journalistic surprise took place in the Chinese People's Republic yesterday. The official daily Jenmin Jih Pao devoted its entire first two pages to President Nixon's visit. It published a picture of him shaking hands with Chairman Mao Tsetung, as well as the texts of the Nixon and Chou Enlai speeches at Monday's banquet, and many other pictures and details about the visit hitherto available only to the outside world.

title: Officer Kills Bar Manager Over Dating of Daughter
description: YONKERS, Feb, 22 (AP)A police lieutenant who disapproved of his daughter's dating a bar manager tried to remove the girl from the bar yesterday, and in a quarrel shot the manager dead, the police said.

title: Muskie Agrees to Debate Rivals in New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N. H., Feb. 22 (AP)A spokesman for the New Hampshire Educational Television Network said today that Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine had agreed to debate the other Democratic candidates in the state's March Presidential primary on television.

title: City Will Open a School Center To Hear and Action Complaints
description: A Center for receiving and following through on complaints and Inquiries from parents and community residents about high schools, special schools and other centralized school programs will go into operation on March 1, School. Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner announced yesterday.

title: GRAEBNER BEATEN IN TENNIS UPSET
description: Alex Olmedo started the ball rolling at the Clean Air tennis tournament yesterday by recording a mild upset over Haroun Rahim, 6.2, 2.6, 76. Before the evening ended, three seeded players had been ousted in the $30,000 event at the Seventh Regiment Armory at 66th Street and Park Avenue.

title: P.B.S. to Propose Public Affairs Chief and Advisory Panel
description: The Public Broadcasting Service will make two controversial proposals to its board of directors on March 6. One calls for the appointment of an experienced journalist to coordinate public affairs programing on the nondommercial network. The other is to create a 12member advisory panel of lournalists to evaluate the service's programs and perform

title: FORDHAM DOWNS NOTRE DAME, 8972
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Feb. 22 Fordham, under its firstyear coach, Hal Wissel, crushed Notre Dame tonight before 8,902 fans, 8972, and enhanced its postseason tournament hopes. Notre Dame is coached by Digger Phelps, who directed Fordham last season.

title: 15% on Line at Lockheed Reported Missing or Idle
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)  Government auditors said today that an investigation of the Lockheed Aircraft Cbrporation's assembly line operations for the giant C5A cargo plane showed that nearly 15 per cent of the workers were not working or nowhere to be found.

title: Mrs. Charles Greenough Dies; Led Drive for Revere Painting
description: Mrs. Enid Scarritt Wales Middleton Evans Greenough, widow of Charles E. Greenough, industrialist and World War lieutenant colonel, died Sunday night at her home, 1212 Fifth Avenue. She was 87 years old.

title: Bronislava Nijinska Is Dead at 81
description: Bronislava Nijinska, whose work as a dancer and choreographer for Serge Diaghilev's Ballets Russcs in the 1920's established her as a major international dance figure, died Monday, apparently of a heart attack, at her home in Pacific Palisades, Calif. She was 81 years old.

title: Senator Gets Phone Call
description: WASHINGTON, Feb.22 (Reuters) ters) Senator Kennedy said tonight that he had spoken by telephone with his nephew Joseph after his release.

title: Pro Wrestler Wins, Dies
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Feb. 22 (AP)Luther Jacob Goodall of Gibsonville, N.C., a former Norfolk State football player, died last night.shortly after winning a professional wrestling match at Charlotte's Park Center. Goodall, 46 years old, wrestled under the name of Luther Lindsey.

title: News Analysis
description: PEKING, Feb. 22The extraordinary traordinary publidity that the Chinese authorities are suddenly giving to President Nixon's visit is spectacular and significant in itself. But the crucial questions are left dangling unanswered: What motivesdomestic as well as diplomaticprompted the Peking Government to such an elaborate display of its new and till shapeless reationship with the Unit ed ,States? What hopes, en thusiasms and policy expectations lay behind the public's enormous curiosity?

title: Talk Jockeys Ride Herd on the Phones
description: People used to listen to the radio; now sometimes the radio listens to people.

Addonizio of Newark and three codefendants, who were convicted in 1970 of extortion and conspiracy in connection with shakedowns of contractors, the United States Attorney's office here said.

title: TREASURY PRESSES CONGRESS ON GOLD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Treasury urged Congress today to pass speedily and without amendment the legislation formally devaluing the dollar by raising the official price of gold to $38 an ounce.

title: Perennial Prospect, 27, Stalks Yankee Manager
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 22  Although William Pena did not live long enough to see his grandson keep his promise to him, George Pena intends to keep it anywayif the Yankees will give him the chance.

description: AUSTERLITZ, N. Y., Feb. 22 (AP)The Interior Department has announced the designation of Edna St. Vincent Millay's 750acre estate here and the Litchfield, Conn., home a the Colonial patriot Oliver Wolcott as national historical landmarks.

title: PROF. HENRY M'DANIEL
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Feb. 22 Henry B. McDaniel, professor of education and psychology emeritus at Stanford University, died in Los Angeles on Sunday while attending a conference on high school guidance. He was 68 years old.

title: Job of Official Chinese Paper Is Not to Report News
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 22As recorder of what is considered to be news outside China, Jenmin Jih Pao would win no laurels.

title: Jefferson's Paez Chooses Rice U.
description: Bernardo Paez has made up his mindhe will play football for Rice University.

title: Dr. Jarring Tries Again
description: The precarious balance between ultimate war or peace in the Middle East was dramatically symbolized last weekend by the concurrent visits to Cairo of Marshal Andrei Grechko, the Soviet Defense Minister, and the United Nations peace envoy, Dr. Gunnar Jarring.

title: Rhodesia Ends Jailing of Todds But Limits Them to Their Ranch
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 22Former Prime Minister Garfield Todd and his daughter, Judith, were released from prison today and sent home, but they will remain in a state of detention and isolation at the Todd ranch.

title: F.T.C. Backs Bill to Submit Budget Pleas to Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23The Federal Trade Commission registered its support today for legislation allowing it and other independent regulatory agencies to submit their annual budget requests directly to Congress.

title: CLERGYMEN DISCUSS FOREST HILLS PLAN
description: Representatives of the black clergy, met at a closed session with members of the New York Board of Rabbis for. two hours yesterday to discuss their opposing views on the controversy surrounding the lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Emil Revyuk, Who Headed Ukrainian Group Here, Dies
description: Emil Revyuk, former president of the United Ukrainian Organization of the United States and editor until 1945 of Svoboda, the Ukrainianlanguage daily published in Jersey City, died Monday in a Queens nursing home. He was 84 years old and lived at 6142 78th Street, Middle Village, Queens.

title: An Appraisal
description: Bronislava Nijinska was one of the great figures of 20thcentury dance, and one of the last survivors of the Diaghilev era, which, during the first three decades of the century, completely changed the course of dance history.

title: GROVER O'NEILL A REALTY MAN, 81
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Feb. 22 Grover O'Neill, a retired investment counselor and real estate broker, died yesterday in Huntington (L. I.) Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived on Cove Road.

title: Bicentennial Panel Urges Network of Parks
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22A proposai for a series of parks to serve as the focus of the nation's 200th anniversary celebration was presented today by the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission.

title: Patrolmen Briefed on Move to Midtown Cleanup
description: The first batch of policemen assigned to reinforce police patrols in midManhattan got the official word yesterday on what to expect: an area rife with prostitutes, pimps, narcotics pushers, homosexuals, panhandlers, loiterers, robbers, pursesnatchers. illegal peddlers and illegal parkers.

title: JOB RIGHTS BILL VOTED AS SENATE ENDS FILIBUSTER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 After five weeks of debate, the Senate broke a Southern filibuster today and passed legislation giving the Equal Employment OpportunitY Commission power to move against job discrimination.

title: ForeignMoney Trading Under Ban in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 22 Argentina's government, beset by one of the gravest economic crises of this century, ordered a ban on all foreignexchange trading today until further notice. The action could be a prelude to devaluation of the peso.

title: Blacks at Michigan State Asking For Aid After Eligibility Expires
description: EAST. LANSING, Mich., Feb. 22 (UPI)  Black athletes at Michigan State University gave school officials today a list of seven proposals designed to insure black athletes an edtiation when they attend Michigan State.

title: Bradley Isn't Ready to Run    for Knicks
description: Bill Bradley was out of the lineup but not out of the spotlight last night as the New York Knicks faced the Portland Trail Blazers in a National Basketball Association game at Madison Square Garden.

Four or five tityles it struck the ground and bounced into the air surrounded by flying debriswindshield, fenders, metal panels, engine parts. When the car came to rest right side up, Ballard climbed. out with no oilier injury than a scratched forearm.

title: Princess Beris Kandaouroff doesn't regard society as more permissive these days.
description: LONDONTake one English schoolgirl in the south of France: add an migr Russian prince; multiply by 37 years of a marriage her parents didn't approve of, and the happy result today is Princess Hefts Kandaouroff.

title: The Feminization of Society
description: Female liberation has now become the talk of the world. Talk is welcome as long as it does not lead to deadend cynicism. Public fuss over the issue is all right as long as it does not divert one's attention from the real effort to gain freedom.

title: SYRACUSE TO DROP 2 SPRING SPORTS
description: Syracuse University, hoping to cut its varsity athletic budget by at least 5 per cent, will discontinue its baseball and spring track teams at the end of the current academic year in June

title: Environmental Head in Jersey Urges Dumping Far Out at Sea
description: NEPTUNE, N. J.; Feb. 22 New Jersey's Environmental Protection Commissioner Richard J. Sullivan, told officials from 15 shore towns that the only practical method of disposing of millions of gallons of sewage sludge from beachfront holding tanks was to barge it to the dead sea dumping ground 12 miles off Sandy Hook.

title: A Leader of the I.R.A. Is Arrested in Dublin
description: DUBLIN, Wednesday, Feb. 23Cathal Goulding, chief of staff of the outlawed Irish Republican Army's official wing, was arrested in Dublin early today.

title: Headmaster of the Collegiate School Is Removed
description: Paul B. Mott Jr., headmaster of the Collegiate School, the oldest independent school in the United. States and one of the most highly rated, has been relieved of his duties by the board of trustees.

description: To the Editor:

title: U.S, SEEKS TO CURB LEADED GASOLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)  The Environmental Protection Agency proposed today to require the sale of unleaded lowoctane gasoline at most of the nation's gas stations by 1974.

title: CELTICS SET BACK SUNS BY 114103
description: BOTON, Feb. 22 (AP)The Boston Celtics snapped a fourgame losing streak today by overpowering the phoenix Suns, 114103, in a National Basketball Association game at Boston Garden.

title: JERSEY TO START LAND PURCHASES
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22Administrative orders for the first land purchases under New Jersey's new $80million Green Ares program will be signed this week.

title: BOMBING BY I. R. A. KILLS 7 IN ENGLAND
description: ALDERSHOT, England, Feb. 22Seven persons, including Roman Catholic army chaplain and five women, were killed today when terrorists of the outlawed Irish Republican Army blew up an officers mess at this sprawling military camp.

title: City Parking Rules in Force
description: Theodore Karagheuzoff, the City Traffic Commissioner, yesterday reinstated alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations throughout the city, effective at 2 A.M. today. The regulations had been suspended because of ice accumulations on the streets.

title: Advertising:
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach just experienced the first nongrowth year in its 22year history. They tried it and didn't like it.

title: Londonderry Inquiry Told Of Moments Up to Killings
description: COLERAINE, Northern Ireland, Feb. 22The official British inquiry Into the killing of 13 Roman Catholics in Londondeny focused tbday on the vital question of who opened fire first in the incident: the paratroopers or the civil rights demonstrators.

title: Norfolk's Only Vehicles For Basing Set to Quit
description: NORFOLK, Va., Feb. 22 (AP)Norfolk's city bus line announced today that it will discontinue service next August, leaving the city with no way to transport 18,000 children being bused to school under a courtordered desegregation plan.

title: KNICKS CONQUER BLAZERS, 122105
description: A blistering fast break during a 45point fourth quarter gave the New York Knicks a 122105 victory over the Port land Trail Blazers at Madison Square Garden last night before a crowd of 18.211, the first lessthancapacity Knick crowd since New Year's Day.

title: Yorty Scores China Trip
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb. 22Mayor Yorty denounced President Nixon's trip to China today and accused the President of letting political expedience replace sound military judgement.

title: VILLAGE LEADERS SEE RISE IN CRIME
description: A group of Greenwich Village community leaders accused Mayor Lindsay yesterday of aggravating their crime problems by initiating a piecemeal anticrime drive in the Times Square area and ignoring other neighborhoods.

title: Levitt Sues to Test Rockefeller Budget
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22  State Controller Arthur Levitt went into court today to test the constitutionality of Governor Rockefeller's proposed $7.9billion budget for the fiscal year beginning April 1.

title: Brown Is Expected In Pacers LineUp For Nets Tonight
description: Despite the fact that he has missed the last two games because of a sprained left hand, Roger Brown is expected to be in the Indiana Pacers lineup tonight when they face the New York Nets in an American Basketball Association game at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L. I.

title: Condors Hold Off Chaps
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Feb. 22 (AP) The Pittsburgh Condors, rallied in the final minutes by George Mcdonald, held off the Dallas Chaparrals, 112105, tonight in the first American Basketball Association game played here. Mcdonald scored 36 points, including a 3point play near the end.

title: Hijackers in Aden Free All Passengers, Including Kennedy
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, Feb. 22Arab hijackers, who commandeered an Athensbound jetliner over India last night and diverted it here, today released all. 172 passengers, including Joseph P. Kennedy 3d, son of the late Robert F. Kennedy.

title: Westinghouse Sees 72 Results Topping Records Set Last Year
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 22The Westinghouse Electric Corporation expects to top 1971's record performance this year, Donald C. Burnham, chairman, told some 130 security analysts here today.

title: GINLEY'S THE NAME
description: GUMSHOE'S THE GAIHEADVT.

title: U.S. Steel Tax Case
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)  The Supreme Court let stand today a decision that adverse conditions for the United States Steel Corporation caused by World War II could be used to gain relief under the Korean War excessprofits tax law.

title: Power Restrictions Eased By British Government
description: LONDON, Feb. 22As coal supplies began to build up at Britain's power stations, the Government eased restrictions on the use of electricity tonight.

title: East Germans Relax Restriction on Visits For Easter Holidays
description: BERLIN, Feb. 22,7The East German Government announced today that in a gestiire, of goodwill it would grant visiting privileges to West Berliners in East Germany for two weeks this spring, at Easter and at Whitsunday.

title: Lakers Lose at Home
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 22 (AP) Bob Lanier's jump shot with seconds remaining in overtime gave the Detroit Pistons a 135134 overtitne victory over Los Angeles as the Lakers lost their second home game in their last 28.

title: Holy Cross Tops St. John's
description: St. John's postseason tournament hopes received a crushing blow last night at the Redmen's court in Jamaica, Queens, as Holy Cross upset Coach Frank Mulzoff's squad, 7673, before a crowd of 2,976.

title: Nuclear Power Rise Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP) By the year 2000, nuclear power plants are expected to supply from 50 per cent to 70 per cent of the nation's electric energy requirements, the Joint Committpe on Atomic Energy was told today by Milton Shaw, director of the Atomic Energy Commission's division of reactor develop, ment and technology.

title: Industry Group Comments
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI) The Lead Industries Association issued a statement criticiziing the proposals on the grounds that they were not based on solid scientific data.

title: 4 Hurt in Bomb Blast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 22 (UPI)A midday explosion here today wrecked a downtown amusement center and injured four persons, the police said.

title: No Court Action Planned
description: TORONTO, Feb. 22 (UPI)The Toronto Maple Leafs president, Harold Ballard, said today he had no plans. to take court action against Bernie Parent, reported to have agreed to jump to the World Hockey Association's Miami Screaming Eagles.

title: Forty Years Of Studying Ends in B.A.
description: After 40 years of parttime study and the last two years as a fulltime student, Mrs. Gladys Spiegela widowed grandmother who admits being near 60will receive her Bachelor of Arts degree today from the Columbia University School of General Studies.

title: Rutgers Quintet Holds Off Connecticut by 8986
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Feb. 22Rutgers. ahead early in the second half by 24 points, saw its lead shrink to 1 as Connecticut put on a furious press, but the Scarlet held on tonight for an 8986 victory.

title: Bridge:  Roth and Barbara Rappaport  Add to Laurels in Event Here
description: Alvin Roth of New York and Barbara Rappaport of East Orange, N. J., reigning national life master pair champions, were the winners again in the Greater New York Bridge Association's sectional tournament at the New York Hilton Hotel over the weekend. With Keith Garber and Dan Beaver of New York they captured the boardamatch team championship, the concluding event.

title: Turn to Pollute
description: Brazil's Planning Minister has been debited with remark that ranks with Commodore Vanderbilt's The public be damned. If Joao Paulo Velloso was correctly quoted, he observed hopefully that Brazil can become the importer of pollutiort. Endorsing a huge woodpulp project which his country would undertake for Japanese paper producers, Mr. Velloso expanded on the theme: Why not? We have a lot left to pollute. They don't.

title: Zurich Official Rules Qut a Deal for Mrs. Irving
description: While lawyers for Clifford and Edith Irving met here yesterday with a Federal prosecutor in an apparent effort to win immunity for Mrs. Irving, a prosecutor in Zurich, Switzerland, declared he would make no bargain involving her.

title: Carnegie President Asks Drive to Ease Burden on Colleges
description: Alan Pifer, president of the Carnegie Corporation of New York, called yesterday for reforms that would lighten the formidable burden the nation has placed on its higher education system.

title: Social Security Bonus Is Backed For Those Who Work Alter 65
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Senate Finance Committee voted today to provide extra Social Security benefitsafter they retireto persons who stay on their jobs past the age of 65.

title: LINDSAY AFFIRMS STAND ON BUSING
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 22Mayor Lindsay told the Florida Legislature today that he would continue to favor the busing of schoolchildren to achieve racial Integration and was willing to accept the political consequences of opposition by many voters on the issue.

title: Canadian Boxer,27, Dies After Defeat; Chuvalo Bout Off
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Feb. 22 (AP)Stewart gray, a 27yearold lightheavyweight boxer from Toronto, died late tonight from injuries suffered last night when he was knocked out by the Canadian champion, Al Sparks of Winnipeg.

title: U.S. MOVES TO CURB HOMEBUYING FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI) an effort to cut homebuying costs, George Romney said today that the government would put ceilings on settlement charges for purchasing federally insured homes.

title: Court Holds Up School Aid
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 22 (AP) A special threejudge Federal court today held up for 90 days the payment of some $24million by Pennsylvania to the state's nonpublic schools. The action was taken to permit the United States Supreme Court to decide whether the schools are entitled to the money.

title: tow Moral Standards, judge Ruled: A Case of Changing Mores
description: On alternate Fridays after work, Barbara Brienze has to run away from home, as she puts it, to claim her allotted 48 hours with her daughter Michele, aged 7, who now lives with her father.

title: A New Confrontation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22It will be surprising if President Nixon or anybody else in his official or unofficial party comes back from China unaffected by their experiences in that country. For China has a way of making its visitors think about the organization and purposes of life, and comparisons, while odious, are unavoidable.

title: NAVY YARD LOSING ANOTHER TENANT
description: Julius Lipsett, president of the Lipsett International Corporation, said yesterday that his ship  scrapping concern planned to leave the Brooklyn Navy Yard when its lease with the Commerce, Labor and Industry Corporation of Kings County (CLICK) expires on March 31.

title: Student Busing Never Big Issue Here Despite Racial Imbalance
description: Busing students to achieve racial balance in public schools, which Mayor Lindsay endorsed during his Florida campaign yesterday, has not emerged as a major issue in New York City, despite the fact that the city's schools are among the most racially imbalanced in the state.

title: Court Rejects Yorty's Bid To Get Off Florida Ballot
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 22  If you can't stand the heat, you should stay out of the kitchen, the Florida Supreme Court told Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles today.

title: S. E. C Asked to Delay Proposal On BrokerFirm Memberships
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. asked the Securities and Exchange Commission today to delay implementation of its proposal that some but not all brokerage firms affiliated with financial institutions be permitted to be members of stock exchanges.

title: Blockades to Welfare Reform
description: Defeatism among liberals is once again aiding Senate conservatives in their effort to kill welfare reform. Senator Ribicoff of Connecticut, a longtime battler for progressive overhaul of the welfare system, almost deserted the fight a month ago because of doubts about the genuineness of the Administration's attachment to its own program for a Federal floor under family income.

title: Mrs. Perkins Bass, 52, Wife Of Former Representative
description: PETERBOROUGH, N.H., Feb. 22  Mrs. Katharine Jackson Bass, wife of Perkins Bass, lawyer and former member of the House of Representatives and Republican National Committeeman, died of cancer on Saturday in Hobe Sound, Fla. She was 52 years old.

title: RANGERS TROUNCE CANADIENS BY 73 WITH LATE RALLY
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 22The New York Rangers rallied from a threegoal deficit tonight and routed the Montreal Canadiens, 73. Six New.York goals were scored in the final period when the Canadiens defense fell apart.

title: Bill Rates Are Mixed In Treasury Auction
COURT WILL RULE ON TEXTBOOK RENT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The supreme Court agreed today to decide if the New York Legislature violated the Federal Constitution in 1965 when it voted to purchase books and lend them to all school children in the higher grades but allow local school boards to require children in the lower grades to rent their texts.

title: Court Upholds the Legislature On December Redistricting Plan
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22Citing the shape of rivers, lakes and mountains, a State Supreme Court justice today upheld the Legislature's new reapportionment plan, ruling that jagged, meandering lines do not necessarily add up to gerrymander.

title: A Justice Refuses Motion to Dismiss Panthers Charges
description: A State Supreme Court Justice refused yesterday to dismiss murder and arson charges against five Black Panthers whose lawyers had argued last week that prejudicial pretrial publicity would deny the defendants a fair trial.

title: EAST GERMANS SET CAPITALISM'S END
description: BERLIN, Feb. 22Erich Honecker, East Germany's party chief, has moved to wipe out all remnants of capitalism and make the country's few remaining private concerns surrender their ent(.prises to the state.

title: Downtown Hotel Era Fading
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Feb. 22  Ten Presidents have slept in the 57yearold Hotel Muehlebach, each reassured of his importance and dignity by its handrubbed oak paneling, its burnished marble floors and its gleaming brass fittings.

title: PERKINELMER SET TO BUY MULTIAMP
description: The PerkinElmer Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire the MultiAmp Corporation, which provides equipment for testing electrical protective devices.

title: MURPHY ATTACKS U.S. DRUG EFFORTS
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, speaking at the opening session yesterday of public hearings by the National Commission on Marihuana and Drug Abuse, described. the Federal investment in drug control as a little like pouring a glass of ice water on a forest fire.

title: Gori Named Soccer Coach
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Feb. 22 (AP)Adolfo Gori, a 14year soccer performer, was selected today to be playercoach of the Rochester Lancers of the North American Soccer League Gori, a defenseman with the Lancers last year, arrived from: his native Italy yesterday.

description: CHICAGO, Feb. 22 (AP)The Chicago Bulls outshot the hapless Philadelphia 76ers tonight in a loosely played N.B.A. contest for a 11988 victory.

title: Lindsay Administration Fights Antipoverty Elections on Saturday
description: The Lindsay administration took two steps yesterday to oppose the plan of the Council Against Poverty to hold elecions of local antipoverty hoards on the Jewish Sabbath.

title: lonesco Takes Only Role In Slime, His First Film
description: PARIS, Feb. 22 yugene Ionesco sprang another surprise last week. He appeared as a movie actor in a film called La Vase (Slime), which he has written and in which he is the sole performer.blanketed in a rocker, visited night after night by depressing visions.

title: Cards Get Anderson, Send Lane to Packers
description: Donny Anderson, who once signed the richest contract in pro football's history, and MacArthur Lane, who contended he was never paid enough, switched teams yesterday. The Green Bay Packers sent Anderson, a 29yearold running back, to the St. Louis Cardinals in an even exchange for Lane, 30yearold runner.

title: SENATE'S LEADERS OFFER BUSING BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 Senate leaders introduced cornpromise legislation today that would prohibit busing to achieve school desegregation if it would risk the health of the children involved or retard their education.

title: OUTCOME UNCERTAIN IN SALVADOR VOTING
description: SAN SALVADOR, Feb. 23 (Reuters)The opposition candidate, Jose Napoleon Duarte, reeinerged today as a possible contender for the presidency after the announcement of election results in the most populous province.

title: The Girl Who Grew Up in Center Court
description: FT. LAUDERDALE, Fla.Christine Marie Evert, the little angel of tennis whose silver cloud carried her to the center court at Forest Hills nearly six months ago, is discovering that growing older while in the public spotlight can have its problems.

title: MAPLE LEAFS TOP PENGUINS BY 20
description: TORONTO, Feb. 23 (UPI)Bernie Parent, who may be playing his final season with Toronto, turned in a shutout tonight as goals by Brad Sel wood and Ron Ellis powered, the Maple Leafs to a 20 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in the National Hockey, League.

title: TV: WNET Moves Into News With 51st State
description: After months of planning, weeks of experimenting and, finally, hours of nervous hesitating, Channel 13WNET has been delivered of a nightly news program. Called the 51st State, it was quitetly slipped into the schedule two and a half weeks ago and is being pre tented at 10 P.M. Monday through Friday.

title: Lillian Weiss, a Writer On Home Decorating, Dies
description: Lillian Weiss, a writer and editor who specialized in home decorating, died Tuesday morning after a brief illness. She lived at 360 West 55th Street.

title: Roaming Catholics
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn.  I was born and raised a Roman. Catholic. was an altar boy, I never missed mass, I went to confession and communion regularly, I ate fish on Friday, thought there were two kinds of people: Catholics and nonCatholics, I considered becoming a priestand I did become a chaplain's aide in the Navy and I met a Catholic girl and we had a Catholic wedding.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Deputy Premier... at 67 years probably the hardestworking senior official in China after indefatigable Premier Chou Enlai... has assumed heavy burden of duties in fields of finance, economy, trade and foreign affairs... sole survivor at top, Politburo level of band of key administrators with which Premier Chou surrounded himself at beginning of Communist rule in China... only active Deputy Premier today of total of 15 approved at last meeting of National People's Congress in 1965... believed to stand last among seven Politburo members with significant influence... was Finance Minister and Deputy Premier before Cultural Revolution but has not been give title of Finance Minister since then, though this may he result of enlargement of his duties... was carpenter before he joined a Communistled uprising in his native province of Hupeh in 1927... is married and wife, Lin Chiais Government official.

title: MISS DAVIS FREED ON $102,500 BAIL
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Feb. 23 Angela Davis, jailed for 16 months while facing murder charges, was released on $102,500 bail here tonight.

title: LETHAM BOWIE
description: Letham Bowie, president of A. H. Bowie & Son, a monument memorial contractor in Long Island City, died on Monday in Elmhurst General Hospital, Queens. He was 78 years old and lived at 152 East 94th Street.

title: CURB ON POPPIES HELD UNREALISTIC
description: Myles J. Ambrose, recently appointed by President Nixon to lead a new Federal agency to combat drug pushers at the street level, said yesterday that the idea of checking heroin smuggling by halting the growing of opium poppies around the world was one of those magicwand statements born in ignorance.

title: Weis, Voisin &
description: Arthur J. Levine was elected chairman and chief executive officer yesterday of Weis, Voisin & Co., Inc., a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Advertising:
description: When Joseph R. Daly, president of Doyle Dane Bernbach, told the annual meeting Tuesday, We'll lose some this year, that's part of the game, he was prophetic.

title: STOCKS MEANDER AS RALLY FIZZLES
description: The stock market shuffled sideways again yesterday in fairly active trading. An effort at a morning rally that fizzled in the afternoon virtually mirrored Tuesday's performance.

description: To the Editor: I would like to suggest another dimension to a recent news story on Judge Botter's historic ruling that New Jersey's property tax is an unconstitutional means of raising local school revenue.

title: Dublin Arrests 8 Leaders of the I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Feb. 23  Eight leading members of the Irish Republican Army were seized today amid indications that the Irish Government was planning a crackdown on the guerrilla group.

title: StudentDevised High School Courses Weighed
description: The city's school Chancellor, Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, is considering a plan to let high school students devise their own courses and even take parttime outside work for credit towar da diploma.

title: Marquess of Salisbury Is Dead; Served in Conservative Cabinets
description: LONDON, Feb. 23The Marquess of Salisbury, whose family has played a notable part in British political history for the last 400 years, died at his home in Hatfield, Hertfordshire, today. He was 78 years old.

title: Miss Davis Wins Position On Communist Committee
description: Three top officers have been reelected by the Communist Party, U.S.A., and Angela Davis, a party member awaiting trial on California charges of murder, has been elected to a new 60member central committee

title: City Aides Ordered to Appear At State Hearing on Civil Jail
description: ALBANY, Feb. 23The State Commission of Correction has ordered city officials to appear at a hearing on March 16 to justify the continued operation of the city's civil jail building.

title: Jesus People Think They Have a Fertile Field in West Germany
description: ESSEN, West GermanyThe Jesus People are convinced they have found fertile new ground in the working class districts of Essen and elsewhere in the industrial heart of West Germany.

description: To the Editor:

title: Hijackers Surrender
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, Feb. 23 (Reuters)The Palestinian commandos who hijacked the German jet to Aden released the 14 crew members and surrendered to Yemeni authorities tonight.

title: BOND PRICES OFF; VOLUME IS LARGE
description: While the bond market shuffled its way yesterday toward slightly lower prices and somewhat higher interest rates, a large volume of financing was done.

title: Sidney Hollander Dead at 90; Long Active in Social Welfare
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 23Sidney Hollander, industrialist and for many years a national leader in social welfare, died today in Sinai Hospital. His 90th birthday was celebrated last Dec. 29.

title: MRS. DAVID ROVNER
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Feb. 23Mrs. Clara Rosen Rovner, former chairman of the women's division of the American Jewish Congress, died of heart ailment yesterday in Holy Cross Hospital. She was 72 years old and lived at 15620 Riverside Drive West, New York. Mrs. Rovner was the widow of David Rovner, bookstore owner in New York, who died in 1957.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Books of The Times
description: The Theater for Ideaswhich Is what this clumsily titled but nonetheless interesting book is aboutis, according to the introductory note by the editor, Alexander Klein, a group of some one hundred heterogeneous intellectualswriters, artists, scholarswho meet in New York City, usually privately, for panel discussions of the arts, culture, and politics, as well as for advance performances of new works in theater, music, dance and film. Shirley Broughton, its continuing director, founded Theater for Ideas in 1961, and she has had advice in planning the forums chiefly from Elizabeth Hardwick and Robert Silvers of New York Review.

title: Chess: Dutch Match Shows That Class Will Usually Decide
description: When young Hans Reetied for first place in last year's Dutch championship with Jan Hein Donner, the only active grandmaster in the Netherlands, and then nosed the latter out on tiebreaking points to be awarded the title, there was some skepticism about whether the result accurately reflected the relative strengths of the two players.

title: Mrs. Nixon Accompanies President to Great Wall
description: PEKING, Thursday, Feb. 24 (UPI)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon rose early today to accompany her husband on his first sightseeing tour in China, a visit to the Great Wall.

title: Display of U.S.China Goodwill Causing Apprehension in Japan
description: TOKYO, Feb. 23Feelings of apprehension are becoming evident among Japanese Government officials as President Nixon and Chinese leaders smile upon one another each night on Japanese television screens.

title: Nixon Talks Further With Chou And Drives to View Great Wall
description: PEKING, Thursday, Feb. 24 President Nixon logged four more hours of private conversations with Premier Chou Enlai yesterday and went off this morning to view the Great Wall of China and the historic Ming tombs.

title: DOCTOR'S WIFE SLAIN IN BROOKLYN HOME
description: Mrs. Katherine Battaglia, 32 years old, was stabbed to death yesterday afternoon in her apartment at 65 Oriental Boulevard in the Manhattan Beach section of Brooklyn, according to the police.

title: White Wins It for Celtics
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 23  Jo Jo White's jumper from the top of the key with 13 seconds to play tonight gave the Boston Celtics a 113111 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Soviet Discloses Scope of Setbacks in South Caused by Snows in January
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 23  The Soviet Union disclosed today the full extent of economic setbacks suffered last month as a result of unusual cold and heavy snow in the southern regions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Torn Wicker, in his column of Feb. 15, finds little to commend in the prospect of a Constitutional amendment to prohibit compulsory busing. As one noted for eminent reasonableness, he says many things that merit careful discussion, particularly when he questions the relevance of a supposed interaction between spending lots of money and hoping to achieve that mythical condition now known as quality education.

title: Johnny Carson Program Moves to West Coast May 1
description: The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson will originate from the West Coast, beginning May 1, the National Broadcasting Company announced yesterday.

title: MANHATTAN KEEPS MET. TRACK TITLE
description: Manhattan survived a series of surprises and escaped with another Metropolitan intercollegiate indoor track and field championship last night at the 168th Street Armory.

title: President Won't Write Off Any State in 72 Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) President Nixon told Republican Governors today that he would mount a campaign for all 50 states for the Presidential election next November.

title: How Proposals Would Affect Real Estate Taxes
Arms Limitation or Arms Race?
description: WASHINGTON President Nixon's $6billion new defense requests call for an increase of more than a billion dollars for new strategic weapons. At the same time, concrete results on the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks have again been postponed, at least until he goes to Moscow.

title: Fregosi Fields Queries at Hot Corner
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 23The New York Mets held their first full workout of spring training today with 38 men in uniform, one holdout who hit 236 last year and one established third baseman who had never before played the position.

title: C. W. Post Tops Stony Brook
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Feb. 23 Four C. W. Post players hit double figures in defeating Stony Brook, 8066, tonight. Ed Miller led the Pioneers with 19 while Pete Haubner added 14. Atr King of the losers took game honors with 25 points. Post is now 149 wonlost, while Stony Brook is 18 and 10.

title: State Jobless Rate Hits 6.5% in January, a 9Year High
description: Unemployment in New York State soared to 6.5 per cent in January, the highest in nine years. In the city, the jobless rate rose to 5.7 per cent, the highest since 1966.

title: 4 Philharmonic Musicians To Retire at Season's End
description: Four musicians whose service with the New York Philharmonic totals 139 years will retire from the orchestra at the end of this season.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: America's national gymnastics coach was extremely impressed but not surprised by the quality of the Chinese gymnasts who performed yesterday in Peking for President Nixon.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The United States Atomic Energy Commission has awarded a $60million contract for the manufacture of nuclear components to the United Nuclear Corporation of Elmsford, N. Y., David F. Shaw, chairman of United Nuclear announced yesterday. The work will be done in New Haven and Montville, Conn., and deliveries will be spread over the next four years.

title: A Spittoon Like Mao's Catches on as Souvenir
description: PEKING, Feb. 23 (Reuters) The two white porcelain spittoons in Chairman Mao Tsetung's study have become famous around the world.

title: Advertising:
description: Now that they think they've got all the bugs out their new system, the people at J. Walter Thompson are ready to announce that their regionalized, computerized broadcast spotbuying setup is operational.

title: Harvard Sextet Sets Back Princeton in Ivy Test, 90
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 23Bill Corkery and Bob Bayern scored two goals each tonight to pace Harvard to a 90 hockey victory over Princeton.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Feb. 24, Thursday (UPI)A 77yearold woman was burned to death in her home here last night, the police said. A preliminary investigation indicated she had apparently fallen asleep while smoking a cigarette. She was identified as Mrs. Ellen Daly, 7.7, of 421 Secatogue Avenue.

title: General Returns to U. S.
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 23 (AP) General Thi arrived in Los Angeles from Saigon today and said that he had been treated as an enemy who is feared beyond reason.

title: Cook Has Third Operation
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 23 (UPI) Greg Cook, the Cincinnati Bengals quarterback who recently announced he would retire from football, underwent surgery in his right shoulder for the third time today at the Cleveland Clinic. Dr. H. Roger Collins, who performed the, surgery, termed the results encouraging.

title: JEANNE A. PHILIPPE
description: Jeanne A. Philippe, a supervisor of nurses in the psychiatric department of Bellevue Hospital, died of cancer on Tuesday in Doctors Hospital. She was 52 years old and lived at 20 Park Avenue.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: First Bancshares of Florida, Inc., a Boca Ratonbased holding company for six banks, raised an indicated $4.4million yesterday with the sale of 2uu,000 shares at a price of $22. The offering was managed by a Drexel FirestoneFirst Equity Corporation of Florida syndicate.

title: J.D.L. Aide Freed of Charge
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 23 (UPI) A charge of assault with intent to commit murder against the Los Angeles head of the Jewish Defense League in an alleged shooting attack against an American Nazi leader was dropped today for lack of evidence. Chief Deputy District Attorney John Howard said there would be no criminal complaint filed against Irving S. Rubin, 26 years old, of Northbridge, Joe Tommasi, head of a Los Angeles area organization of the National Socialist White People's party, told the police that two or three shots were fired at him Feb. in suburban El Monte.

title: Cougars Sink Floridians
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb. 23 (AP)  The Carolina Cougars moved into a tie for fourth place in the A.B.A.'s Eastern Division with a 132118 victory I over the Floridians tonight.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Newly appointed Minister of Foreign Affairs... army doctor turned diplomat... technocrat and not decision maker... not member of party's Central Committee or Deputy Premier... Now 61, served for 16 years as Deputy Foreign Minister... occasion for promotion was death from cancer in January of Chen Yi, who had long held post... Mr. Chi graduated from military medical college and began career in army in 1929... joined Communists and became director of medical department of Communist armies in Yenan from 1936 to 1939 shifted to diplomacy in 1950 and sent to East Germany as Peking's representative.... Became Deputy Foreign Minister in 1955... tall and widejawed, manner is discreet and sober in contrast to smiling Chiao Kuanhua, Deputy Foreign Minister, who is better known abroad... Mr. Chi so far has received no visiting newsmen or acted alone as foreign affairs spokesman in meetings with visiting foreigners.

title: Monsanto Executive Resigns Top Posts
description: The Monsanto Company announced yesterday that Edward J. Bock, its 55yearold president, had decided to take early retirement. Mr. Bock is resigning as president and chief executive officer and will not stand for reelection as a director at the company's annual meeting March 23.

title: Thieu Is Known to Be Worried About U.S.China Discussions
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23President Nixon's visit to Peking has not aroused intense! interest here except among! politicians, most of whom are welcoming it cautiously in the hope that somehow it will shorten the Vietnam war. But, President Nguyen Van Thieu is! known to be worried.

title: Sales Tax in Mt. Vernon
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Feb. 23 (AP)Mayor August Petrillo today signed into law a 1 per cent city sales tax to take effect June 1.

title: Casey Parries a Senator Over Membership Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, sidestepped a confrontation today with a key Senator over the issue of who may be a member of a stock exchange.

title: 4 Inches of Snow Fall Before Turning to Rain
description: Four inches of snow had fallen on the city by early morning, according to the National Weather Service.

title: Argentina Devalues Her Peso by 9.2%
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 23The Argentine peso was devalued by 9.2 per cent today through a modification of exchange regulations for imparts and exports.

title: ExPolice Official Guilty Of Contempt Court Here
description: A Criminal Court jury in Manhattan convicted a former assistant chief inspector of police, Thomas C. Renaghan. of one count of contempt of court last night and acquitted him on another.

title: Levitz Furniture Defends Stock's Floating Supply
description: The Levitz Furniture Corporation yesterday defended its position in three current investigations involving trading in its common stock, and said that the float of its securities was considered adequate by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthe counter market finished mixed yesterday in moderate trading after some late weakness erased many earlier gains.

title: BIG BOARD'S DEFICIT WIDENED LAST YEAR
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday a loss of $16.7million for 1971, reflecting expenditures of $35.4million for the Big Board's customer asistance program.

title: Teacher Accuses L.I. Board of Bias On Maternity Leave
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Feb. 23  A woman school teacher charged today that she had been the victim of sex discrimination when the Hauppauge School District refused to permit her to take paid sick leave for the birth of her baby, insisting instead that she be placed on unpaid maternity leave.

title: Kennedy in Frankfurt After Hijacking
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Thursday, Feb. 24 (AP) Joseph P. Kennedy 3d, free from captivity aboard a hijacked airliner, stopped here early today on his way home to New York. The hijacking incident, meanwhile, ended with the announcement of the release by the Arab hijackers of the jumbo jet and 14 crew members remaining in Aden, Southern Yemen.

title: FREDERICK FAIRCHILD
description: DARIEN, Conn., Feb. 23Frederick T. Fairchild, long associated with the New York Life Insurance Company, died yesterday in St. Joseph's Hospital, Stamford. He was 64 years old and lived at 9 Edgerton Court.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator William Proxmire showed up at a committee hearing with gauze bandages covering his head, and made no bones about why. On Tuesday night, Feb. 22, I began treatment for hair transplants, he said in a prepared statement.

title: Oil Spill on Alaska Run Put at 392 Barrels a Day
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 The Coast Guard has reported, on the basis of a study, that 392 barrels of oil a day could be spilled by tankers on the route to West Coast ports from the southern end of the planned Alaska pipeline.

title: More Photos in Newspaper
description: PEKING, Feb. 23 (Reuters) Jenmin Jih Pao, the Chinese Communist party newspaper, printed four more pictures today relating to President Nixon's mission to Peking, but the article was relegated to a position at the bottom of Page 1.

title: Klein Finds Backing for Trip
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Feb. 23 (AP)Herbert G. Klein, White House communications director, said today he had found very strong support from the American people for the President's trip to China. Mr. Klein was here to campaign for Mr. Nixon for the New Hampshire primary on March 7.

title: Rises in Transit Fares and Property Taxes Among Causes
description: The nickel increase in the transit fare helped to push the Consumer Price Index up sharply last month in the metropolitan area, the Bureau of Labor Statistics said yesterday.

title: Court Voids a Conviction For Illegal Bill Collections
description: Shepherd Boneparth. owner of a Harlem furniture store won a reversal yesterday of his convictions on charges of using a deceptive collection device to victimize customers.

title: NewSouth Politics Found to Be Not So New
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23What ever happened to the politics of the New South? In 1970, a group of previously unknown moderates were elected Governors of Southern states, many of them beating segregationists. There were Jimmy Carter in Georgia, Reubin Askew in Florida, Dale Bumpers in Arkansas, John C. West South Carolina. Then, in 1971, and early 1972, William L. Waller of Mississippi and Edwin Edwards of Louisiana also won.

title: Complex Rome Trial Opens in Bomb Death of 16
description: ROME, Feb. 23Leftist demonstrations, police sorties and intensive security measures marked the opening today of one of the most emotioncharged and complex political trials here since the fall of Fascism.

title: Justices Rule Hartke Election Is Subject to Recount in Indiana
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23The Supreme Court ruled today that Senator Vance Hartke's apparent election victory in 1970 over former Representative Richard L. Roudebush was subject to a recount in Indiana. It was the first time the Court has ruled on the constitutionality of state recount procedures.

title: Yale to Pay Taxes on Mellon Art Center
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 23Yale University and the City of New Haven have reached an agreement that will permit the university to go ahead with the construction of its $10million Paul Mellon Center for British Art while keeping the site on the city's tax role.

title: Teacher Struck With a Hammer And Pushed Down School Steps
description: A white teacher in Brooklyn was struck on the head with a hammer and pushed down flight of stairs yesterday morning by two black youths described as in their late teens. It was the fourth time in three months that a teacher has been attacked at the school.

title: Contract Sharpens Blomberg's Appetite
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 23Ron Blomberg, who loves baseball almost as much as he loves food, came to town today. He spent most of his time discussing his 1972 salary with Lee MacPhailand eating.

title: Pragmatic Solution Sought on Taiwan Newsmen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 23Secretary General Waldheim told a group of American news executives today that he would search for a pragmatic solution permitting the reaccreditation of two Chinese Nationalist correspondents who were ousted from the United Nations headquarters in December.

title: The Long Wait in State Lottery
description: At 10 o'clock yesterday morning, 14 family groups clustered tensely over barely sipped cups of coffee in the Oval Room of the Roosevelt Hotel waiting out the two hours before one of them would be selected as the New York State Lottery winner of $25,000 a year for the rest of their lives.

title: U.S. Raises Quota For Sugar Supplies Under Official Act
description: The Agriculture Department yesterday increased raw sugar supplies in this country by adding 100,000 tons to the 1972 sugarmarketing quota.

title: P.S.A.L. Title Basketball Scheduled for March 5
description: The Public Schools Athletic League's championship besketball will be played Sunday, March 5, at Columbia University, it was announced yesterday.

title: Jarring Confers With Hussein, Is Due to Go to Israel on Friday
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 23Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations peace envoy for the Middle East, conferred in Amman today with King Hussein and other Jordanian officials and returned to his provisional headquarters in Cyprus late in the day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Guidelines Set for Decontrolled Rents
description: New Federal guidelines were set yesterday for apartments in New York that became decontrolled last July when they became vacant. The guidelines also affect any controlled or stabilized apartments that become vacant from now on.

title: Stalin Daughter Disputes Husband On Separation
description: PARADISE VALLEY, Ariz., Feb. 23  William Wesley Peters and his wife, Svetlana Alliluyeva Peters, Stalin's daughter, are living nine miles apart but disagree over whether they are separated.

title: ARGENTINA IS COOL TO PLAN ON CUBA
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 23 Argentina is quietly opposing a plan, sponsored by Chile and Peru, to reconsider the isolation imposed on Cuba by the Organization of American States.

title: SALE OF CAMPUS OPPOSED AT N.Y.U.
description: Hardly a student at New York University's 47acre campus in the Bronx favors its proposed sale to the State University of New York.

title: Wise Gets 50 Points
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Feb. 23 (AP)  Willie Wise scored a career high of 50 points tonight as he led the Utah Stars to a 133116 trouncing of the Kentucky Colonels.

title: Rider Subdues Hofstra
description: TRENTON, Feb. 23 (AP) Rider squandered a ninepoint lead in the final 4 minutes tonight but came back in overtime to, trip Hofstra, 8176. Steve Jefferson paced Rider with 20 points and 19 rebounds. Dave Bell of Hofstra took scoring honors with 21 points.

title: Bridge: OutofTown Players Take Most Metropolitan Unit Titles
description: Players from many other parts of the country competed here last weekend in the tournament organized by the Metropolitan Bridge Unit of the American Bridge Association, and won nearly all the titles.

title: 6,000 in 19 States Take Uniform Bar Examination
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 23Jim Shafter, Alison Edwards and 6,000 other aspiring lawyers made history today.

title: Religious Group Will Stress SpanishSpeaking Minority
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI) The National Conference of Christians and Jews announced today that it would focus its brotherhood commitment emphasis for 1972 on the Spanish speaking minority in the United States.

title: Executive Changes
description: Michael Levinson has rejoined Dominick & Dominick, Inc., members of the New York Stock Exchange, as a vice president in the international area.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Top military figure, having taken over functions former ly exercised by Defense Minister Lin Piao... One of deputy chairmen of Communist party's military affairs commission, but seems to exercise power as its apparent executive director... Ranks fourth in party's ruling Politburo... has had most dealings with American officials, aside from Premier Chou Enlai... One of 10 marshals in Communist forces before ranks were abolished... In 1920's, while instructing in military academy headed by Chiang Kaishek, was persuaded by Mr. Chou, academy's political commissar, to join party... Attended Sun Yatsen University in Moscow then became chief of staff of party army in Kiangsi... drafted plan for Long March in 1934 from Kiangsi to north Shensi and later became chief of staff of all Communist forces Served in 193738 as Communist liaison officer with Nationalists during the war with Japanese... 73 years old... amiable manner ?? steely qualities.

title: Income Tax Rates Proposed in Jersey
description: Following is the income tax rate schedule recommended in the report of the New Jersey Tax Policy Committee:

title: Dave Shade, Boxer, Dead; Once Held Australian Title
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 23 (UPI) Dave Shade, who held the middleweight boxing crown of Australia and New Zealand briefly in 193334, collapsed and died yesterday on a street corner. He was 69 years old.

title: OLMEDO NASTASE VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: There's one thing you can say about oldtimers: they have patience. Nobody proved this any better last night at the Clean Air tennis tournament than 36yearold Alex Olmedo, who gave young Dick Stockton a lesson in that virtue.

title: Supreme Court Asked for First Amendment Rule Protecting News Sources
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 A news blackout concerning dissident groups and the drug counterculture will settle over the press, the Supreme Court was told today, if newsmen are forced to testify about information given them in confidence.

title: Bankers Trust Forecasts Higher ShortTerm Rates
description: Shortterm interest rates in the United States are at low point at the present time, and should begin to rise shortly, the Bankers Trust Company predicted yesterday. At a news conference held in connection with the publication of his bank's annual investment outlook, Edmund F. Ebert, executive vice president of Bankers Trust, said that our evaluation is that rates have about hit bottom.

title: SCOTT SCORES 46 AS SQUIRES WIN
description: NORFOLK, Va., Feb. 23 (AP)  Charlie Scott snapped a weeklong scoring slump and scored 46 points tonight to lead the Virginia Squires to a 121105 American Basketball Association victory over the Memphis Pros.

title: Henry H. Rousseau, 63, Headed FritoNew York
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Feb. 23Henry Harwood Rousseau, former director of FritoLay Inc. of Dallas and president of FritoNew York, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, while visiting friends in New York. He was 63 years old and lived at 1009 Redding Road and Blue Hill, Me.

title: Dance: Welcome, joffrey
description: The City Center Joffrey Ballet arrived back in town last night, and even despite the snow, it was welcome. When the Joffrey dancers are at home at the City Center the town is that much brighter and happier. The company opened this year with a fairly familiar program. Kettentanz, Feast of Ashes and Trinity, but each ballet seemed to be danced a little better than ever before. The company; even at this first glance, is clearly in great condition.

title: BULLINS CRITICIZES STAGING OF DUPLEX
description: Ed Bullins, on of the theater's leading black playwrights, yesterday accused the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center of turning his play, The Duplex, from a serious work to a stereotyped musical.

title: SPLIT DELAYS FUNDS FOR RADIO IN EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 Senate and House conferees failed to reach agreement today on further funds for Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty, the Americanrun stations whose Congressional support ended last night.

title: Fear of Opposition Seen in Saigon's Ban on General
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23  A former senior South Vietnamese Army commander with ties to the antiGovernment Buddhists was barred from returning from exile in the United States today because President Nguyen Van Thieu apparently feared he might become a focus for increased opposition.

title: All 69 Matisse Bronzes Shown
description: The Museum of Modern Art's new exhibition, The Sculpture of Matisse, which opens to the public today, brings together for the first time all 69 of Matisse's known bronzes in a spacious, airy installation that could be more satisfying only if the sculptures could have been left unprotected. Their malleable look, making them seem to have come direct from Matisse's hands (as in essence they have), demands that they be touched to complete an extraordinary impression of direct contact with the artist.

title: 2 Vermeers Are Found By Curator
description: The HAGUE, Feb. 23Nearly a year after his first impression that they might be original works, Dr. D. Hannema of the HannemaDestuers Foundation in the Netherlands said today that he had discovered two Jan Vermeer paintings.

title: Rangers Beat Flyers for Fifth Time, 43
description: After their magnificent rally against Montreal on Tuesday night, it would have been too much to expect the New York Rangers to duplicate that scoring spree against Philadelphia in Madison Square Garden last night.

title: ALFRED NIEMANN, MACY'S EXECUTIVE
description: Alfred Paul Niemann, senior vice president for personnel of Macy's New York, died Tuesday evening, apparently of a heart attack, while on his way home. He was 46 years old and lived at 342 South Kilburn, Road, Garden City, L. I.

title: Personal Finance
description: How do you like the idea of paying 9 per cent interest to get a home mortgage loan?

description: LONDON, Feb. 23  Japan again led the world in shipbuilding last year, turning out more tonnage than any country ever has before in a single year and besting the previous record by the United States during World War II.
