title: Article 6  No Title
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 23 Chinese gymnastics, which President Nixon viewed in Peking today, is, as old as China herself. There are records of gymnasts performing before emporers 2.000 years. ago.

title: Rep. Dowdy Gets 18 Months, $25,000 Fine in Bribery Case
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 23Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, was sentenced to 18 months In jail and $25,000 fine today in Federal Court before Judge Roszel C. Thomsen.

title: Prison Stabbings In Jersey Are Laid To a Drug Racket
description: TRENTON, Feb. 23  The decision by a drug ring controlled by white prisoners in Trenton State Prison to charge black prisoners twice as much as whites for drugs was the cause of recent stabbling attacks at the prison, according to the head of the correction officers union.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Rugged Barriers
description: PEKING, Thursday, Feb. 24 There is talk of exchanges in the airof people, performers, ideas and goodsthat makes it timely to consider the difficulties as well as the opportunities such contacts offer to both Americans and Chinese. Starting the relationship, though it took more than 20 years, may turn out to have been the easy part of the exercise.

title: St. Peter's Triumphs, 11698
description: Despite a 40point outburst by Kenny Lam, St. Francis went down to defeat, 11698, at the hands of St. Peter's last night in Brooklyn. The victors were led by Ted Martiniuk and Howie Anderson with 28 and 25 points, respectively.

title: Age Bias Victims Told by State Unit To Come Forward
description: Victims of job discrimination who are older than 40 must come forward to help prosecute offending employers if they wish to save themselves and other older workers from future of bleak downward mobility, the city's Human Rights Commission said yesterday.

title: Indian Press Is Critical
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 23 (AP)Indian, newspapers took.a generally critical view today of President Nixon's visit to China, possibly reflecting the concern of Prime Minister Indira.Grandhi's Government at what may be happening in the meetings.

title: Town Said to Be Retaken
description: VIENTIANE, Feb. 23 (Reuters)  American sources reported today that Laotian Government troops reoccupied the southern town of Dong Hene last night.

title: GROUP BIDS TO BAR T.I.C. OMEGA DEAL
description: A group of stockholders sued in United States District Court here yesterday to block a proposed merger of the Transcontinental Investing Corporation and OmegaAlpha, Inc.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The gambling gentry has not yet outraged the proprieties by setting up a winter book on the various gold medal winners at the Olympic Games in Munich next summer. But if such a listing ever were made, there would be no hesitation in determining the one best of all, the man most likely to become an Olympic champion.

description: The Ming Tombssituated in a natural valley a short drive north of Pekingare the, burial place of 13 of the Emperors of the Ming Dynasty (13681644), their Empresses and second wives.

description: To the Editor:

title: General Motors Faces Suit On Engine Mount Defects
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 23 (UPI) A $1.26billion classaction lawsuit was filed against the General Motors Corporation today, charging that it, failed to make effective repairs on 6.7 million Chevrolets that are being recalled because of defective motor mounts.

title: Muskie Is Challenged To Disclose Finances
description: Stewart R. Mott challenged Senator Edmund S. Muskie yesterday to disclose his Presidential campaign finances and also to list the names of all his contributors.

title: Prof. Irwin Corey, Master of an Art, Is Performing Here
description: Irwin Corey, the apoplectic professor of perverse pedantry, is currently presenting his credentials as an outstandingup comic at the Upstairs at the. Downstairs.

title: A New Yiddish Weekly Makes Its Appearance
description: A new Yiddish language weekly newspaper, Der Algemeiner Journal, published its first issue yesterday. It is aimed, its editor said, at the 38,000 readers of the defunct DayJewish Morning Journal.

title: Do Sees No Gains
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23 (UPI)Tran Van Do said in a telephone interview today that he did not think the meeting accomplished much.

title: FOE SAID TO DRIVE LAOTIANS OFF HILL
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 23 (Agence FrancePresse)  An enemy counterattack against Laotian troops who had recaptured the southern part of the strategic Plaine des Jarres was reported here today by military sources.

title: No Drums, No Bugles'
description: "No Drums, No Bugles," which opened yesterday at the Coronet Theater, is not a good movie, but it is a drama of conscience made with such obvious sincerity, with such small financial means and with such limited artistic imagination, that one would like to be kind to it, as if to someone who suffers certain very severe physical handicaps. To be kind, however, is to employ the same sort of fuzzy thoughtfulness used by Clyde Ware, the novelist ("The Innocents," "The Eden Tree") who wrote, directed and produced the film, which is his first.Ashby Gatrell (Martin Sheen) is a young West Virginia farmer who cannot bring himself to fight against either the North or South during the Civil War. In desperation, he abandons his wife and child and hunting dog and spends the three years of the war hiding several miles from home, sleeping in a cave, eating mushrooms and squirrels, having little fits of madness, and trying to persuade us that he really knows what he is doing, and that he believes in it.Mr. Ware apparently means that we should believe Ashby Gatrell, and that we should identify him with those contemporary resisters who have abandoned not only their families, but also citizenship, to escape participation in a guilty war.I, for one, however, was never persuaded, either that Ashby, as written, is a character to trust, or that his quite momentous decision is comparable to those of so many draft-age men today. Ashby, as played, often verges on the loony.The mistrust, I think, comes on early when, after watching Ashby sorrowfully witness a small battle outside his cave, we realize with shock that his family is still living nearby, as far as we know, he hasn't given much thought to their safety, even though opposing armies are roaming the countryside.The movie really falls apart when it opens its mouth. Because "No Drums, No Bugles" is essentially a one-character drama, Mr. Ware must employ all sorts of tricks to relay information to us. Poor old Ashby can only talk to himself so much of the time, so that most of the crucial information is fed to us through the overheard conversations of soldiers, hunters and, in one awful scene, of Ashby's wife (who also talks to herself), lamenting the woe and misery she faces (while Ashby hides discreetly behind a wall).Mr. Ware photographs most of these other characters from the knees downfrom Ashby's point of view. Thus, when they talk, it's like listening to an old-time radio drama while watching a movie distantly related to it.Although the drama of conscience never amounts to much, the movie often achieves a kind of elegiac lookthrough the haunted features of Martin Sheen and in the beautifully photographed West Virginia mountains where the film was madethat kept reminding me, unhappily, of passages from Stephen Crane, Ambrose Bierce and other, better writers.

title: 2 Stamford Sisters Drown
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Feb. 23 Two daughters of a Pan American World Airways pilot drowned off Sicily Saturday on a beach near Taormina. They were Lieut. Theresa Kistler, 24 years old, a Navy nurse, and her 8yearold sister, Mary Elizabeth Marqua, the daughters of Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. Marqua of Stamford. Lieutenant Kistler had made a vain effort to save her sister.

title: Precedents Exist for Informal Relations
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 Growing international practice in recent years suggests that the United States and China could find ways to establish a wide range of relations even in the absence of formal diplomatic recognition.

title: It's the Thought That Counts
description: Among the insignificant but fascinating details of President Nixon's visit to Peking is the question of how he hit upon a pair of musk oxen as an appropriate present for his host. Indeed, the whole subject of gift exchanges between heads of state might be a fruitful field of inquiry for anyone interested in the trivia diplomacy, not to mention dissertation writers in search of a Ph.D.

title: ERIC LUND
description: NORWALK, Conn., Feb. 23Eric Lund, captain of the soccer team at the University of Connecticut, died of leukemia last night at the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center in New York. He was 22 years old and had been ill for four and a half years.

description: To the Editor:

title: Ashbrook Scores Busing Before Florida Legislature
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 23 Representative John M. Ashbrook, who is seeking to defeat President Nixon as the Republican Presidential nominee this year, came to Florida today to give his views on school busing.

title: UNIONIST INDICTED IN BRIDGE STRIKE
description: Barry L. Feinstein, president of the City Employes Union, was indicted yesterday on 11 criminal charges growing out of the strike last June that left 23 drawbridges inoperative and caused massive traffic jams throughout the city.

title: Delegate Outcome in Minnesota Clouded
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 23After analyzing substantial, but far from complete, returns from the voting last night to start selecting Minnesota's delegates to the Democratic National Convention, William McGrann, state campaign manager in Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's quest for a second Presidential nomination, was in a cocky mood today.

title: 5 BILLBOARDS ASK CLUES IN SLAYING
description: A 30footby12foot billboard erected near the entrance of the Western Expressway leading into Rochester, offers a $6,000 reward for information on the rape and murder of 10yearold girl, Carmen Colon.

title: Santos Wins as Pale Stars
description: SHEFFIELD,, England, Feb. 23 (AP)An injured Pele led Santos of Brazil to a 20 victory today over the English Second Division soccer team Sheffield Wednesday. Pele, who had three stitches inserted in a gashed knee, rampaged through Sheffield's unsteady defense and came close to scoring on several occasions.

title: Hartford Panel Calls for a State Investigation Unit
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 23A legislative committee urged the General Assembly today to establish a Temporary State Commission of InvestigatiOn to combat organized crime, racketeering and possible corruption by public officials.

title: Market Place: Du Pont's Lens Affects Others
description: Yes, du Pont, the giant of the chemicals and plastics business, is working on a contact lens. No, it is not soft lens like the kind being marketed by Bausch & Lomb and other companies. Yes, it does have some properties similar to those of the soft lenses, but there also are differences. No, it will not be on the market in a hurry.

title: Soviet Craft Leaves Moon With Rocks From Surface
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 23  The Soviet Union announced today that its latest mooncraft, Luna 20, was on its way back to earth after having collected rock samples from a mountainous portion of the lunar surface.

title: Nationalists at Taipei Assembly Say They Are Still China's Elected Representatives
description: TAIPEI. Taiwan, Feb. 23Under signs bearing such designations as Shanghai District. Kwangtung and Szechuan, the 1,400 members of the National Assembly of Nationalist China caucused as provincial delegations today to nominate candidates for the 85seat Assembly Presidium.

title: Saline Water Program
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP)  The House Interior Committee approved a $26.8 million saline water conversion program today.

title: BLASDALE SHOWS GIFTS IN SCRIABIN
description: A strong poetic sensibility and an individual style set the playing of Justin Blasdale apart from that of other young pianists. Presented in his local recital debut last season by the Concert Artists Guild, he appeared again at Carnegie Recital Hall Tuesday night under the same auspices. His gifts are, in a way, so special that they work well in some pieces and much less well in others.

title: President's Itinerary
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 23 (AP) Following is a tentative itinerary for the rest of President. Nixon's China visit. as disclosed by the White House. It is subject to change; his daily schedule is being announced in China.

title: FLORIDA EXECUTIONS DELAYED BY ASKEW
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 231 (UPI)  Gov. Reubin Askew, who, as a State Senator voted to retain capital punishment, granted a mass stay of execution today to the 91 prisoners on Florida's Death Row until July 1, 1973.

title: Bridgeport 5554 Victor
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Feb. 23 Mike Mulvihill made a foul shot with four seconds to go to give Bridgeport a 5554 victory over Fairleigh Dickinson tonight. The winners are 165 wonlost and the losers have record of 138.

title: Smith, Newcombe Share Trophy
description: Because the International Lawn Tennis Federation has barred contract professionals from its tournaments in a dispute with Lamar Hunt's World Championship Tennis organization, Stan Smith and John Newcombe probably won't meet on the court this year.

title: New Friends, Neglected Loves
description: Shortly before President Nixon departed for Peking, the State Department announced that some leading members of the President's entourage would brief Japan and eight other Asian allies as soon as the China visit ended. This is a needed show of concern for friends in Asia, especially Japan, who have been severely slighted during Mr. Nixon's courtship of Mao Tsetung.

title: Dahomean Sergeant Slain In Attack on Chief of Staff
description: COTONOU, Dahomey, Feb. 23 (Agence FrancePresse)Col. PaulEmile de Souza, chief of staff of Dahomey's army, and his bodyguards shot and killed an attacker early today during an attempt on the colonel's life by soldiers who were reported to have tried to take over strategic national points. The colonel was slightly wounded.

title: Liguori Weakens Foot in Workout, Quits A.A.U. Meet
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 23 (AP)Marty Liguori, still ailing from a heel injury, withdrew today from the mile race in Friday's national Amateur Athletic Union meet at Madison Square Garden.

title: Justice Postel Walks Out On Reporters et Meeting
description: State Supreme Court Justice George Postel last night walked out of a meeting of the Newspaper Reporters Association attended by 45 per sons in the Banquet Room of the Roosevelt Hotel when he learned that his remarks would not be off the record.

title: Florida and Beyond
description: Three weeks before the voting, the probable winners in the Florida primary are general apathy and Wallace demagoguery. No one of the several responsible candidates has yet captured the imagination of the voters. Like baseball spring training, which is also getting under way in Florida, their campaigns are of interest to devoted fans but not to the public at large.

title: Chinese Styles for Mother and Daughter
description: If you want to be topical, the label to flaunt in clothes these days is one that reads China, not Paris. Inside one of the styles made by Jenny Bell Whyte for Saks Fifth Avenue, the typed label says, Hand embroidered, hand pleated wedding skirt. Mainland China, circa 1820. Remade 1972. It has a pleated panel in front, gold embroidered dragons on the sides. It arrived in a package from Mrs. Harold Grant, a woman in Washington, D.C., who had heard about Mrs. Whyte's fashion restorations.

title: N.B.C. to Show Film Adaptation OfRed Detachment of Women
description: The American people will have an opportunity to see film adaptation of the same ballet attended by President and Mrs. Nixon in Peking Tuesday, under an agreement reached here with the United Nations representatives of the People's Republic of China.

title: 33 Members of Panel On Taxes in Jersey
TV Networks Schedule Today's China Coverage
description: The major networks have announced the following scheduled coverage today of President Nixon's trip to China. The schedules, shown in New York time, are subject to change.

title: Tenant Association In Newark Faces Contempt Charges
description: NEWARK, Feb. 23  The leaders of the Stella Wright Tenant Association were served summonses today directing them to appear in Superior Court next Thursday to show why they should not be jailed for contempt of court.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Wife of Premier Chou Enlai... Quiet and unassuming, she has made career first as daring revolutionary and later as effective national administrator of women's affairs... plays secondary political role possibly because of fragile health... Recently began to appear frequently at official functions, perhaps in preparation for duties as hostess for Nixons... Membership in party's Central Committee indicative of continuing importance... Joined party and met and married Mr. Chou in her twenties when they were students in Tienkin... they have no children Worked with husband in Shanghai underground during early conflicts... stricken with tuberculosis and carried on a stretcher during much of the 6.000mile Long March... From Yenan she slipped through surveillance to convalesce in temple near Peking but faced new danger when Japanese took over area in 1937... Edgar Snow helped her escape to Shanghaihound British ship her as maid.

title: Porter and A.B.A. Sued By N.C.A.A. for Deceit
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 23 (UPI)  The National Collegiate Athletic Association, in a historymaking move, filed $216,663 suit today against the former Villanova allAmerica basketball player, Howard Porter, and the American Basketball Association in Lommon Pleas Court of Media, Pa.

title: PRICING CUTS SET IN KEY INDUSTRIES
description: Price reductions for portable Colortelevision receivers, certain grades of stainless steel used in tanks and other containers and several grades of polyester yarns were announced yesterday by major manufacturers.

title: Philip Hugs Ape to Aid Wildilife Fund
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Feb. 23Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, today met Aminah, a young, redhaired, 55pound female orangutan, and minutes later they were hugging each other for photographers at the National Zoo.

title: 500th Victory on Ice
description: BOSTON, Feb. 23 (AP)Ed Kenty scored four goals tonight as the Boston College hockey team upset Boston University, 75, giving John (Snooks) Kelley his 500th career victory. Kelley, in his 36th year at B.C., is retiring at the end of the season.

title: Lakers, Lose, 115110
description: WACO, Tex., Feb. 23 (UPI)Elvin Hayes scored 18 points in the first quarter to stake the Houston Rockets to an early lead over Los Angeles tonight and the Rockets went on to beat the Lakers, 115110.

title: Mrs. Alan D. Cohn, 42, Dies; Psychiatric Social Worker
description: Mrs. Nancy Deitsch Cohn, psychiatric social worker at Mount Sinai Hospital, and the wife of Alan D. Cohn, a partner in the investment banking firm of W'rtheim & Co., died of cancer Tuesday night at their home, 1111 Park Avenue. She was 42 years old.

description: HAPPINESS and VITALITY Arica Institute (212) 1897430Advt.

description: New Jerseyanstraditionally reluctant to give much money or much power to their state governmentwill at least have to give it their attention for the next few months.

title: Dollar Is Off in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Feb. 23 (Reuters)The United States dollar continued to decline on the Tokyo Foreign Exchange Market today, closing at a new low of 302.50 yen, down from 302.70 yen at yesterday's close.

title: A Paperback on Nixon Trip To Be Published in 2 Weeks
description: A pictorial record of President Nixon's historic journey to China, with text by members of the United Slates press corps who traveled with the Presidential party, will be published by Bantam Books within eight days after the President's return.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23 (AP)Enemy troops continued small rocket and mortar assaults on military positions and villages today in the Central Highlands, near Saigon and in the Mekong Delta.

title: BERRIGAN WITNESS FORWARDED MAIL
description: HARRISBURG. Pa., Feb. 23A nun testified for the Government today that she had served as a mail drop for one of the defendants accused in an alleged antiwar conspiracy to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, blow up the heating systems of Government buildings in Washington and raid draft boards.

title: PACER JINX ENDED BY NETS, 108106
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Feb. 23Outside a blizzard swirled, but inside the Nassau Coliseum the New York Nets spread sunshine for their followers tonight as they held off the Indiana Pacers for a 108106 victory.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: SirloinThe Red Meat at the Heart of Dining in New York
description: New York has several thousand restaurants of nearly every shape and size imaginable, from hot dog stands to French extravaganzas. But if anyone had to name the most typical kind of restaurant in the city, he would almost certainly opt for steak houses. Red meat, especially sirloin, is the name of the game, the heart of what eating out in Manhattan, and America, means.

title: IN THE NATION
description: It was a typical campaign day, more or less. Senator Muskie said he'd debate his Democratic rivalsmaybe, if everything could be worked out. Senator Jackson denounced Senator Muskie and Governor Wallace as extremists on the busing issue. Senator Humphrey suffered something of a setback in the convention delegate selection of his home state. Mayor Lindsay told the Florida Legislature he favored busing, and Representative McCloskey told the Concord, N. H., Rotary Club that he favored tax reform. The Dartmouth College newspaper endorsed Senator McGovern, and the Florida Supreme Court told Mayor Yorty he'd have to stay on the Florida ballot, like or not.

title: Rumanians Praise Trip
description: BUCHAREST. Feb. 23 (AP)The Rumanian Communist patty s official newspaper, Scinteia, today described President Nixon's trip as an important, positive act that has broad international impact. Rumanian sources said they were shocked by the antiChinese cam paign of the Soviet Union and its Warsaw Pact allies that started when the Nixon visit began Monday.

title: Hawks Defeat Suns
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 23 (AP) Jim Washington scored a ca reerhigh 28 points and pulled down 20 rebounds tonight to lead the Atlanta Hawks to a 120118 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: J. C. PENNEY CO. EXPANDS PROFIT
Banishing Job Bias
description: The Government's arsenal of legal weapons against race and sex discrimination in jobs will be strengthened significantly if the bill adopted by the Senate after weeks of Southern filibuster prevails in conference.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Telephone craftsmen in Westchester and Putnam Counties voted to go back to work today after a twoday work stoppage protesting the suspension of 129 union leaders.

title: Volpe Names Representative
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe swore in Dr. James Constantino. of McLean, Va., today as his regional representative at Philadelphia. Mr. Volpe said that Mr. Constantino, 41 years old, would serve as secretarial representative in Maryland, Delaware, Pennsylvaia, Virginia, West Virginia and the District of Columbia.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Wife of Mao Tsetung, the party chairman... ranks third in Peking hierarchy after husband and Premier Chou Enlai... former obscure Shanghai actress known then as Lan Ping... was deputy to chief Cultural Revolution strategist, Chen Pota Vigorous advocate of upheaval, radical reform and ouster of revisionists... earlier had stayed in background, reportedly as result of agreement with Politburo officials, who approved the separation in the late nineteenthirties of Mr. Mao and his wife, Ho Tzuchen... Put in charge of cultural realm, she banished practically all earlier works of drama, art and music and fostered output of operas, ballets, dramas and musical works that promoted new Maoism.. became identified with radical left, but in reaction that set in against excesses, not only escaped censure but moved higher... at 58 she is no longer beautiful but has commanding presence and is given to more flair in personal attire than other women leaders.

title: Morocco Asks Death for 26
description: KENITRA, Morocco, Feb. 23 (Reuters)The prosecution has demanded the death penalty for 26 of the 1,081 army men being tried by a military tribunal in connection with last summer's attempted coup against King Hassan H. Col. Ramdane Ben Ayyad, winding up the case for the prosecution last night, also demanded life imprisonment for 25 of the defendants.

title: Carry On Camping'
description: More than 900 years have passed since the Norman Conquest, and it is sobering to think that so many centuries of English history, that the slow, beneficent growth of a society so traditional and stable, that the legacy of Shakespeare, Jonson, Dryden and the likeshould have issued at last with "Carry On Camping," which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters.For "Carry On Camping," which boasts a fair tra-Nurse," "Carry On Cleo," dition of its own ("Carry On "Carry On Regardless," etc. etc.), really does require a settled social system, a widely accepted code of conduct, a set of values, an appreciation of class and the accents of classall of which may be ridiculed with the complete assurance that nothing will be touched. It requires as well the class and the accents of characters with names like Sid Boggle, Joan Fussey, Charlie Muggins, Bernie Lugg. Those names also take you back to the music halls, to the minor roles of Dickens, or the people of Mayhew's London.Sid and Joan, Charlie and Bernie go off on a camping holiday, pitching their tents in some sly farmer's field, where they are joined by others, including especially the high-class young ladies of the Chayste Place Finishing School. Many and merry are the adventures that follow, and in a depressed 10 minutes you could probably imagine every one of them. They all have to do with the miseries of life in the open and sex in secret. "Carry On Camping" is a movie that proceeds partly by pratfall but mostly by a merciless succession of double entendres, which somehow excite the prurient interest of everybody except, perhaps, the audience."The Carry On . . ." movies do have their loyal followers, and I know one distinguished film critic who says he admires them for their sheer vulgarity. It may be best to leave it at that and admit that the premiere of "Carry On Camping" offers a significant opportunity to sheer-vulgarity buffs everywhere.

title: TEMPLE NOTCHES ITS 20th, 10864
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 23 (AP)Temple scored its 20th victory of the season by routing Rhode Island, 10864, at the Palestra tonight.

title: High Libyan Delegation Goes to Soviet
description: CAIRO, Feb. 23A highlevel delegation from Libya's revolutionarynationalist Government, among the most outspoken Arab critics of Soviet ambitions in the Middle East, left nere today for a fiveday visit to Moscow.

title: Total for 1972 Lower
description: DETROIT, Feb. 23United States auto companies posted a slim increase in daily sales of new cars during the Feb. 1120 period.

title: VETERANS ARE FOUND CHEATED ON GRAVES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) Veterans are being cheated by unscrupulous private cemeteries that offer free graves to induce the veterans to buy costly burial packages, a Senate committee was told in report released today.

title: ELMER G. BUTLER; TAUGHT BIOLOGY
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 23 Dr. Elmer Grimshaw Butler, the Henry Osborn Professor of Biology Emeritus at Princeton University and a former president of the American Institute of Biological Sciences, died today in Princeton Hospital after a brief illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 19 Lake Lane here.

title: Fulbright Feels Nixon Visit Could Help End the War
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI) Senator J. W. Filbright said today that he felt President Nixon's trip to China could help end the Vietnam war.

title: Foreign Aid Fiasco
description: Representative Otto Passman, Democrat of Louisiana, in his long career as chairman of the House Appropriations subcommittee dealing with foreign aid, has steadfastly pretended to be the enemy of waste and the champion of the taxpayer. The compromise reached this week by HouseSenate conferees on the foreign aid bill demonstrates the fraudulence of his claim.

title: PENTAGON SHIFTS ON R.0.T.C. AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23The Department of Defense has backed down from its dayold pledge that it would not forbid its officers to attend 15 prestigious colleges and universities opposed by the chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, Representative F. Edward Med, Democrat of Louisiana.

title: PHILLIPS ANDOVER NAMES NEW HEAD
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Feb. 23Theodore R. Sizer, the 39yearold dean of Harvard's School of Education, has been appointed headmaster of the Phillips Academy at Andover, the oldest incorporated school for boys in the country.

title: 5 GOVERNORS RESIGN AT COAST EXCHANGE
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 23 (AP) The president of the West Coast Commodity Exchange said today that five of its 11 governors had resigned after an unsuccessful power play.

title: U.S. Plywood and Temple Terminate Merger Talks
description: U. S. Plywood Champion Papers, Inc., and Temple Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that, due to stockmarket conditions subsequent to their agreement in principle Jan. 6, they could not agree on price and had, therefore, terminated their merger talks.

title: Cost of Living Unit Says Results for the Nation Were Encouraging
MRS. ISABEL HILL, 75, AIDE TO J. H. WHITNEY
description: CAMDEN, S. C., Feb. 23Mrs. Isabel Preston Hill, secretary to John Hay Whitney in New York and London when Mr. Whitney was Ambassador to the Court of St. James's, died on Monday at Kershaw County Memorial Hospital. She was 75 years old and had retired in 1966.

title: Sabres Halt Hawks, 21
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 23 (UPI) The scrambling Buffalo Sabres, last place in the National Hockey League East, scored two unassisted and freakish thirdperiod goals tonight to defeat the Chicago Black Hawks, West Division leader, 21.

title: Under 5% of U.S. Rents Have Risen Since 1971
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23A special survey by the Bureau of Labor Statistics indicated today that less than 5 per cent of the nation's rental units have had a rent increase since the end of the wagepricerent freeze.

title: HERMAN L. HASSELL JR.
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. J., Feb. 23 Herman L. Hassell Jr., manager of manufacturing engineering of the Amerada Hess Corporation, Woodbridge, died on Sunday at Doctors Hospital in New York after a brief illness. He was 36 years old and lived at 4 Mohican Drive.

title: Ulster Acts to Curb Army
description: LONDON, Thursday, Feb. 24 A Northern Ireland court decision yesterday threw doubt on the powers of the British soldiers to act in Ulster, and, here in London the Government rushed a bill through Parliament early today to upset the decision.

title: Fancier of Huskies Remembers Old, Lonely Days in Show Ring
description: Sleddog racing struck blow for Women's Lib long before the movement became a cause clbre.

title: Talk Between Aides Of Hanoi and Saigon In Paris Confirmed
description: PARIS, Feb. 23The North vietnamese delegation to the peace talks confirmed today that Xuan Thuy, the delegation chief, had met Tran Van Do, the former South Vietnamese Foreign Minister, for two hours on Dec. 19.

title: E. C. A. C. Backs Freshman Rule For Football by a 1Vote Margin
description: Major colleges in the Eastern College Athletic Conference were given permission yesterday to use freshmen on their varsity football teams when the conference, by a margin of one vote, ended a 20year ban on their eligibility.

title: 30 Questioned in Britain
description: LONDON, Feb. 23 (Reuters) Scotland Yard detectives raided the homes of known sympathizers of the Irish Republican Army before dawn today and rounded up about 30 people for questioning on the Aldershot explosion.

title: Allen Given Over $100,000 In Record White Sox Pact
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Feb. 23 (AP)Dick Allen, the slugger acquired in December, has signed a contract for more than $100,000, a record for the club, the Chicago White Sox said today.

title: N.C.R. PAYOUT CUT TO 1OC FROM 18C
description: The National Cash Register Company yesterday reduced its dividend on the common stock to 10 cents a share from the 18 cents a share paid in previous quarters. The reduced payment will be made April 25 to holders of record March 17.

title: COAST DEMOCRATS SELECTING SLATES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 23The nine Democrats in California's Presidential primary, after leaping the first hurdle m their party's reform program, are strung out like longdistance runners for the next jumps.

title: Serkin Gives New Life to a Mendelssohn Concerto
description: Rudolf Serkin is one of the few pianists who seem genuinely fond of Mendelssohn's music. Some seasons back he was playing the D minor Concertothe only pianist to have included it in his repertory in our time. And now he has returned to the familiar G minor Concerto, that work so beloved of our greatgrandparents and conservatory students.

title: Usury Victim Pleads Guilty Of Lying to U.S. Grand Jury
description: A usury victim who had been dunned for $30,000 in interest on a $1,000 debt pleaded guilty yesterday to lying to a Federal grand jury about the transaction because, according to the prosecution, he feared for his family's lives.

title: High Court Denies Right of Tenants to Withhold Rent
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23The Constitution does not give tenants the right to withhold rent payments from landlords who fail to make repairs, the Supreme Court held today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Catching Spotted Trout
description: MARCO ISLAND, Fla. From the patio of my room at the Marto Beach Hotel, the Gulf of Mexico was smooth and shimmering in the early morning sun, but within an hour a stiff southeast breeze had begun. to blow, and at Goodland a short while later, Don Wine, who was my guide for the day, was not happy.

title: Archibald Scores 55
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 23 (UPI) Nate Archibald put on a oneman show tonight, scoring a careerhigh 55 points and leading the Cincinnati Royals to their third straight victory, 110106 decision over the Portland Trail Blazers.

description: Roger Staubach, the former Naval lieutenant who became an almostinstant quarterback hero for the champion Dallas Cowboys, sees both sides of the football.

description: TRENTON, Feb. 23The State Tax Policy Committee proposed today farreaching reform of New Jersey's tax structure, with the stress on reducing realestate taxes and allowing the state to take over most school costs from localities.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23Representative Wilbur D. Mills proposed today that Social Security benefits be increased by 20 per cent this Juneinstead of the 5 per cent in a bill that he steered through the House last year.

title: ROBINSON SCORES SCHOOL CUTBACKS
description: Isaiah E. Robinson, president of the Board of Education, told a City Hall capital budget hearing yesterday that the school system was being forced to bear the brunt of cutbacks in needed new construction.

title: Hot Line for School Peace
description: The establishment by Dr. Harvey Scribner of a Chancellor's Action Center to which parents and other cornmunity residents, may direct questions and complaints about the high schools is a sensible move toward better rapport between the public and the schools. Grievances and misunderstandings have often exploded into controversies, not because the issues were serious or insoluble but because faulty communications allowed frustrations to accumulate.

title: Humble's President Named to Board
description: The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), the world's largest oil company, announced yesterday major executive changes.

title: Increased Fringe Benefits Are Allowed by Pay Board
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23The Pay Board amended rules today to allow higher fringe benefits that could raise total increases to workers by as much as 6.2 per cent and, in some cases, more. The board also ruled that raises granted under incentive programs designed to promote increased productivity were exempt from its general standard limiting new wage increases to 5.5 per cent.

title: Custodian of a Tradition Olgivanna Lloyd Wright
description: Our Taliesin life is based on the democratic principle young people are treated according to their merit. With those few of wealthy or aristocratic background we have more difficulties.

title: A Transfer of 1,500 Willowbrook Patients Planned
description: ALBANY, Feb. 23A state legislative chairman who has been inquiring into conditions at the Willowbrook State School disclosed a plan today to reduce its overcrowding through the gradual transfer of 1,500 mentally retarded patients to other institutions.

title: Jersey Tax Plan in Brief
description: PROPERTY TAXES: Cuts in local taxes of 40 per cent on the average, for a total reduction of $863million. A statewide property tax of $1 per hundred of equalized valuation, to raise $553million (as of. 1972). Ceilings on local realty taxes to 50 cents per hundred for county taxes, $1.50 per hundred for municipal purposes, and zero for school taxes, except for specially voted levies to raise school funds over the standard statefinanced program.

title: JOSEPH S. CARREAU
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., Feb. 23Joseph S. Carreau, a founding partner of Carreau & Snedeker and senior partner of Carreau & Co., Wall Street houses, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital alter a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived in the Fairway Apartments.

title: Mrs. Onassis'
description: A lawyer for Mrs. Aristotie Onassis touched off a heated exchange in Federal Court here yesterday when he moved to have a photographer who had been enjoined from harassing her cited for civil contempt.

description: GINLEY'S THE NAME GUMSHOE'S THE GAMEADVT.

title: BUCKS SET BACK BULLETS, 113105
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 23 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks took the lead for the first time with 2 minutes left tonight and defeated the Baltimore Bullets for the 11th straight time, 113105, in a National Basketball Association game.

description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 24Angela Davis said today her release on $102,500 bail after 16 months in prison was victory for the people and vowed to work for the release of all political prisoners.

description: A model prison law library, the first of its kind in the Unitled States, has been established in the Bronx House of Detention for Men for use by inmates.

description: Anthony J. Amendola, an architect who specialized in planning foodservice facilities, died here Wednesday night. He apparently suffered a heart attack while bowling at the Port Authority bus terminal as a member of the Architectural Bowling League. He was 71 years old and lived at 9739 72d Drive, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: South Vietnam Fighting Slows; Foe Shells Bases in Highlands
description: SAIGON, South ,Vietnam, Friday Feb. 25 (AP)Battlefield action tapered yesterday across South. Vietnam, with enemy gunners concentrating their shelling on military positions in the Central Highlands.

title: 60 Million Saw Nixon Arrive
description: Some 60 million Americans watched President Nixon's arrival in Peking on television Sunday night, according to New York Arbitron, a rating service. This is approximately the same number of people tuned in on the three major television networks any Sunday, the organization reported.

title: Text of the Senate's Busing Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24Following is the text of the busing amendment that the Senate voted today to attach to a higher education bill:

title: Warm Mood Is Continuing To Surround Nixon Trip
description: PEKING, Friday, Feb. 25President Nixon continued to react with public enthusiasm today toward his Peking visit while his Chinese hosts, although not matching the President's rhetorical buoyancy, continued to give widespread publicity to their extensive dealings with him.

title: Irate Customers Question Soviet Aide on Services
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 24  The Minister of Consumer Services, who holds one of the most thankless government posts in the Soviet Union, ventured on television the other day to answer irate viewers questions. He did not have an easy time, but proved adept at passing the buck.

description: PEKING, Feb. 24 One of the many remarkable features of President Nixon's historymaking visit to Peking has been the constant presence of the lithe, soberfaced men whose job is to protect the leader of the world's most powerful democracy.

title: NEW DEGREE PLAN IS BEGUN BY STATE
description: State Education Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist yesterday invited applications for two external college degrees that can be earned by persons who have never taken a college course or even acquired a high school diploma.

title: 8 Held in Dahomey Attack
description: COTONOU, Dahomey, Feb. 29 (Agence FrancePresse)  Four junior officers and four sergeants have been arrested after an attempt yesterday to take over the Government or this former French colony in West Africa. President Hubert Maga said the man who led a raid on the residence of Col. PaulEmile de Souza, the army Chief of Staff, was a private Dadouda Moumoni, who was shot dead by the Colonel.

title: Survey Defends Global Companies
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24A detailed survey of 74 United States manufacturing companies with extensive foreign operations disclosed today that the companies had a higherthanaverage growth of domestic employment in the last decade and that they also had substantially increased their exports from the United States. The information is aimed at heading off a drive in Congress, spearheaded by organized labor, for legislation that would hamper overseas operations, of United States business. The 12 business economists who were in charge of the study said:

title: BroadwayHale Stores Broadens Its Top Staff
description: BroadwayHale Stores, Inc., the largest retail concern on the West Coast, announced yesterday a broadening of its top staff effective April 1 to accommodate the company's continuing growth and geographical dispersion.

title: 9 CITED IN MICHIGAN IN VETERANS'

title: Weekend Recipes
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Letter Found in Priest's Cell Linked to Berrigan Indictment
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 24Two Federal prison officials testified today that the finding of a contraband letter in the cell of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan led to the exposure of an alleged antiwar conspiracy that included a plot to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser for national security affairs.

title: Dining Out: Middling French. and Indifferent Cuban Cuisine
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday arc rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The almost immediate No, No response by city and state correctional officials to recent inmate demands for a union is especially disheartening in the wake of Attica and other recent tragedies. The rights of the incarcerated to the kind of representation usually associated with organized labor is, of course, debatable from legal and penal standpoints. The sense of union, however, is something to which correctional authorities should address themselves.

title: BROADCASTING ROLE SOUGHT BY BLACKS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 A small group of black executives met today in a downtown hotel in an effort to form a multimilliondollar communications conglomerate based on what they see as an impending revolution in the broadcast media.

title: A HOAX AT TOES SPARKS NEARRIOT Jail Protest Follows Word of Death of Inmate's Kin
description: A phonecaller's hoax set off a 17hour demonstration by 90 inmates at the Manhattan House of Detention beginning Wednesfi day night. The men barricaded themselves on the seventh floor, of the jail, called the Tombs,I and demanded that a fellow prisoner be allowed to attend the funeral of two of his children.

title: SOYBEANS SEEN AS TOP CASH CROP Economist Says Commodity Will Pass Corn in 1972
description: Soybeans will surpass corn this year as the No. 1 cash crop in the United States, an economist of the Agriculture Department predicted yesterday.

title: 11% Increase Expected
description: American industry has raised its sights for capital spending this year, McGrawHill Publications reported yesterday. A recheck of plans for improving plant and equipment indicates that business will spend $90.75billion for this purpose in 1972, an increase of 11 per cent from the level of estimated spending in 1971.

title: Candidates Day
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb. 24Senator George McGovern. touring shoe factories and electronics assembly lines here today, was taking credit for forcing the planned March television debate by Democratic candidates.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Please inform a recent letter writer, George Sears of G. & C. Merriam Co., and your readers of another meaning of consumerism, an antiantimeaning: the singleminded efforts of American business to convert human beings into mere mouths.

title: Senate RollCall Vote On Basing Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (AP)Following is the 51to37 rollcall vote by which the Senate today adopted a key provision of a compromise school busing amendment. The provision would deny the use of Federal funds for busing unless requested by local authorities.

title: Priest Tells Ulster Inquiry British Shot Unarmed Boys
description: BELFAST. Northern Ireland,1 Feb. 24A Roman Catholic priest told an inquiry today that an unarmed boy of about 16 or 17 had been shot by British paratroopers only a few feet from him in Londonderry last month.

title: Hanoi Comments on Trip, Decries Plotting of U.S.
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 24 (AP)North Vietnam made its first comment on President Nixon's visit to China today and it was an adverse one that did not mention China by name.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: HAPPINESS and VITALITY Arica Institute (212) 4897430Advt

title: SHINSUKE ASAO, 78, LED SHIPPING LINE
description: Shinsuke Asao, former chairman of the board and president of the N.Y.K. Line (Nippon Yusen Kaisha), died Wednesday in Tokyo, the shipping line reported here yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: A CONFLICT IS SEEN AT ONASSIS TRIAL Judge Says Photographer Told Different Stories
description: Federal Judge Irving Ben Cooper said yesterday afternoon that there was a dearcut conflict between the testimony and pretrial depositions of Ronald E. Galella, a freelance photographer who is suing Mrs. Aristotle Onassis for $1.3million for allegedly interfering with his livelihood.

title: Thieu Says Soviet Urged a Drive by Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23 President Nguyen Van Thieu asserted in an interview today that the Soviet Union had urged North Vietnam to open a military offensive here to block any efforts by the United States and China to end the Vietnam war during President Nixon's Peking talks. However, he said, South Vietnamese Army attacks and United States bombing kept the threat from materializing.

title: Soviet Aide Still in Rumania After a Reported Spy Case
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Feb. 24 (AP) A Soviet diplomat, reported in the Western press last week to have been involved in a spy case in Rumania, made public appearances here this week.

title: New Deadline Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (UPI)Auto manufacturers will apparently have until 1976 to install passive restraint safety systems such as air bags that inflate automatically and cushion passengers on impact.

title: JAPAN REJECTED U.S.PLEA ON HANOI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Japan was reported today to have refused an American request that she refrain from sending her first official mission to North Vietnam this month. The American objection was said to be that it might embarrass President Nixon during his visit to China.

title: POLICE WITNESS Al KNAPP INQUIRY CALLED IN KILLING
description: William R. Phillips, the suspended city patrolman who became an undercover agent and key witness last year for the Knapp Commission investigation of police corruption, has been questioned in the murder of two persons in an East Side bordello three years ago.

title: State Panel Hears Brooklyn Protests
description: The Scott Commission spent a day in Brooklyn yesterday looking into city administration there and found little but complaints.

title: Judge Refuses to Restrain Choice of Speed Skaters
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 24 (AP)Federal Judge William H. Webfi ster denied today a petition by Neil Blatchford of Northbrook, Ill., to restrain the United States International Skating Association from sending three speed skaters to Sweden this weekend.

title: Fordham Toppled; Manhattan Scores
description: Harry Rogers, who at 6 feet 71/2 inches plays in the St. Louis backcourt, sidetracked Fordham's hopes for a National Invitation Tournament bid last night when he scored on jump shot with 21 seconds remaining to give the Billikens a 7571 victory in the second game of a college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden.

title: China, at U.N., Bars a Deal On Two Taiwan Newsmen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 24  A spokesman for the Chinese Mission to the United Nations served notice today that his Government would strongly oppose any compromise that would permit the reaccreditation of two Chinese Nationalist correspondents ousted from United Nations Headquarters last December.

title: 1,000 Ford Pintos To Be Used in Test Of Safety Starters
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 24  A test seat belt starter interlock system will be put into about 1,000 Ford Pintos over the next few weeks.

title: At Peking Market, Duck and Sea Food Are Indeed Fresh
description: PEKING, Feb. 24 (AP)Going marketing in Peking is like shopping at a supermarket in the United Stateswith exceptions.

title: COLUMBIA IS GIVEN JOBBIAS WARNING
description: The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has warned Columbia University that it must either observe Federal rules concerning equal job opportunity or face losing $13million In Federal contracts.

title: Candidates'
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb. 24Representative Richard H. Fulton, Tennessee Democrat, a consistent supporter of Social Security legislation. visited with senior citizens here today on behalf of the writein candidacy of Representative Wilbur D. Mills.

title: TIGHT CURB URGED FOR STRIP MINING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Donald W. Whitehead, the Federal cochairman of the Appalachian Regional Commission, called today for strong Federal legislation to control coal surfacemining.

title: A SKETCH PROGRAM IS GIVEN BY GIUFFRE
description: The latest phase of Jimmy Giuffre musical jouny, which has taken him during the last 25 years into bigband swing, impressionistic folk blues and explorations of unaccompanied, amplified clarinet effects, is a venture into short, mood sketches that have overtones of Eastern music.

title: BILLION RISE IN YEAR REPORTED FOR ABM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (UPI) The cost of President Nixon's foursite Safeguard antiballistic missile (ABM) system has increased almost a billion dollars in the last year, Army Secretary Robert F. Froehlke said today.

title: Capital Peace Corpsmen Fighting Overseas Slash
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24Staff members of Peace Corps headquarters here held a series of meetings today in attempts to stave off cuts ordered in overseas volunteers.

title: Yonkers Addict Is Indicted In a Death by Methadone
description: YONKERS, Feb. 24 (AP)A Yonkers heroin addict under treatment in a Westchester County rehabilitation program was indicted today on a charge of selling methadone to a young man who authorities say died of an overdose of the therapeutic drug.

title: FLIGHT TO JUPITER IS SET FOR SUNDAY
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 24  Exploration of the distant outer planets by spacecraft is scheduled to begin Sunday night with the launching here of an unmanned Pioneer 10 on a 22month, halfbillionmile journey to Jupiter.

title: Egypt, Canada Sites
description: Oil discoveries were announced yesterday in two sharply different areas of the world, the Western Desert of Egypt and the Canadian Arctic.

title: Dr. Frank Kingdon, Educator, Author and Commentator, Dies
description: Dr. Frank Kingdon, author, lecturer and educator, died yesterday at his home, 145 East 74th Street, apparently of a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: CHILE PAYS COMPANY AFTER LAWSUIT HERE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 24Chile's leftwing Government decided today to pay $5.7million to the Kennecott Copper Corporation after a United States Federal court blocked bank accounts of Chilean state enterprises in New York.

title: RESERVE REDUCES SUPPLY OF CREDIT OpenMarket Operations Drain Over $2.3Billion From Banking System ERROR AFFECTED MOVE Part of the Action Reflects Computer Mistake of Preceding Week
description: The Federal Reserve engaged in a massive openmarket operation that drained more than $2.3 billion from the banking system in the week ended Wednesday, central bank data published yesterday showed.

title: HARRIS GRAND
description: Harris Grand, a landscape contractor and the first president of the American Association of Landscape Contractors of New York in 1964, died yesterday of cancer at his home, 160 Parkside Avenue, Brooklyn. He was 69 years old.

title: HAWKS SET BACK BY SABRES 5 TO 3 Late Goals by Martin and Lawson Send Chicago to 2d Setback in Row
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 24 (UPI)1 Rick Martin scored his 40th goal of the season tonight with 2:01 left in the game and Danny Lawson added a score with 10 seconds remaining as the Buffalo Sabres sent the Chicago Black Hawks to their, second defeat in two nights, 5.3.

title: Heating Engineers Ratify a Contract For 2Year Term
description: A 24day strike by operating engineers who oversee the heating of 226 major office buildings here ended last night when union members ratified a twoyear contract.

title: Villanova Quintet, Triumphs Over Seton Hall, 104 to 62
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Feb. 24 (AP)Larry Moody scored 25 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead Villanova to a 10462 basketball victory over Seton Hall tonight.

title: Ralph M. Home Dead at 80; A Retired Tax Aide Here
description: Ralph M. Horne, who retired as assistant regional commissioner (appellate) of the Internal Revenue Service for New York in 1962, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 7811 35th Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens. He was 80 years old.

title: Richey, Gimeno, Gisbert and Nastase Gain Tennis Quarterfinals
description: Even though he played what he characterized as erratic tennis, Cliff Richey of Sarasota, Fla., was good enough last night to halt a string of successes by Spanish players yesterday in the Clean Air tournament at the Seventh Regiment Armory.

title: MET STUDIO GIVES A SONG PROGRAM
description: Many concertgoers assume that all vocal music written today is disjunct, contorted, unkind to the voice and the English language. It is a dominant style of the times and has its own raison d'tre. There still exists, however, a body of American composers who write traditionally, who believe that a melodic line should relate to the text and that the words should be understood. Some of them had their works sung in a program presented by the Metropolitan Opera Studio Wednesday night at the New York Cultural Center.

title: A.A.U. DASH MAWS 12 OF THE FASTEST Meriwether and Washington in Rematch After Their Dead Heat Last Week
description: Mel Pender figures Dr. Delano Meriwether's getup of yellow swim trunks, suspenders and white hospital Tshirt is just what the doctor needs at the starting line, a prescription for confidence.

title: A.&
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 The Department of Justice filed suit today against the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company and a Baltimore local of the Amalgamated Meat Cutters Union, charging violation of regulations of the Pay Board.

title: Commercial Standard Elects
description: William B. Moeser. senior vice president of U.S. Financial, was named yesterday as president of the Commercial Standard Title Insurance Company following the consolidation of U.S. Financial's title operations into Commercial Standard.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a Feb. 11 editorial Dubious Integration Plan...  The Times found unfortunate that the Fleischmann Commission has proposed actions likely to create a maximum of conflict and in any case are quite unrealistic. Election year attitudes and politics aside, the commission's recommendations are not as unrealistic as The Times chose to characterize them.

title: With Song and Fortune Cookies, Pupils Ask City for New School
description: Twenty eager sixth graders from an elementary school in Chinatown lined up in the center aisle of the jammed and steamy Board of Estimate chamber at City Hall yesterday, cleared their throats and, to the twanging of a guitar, sang:

title: New Hampshire Key: A State in Transition
Muskie Praised by Daley And Likened to Kennedy
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 24  An unexpected ptum dropped into Senator Edmund S. Muskie's laptoday when he was ushered by Mayor Richard J. Daley into a meeting of Cook County's Democratic Committee and warmly praised by the Mayor.

title: Blue, Holtzman Missing
description: MESA, Ariz., Feb. 24 (AP)Two top pitcherS for the Oakland Athletics were absent as the team opened. its training camp today.

title: BOOM IN COMPUTERS IS FOUND RENEWING
description: The computer industry has begun to boom again after spending two years in relative doldrums, according to a major study of the industry released yesterday.

title: Israel Warns Lebanon After 2 Die in Border Ambush
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 24Lieut. Gen. David Elazar, the Israeli Chief of Staff, warned today of possible reprisal action against Lebanese territory after new incidents along the frontier.

title: Inquiry Starts Into Chuvalo Fight Card
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Feb. 24 (AP)  A full investigation was started today into a boxing card in which one fighter alleged he threw his match under threat of his life and another boxer died as a result of injuries.

title: The Myth of Masculinity Is Shattered: Both Sexes Are Only Human
description: Why can't a woman be more like a man? asked Henry Higgins in My Fair Lady, and the reply came Wednesday night from a chorus of psychoanalysts:

title: COVERAGE OF TOUR REVISED BY C.B,S.
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System, which had announced that it planned to present live coverage via communications satellite of President Nixon's scheduled visit last night to the Forbidden City, decided against it yesterday afternoon.

title: Rest of Itinerary
description: PEKING, Feb. 24 (UPI)Following is the itinerary for the rest of President Nixon's visit to China:

title: Big Board Trading Halts As Two Computers Fail
description: The New York Stock Exchange made history in somewhat redfaced fashion yesterday when its ticker service was shut down and trading halted because of computer failure.

title: PACT WITH HUNGARY SIGNED BY RUMANIA
description: VIENNA, Feb. 24 (AP) Rumania and Hungary signed 20 year friendship treaty in Bucharest today in which they reiterated their national independence.

title: Effective March 24
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its revised commission schedulethe first basic overhaul of Big Board fees in 14 yearswould go into effect with trades executed on March 24..

title: MARTIN ATTACKS DEFICIT SPENDING Federal Reserve's ExChief Finds Stimulus Exceeding Any Reasonable Gauge
description: William McChesney Martin Jr., who was chairman of the Federal Reserve Board longer than any other man, yesterday attacked the Nixon Administration's plans for deficit spending.

title: EDWIN EDWARDS, 72, AN ACCOUNTING AIDE
description: Edwin J. Edwards, a partner in and a founder of the New York accounting concern of Lopez, Edwards, Frank & Co., died yesterday of a heart attack at his home here. He was 72 years old and lived at 155 West 68th Street.

title: Ambassadors to China Shat Oat of Festivities
description: PEKING, Feb. 24 (UPI)The ambassadors accredited in Peking have been excluded from, all activities connected with President Nixon's visit.

title: Bridge: Skillful PartScore Playing Helps Team Event Winners
description: Slam contracts are certainly spectacular, and may generate highly cignifirnnt results in rubber bridge or team play, but the humble partscore, offering many possibilities in the play, has attractions for the connoisseur.

title: Heck's Will Reduce Offer For Atlantic Stores Shares
description: Heck's, Inc., which operates 18 discount department stores in West Virginia, Kentucky and Ohio. said yesterday that it would revise downward its offer for one million shares of Atlantic Department Stores, Inc., owing to information received that Atlantic had suffered a loss of between $2.5million and $3million in fiscal year ended Feb. 26.

title: MAILED CIGARETTES FACE STATE PENALTY
description: A list of 100,000 names, all purchasers of untaxed cigarettes from five Weldon, N. C., mailorder concerns, was turned over yesterday to the New York State Tax Commission by the office of United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr.so that the state can collect the taxes.

title: Integration Is Working
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.During recent years, Florida and the South have made giant strides toward ending the deep divisions that have persisted. We have tried to resolve the issues that arose out of human slavery as widely practiced during Colonial days and during the first 75 years of this country's existence.

title: Copters Rescue 400 From Roof in Sao Paulo Fire
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Feb. 24 (Reuters)Helicopters snatched 400 people to safety from the roof of a blazing skyscraper here today but a heavy death toll was feared.

title: Forbidden City Housed Emperors for 600 Years
description: The Forbidden City  a complex of palaces and temples set on 250 acres in the heart of Peking  was the dwelling place of 24 Ming and Ching dynasty emperors from the early 15th century until 1912, when the Ching dynasty was overthrown.

title: Price Increases Set
description: Upward price changes involving certain copper products, pile fabrics, sulphur, iron pipe fittings and hightemperature alloys were announced yesterday by several manufacturers.

title: Big Ten Reviews Suspensions
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 24 (AP)  Big Ten athletic directors completed a session of more than eight hours gathering testimony today in the suspension cases of Ron Behagen and Corky Taylor and prepared tonight to go into an executive session.

title: STUDENTS NAMED TO YOUTH BOARD
description: The New York City Youth Board got its first youthful members yesterday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 3 P.M.

title: In Laos, A.I.D. Marches On
description: VIENTIANE, LaosSome time ago, I had my introduction to the selfperpetuating interregnum of suspended time, space and perception occupied by the United States Agency for International Development, and its sister agencies, Clandestine Client State Division, when I paid my first call on the genial, perennial A.I.D. director in Laos, Charles Mann.

title: Candidates'
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 24Mayor Lindsay took some soft jabs at the New York press this week on an overnight visit to Los Angeles where lie announced his decision to enter the June 6 Democratic primary in California.

title: Kennedy Wants Name Off Nebraska Ballot
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Feb. 24 (Reuters)Senator Edward M. Kennedy has asked that his name be removed from the Democratic ballot for the Nebraska Presidential primary election on May 9.

title: Daniel Berrigan Is Freed After Serving 18 Months of a 3Year Term
description: DANBURY, Conn., Feb. 24In the bitter cold this morning, with about 200 supporters waiting ankle deep in snow at the gate, the Rev. Daniel J. Berrigan, a major symbol in the antiwar movement, walked out of Federal prison on parole.

title: Candidates'
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 24Senator Henry M. Jackson voiced optimism today on his chances of doing well in the Wisconsin Democratic primary on April 4. He did so after hearing reports from supporters from his home state of Washington who have been campaigning here.

title: 10 More Seized in Ireland
description: DUBLIN, Feb. 24 (AP) DUBLIN, Feb. 24 (AP) The police arrested 10 more militants of the Irish Republican Army today in the republic's new crackdown on the organization.

title: In Washington, They Also Serve Who Putter and Mind the Store
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24At the White House, the staff has been playing miniature golf on the carpeted floor of the West Wing, while at the State Department, the officers who have been left behind concede that institutional flabbiness has set in.

title: B. P. Buying Pipeline
description: AVIEMORE, Scotland, Feb.24 The British Petroleum Company, Ltd., said today that it was awarding $32.5million of contracts for 241 miles of pipe to tap its huge oil find under the North Sea.

title: OPENING OF SERIES IN WHITNEY IS JOY
description: It was a joyous night of joyous sounds at the Whitney Museum on Wednesday evening. Ragtime and All That Jazz was the the title of, the occasion, the first of five programs to be presented in the 15th year of the Composers Showcase series.

title: Housing Symphony Plans Its Final Tryout Tomorrow
description: The final tryout for the newlyformed Symphony Orchestra of the New York City Housing Authority has been scheduled for the Hudson Guild, 441 West 26th Street, tomorrow from 2:30 to 4:30 P.M.

title: Coop City Residents Protest
description: A group of angry Bronx residents demonstrated yesterday outside Governor Rockefeller's midtown office, at 22 West 55th Street, seeking state financial assistance to block a planned 35 per cent raise in rent for Coop City tenants. The group, according to a police estimate, numbered 500 people. The Governor, however, was in Washington. Coop City is a resident middleclass housing development in the Bronx with 60,000 residents.

title: Miss Davis's Benefactor
description: FRESNO, Calif., Feb. 24About a year ago Rodger McAfee walked into the Oakland home of Albert J. (Mickey) Lema, chairman of the Communist party in northern California, and offered a deed to 405 acres of rich San Joaquin Valley farmland covered with alfalfa. The deed, he explained, could be used as collateral if and when Angela Davis was granted bail. Yesterday. Mr. McAfee's alfalfa land helped to free the black activist, and the 33yearold white farmer found that his role in her release brought him 'the thrill of a lifetime.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here is a book that succeeded for me despite almost everything about it. By everything about it I mean, for instance, that I was a New York Yankees fan in the days that Roger Kahn is recalling (never mind just why I was a Yankee fan), so it was hard for me at first, reading The Boys of Summer, to get worked up over Brooklyn Dodger teams that Mr. Kahn may have loved to distraction and now judges to be among the best in baseball history, but that we imperialists from the Bronx looked down upon as a pretty ragtag lot of losers that our Yankees could take any time and did (except in 1955). By everything I mean, for instance, Mr. Kahn's unremitting tone of ven oration, as if all his memories had been removed from the altars of the world's great cathedrals. By everything I mean, for instance, that the Dodgers, Ebbets Field and The New York Herald Tribune are not yet so distant in the past that they can be treated as relics of some Golden Age. Besides, too much emotion expended on too little amounts to sentimentality, and artistry lavished on trivia adds up to kitsch.

title: TAX ACTION URGED BY JERSEY G.O.P.
description: TRENTON, Feb. 24Richard W. DeKorfte, the Republican Assembly majority leader from Bergen County, announced today that he would attempt to have a special legislative session in June approve a $1.5billion taxreform package for New Jersey.

title: 6 Indicted in Case of Stolen Securities
description: Federal charges of conspiracy, fraud and transporting stolen securities were filed here yesterday against a former official of the state's Democratic I party, a rabbi, a convict and three former brokerage company employes.

title: A Vagrancy Law in Florida Upset by Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 The Supreme Court declared unanimously today that it was unconstitutional to punish persons as vagrants under vague laws that outlawed such conduct as loafing, nightwalking and avoiding work.

title: Notes on People
description: Luis A. Ferre, Governor of Puerto Rico, received the 31st Hoover Medal in ceremonies presided over by Vice President Agnew in Washington. The award, named for its first recipient, Herbert Hoover, honors outstandhig engineers for distinguished public service. Governor Ferr6, an engineer with a master of science degree from Massachusetts Institute of Technology, was cited for the exemplification of an engineerhumanist's achievements in enriching the life of a people. Winners of the Hoover Medal are chosen by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers aided by several other professional engineering societies.

title: CONCERT IS GIVEN BY JONI MITCHELL
description: A concert appearance by Joni Mitchell is not only rare, it is a rare delight. Her performance at Carnegie Hall Wednesday night was her first New York appearance in nearly two years; for anyone who values popular music in its finest form, the interval has been far too long.

title: Crangle Asks Party To End Court Pact
description: Confident that Democrats can win three State Court of Appeals judgeships this November, State Chairman Joseph F. Crangle is urging Democratic leaders to break a bipartisan agreement and wage election contests for the $42,000 judgeships.

title: Leading Light 31 Choice in Westbury Pace
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb, 24Of the 72 standardbreds, plus eight alsoeligibles, set to go postward on tomorrow night's ninerace program at Roosevelt Raceway, 26 definite starters and four standbys are New Zealand and Australian expatriates. Among the starters is Leading Light, an 8yearold Kiwi, owned by the Moon River Stables of Floral Park, L. I. The chestnut son of Local Light and Rose Tattoo, trained by Herman Carbone and driven by Buddy Gilmour, is the early 31 favorite to win the featured $7,500 Class A2 onemile pace from the No. 6 post.

title: MARKET EDGES UP AS VOLUME FALLS Turnover Is 15.86 Million as Stocks End Session With Generally Small Gains DOW CLOSES AT 912.70 Winners Outpace Losers by 736 to 677113 Block Trades Are Completed
Market Place: British Reports Project Profits
description: LONDON, Feb. 24When investors here leaf through the British equivalent of a security prospectus, they are likely to turn immediately to a section that has no American counterpart management profit projection for from one to two years.

title: Pipeline Venture Sought
description: TOKYO, Feb. 24The Soviet Union has asked for Japanese bank loans totaling $1.51billion to help to finance a new $3billion transSiberian pipeline project and the development of coal and natural gas resources in partnership with Japanese enterprises.

title: Influx of Dollars a Factor
description: FRANKFURT, Feb. 24West Germany today slashed its discount rate from 4 per cent to 3 per cent and prepared to put into effect its first exchange controls of the postwar era to check an influx of dollars and defend the monetary accord of last Dec. 18.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.3 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 112.5 from 112.2 last week.

title: Kennedy Arrives in Boston
description: BOSTON, Feb. 24 (AP)Josept P. Kennedy 3d, 19yearold son of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy, arrived in Boston today, ending the adventure that began when the plane on which he was a passenger was seized by five Arab hijackers.

title: Humphrey Son Seeks Office
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 24 (AP) Hubert H. Humphrey 3d, eldest son of the Minnesota Senator, announced today that he would seek public office this Jail as a Slate Senator. Mr. Humphrey, 29 years old, said he was :seeking DemocraticFarmerLabor endorsement to run for the Minnesola Senate in a suburban Minneapolis district.

title: Temblor in California
description: HOLLISTER, Calif., Feb. 24 (AP)  A sharp earthquake along the San Andreas fault jolted a farming valley SO miles; southeast of San Francisco today. It was called a strong earthquake but not a major one by William Cloud, seismologist at the University of California, Berkeley.

title: Court Grants Stay on Order To Halt Forest Hills Project
description: State Supreme Court Justice Irving H. Saypol. signed a formal order yesterday embodying: his decision directing the halting of construction on the controversial Forest Hills lowincome housing project.

title: Sommer Elected Chief Of Monsanto Company
description: Charles H. Sommer, chairman of the Monsanto Company, was elected yesterday to the additional posts of president and chief executive. is 61

title: Peter Pucilo Is Dead at 58; Ukrainian Unit's Head Here
description: Peter Pucilo, supreme treasurer of the Ukrainian National Association, Ukrainian fraternal organization, died, apparently of a heart attack, in Jersey City on Wednesday. He was en route to his home in Somerville, N. J.

title: Special Charge Noted
description: The Celanese Corporation reported yesterday a net loss of $22.7million for 1971 after giving effect to an extraordinary charge of $82.2million for the Columbia Cellulose Company, Ltd., subsidiary in Canada. In the previous year the corporation had a net income of $53.6million, or $3.61 a share, after an extraordinary gain of cents a share.

title: Red Smith Warning: This Serve May Be Hazardous
description: Spiro T. Agnew, a Vice President who moonlights sports, will team with Sonny Jurgensen against Ambassador George Bush and Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior, in a doubles match opening a $25,000 tennis tournament March 6 in Georgetown University's McDonough Gymnasium in Washington for the benefit Georgetown Hospital's Vincent T. Lombardi Cancer Research Center. Spectators wearing glasses are advised against sitting in the front rows. Ted is very sensitive on that score, Bill Riordan said. He's sensitive? a Democrat said. How about Doug Sanders, who couldn't wear a hat after Agnew bounced that twoiron shot off his knob in the Bob Hope Desert Classic? How about the three spectators Spiro hit with another slice? How about the tennis partners he skulled at the Japanese Embassy? Who's got the best right to be sensitive?

title: Yanks Reassign McKinney to No. 27
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 24  If Rich McKinney ever joins Babe Ruth, Lou Gehrig, Joe DiMaggio, Mickey Mantle and Casey Stengel in having his number retired by the Yankees, the number will be 27, not 11.

title: Astor Display Draws on Diaghilev and Designers
description: In recent years, there has been a growing interest in two kinds of exhibition concerned with Russian art of the first quarter of this cenury. One, like the exhibition, Diaghilev and Russian Stage Designers, which opened yesterday at the Vincent Astor Gallery of the Library of the Performing Arts at Lincoln Center, draws upon the magnetic name of Serge Diaghilev and the stage designers in his opera and ballet seasons in the West from 1908 to 1929.

title: PAKISTANIS SEEK DETAILS ON TALKS
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Feb. 24Pakistan asked today for clarification of public statements by the Indians that they were ready for unconditional peace talks, saying that the offer seemed not to have been made in good faith.

title: SCOTT UNIT FUNDS DELETED BY G.O.P.
description: ALBANY, Feb. 24The sum of $450,000 for the controversal state commission investigating New York City's governmental operations has been deleted from Governor Rockefeller's $23.6million deficiency budget request by Republican leaders seeking to move the budget bill to a vote next week.

title: HUGHES FILES SUIT ON EXAIDE'S BOOK
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 24Howard R. Hughes has moved in a Delaware Chancery Court to try to take the profits of a book written about him by Noah Dietrich, for 32 years his chief executive officer.

title: OTB's Handle Drops On Shift to Gulfstream
description: With the cancellation of Bowie's program yesterday because of snow and rain, New York's Offtrack Betting Corporation switched to Gulfstream Park in Hallandale, Fla.

title: Fernandez Stops Weldon
description: Jose Fernandez, 1281/2, of the Dominican Republic, stopped Kenny Weldon, 126, of Houston in the fifth round of a scheduled 10round boxing match at Sunnyside Gardens last night. It was the first knockout registered against Weldon. Fernandez recorded his eighth knockout.

title: Humphrey's Busing View Linked to Wallace Stand
ExCensus Aide Scores PayforVoting Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (UPI) A proposal to pay people to vote was opposed today by a former director of the Census Bureau, who said it would attract the kind of voters that we don't want at the polls.

title: Drop Continues in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Feb. 24The dollar came under sharp pressure in the Tokyo foreignexchange market today and continued its slide toward its new floor rate against the yen.

title: Marshall: Food Poisoning
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 24 (UPI)Dave Marshall, an outfielder for the New York Mets who was scheduled for meeting with manager Gil Hodges after arriving at camp overweight, missed today's workout because of food poisoning.

title: Thornton Gets Cards Post
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 24 (AP)The St. Louis Cardinals today named Bill (Thunder) Thornton. a 31yearold former National Football League running back, as their first black assistant coach. Thornton will coach the team's offensive backfield.

title: Floridians Win, 130118
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb, 24 (AP) 1Warren Jabali's club record of six 3point goals, and his 30 points, led the Floridians to a 130118 victory tonight over the Denver Rockets in the American Basketball Association.

title: Missile Award to Kiewit
description: The Peter Kiewit Sons Company announced yesterday the receipt of a $110.9million Army award for work on the safeguard ballistic missile system in Montana.

title: WEIPING CHEN, 96, CHIANGS'
