description: A sculpture model of a proposed memorial to Ralph J. Bunche was shown yesterday at a wreathlaying ceremony honoring the late Under Secretary of the United Nations for Political Affairs. Mr. Bunche died Dec. 9.

title: Lebanon Reports Attacks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 27Israeli fighter planes, armor and infantry carried out attacks in Lebanon for the third day today.

title: No Solution by S.E.C.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has predictably solved nothing by its Solomonlike compromise proposal to permit some financial institutions to join stock exchanges while excluding other institutions that do not do a predominantly public brokerage business. Predominant, says the S.E.C. report, means that significantly more than half of the brokerage must be done for persons or other institutions not connected with the parent organization.

title: Cargo: Chrome and Shame
description: An Argentine ship, the Santos Vega, has been loading 25,000 tons of Rhodesian chrome ore in Portugueseruled Mozambique for delivery at New Orleans. When the cargo is landed in this country, it will become the symbol of a deliberate infraction by the United States of the sanctions that were invoked with strong American backing by the United Nations Security Council against Rhodesia's white minority Government. Thus it will come about that this country, which has probably spoken up more often than any other at Turtle Bay in support the rule of law in world affairs, will place itself violation of such law and the United Nations Charter.

title: Police Seek A New Way To Rate Men
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy disclosed yesterday that he and his aides were trying to develop evaluation procedures that would enable them to dismiss from the force incompetent or unproductive policemen.

title: Anglican Bishop Is Ordered To Leave SouthWest Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Feb. 27The Anglican Bishop of Damaraland in SouthWest Africa, the Right Rev. Colin O'Brien Winter, and his Secretary, David de Beer, have been ordered by the South African Government to leave SouthWest Africa by next Saturday.

title: 4 OFFICERS LEAVE GENESGO DIVISION
description: The entire fourmember top management team of the Susan Thomas division of Genesco, Inc., will leave their posts this week, ending a relationship that began in September, 1968, when the Thomas family sold their company to Genesco, a Nashvillebased operator of retaling and apparel manufacturing companies.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Completes 3Day Campaign in Florida
RANGERS VICTORS OVER BLUES, 2TOO
description: Slowly and deliberately, as though savoring the moment, Ed Giacomin removed his mask at game's end last night, with his first shutout of the National Hockey League season tucked safely away.

title: Theater: Lorca's Alba
description: Even if you don't understand a word of Spanish, trot over fast to see what the ADAL Theater has done with Lorca's The House of Bernarda Alba. A quick reading of the play, easily available in English and one of Spain's theater jewels, will suffice. The ADAL unit trenchantly brings it to life.

title: Jews Will Observe Festival of Purim Beginning at Sunset
description: The colorful Jewish festival of Purim will start tonight at sundown with ceremonies in synagogues and homes.

title: First Loss for Holy Cross
description: A basket by Patrick Oliveto with nine seconds remaining yesterday enabled St. Raymond's of the Bronx to upset Holy Cross, 5149, in the quarterfinal round of the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association basketball tournament at St. John's University. Holy Cross, which lost its first game in 18, was the only undefeated team in the competition.

title: CHAIM TOWBER
description: Chaim Towber, Yiddish playwright lyricist and actor, died Saturday in Beth Israel Hospital at the age of 70. He lived at 181 Henry Street.

title: Senate Panel Approves Housing Bill That May Disperse Poor Families From Slums
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Senate Banking and Currency Committee has approved legislation that could have the effect of dispersing substantial numbers of lowincome families from the central cities into outlying areas.

title: Kenneth M. Swezey Dead; Author of Science Books
description: Kenneth M. Swezey, author of many books explaining scientific principles and workshop applications, died of a heart attack Friday at his home, 163 Milton Street, Brooklyn. He was 67 years old.

title: Man Shot at a Bronx Party Dies After Crawling a Block
description: A Bronx man who got into an argument at a party early yesterday morning was shot by one of the revelers and curd after staggering down five flights of stairs and crawling one block, the police said.

title: In Four Small Rooms, They've Made Every Inch Count
description: The Conrad Levensons don't believe in wasting anythingespecially space.

title: Margin Is 73 to 70
description: Unbeaten Canarsie advanced to the final round of the Public Schools Athletic League basketball championship yesterday, upsetting.DeWitt Clinton, the defending champion, 7370, at Staten Island Community College.

title: Books of The Times
description: No lover can live up to the history of poetry, or raise goose pimples on the skin of a faculty wife who is wearing three layers of exegesis. Yet, in Love in the Dunes, the first of these three long stories, Shirley Kane feels that she must have lover, that until she does there will be bare, uncultivated patch in her sensibility. Her husband Max, like so many intellectuals, is not at his best on a beach. Relating to him at a summer resort is rather like trying to read without sunglasses in the midday glare. Shirley tends to think of him in terms Violet Paget used in her book on empathy in art: How out of time to the trees, to the landscape, the people are walking and talking! Max's heroism, if he has any, tends to show itself in negationin refusing nature, in betraying it with his work, choosing the rustle of papers over the murmur of the waves, the work table over the tableau. He is not man for al seasons, for ecstatic identities with the weather.

title: Held in Bombing
description: ALDERSHOT, England, Feb. 27 (UPI)The police charged two men tonight in the bombing last Tuesday of an army mess in which seven persons were killed. One was charged with conspiracy to cause an explosion and the other with conspiracy to pervert the course of justice and illegal possession of firearms. Both will appear in Aldershot's Magistrates Court Monday, the police said.

title: Sniper Shootings and Fires Reported in North Carolina
U.S. Toll Rises in Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 27 (Reuters)American casualties in Vietnam during the last week reached their highest reported level of 1972.

title: Plainfield C.C. No. 1 Rink Wins St. Andrew's Curling
Candidates'
description: BOSTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles, campaigning for the Democratic nomination for President, said today that the Soviet Union had passed the United States in firststrike capability.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: For much the same reasons noted by the William Esty Company, Needham, Harper & Steers has dropped out of the running for the $22million American Motors account.

title: More Couples Are Appearing on City Hall Payroll
description: A growing number of wives are joining top city officials in patronage jobs on the city payroll, and the forecast is that the number will increase in the foreseeable future.

title: CAMERATA GROUP OFFERS HEBRIDES
description: Abraham Kaplan, who has built his primary reputation here as a choral conductor, chose a pair of symphonic warhorses for his Carnegie Hall I(program with the Camerata Singers and Orchestra: the Friday night concert opened with Mendelssohn's Hebrides Overture and closed with the Brahms Symphony No. 2 in D. In between came Ariel, Visions of Isaiah, a cantata for baritone, soprano, mixed chorus and orchestra by Robert Starer who, like Mr. Kaplan, was born in Israel and now lives in New York, teaching at the Juilliard School.

title: Saigon Is Cautious And Eager to Know All Details of Talks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Feb. 28Saigon's initial reaction to the communique issued at the end of President Nixon's visit to China last night was cautious. But officials were suspicious and anxious to learn if the Americans had made any concessions to the Chinese not covered in, the communiqu.

title: Hijackers Leave Aden
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 27 (UPI)Five Palestinian guerrillas who hijacked a Lufthansa jumbo jet to Aden last week and ransomed it and its crewmembers for $5million left the Southern Yemen city today, the Middle East News Agency said. The agency said the destination of the five hijackers was unknown.

title: Candidates'
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27  Mayor Lindsay put a $20 bill in silver collection plate this morning at St. John's Baptist Church and told the black congregation that if it's a choice between Wallace and Lindsay, the Democratic voters of Florida will pick Mr. Lindsay.

title: NO, 2 C.I.A. POST REMAINS VACANT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The White House has delayed filling the No. 2 position at the Central Intelligence Agency for more than two months out of deference to Senator John C. Stennis, Government sources say.

title: MRS. EISENSTAEDT
description: Mrs. Alma KayeZlotnick Eisenstaedt, wife of Alfred Eisenstaedt, Life magazine photographer, died yesterday of cancer in Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 60 years old and lived at 7250 37th Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: Jamaica, Queens, Gains Title of AllAmerica City
description: For the first time a coveted AllAmerica City title has been conferred on a community that is a part of a cityJamaica, Queens.

title: Neat Package Wins Sail; Condor Ahead in Standing
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27 (AP)Ronald Hume's 39foot Neat Package used its handicap to defeat the bigger Class A boats and win the annual Lipton Cup yacht race, 24 hours after it crossed the finish line.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 3,000 March Peacefully in Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY. Northern Ireland, Feb. 27 (AP)The first mass demonstration in this troubled city since 13 civilians were killed four weeks ago proceeded peacefully today, avoiding confrontations with British troops who had cordoned off the Roman Catholic Bogside district with armored cars.

title: SALVIN C. MAROLDA
description: Salvin C. Marolda, a retired state bank examiner, died Saturday in New York Infirmary. He was 78 years old and lived lat 531 East 20th Street.

title: Survey Shows TeenAgers Need 948.000 Summer Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The National League of Cities and United States Conference of Mayors says a national survey shows a need for about 948,000 jobs for teenagers next summer.

title: A Reporter's Notebook: 8 Days in a Generation
description: SHANGHAI, Monday, Feb. 28The last glimpse of China for the American voyagers is through weary eyes. They felt the excitement of Marco Polo, but they had only days where he had years. To be precise, they had eight days to fill a hunger of decadesone day for every 100 million Chinese, most of whom were babies when Americans last strolled these streets.

title: Shapiro, Professor At Illinois, Heard In a Piano Recital
description: Joel Shapiro, a pianist who gave some recitals here in the mid1960's, returned to Town Hall late Saturday afternoon to play a program consisting of Mozart's Variations on Unser dummer Pobel meint, Weber's Sonata in E minor and Liszt's Sonata in B minor.

title: Chinatown Has Little to Say on Accord
description: If Chinatown's man in the street had an opinion last night on President Nixon's agreement to arrange a gradual with, drawal of American troops from Taiwan, he wasn't telling any body.

title: Cater's Future as Yank Depends On How Blomberg Fares at First
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27When Danny Cater walked on the field for the Yankees first full workout last Thursday, he asked Elston Howard, Where do go?

title: NonBengalis in Bangladesh
description: Sheik Mujibur Rahman's suggestion that the United Nations arrange an exchange of frightened and unwanted minority groups between Bangladesh and Pakistan represents an unfortunate retreat from his earlier vows tolerance for all in the new breakaway Bengali nation. But at the same time it points to a practical solution to one of the pathetic human legacies of the civil war.

title: 1.100 Attend Testimonial For the Editor of Freiheit
description: Eleven hundred persons turned out yesterday for a testimonial luncheon for Paul Novick, editor in chief of the Yiddishlanguage Morning Freiheit, at the Americana Hotel.

title: Other Reaction
description: MOSCOWAction viewed as mask for secret policies.

title: Lindsay Sees Welcome Step
description: MIAMI, Florida  Mayon Lindsay, commenting on the communiqu, said: A welcome step, a good step. One hopes there vill be a normalization of relations with China.

title: Blame for Flood Is Hard to Fix
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Feb. 27  A rash of questions arose in this coal capital today about the legal liability and moral accountability of the Government and the mining industry for catastrophes like the inundation yesterday of a Logan County hollow where at least 60 men, women and children were known to have drowned.

title: Bonn Welcomes Move
description: BONN, Feb. 27  The West. German Government today ANCL corned President Nixon's apparent success in taking the first steps toward normalization of ChineseAmerican relations. The chief Government spokesman, Conrad Ahlers, said Bonn regarded this policy of rapprochement as necessary in order to insure world peace. He added that the Government of Chancellor Willy Brandt had followed Mr. Nixon's trip to China with great interest.

title: HAWKS OUTBATTLE BLAZERS, 113110
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 27 (UPI The Atlanta Hawks gained a 113110 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers here today in a National Basketball Association game marred by fighting.

title: Reasonable, Says McCloskey
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb: 27  Representative Paul N.I McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, who is campaigning in the New Hampshire primary this weekend, had this reaction to the joint communiqu from China: It seems entirely, reasonable to me, and I see nothing unusual in it.

title: Stage: Revisiting a Spry Jacques Brel
description: It seems difficult to believe, but on Saturday afternoon the musical at the Village Gate, Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris, had its 1,700th performance. And I remember it when it was just a child. It has grown well.

title: Two Snowmobilers Drown
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb. 27 (AP)Two persons drowned early today when thin ice gave way under a party of some 17 snowmohilers on Lake Massabesic. Eight snowmobiles went to the bottom of the lake and four more, operated by a rescue team from the State Fish and Game Division, broke through as rescuers sought to reach the party. The victims were identified as Eva Ann Muntz, 36 years old, and William Godzyk, 24, both of Auburn.

title: GREEK ORTHODOX HONOR 11 LAYMEN
description: Archbishop Iakovos, Greek Orthodox spiritual leader of the Western Hemisphere, yesterday conferred the patriarchal title of archon upon 11 lay leaders of the church.

title: Bridge:
description: The laws of bridge were codified in the nineteenthirties, and the only substantive change since World War 11 was in 1948, when the scoring was amended to give a 50point bonus for making a doubled contract.

title: Operators of Roadside Stands Learn New Sales Techniques
description: ALBANY, Feb. 26  Can spring be far behind if farmers are making plans to open their fresh fruit and vegetable stands?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: YOUTH DIES RESISTING HOLDUP IN A SUBWAY
description: A 14yearold youth was stabbed to death yesterday evening as he and four friends resisted an attempted robbery by five other youths at a plat form of the Chambers Street IRT subway station, the police reported.

title: Hodges's Plan: One Met Platoon
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 27The big switch in the New York Mets training camp this spring is that Gil Hodgeswho platoons his troops like a puppeteeris finally committed to the set lineup.

title: HOFFA IS HOPEFUL OF TEAMSTER ROLE
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 27 (UPI)James R. Hoffa says he plans to get back into the labor movement and into a leadership position with the teamsters as soon as parole restrictions on his union activity expire.

title: Woman Chokes on Steak
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27 (UPI) Mrs. Alfred Conti chocked to death on a piece of steak in a restaurant last night despite the efforts of her husband, a surgeon, to perform an emergency tracheotomy with a kitchen knife.

title: Petty,inaPlymouth, Wins Richmond 500 For 2d Score of '72
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 27 (AP)Richard Petty of Randleman. N.C., outraced Bobby Allison of Hueytown, Ala., in the latter stages today and won the Richmond 500 for his second victory of the 1972 Grand National stock car season.

title: Candidates'
description: NAPLES, Fla., Feb. 27Senator Hubert H. Humphrey today called upon President Nixon and his national security adviser, Henry A. Kissinger to give Congress a real indepth explanation of what took place on their China visit.

title: Antipoverty Post Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Peter M. Mirelez, Denver community leader and specialist in seasonal farm worker programs, has been appointed head of the migrant division of the Office of Economic Opportunity and chief of special programs for the SpanishSpeaking poor. Mr. Mirelez will be sworn in Tuesday by Philip V. Sanchez, director of the antipoverty agency.

title: Israelis Attack 3d Day
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 27Israeli Air Force jets strafed Arab guerrilla headquarters for southern Lebanon, it was announced here tonight. The air raid was the third against Lebanese territory in three days.

title: Archeologists'
description: The Transit Authority is reported to be spending halfmillion dollars a year in a foredoomed effort to cope with a rising tide of graffiti in subway cars and on station walls. As fast as a MagicMarked obscenity is removed from an available space, it is replaced by suggestions of where whitey should go, of what might be a desirable fate for the city's blacks and Puerto Ricans or some comparably incisive social analysis. And no sooner is that expunged than it is replaced by the name and address of someone who, psychologists explain, simply needs to impose his identification on others.

title: March Orders Show Upturn at Mills
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 27 The steel market was in a state of transition last week.

title: City Plans Custom Care to End Lost Status of Young Detainees
description: The city administration has begun developing individual care plans for the problem children sent to its juvenile centers, starting from their first appearance in court and following up, if need be, to age 18 and possibly 21.

title: Red Smith 70 Is 2 Under, Gene
description: Stealthy as a Mohican, Gene Sarazen's 70th birthday crept up on him yesterday. He tried to ignore it, rising early as he would any other day, pulling on fresh knickers for his daily round of golf. Don't make opera of it, he had told Fred Corcoran by phone from Marco Island Florida the other day. When you get down here you and Nancy and Mary and I will have dinner, that's all.

title: Lakers Down Bulls
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27 (AP) Jerry West hit for six points in a oneminute span of an overtime period tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Chicago Bulls, 123118.

title: Sabres, Seals Tie, 44
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 27 (AP)Jim Watson's goal late in the third period earned the Buffalo Sabres a 44 tie with the California Golden Seals tonight: California Golden Seats 2 1 14

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PATHANS PROTEST RULE BY PAKISTAN
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, Feb. 27In an impressive show of force thousands of Pathans, many heavily armed, demonstrated today in support of their demand that Pakistan lift martial law and grant greater selfgovernment to the provinces.

title: Virginia Senior Picked For High School Board
description: HERNDON, Va.. Feb. 27An 18yearold high school senior has been selected to become apparently the first school board member in the nation who is still a student in the system that he helps govern.

title: G. F. Brach Weds Kathie E. Strauss
description: The marriage of Miss Kathie Ellen Strauss, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Strauss of New York, to Gerard Florian Brach took place at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel yesterday afternoon. The bridegroom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Florian Brach of Annecy, France, is with Restaurant Associates, Inc. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobol performed the ceremony.

title: National Book Awards Are Expanded
description: After two years of sizzling literary polemics, the selection system of the National Book Awards has undergone yet another reorganization and the number of prizes has been expanded from 8 to 10.

title: Personal Finance
description: Stockholders generally are delighted to receive stock splits and stock dividends. It gives them a psychological boost, even if it doesn't put money in their pockets. Usually, companies declare splits or stock dividends at times when earnings are on the rise.

title: Values and Priorities in Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON The catastrophic adventure in Indochina has broken the postwar foreign policy consensus. After two generations of war and preparations for wars, the air is filled with promises of new approaches to the outside vorld.

title: March 20 Set for Decision In Holland, Andrews Suit
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 27Judge Francois Auclair, of the Practice Division, Quebec Superior Court, will give his decision by March 20 on an application by the brokerage firm of Holland Andrews, Perrier & Co., Ltd., for a permanent injunction to block a hearing by the Montreal and Canadian Stock Exchanges into charges made against the firm.

title: DURYEA DISMISSES FUND BID BY CITY
description: State Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea yesterday dismissed the Lindsay administration's planned request for $850million in additional state aid for the city as totally unrealistic.

title: Saigon Reports Killing 56 of Foe in 3 Tough Battles
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam. Monday. Feb. 28 (AP)South Vietnamese forces battled Communistled troops on three fronts yesterday in tough fighting that took a total of nearly 100 casualties on both sides, the Saigon command announced today.

title: Chess:
description: The fifth annual GoldwaterMarshall Invitation Tournament, a sixman round robin, was won by Grandmaster Arthur Bisguier of Hartsdale, N. Y., a former United States open and invitational champion. He posted 31/2 points out of 5. Tied for second and third were Edmar Mednis, a topechelon player, and Sal Matera, who led the Columbia University chess team that won the PanAmerican title.

title: West Virginia Flood Toll At60 With Hund reds Lost
description: MAN, W. Va., Feb. 27Up on Buffalo Creek, where people used to live, only the bulldozers and the helicopters belonged today. The people were gone, scattered by yesterday morning's flash flood that was unleashed by the collapse of coal waste pile accumulated over the last 15 years.

title: Deft Performing Narks Philomusica's Concert
description: All the chamber works on the New York Philomusica's program at Tully Hall yesterday afternoon were superbly performed. Most breathtaking of all, though, was Mozart's endlessly inspired Divertimento No. 15 for two horns and strings.

title: Advertising:
description: The Best Foods division of CPC International, which was one of Lennon & Newell's last major clients, is presently formulating a plan to insure that its agencies promptly use its money to pay media bills.

title: TOOL ORDERS OFF DURING JANUARY
description: Machine tools orders, an important indicator of the future capital spending plans of industry, declined 22 per cent in January from December but were up 32 per cent from the yearearlier month.

title: NETS DOWN CONDORS ON 49POINT PERIOD
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 27 The New York Nets, behind a 49point first period, a team record, rolled to a 131123 victory tonight over the Pittsburgh Condors in an American Basj ketball Association game.

title: Issue of Propriety for Rehnquist
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27.Justice William H. Rehnquist, a former Assistant Attorney General who vigorously advocated many of the lawandorder policies of the Nixon Administration, is now facing some sensitive questions of, ju(tidal propriety as some of those same issues arc, coming before the Supreme Court. At issue is when a Justice should disqualify himself from ruling on a casea murky legal area that has produced several controversies in recent years over alleged conflicts between judges financial holdings and their role on the bench.

title: He Designs Pants for Women but Prefers Them in Dresses
description: Despite the fact that his pants outfits were his most highly commended styles at the showing of the Nina Ricci collection in Paris a few weeks ago, Gerard Pipart fervently hopes women, won't be wearing trousers all the time. Pants as a uniformit's a bad excuse for not accepting the role as a women, he said. The pants Pipart designs are about as womanly as pants can be. They have pleats under the waistband, flare gently and have cuffs at the bottom. Still, he feels women look more seductive in dresses.

title: ISRAELI BOND DRIVE SEEKS $450MILLION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 27Pinchas Sapir, Israel's Finance Minister, today urged Jews of the nonCommunist world, particularly in the United States, to provide almost all the funds required to meet his nation's new $500million development budget.

title: Sabin to Have HeartSurgery
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 27 (UPI)  Dr. Albert B. Sabin, developer of the Sabin oral polio vaccine, will undergo openheart surgery at the Cleveland Clinic. Dr. Sabin, 65 years old, who lives in Israel, said Xrays indicated he had a blockage in an artery that if not corrected would give him a oneinfive chance of popping off. He said he expected to be released from the hospital around March 18 and then recuperate in Florida.

title: 100 Hurt as Rikers Attack Frees 5 Hostage Guards
The Case of a City Tenant and Guilt by Association
description: Mrs. Ernestine Tyson gripped the arms of her chair in the stuffy hearing room last week. She had sat through court proceedings before, but they had always involved her older son. Now she faced a trial of a sort herself.

title: No. 1 Broker, as Author, Takes a Panoramic View
description: Donald T. Regan, the world's No. I stockbroker, is branching out a bit. His first book, A View From the Street, will be published this spring by the New American Library.

title: Pioneers Defeat Chiefs To Gain Roller Derby Lead
description: The Pioneers defeated the Chiefs, 4341, in an International Roller Derby League game yesterday at Madison Square Garden. The victory gave the Pioneers possession of first place, which they had shared with the Chiefs prior to the game.

title: Closer Check Set For Cost Figures In Defense Pacts
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 27The Government disclosed late last week how it hopes to make defense contractors adhere to uniform accounting standards and, thereby, avoid such expensive practices as cost overruns.

title: Squires Wins Preston Run
description: Pete Squires, a 21yearold Manhattan College student, won the 11th annual Bob Preston Memorial fivemile run yesterday over the Harlem River course. Squires, who defeated Bill O'Brien of the Millrose Athletic Association by 100 yards, was clocked in 25 minutes 2 seconds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Vienna: Rare Soloist on Double Bass
description: VIENNAWho has ever heard of Max Bruch's Kol Nidre being played on a double bass? It can be done and Prof, Ludwig Streicher of the Vienna Philharmonic makes it into an unforgettable experience, giving the passionate Hebrew prayer for forgiveness a voice that no other instrument and no other musician has to offer. On the average, there is about one great doublebass soloist every century. Professor Streicher is one of these rare artists. He started his career as a concert soloist on his 6foot fiddle as late as 1966 but it was a flying start. Soon the critics were raving about his incredible technique, his mellifluous tone and flawless intonation.

title: Cleveland Mayor Upheld By Judges on Cutting Pay
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 27 (UPI) Two state appellate judges overruled today a lower court's (refusal to let Cleveland cut the salaries of its 2,300 firemen and policemen by 10 per cent in an austerity move by Mayor Ralph J. Perk.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Four Members of Family Die in Queens House Fire

title: SammisGray Advance
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Feb. 27 The topseeded team of Gordon Gray and Jesse Sammis 3d of Greenwich led the way into the semifinals of the Greenwich men's platform tennis doubles tournament today by downing Ted Winpenny and Keith Jennings of New Canaan, 810, 64, default.

title: Hawks Tie Canucks, 33
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 27 (UPI)The Chicago Black Hawks, West Division leaders, rallied in the third period from a twogoal deficit tonight and battled to a 33 tie with the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Sagamore Toccoa Best in Elm City K.C. Show
Weiskopf Triumphs by Shot
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27Tom Weiskopf, who was so frustrated last year with his golf that he was going to quit, won the game's biggest purse today as he beat Jack Nicklaus by one stroke in the Jackie Gleason Inverrary Classic.

title: Marian Anderson At 70, Reflecting On a Life's Work
description: Marian Anderson never quite became the homemaker with a vengeance she had threatened to become seven years ago following her emotioncharged farewell performance at Carnegie Hall.

title: Miss Schonfeld Bride of Dr. David Statt
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., Feb. 27Miss Deborah V. Schonfeld, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Moses Schonfeld of Mamaroneck, was married here this afternoon to Dr. David Statt. He is the son of Mrs. Eli Statt of Glasgow, Scotland, and the late Mr. Statt.

title: Total Taxes for Year Set At Record $295Billion
description: Federal, state and local taxes will take a record total of $295billion, or an average of $4,530 from every American household, in the current fiscal year ending June 30, the nonprofit Tax Foundation predicted yesterday.

title: U.N. Demands That Israel Halt Attacks on Lebanon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Monday, Feb. 28The Security Council early today unanimously demanded that Israel cease all military action against Lebanon and forthwith withdraw all its military forces from Lebanese territory.

title: PIONEER 10 LIFTOFF TO JUPITER DELAYED
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb., 27The launching of Pioneer, 10, an American spacecraft designed to explore Jupiter, was delayed tonight because of high winds and a momentary power failure at the launching pad here.

title: ITALIAN LEADER DUE TO CALL ELECTIONS
description: ROME, Feb. 27President Giovanni Leone conferred with the Speakers of the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate tonight as a preliminary step for disbanding

title: CONGRESS LEADERS PUT OFF COMMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Most members of Congress were content today to put off discussion of the joint communiqu from Shanghai until tomorrow when they will have had a chance to read the document.

title: Car Thefts Up 183%
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Feb. 27 (AP)Automobile thefts have risen 183 per cent in the last 10 years to one million a year, C. C. Benson of the National Automobile Theft Bureau told 100 law enforcement officers attending a seminar here.

title: Warriors Stop Rockets
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 27 (UPI)Nate Thurmond and Cazzie Russell scored 28 points each tonight to lead the Golden State Warriors to a 117104 triumph over the Houston Rockets. The loss ended Houston's threegame winning streak.

title: ANJA SILJA SINGS FIDELIO AT MET
description: In the performance of Beethoven's Fidelio given on Saturday night by the Metropolitan Opera, Anja Silja made her debut with the company in the part of Leonore. The German soprano made her American debut in 1968 with the San Francisco Opera and has also sung with the Chicago Lyric Opera.

title: Goya Grotesquery Laid to Lead's Use
description: Art historians have long speculated about the nature of a severe illness Goya suffered in the midst of his painting career that is generally thought to have caused a remarkable and abrupt transformation in the subject matter of his paintingfrom pleasant court portraiture to grotesque social commentary.

title: Flood Relief Allocated
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The Office of Emergency Preparedness said today that $3.5million had been made available from the President's Disaster Relief Fund to alleviate conditions created last September by flooding in the Pennsylvania counties of Bucks, Chester, Delaware, Montgomery, Philadelphia, Fayette and Westmoreland.

title: DataProcessing Plans for Soviet Economy Run Into Obstacle
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 25A new obstacle  computer phobia has reared its head in the path of an ambitious Soviet program of computerizing the economy.

title: Muskie Advances in County Delegate Caucus in Iowa
Knicks Win and Gain Playoffs
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Feb. 27  The Knicks needed 53 minutes of bruising, frustrat ing basketball today at the University of Maryland's Cole, Field House, but clinched a spot in the National Basketball Association Playoffs by downing the obstinant Baltimore Bullets, 9795, in overtime.

title: Poor's Duo Takes Title
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27 Tom Poor of Boston and Mrs. Nathan Stauffer of Haverford. Pa., won the United States mixed doubles squash racquets championship today by defeating the defenders, Kit Spahr of Haverford and Mrs. Halsey Spruance of Wilmington, Del., 1015, 1511, 1511, 158.

title: Leaders of Senate Labor Panel Pledge to Press Pension Reform Measure This Year
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The Democratic and Republican leaders of the Senate Corn, mittee on Labor and Public Welfare committed themselves today to enactment this year of pension reform legislation designed In guarantee and broaden retirement benefits for workers.

title: SYLVIA PEDLAR, 71, DESIGNER, IS DEAD
description: Sylvia Pedlar, lingerie designer who adapted the Roman toga to the American nightgown, died here Saturday after a long illness. She was 71 years old and lived at 40 Fifth Avenue.

title: Litton Industries Reports a Deficit
description: Litton Industries announced, over the weekend a loss of $8,753,000 for the second fiscal quarter, ended Jan. 31, in contrast to a yearearlier profit of 811,922,000, or 30 cents a share after adjustment for a 21/2 per cent stock dividend last November). Sales in the latest quarter rose to $622,315,000 from $599,612,000 a year before.

title: DE COTEAU LEADS THE NEW WORLD
description: The Symphony of the New World, recently shaken by an internal power dispute, played a concert at Philharmonic Hall yesterday afternoon that seemed harmonious enough, organizationally. The integrated orchestra, inactive since the resignation last Oct. 10 of its music director, Benjamin Steinberg, was guestconducted by Denis Montague de Coteau, with Andrew Frierson, bassbaritone, as soloist.

title: A U.S. Force of 8,000 Helps Defend Taiwan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 American forces on Taiwan, reported to number 8,000 to 9,000, are there to help defend the Chinese Nationalist refuge and they also support American troops in Vietnam operation. That presumably will continue to be true as the United States withdraws from Vietnam but the bases may have some use in logistic support of South Vietnamese forces.

title: RESERVE RESENTS CENSURE ON RATES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Top officials of the Federal Reserve Board, while saying little in public, believe the Federal Reserve is being unfairly criticized at home and abroad for driving down shortterm interest rates in the United States.

title: Transcript of Session Held With Kissinger
Davis Trial Opens Today; Struggle Over Jury Seen
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 27 (UPI)After months of delay, Angela Davis goes on trial tomorrow, charged with plotting and providing the guns for a courthouse escape attempt that left four men dead last August.

title: Moscow Implies Communique Hides Most of the Essence of U.S.Chinese Talks
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27The Soviet Union, apparently still apprehensive about what really went on in Peking, treated the AmericanChinese communiqu today as hiding more than it disclosed about the essence of the talks between President Nixon and Chinese leaders.

title: Nader Mobilizes Retired Professionals in Corps to Tackle the Problems of Social Change
description: WASHINGTON. Feb, 27Ralph Nader, the big voice for, the consumer in Washington and a magnet for young crusaders, is now moving to use a vast and neglected resource of wisdom and expertise  the nalion's old people.

title: Beverly Sills Adds Touch of Fun To Chamber Society Program
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center has programed many kinds of works in its relatively brief history, but none, perhaps, has been more fun and less consequential than the final item in the concert given Friday night and repeated Saturday night.

title: Williamson Pell Jr. Dies at 60; Trust Expert Aided Princeton
description: Williamson Pell Jr., senior partner in the law firm of Jackson, Nash, Brophy, Barringer & Brooks, died yesterday in ColumbiaPresbytarian Medical Center. He was 60 years old and lived on Claremont Road in Bernardsville, N.J., and in New Marlboro, Mass.

title: Smith Captures Final in 4 Sets As FootFaults Plague Gisbert
description: The footfault, that technical curse of all tennis players, crept into Juan Gisbert's game yesterday and helped stymie his dreams of winning the $30,000 Clean Air tournament.

title: For Africa, a Debate in Many Tongues
Burton K. Wheeler Now 90
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Burton K. Wheeler, who represented Montana in the Senate for 24 years, celebrated his 90th birthday today. About 400 people attended a reception for Mr. Wheeler, who served in the Senate from 1923 to 1947 and helped expose the Teapot Dome scandal during the Harding Administration. The scandal involved leasing of Federal oil lands in Wyoming and California to private oil companies.

title: YOSEF SAPIR
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 27 (AP)Yosef Sapir, chairman of the Israeli Liberal party, died in Wolper Jewish Hospital yesterday. He was 70 years old.

title: Niagara Triumphs, 8074
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 27 (UPI) Niagara, behind by 8 points early in the second half, fought back to gain an 8074 victory today over a Little Three Conference foe, St. Bonaventure.

title: Philip Weissman, Psychiatrist, Theater Expert, Killed in Fall
description: Dr. Philip Weissman, a psychiatrist who was well known for his studies on creative imagination in the theater, jumped or fell to his death yesterday afternoon from his 17thfloor penthouse apartment at 8 East 96th Street, the police reported.

title: JERARD WINS JUMP AT BEAR MOUNTAIN
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Feb. 27Robert Jerard, 24yearold mechanical engineer from Hopkinton, Mass., won the Joseph McManus ski jump1 ing trophy today.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: GINLEY'S THE NAME GUMSHOE'S THE GAMEADVT

title: Yeshiva Presents Festival of Sephardic Music
description: Although there are only about 100,000 Sephardic Jews in America today, these descendants of the 15thcentury Spanish and Portuguese exiles maintain a rich and varied cultural heritage. They point proudly to the fact that the oldest synagogue in America is Sephardic, and that Sephardic melodies were the first Jewish music heard in the world.

title: Commission Bars Price Rises Tied to Excessive Building Pay
description: WASHLNGTON, Feb. 27The Price Commission, in a move to press construction contractors into holding the line on pay, will refuse to allow increases in wage costs above 5.5 per cent to be passed along in the form of higher prices, C. Jackson Grayson Jr., the commission chairman, says.

title: City Housing Authority Completes Auditions for Its Own Orchestra
description: The New York City Housing Authority completed auditions for its projected symphony orchestra over the weekend and plans to begin rehearsals on Saturday.

title: Continental Groups Link Resources to Erode Concern's Market
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Feb. 27Through more transnational hookups and increasingly active Government intervention, Europe's computer makers are mounting an ever more serious challenge to the primacy of the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: RUSSIANS STUDY CORE FROM MOON
description: MOSCOW, Feb, 27  Lunar material brought to earth by the Soviet unmanned spacecraft Luna 20 was removed from a core tube today and turned out to be ashcolored dust with a few larger particles embedded in it,

title: FIVE U.S. NEWSMEN STAYING ON IN CHINA
description: SHANGHAI. Feb. 27 (UPI) Five American correspondents who have been reporting on President Nixon's trip to China have been permitted to remain in the country after the departure of the official party for the United States. They are Joseph Kraft, columnist for PublishersHall Syndicate, Jerrold Schecter of Time magazine, Henry Bradsher of The Washington Star, Richard Dudman or The St. Louis PostDispatch and Robert Boyd of Knight Newspapers.

title: PETKEVICH VICTOR IN FIGURE SKATING
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Feb. 27 John Misha Petkevich, who finished fifth in the Olympics, turned in a flashy performance tonight to capture the men's figure skating title and give the United States its first gold medal at the World University Winter Games.

title: Reforms Reduce Backlog In City Criminal Courts
description: The Criminal Court of New York City, until recently one of the most chaotic and criticized court systems in the nation, announced yesterday that for the first time in its history its calendars were current and its backlog reduced.

title: Candidates'
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 27 Senator Henry M. Jackson said today that two of his senatorial rivals for the Democratic Presidential nomination, Edmund S. Muskie and Hubert H. Humphrey, had not supported the space shuttle program.

title: Suns Top Cavaliers, 127125
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 27 (UPI)Dennis Layton's 3point play with five seconds left tonight gave the Phoenix Suns a 127125 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Text of Nixon Toast At Shanghai Dinner
description: SHANGHAI, Feb. 27 (AP)Following is the text President Nixon's toast tonight at a dinner given by Shanghai's Municipal Revolutionary Committee:

title: FIGHT ON INFLATION PLEDGED BY HEATH
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (UPI)Prime Minister Heath today pledged a noholdsbarred fight against both inflation and growing violence on the picket line and elsewhere in Britain.

title: The Divisions Run Deep
description: CAIRO, Feb. 27It was just a little local difficulty, some of the Britishtrained, stiffupperlipped officers of the SuI danese Army used to say with a shrug when reports of rebellion and repression began to emerge from the Sudan's remote southern provinces.

title: SADAT SAID TO BAR ANY HOTEL TALKS
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt is quoted by Newsweek magazine as ruling out the possibility that his country would engage in proximity or hotel talks with Israel if the United States acted as intermediary.

title: KnitFabric Groups Merging
description: An agreement to merge the Warp Knit Institute into the Knitted Textile Association was announced yesterday. The 200 members of the K.T.A. produce more than 85 per cent of American knitted fabrics, valued at about $2billion last year.

title: Accord Gives Self Rule to South Sudan
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Feb. 27 (Reuters)The southern area of the Sudan is to have selfgovernment under a formula, reached here yesterday, to end 16 years of a civil war between the Moslems of the north and the tribesmen of the south.

title: Woman Winning State Department Case
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 27 Alison Palmer, a Foreign Service officer, appears to be winning her onewoman campaign against the State Department, which she has accused of sex discrimination.

title: Text of U.S.Chinese Communiqu
description: SHANGHAI, Feb. 27 (AP)Follow ing is the text of the communiqu issued today at the conclusion of the meetings between President Nixon and Premier Chou Enlai:

title: Singer Sets Acquisition
description: The Singer Company announced over the weekend an agreement to purchase certain assets of the Tappan Company's environment comfort group.

title: Sharp Criticism From Ball
description: One sharply critical comment on the joint communiqu came from George W. Ball, former Under Secretary of State, who said: I could have written it a few weeks ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Flyers Topple Wings
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27 (AP) Mike Parizeau scored his third goal of the season to break a 11 tie and Doug Favell in the goal made it stand up as the Philadelphia Flyers defeated the Detroit Red Wings, 31, in the National Hockey League today.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Feb. 27  Imagine that racial conflict in some region of the United States explodes in violence so serious that the Federal Government sends in troops, then begins arresting blacks suspected of terrorism. Under a special keepthepeace law it holds 100,000 blacks in prison camps without trial or charges. And all this arouses little public or political criticism outside the affected region.

title: N.A.S.D. DISCIPLINES 2 FIRMS IN NEW YORK
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers yesterday announced disciplinary action against seven firms and 11 persons for violations of its rules of fair practice. Included were two securities houses and four individuals from New York.

title: Bing Is Appointed Professor of Music At Brooklyn College
description: Rudolf Bing, who will retire at the end of this season as general manager of the Metropolitan Opera, will be Distinguished Visiting Professor of Music at Brooklyn College beginning next September. His appointment by the City University of New York is on the agenda to be considered this evening by the Board of Higher Education.

title: MRS. GUNTER BEATS MISS EVERT, 76, 62
description: BETHESDA, Md., Feb. 27 (AP)Mrs. Nancy Gunter defeated 17yearold Chris Evert, 76, 62, today to capture the Virginia Slims women's tennis tournament before more than 2,000 fans, including Vice President Agnew.

title: MISS PFLUG VICTOR IN SPEED SKATING
description: ESKILSTUNA, Sweden, Feb. 27 (UPI)Dianne Holum of Northbrook, Ill., an Olympic gold medal winner, finished in second place today in the first world sprint speed skating championship.

title: Of Hope and Fear
description: MIAMIIn a democratic society, the task for a political leader is how to encourage and sustain people's hopes while taking account of their fears. The busing issue which now dominates the Florida primary defines that difficult task at the moment for the Democratic Presidential contenders. But busing is not unique.

title: Arctic Island Oil Strike Yields Promising Sample
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 27Ellesmere Island, lying with its magnificent fjords just below the permanent ice cap and only 700 miles from the North Pole, has been best known for the Eureka and Alert weather stations.

title: TOKYO IS RELIEVED BY LIMITED RESULT
description: TOKYO, Monday, Feb. 28The Japanese Government, fearful of being undermined by President Nixon's visit to China, reacted last night with almost visible relief to the limited concrete achievements set out in the communiqu.

title: Average Nears 3.45%
description: ShortTerm Treasury bill rates again moved higher yesterday, but their rise was much less pronounced than on last Friday.

title: GOVERNOR OFFERS PROMPTTRIAL BILL
description: ALBANY, Feb. 28Governor Rockefeller sent to the Legislature today a bill designed to provide prompt trials to defendants in criminal cases.

title: California Aide to Appeal Ruling on Death Penalty
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 28 (AP) California's Attorney General, Evelle Younger, said today that his office would file a petition Friday asking the state Supreme Court for a rehearing on its ruling that the death penalty is unconstitutional.

title: Hundreds Stage Albany Protest Against Cut in Drug Program
description: ALBANY, Feb. 28  In the largest budget protest this year hundreds of New York City residents gathered at the State Capitol today to lobby against the loss of a school drug program credited with referring 4,000 students to treatment centers since it began last Sentember.

title: THOMAS KENNEDY, YONKERS EXAIDE
description: YONKERS, Feb. 28Thomas V. Kennedy. former City Manager and Controller of Yonkers, died Saturday in St. John's Riverside Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 26 Odell Avenue.

title: Democratic Disarray in Italy
description: Deep divisions that have paralyzed government Italy at a time of mounting economic problems have finally forced the showdown that Italy's democratic leaders have long dreadedthe dissolution of Parliament and President Giovanni Leone's call for new elections on May 7, one year ahead of schedule.

title: Bridge: Unhelpful Lead Paves Way To a Successful Grand Slam
description: For the odd day in Leap Year an odd hand is perhaps appropriate. On the diagramed deal from the recent New York tournament some declarers in a grand slam contract received a helpful lead that took a finesse for them. They went down. Others received an unhelpful leadand made the contract. W. S. Gilbert would no doubt have called this a most ingenious paradox.

title: Contributors To McGovern
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Following are the 86 persons listed as contributors of $1,000 or more to Senator George McGovern's campaign for President:

title: Nixon Aides Oppose A 20% Benefits Rise For Social Security
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI) Administration officials opposed today a 20 per cent increase in Social Security benefits and denied they intended to reintroduce the proposal later during President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: The Push Is On for Tournament Berths
description: The comic flyer from Oral Roberts University asked, what is a Richie Fuqua?

title: 5 Killed, Cambodia Says
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 28 (AP)  The Cambodian command reported today that five soldiers were killed and 17 wounded in renewed fighting on an island in the Mekong River about 80 miles northeast of Pnompenh, the capital.

title: Dizzy Trout, ExPitcher, Dies; A Detroit Tigers Ace in 1940's
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 28 (UPI)Dizzy Trout, a star pitcher for the Detroit Tigers in the 1940's, died today at Ingalls Memorial Hospital where he was under treatment for stomach cancer. He was 56 years old.

title: Stage: Night Watch, Stylish Thriller
description: A most superior thriller turned up at the Morosco Theater last night, which from its first bloodcurdling scream to its last charming surprise is a firstclass example of its genre. It is called Night Watch, and its author, Lucille Fletcher, wellknown in films and television, here makes her Broadway debut with style.

title: Assemblyman Scores Parks Department on Maintenance of Broadway Malls
description: Two Assemblymen from Manhattan led a tour yesterday along Broadway between 162d and 135th Streets, inspecting broken park benches and fence railings on island malls filled with trash and dog excreta.

title: Plans Set for 15 Inns
description: Prime Equities, Inc., announced yesterday a $25million expansion program involving the construction of 15 Ramada Inns that Prime Equities will operate. Peter E. Simon, president of Prime Equities, said his company had received licensing rights from Ramada Inns to operate the inns. Mr. Simon said that five inns will be situated in New Jersey, four in New York, four in Connecticut and two in Florida.

title: Candidates Day
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 28Good health to you, good health to you, Mayor Lindsay told senior citizens as he pressed his way through the crowd at a massive rally at the midpoint of an energetic 13hour day.

title: Miss Walsh Is Skating Victor
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Feb. 28In a wellshared distribution of the spoils, the United States, France and Canada won a gold medal each today as the World University (FISU) Winter Games moved through the second day of competition.

title: Communists Help to Dampen Protest on Renault Killing
description: PARIS, Feb. 28Actions by the Government and the Communist party dampened protests today over the killing of a young Maoist at the Renault automobile works here.

title: Secret Launching Delayed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 28 (AP)The launching of a secret Air Force satellite has been delayed 24 hours until Wednesday, sources reported today. A Titan 3 rocket reportedly is to hurl the satellite into orbit to provide early warning of a hostile missile attack on the United States.

title: U.F.T. SUIT SEEKS MILLION FOR BIAS
description: The United Federation of Teachers filed suit for $1million in punitive damages against the. AfricanAmerican Teachers Association yesterday charging that the group fostered policies of discrimination and segregation against white teachers.

title: WHITMORE LOSES BID FOR A HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The long and controversial case of George Whitmore Jr, came to an apparent end today as the Supreme Court refused to disturb his conviction for the attempted rape and assault of a practical nurse on a Brooklyn street almost eight years ago.

title: RYAN COMPLAINS HODGES TOO MUM
description: HOLTVILLE, Calif., Feb. 28 (AP)  Nolan Ryan says the New York Mets manager, Gil Hodges, failed to help him improve because he was uncommunicative.

title: Bill Asks Curb on Smoking
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI) Senator Richard S. Schweiker Republican of Pennsylvania, introduced a bill today that would limit smoking to specific areas of airliners, trains and buses. Citing a recent. report by the Surgeon General of the Public Health Service that nonsmokers also suffer the effects of smoking by inhaling the fumes, Schweiker said, Everyone has the right to breathe clean air.

title: JUSTICES TO RULE ON BAN ON TV ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Supreme Court agreed today to decide if radio and television broadcasters may constitutionally refuse to sell time to noncommercial advertisers who wish to broadcast their views on controversial issues.

title: Security to Be Tight For Chaplin's Visit To City Next Month
description: Final arrangements for Charles Chaplin's first visit to the United States in 20 years have been settled, including exacting precautions to assure that the 82yearnld film master will not he mobbed during his visit to New York in April.

title: Ethel Britton, an Actress On Stage and TV, 57, Dies
description: Ethel Britton, an actress who appeared on Broadway in Strike Up the Band, The DuBarry and Harvey, died on Saturday at her home, 401 East 83d Street. She was 57 years old.

title: Tugs Free Cruise Ship
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 23 (UPI)The Government said today that tugs have freed the Norwegian cruise ship Lindblad Explorer from rocks in the Antarctic where she ran aground on Feb. 11 with 104 tourists abroad, all of whom were rescued. A German rescue tugboat, the Arctic, pulled the Norwegian ship free from rocks off King George Island on Saturday.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: GINLEY'S THE NAME GUMSHOE'S THE GAMEADVT

title: John H. Holdridge
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 John H. Holdridge, a Mandarinspeaking West Pointer who turned diplomat nearly a quarter of a century ago, is the White House's inhouse expert on China in particular and the Far East in general.

title: For Best Chow in Vietnam They Even Risk Enemy Fire
description: TANCANH, South Vietnam  Although Tancanh is only 20 miles from a major Communist base area on the Cambodian border and is often hit by rockets, American helicopter pilots who fly over large areas of the country, compete for a chance to stop here.

title: Egyptians Report the Arrest Of 11 More Iraqis in a Plot
description: CAIRO, Feb. 28The Egyptian Interior Ministry reported today that 11 more Iraqis had been arrested in a plot to assasinnate former Iraqi officers and officials in refuge here because of their opposition to the Baathist regime of President Ahmed Hassan alBaler.

title: Sentenced on Tax Evasion
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 28 (AP) Harry J. Karafin, under indictment for income tax evasion of $11,056, entered a plea of guilty today to one count of the indictment involving $3,895. He was sentenced to five years probation. Karafin, a former reporter for The Philadelphia Inquirer, is now serving four to nine years for extortion and blackmail and an additional two to seven for perjury.

title: $4Million Fire in Butte
description: BUTTE, Mont., Feb. 28 (AP) An explosion and fire early today destroyed a threequarter block section of Butte's downtown business area, including four residence hotels, a J. C. Penney Company store and seven small businesses. Officials said there were no serious injuries. Damage to the area was put at $4million by city officials.

title: Taipei's Statement on the Communique
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Feb. 28Following is the text of a statement issued today by the Chinese Nationalist Government:

title: To Have and To Hold
description: A beautifully illustrated pamphlet issued by the Department of Interior entitled To Have and To Hold tells the story of Alaska's migratory birds. Few Americans realize that Alaska is the nesting area each year for ducks, geese, swans and other water fowlmore than twelve million in allwhich migrate throughout this country.

title: Books of The Times
description: I had hoped that with the publication of John O'Hara's The Ewings"which he finished two months before his death in April, 1970I might have the opportunity to say a few things in defense of O'Hara fiction. And for a little time, reading The Ewings, the hope seemed justified. For little time, that dramatic economy was there, which might have provided the occasion to observe how more highly regarded novelists could learn a thing or two from O'Hara, especially about getting people on and off stage (or in and out of bed). For a little time, that powerful sense of milieu was thereindirectly conveyed through that shockingly direct dialoguewhich might have been an occasion to wager that perhaps a hundred years from now, it would be to O'Hara that readers would turn to learn what America was like in the first half of the 20th century. (Of course they would be wrong, but their mistake would be understandable, and greatly to O'Hara's credit.)

title: BOYCOTT OF SCHOOLS FAILURE IN GEORGIA
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 28Absenteeism among students in several Georgia school systems ran high today, but a statewide boycott advocated by antibusing groups failed to materialize.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: MARCO ISLAND, Fla.An ecologically sensitive approach to land development is under way on Marco Island under the direction of George P. Spinner, who has 23 years with the United States Fish and Wildlife Service.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Spanish Right Protests Gibraltar Negotiations
description: MADRID, Feb. 28 (Reuters) Some 200 rightwing nationalists chanting antiBritish slogans demonstrated outside the Foreign Ministry today shortly before the British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, opened talks on the Gibraltar issue.

title: Poland Ends Church Obligation To Submit Financial Records
description: WARSAW, Feb. 28The Polish Government announced today that the Roman Catholic Church would no longer be required to submit reports on income and expenditure or maintain records of assets.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Transamerica Income Shares, Inc., yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission an initial offering of 4 million common shares for sale through Loeb Rhoades & Co. and Mitchum Jones & Templeton.

title: BOOK PUBLISHER ACCUSED BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Federal Trade Commission accused Crowell Collier and MacMillan, Inc., today of deceptive practices in selling the Harvard Classics and in billing buyers of encyclopedias.

title: Flood Here Laid to Misunderstanding
description: What a city official described as a gap in communications led to flooding yesterday on the BrooklynQueens Expressway, tied up thousands in traffic for more than eight hours and caused the destruction by fire of a police car.

title: Tarr Warns Amnesty Could Wreck Draft System
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)  The Selective Service director, Curtis W. Tarr, told Senators today that granting amnesty to Vietnam war draft resisters would be unfair and set a dangerous precedent.

title: GENERAL UNITED SOLD TO INSURER
description: The All American Life and Financial Corporation announced yesterday that its subsidiary, the All American Life and Casualty Company, had acquired 78 per cent voting control of the General United Group, Inc., for cash and notes totaling $18.2million from WheelabratorFrye, Inc. General United is an insuranceholding company based in Des Moines, Iowa. It owns 94.6 per cent of the shares of the United Security Life Company, another insuranceholding company. A spokesman for All American Life and Financial said that within the next year the company intended to make an offer to acquire the remaining common stock of General United for cash or securities having a value of not less than $3.07 a share.

title: Cuba Cutting Sugar Ration To Cope With Drought Loss
description: MIAMI, Feb. 28 (AP)  The Cuban Government confirmed today that the island's crucial sugar production had been badly hurt by a severe drought and announced that, beginning Wednesday, individual sugar rations would he cut by pounds a month.

title: Hunger Strike Wanes
description: SOMERS, Conn., Feb. 28A weekend hunger strike by as many as 900 of the 1,050 inmates at the Connecticut Correctional Institution here dwindled to fewer than 150 holdouts today as state prison authorities continued interviewing inmates to determine the cause of the boycott.

title: FRANCHISER LOSES BID TO HIGH COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP) The Supreme Court declined today to disturb a lower court ruling that the Chicken Delight food franchise system violated antitrust laws.

title: JUDGE TELLS S.E.C.: GIVE SCHAPIRO DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28A Federal judge ruled today that. the Securities and Exchange Commission must make available to M. A. Schapiro & Co. all the documents connected with a study made by the commission of the New York Stock Exchange's Rule 394.

title: House Creates Election Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP) The House created today special fivemember committee to police the 1972 House elections. The committee will investigate complaints of election irregularities and check on campaign practices.

title: PENN IS FAVORED FOR I.C. 4A TITLE
description: Despite Villanova's almost unbeatable I.C. 4A. track record in recent years, Pennsylvania was the choice of metropolitan area coaches for the team title in the 51st annual championships Friday and Saturday at Princeton.

title: Rikers Island Prison KnownasMonstrosity
description: In its 41 years of forbidding existence, first as the Rikers Island Penitentiary and now as the Adolescent Remand Shelter, the ugly redbrick building has been called Godforsaken, a monstrosity and a latterday Devil's Island.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CONSTRUCTION PANEL TOLD TO GIVE DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The chairman of the Pay Board, George H. Boldt, has told the Construction Industry Stabilization committee to provide the board with a complete report on its decisions affecting construction industry contracts, a board spokesman said today.

title: Reaction in Parliament
description: LONDON, Feb. 28 (Reuters) Six members of Parliament tonight called for a House of Commons study of race relations in Massachusetts in retaliation for Senator Kennedy's testimony on Northern Ireland to a United States Congressional subcommittee.

title: Governor Max Out of Florida Derby
description: HALLANDAT..E, Fla., Feb. 28  The draw for what may be the richest race in the history of this state, the Florida Derby will be made tomorrow. With the prospect of as many as a dozen thoroughbreds being named, 1143mile test for 3yearolds, a $125,000 added event, may have a gross value of approximately $170,000.

title: Opportunity in Cuba?
description: It is more difficult to govern than to wage guerrilla warfare, Premier Castro remarked last year. One element behind this statement was undoubtedly the discouraging performance of the Cuban economy which has for years now had to impose drastic rationing on the Cuban people. But matters have apparently been getting worse rather than better, and yesterday Radio Havana announced a further onethird cut in the sugar ration. It blamed bad weather for the fact that the available amounts of sugar have been delayed and grievously diminished.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City Board of Higher Education last night rejected unanimously and absolutely Governor Rockefeller's proposal that City University start charging tuition next school year to make up the $34million difference between the amount the Governor has proposed for the university and the sum the board says the state should pay.

title: MASTER PLAN ASKS 100 CHANGES HERE IN POLICE POLICIES
description: Aconfidential master plan for improving the New York Police Department contains more than 100 recommendations for change, including the elimination of some precincts, the dismissal of unproductive policemen and the development of a police West Point for the training of commanders.

title: In West Africa, Payoff Is Way of Life
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 28An American was sitting in his car outside the postoffice here the other morning when a policeman in a tow truck approached him.

title: STONY BROOK GROUP ARRESTED ON CAMPUS
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Feb. 28 Helmeted Suffolk County policemen came to the State University campus here tonight to help campus police arrest two dozen persons who had barricaded themselves in part of the administration building, in a dispute over a planned revolutionary people's conference.

title: Rookie's Bat Speaks to Yanks
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 28He can say little more than excuse me or five swings or one more, but the Yankees Man of Mexico City isn't letting a language barrier deter the quest for his impossible dream. Rather, Celerino Sanchez is making the barrier work for him.

title: Advertising:
description: Eighty per cent of the consumers interviewed in a recent survey said they considered unit pricing very helpful.

title: A Militant Handful Blamed For Rikers Prison Revolt
description: Benjamin Malcolm, the city's Commissioner of Correction, said yesterday that he believed Sunday's riot by inmates of the Adolescent Remand Shelter on Rikers Island had been organized by a handful of hardcore militants.

title: Wallace Files in New Mexico
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Feb. 28 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama filed his declaration today as a Democratic candidate in New Mexico's Presidential primary election.

title: The Talk of Lancaster, N. H.
description: LANCASTER, N. H., Feb. 23 Normally by this time in a Presidential year, the windows of Armand Abelli's food store on Main Street are crowded with posters from candidates of both parties, proclaiming visions of their various new Americas in slogans of five words or less. But 1972 isn't unfolding as a normal year in this placid, generally contented town of 3,300, up in what New Hampshire calls its north country. There are no campaign posters to be seen in the food store or anywhere else in Lancaster, no hint that the politicians have elicited anything stronger here than the mildest curiosity. And even that curiosity seems begrudged.

title: Canada's Exports to U.S. Rise
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 28 (Canadian Press)Shipments of motor vehicles and aircraft to the United States buoyed up an otherwise sinking set of Canadian export figures last month.

title: MARCHI PRESENTS S.I. LANDUSE BILL Would Curb Condemnations in South Richmond
description: ALBANY, Feb. 28Legislation to create a publicbenefit corporation for the development of more than 10,000 acres of land in South Richmond on Staten Island was introduced today by Senator John J. Marchi, the chairman of the Senate Committee on the City of New York.

title: Worry Over German Economy Spurs a Cut in Investment Plans
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Feb. 28On the surface there are few.signs of an economy in trouble in West Germany. Those trailer trucks bearing chemicals from Leverkusen to Hamburg, beer from Munich to Diisseldorf, automobiles from Wolfsburg to BadenBaden, are still chewing up the highways that Hitler built.

title: Mobil Oil to Buy Sea Rig
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation reported yesterday its Mobil North Sea, Ltd., affiliate had awarded a contract to Sedco International of Dallas for construction of a $24million drilling rig capable of reaching 25,000 feet. The rig is scheduled for use in the North Sea after delivery in February, 1974.

title: ARMY PLANS CURBS ON REENLISTMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI) Secretary of the Army, Robert F. Froehlke said today that the Army was about to restrict sharply the conditions under which former servicemen might reenlist and retain their old rank.

title: Dizzy Trout Dies at 56
description: Paul (Dizzy) Trout, a pitching star for the Detroit Tigers in the World War II era, died yesterday in Chicago at the age oF 56. Details on Page 38.

title: I.L.A. PACT ACCORD TIED TO ECONOMIES
description: Stevedore management is apparently relying on a combination of tighter work rules and early retirement to limit the costs of the guaranteed annual income paid to eligible longshoremen here.

title: SOVIET PURCHASES CANADIAN WHEAT
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 28 (UPI) The Canadian Government announced today a major wheat sale to the Soviet Union, involving shipments of up to 185 million bushels valued at around $330million.

title: IVAR ROOTH DIES; SWEDISH BANKER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 Ivar Rooth, the Swedish banker who was managing director and chairman of the International Monetary Fu'nd here from 1951 to 1956, died yesterday at the age of 83. He had been living in semiretirement in Lidingo, Sweden, since 1962.

title: Largest Bus Line In Jersey Facing Threat of a Strike
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 28 More than seven million New Jersey commuters who depend on Transport of New Jersey buses to get them to work, schools or shopping may have to find some other means of transportation Wednesday.

title: MISS BRIDE SHINES IN SOLO HARP DEBUT
description: Kathleen Bride, a harpist whose impressive credentials include a European tour with a contemporary music ensemble conducted by Luciano Berio and appearances in New York with the New Jersey Symphony and the Royal Philharmonic, made her solo debut Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on the Peaceful Uses of the Seabed, subcommittee on internal regime3:30 P.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FEMINISTS PROTEST SEXIST TOYS IN FAIR
description: Small groups of feminists, schoolchildren and antiwar demonstrators picketed the annual wholesale Toy Fair yesterday to protest the making of what they said were sexist and militarist toys.

title: U.S SAYS JAPAN REMAINSKEY ALLY
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, Feb. 29The United States told the Japanese Government today that President Nixon had made no secret deals with Peking during his visit to China.

title: Reagan Expects Big Quake
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 28 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan told his newly created Earthquake Council today to begin preparing for a major earthquake. The council, which includes government and university officials, was formed earlier this month to coordinate earthquake preparedness programs, recommend legislation and work on developing warning system.

title: Javits, in a Willowbrook Tour, Vows to Introduce Legislation
description: In the wake of the widely publicized plight of retarded) children, Senator Jacob K. Javits joined Federal officials yesterday in a personal inspection of the Willowbrook State School on Staten Island.

title: Vietnam Reds Avoid Comment
description: PARIS, Feb. 28The North Vietnamese and Vietcong delegations at the peace talks here refrained today from commenting on the results of President Nixon's trip to China.

title: Insecure Borders
description: The fresh flareup of fighting along the IsraeliLebanese border offers a pointed reminder that there can be no real peace or security for Israel or its neighbors in the absence of an overall settlement of the ArabIsraeli dispute. This latest manifestation of the instability of the Middle East truce makes more urgent than ever the effort of Ambassador Gunnar Jarring reactivate his United Nations peace mission.

title: Allende in New Bid to Control University
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 28The leftwing coalition of President Salvador Allende Gossens, In a new attempt to gain control of the University of Chile, has named its own candidate for the post of rector.

title: 5 JAPANESE LEFTISTS CAPTURED IN BATTLE
description: KARUIZAWA, Japan, Feb. 28 (UPI)More than 1,000 policemen stormed a mountain villa here today, captured five radicals and freed the woman hostage, they had been holding.

title: Exhibit Traces Balloon Flight History
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Smithsonian Institution is up, up and away with a spectacular balloon exhibit that dramatizes the history and adventure of man's first escapes from the planet earth.

title: New Magazine for Fiction Is Planned
description: A new magazine of fiction, which is called Fiction and which its editors consider not a magazine but a newspaper, is being published here this month by a group of young writers and poets.

title: Modern Hamlet Stirs Moscow Stage
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 28  The most novel and talkedabout drama in Moscow this season is a starkly contemporary version of Hamlet, which begins with the young prince at the back of a naked stage strumming a guitar and then rushing forward to give a prologue of Boris Pasternak's poem on Hamlet from the stillbanned novel Dr. Zhivago.

title: T. Rex, No.1 British Rock Group, Fails to Live Up to Its Publicity
description: Smoking spotlights on 57th Street, virtually nonstop radio announcements, heavy newspaper advertising  the aura surrounding T. Rex's first Carnegie Hall concert Sunday night had all the elements of hyped superstardom. Too bad the results couldn't justify the means.

title: SUITS ARE DROPPED IN SEX STUDIES CASE
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 28 (UPI)Damage suits totaling about $1.5million against Dr. William H. Masters and Mrs. Virginia Johnson, the husbandandwife sex researchers, were dismissed today in United States District Court after an outofcourt agreement was reached.

title: Los Angeles Buses Halted
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 28 (AP) The Southern California Rapid Transit District, which serves about 400,000 bus riders daily, was shut down today by a strike of mechanics. The police said that there was no unusual traffic congestion as commuters shifted to private cars, the normal means of transportation for most Southern Californians. Many used car pools.

title: TAX COURT GIVES ART EVALUATION
description: In what it terms a Solomon like pronouncement, the United States Tax Court has placed a valuation of $2.7million on unsold works in the possession of the late sculptor David Smith at the time of his death, and ruled that his estate must pay taxes based on that figure.

title: Newsmen Protest Continued Pakistani Press Curbs
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Feb: 28Altaf Gauhar, editor in chief of the Englishlanguage Karachi newspaper Dawn, was arrested two weeks ago and has been held incommunicado on an unspecified charge of having violated Pakistan's martial law regulation No. 78.

title: STOCKS APPROACH NEW HIGH GROUND
description: The stock market;cored a narrow gain yesterday, as most leading price indicators approached record highs, and all climbed into new high ground for 197172.

title: SPECIAL TAX BUS FOUGHT IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28A group of Democratic liberals In the House will make an organized effort tomorrowthe first in memoryto block passage of what are known as members bills in the tax field.

title: Ban on Yale Professor Stirs Campus
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 28 Kingman Brewster Jr., the president of Yale University, recently suspended for one year a young, popular, black, Marxist philosophy teacher, causing a stir among some faculty and undergraduates.

title: Messersmith Gets $60,000
description: HOLTVILLE, Calif., Feb. 28 (UPI)  Andy Messersmith, 20game winner last season, came to terms today with the California Angeles for an estimated 60,000 for the 1972 season. Last year he earned approximately $37,500.

title: Australia Seeks Ties
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 28 Prime Minister William McMahon said today that Australia would test China to see whether she would be prepared to move toward normal relations without making Taiwan a stumbling block.

title: Transcript of President's Speech on His Return Home
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's televised address last night on his return to Washington from China, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: The McGovern Example
description: Senator George McGovern has set an example for candidates in both parties by making a complete disclosure of his campaign finances. He has provided the press with a computer printout giving the name and address of every contributor to his campaign. In addition, he has listed separately the names of all individuals who have given $1,000 or more.

title: Herman Greenwald Dies; Was Principal in Brooklyn
description: Herman Greenwald, who retired as principal of Public School 219 in the East Flatbush area of Brooklyn in 1970, died Sunday in LaGuardia Hospital, Forest Hills, Queens. He was 65 years old and lived at 7025 Yellowstone Boulevard, Forest Hills.

title: 30 Found Safe
description: MAN, W. Va., Feb. 28 (UPI) Thirty persons were found safe tonight in a hillside mine where they had taken refuge after the dam collapsed.

title: Bill Rates Up Sharply At the Weekly Auction
