description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Yields on United States Treasury bills rose sharply in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Nyquist Rules Parents May See Children's Full School Records
description: The State Education Commissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist, has ruled that parents have a right to see all school records concerning their children, including teachers comments, guidance notes and other informal data that are placed in a youngster's file.

title: U.S. Is Urged to Oppose Britain's Policies on Ulster
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 A score of witnesses including Senator Edward M. Kennedy called on Congress and the Nixon Administration today to take a strong stand against British policy in Northern Ireland.

title: Jarring Returns to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 28 Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special representative for the Middle East, returned here today after conferring last night in Geneva with Secretary General Waldheim. Dr. Jarring reported on his visits last week to Egypt, Israel and Jordan.

title: Jersey Bell Asks $137Million Rate Rise
description: NEWARK, Feb. 23The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company, which was granted a 9.3 per cent rate increase last month by the state Board of Public Utility Commissioners, todayl, filed a twopart request for an additional 22 per cent increase.

title: Whitsuntide in March
description: Whitsuntide, a new play by Torn LaBar, will be presented at the Martinique Theater, 32d Street and Broadway, on March 26 by Bert Steinberg and Howard CramptonSmith. Russell Treyz is directing.

title: Candidates Day
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 28 (UPI)Eugene J. McCarthy started a fourday campaign tour of Chicago and northern Illinois today in an effort to make a strong showing in the state's March 21 Presidential primary election.

title: McCloskey Makes Vow
description: NASHUA, N. H., Feb. 28 (AP) Representative Paul N. McClosky Jr., Republican of California, said today that he would not support President Nixon for reelection as long as the bombing is continuing in Vietnam.

title: Arguments in Flood's Case Are Put Off Until March 20
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI) The Supreme Court today put off until March 20 arguments on Curt Flood's suit against baseball's reserve clause and the sport's antitrust status.

title: RICHEY EASY VICTOR IN HAMPTON TENNIS,
description: HAMPTON, Va., Feb. 28 (AP) Cliff Richey defeated Jim Parker of Hampton, a member of the Air Force, 61, 6.2, and Andres Gimeno of Spain ousted Tenny Svenson of Sweden, 60, 62, at the start of the $35,000 Hampton tennis tournament today.

title: AMERICAN EXPORT DESCRIBES WOES
description: Stockholders of American Export Industries, Inc., learned yesterday that their financially troubled company still faces la critical period in the months ahead.

title: '71 EARNINGS GAIN AT NIAGARA MOHAWK
description: The Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday 1971 operating revenues of $571,382,000 against $522,200,000 in 1970.

title: SAIGON PLEASED BY COMMUNIQUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 28We felt at ease, said a senior official of the South Vietnamese Foreign Ministry, describing his colleagues initial reaction to the ChineseAmerican communiqu from Shanghai.

title: Acting Career Highlights To Mark Tony Award Show
description: Highlights in the careers of Ethel Merman, Richard Rodgers and Harold Prince, as performed by Broadway stars, will he recreated in the entertainment program for the 26th annual presentation of the Antoinette Perry (Tony) Awards on April 23. The awards will be televised by the American Broadcasting Company from the stage of the Broadway Theater from 9 P.M. to 11 P.M.

title: Author Publishes Her First Book at 73
description: After waiting 73 years, many of them spent reading what other people had to say, Ida Cowen has now published her own book.

title: Executive Changes
description: David H. Bradford Jr., has been elected executive vice president of the Allied Chemical Corporation.

title: Colts Plan Workout In Tampa, Add Fuel To Baltimore Story
description: The Baltimore Colts on Saturday will run a oneday training camp for 25 rookies and a handful of seasoned players, including John Unitas, in the Tampa Stadium at Tampa, Fla. Why Tampa?

title: Dentist Gets 15Year Term
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 28 (AP) Dr. Bernard Bender, a dentist convicted of fitting young men with braces to avoid the draft, was sentenced to 15 years in prison today by a Federal judge who said Bender's action smacks of treason. Judge A. Andrew Hauk ordered Bender to undergo a threemonth motivational study. The judge indicated that he might modify the sentence after seeing the results of the psychiatric study.

title: IN THE NATION
description: MANUELITO CANYON, N. M., Feb. 27Atop one of the rocky promontories that thrust rough fingers into Manuelito Canyon stands the ruin of what may once have been the watchtower of primitive tribesmen. It was built long before the ancestors of the Navajos, who live here now, moved down from the Northwest.

title: INJURIES ARE KEY TO KNICKS DRIVE
description: Walt Frazier and Bill Bradley may play with leg injuries as the Knicks open their lateseason bid for first place in the National Basketball Association's Atlantic Division tonight at Madison Square Garden.

title: ProRegime Greek Paper Asks End of Monarchy
description: ATHENS, Feb. 28A proGovernment newspaper called today for abolition of the monarchy.

title: OTC ENDS MIXED WHILE AMEX DIPS
description: The overthecounter market did somewhat better than the American Stock Exchange yesterday as the counter issues ended mixed while the listed stocks finished mostly lower.

title: Cable TV Getting Political Test in New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N. H.  Cable television is getting its first political test in the New Hampshire Presidential primary and could he a factor in the outcome.

title: CHARLES A. POOLER, A RETIRED AD MAN
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Feb. 28  Charles A. Pooler, who retired in 1963 as a director and senior vice president) for administration of Benton & Bowles, Inc., advertising, died here Thursday after a long illness. He was 63 years old and lived in Palm Beach Gardens.

title: Informer Says Berrigan Told of Entering Tunnels
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 28An exconvict testified today that the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan told him in a prison yard conversation that the priest had posed as an underground electrician and entered utility tunnels in Washington to determine the feasibility of blowing them up as an antiwar gesture.

title: Waldheim Hopes Nixon Visit Will Lead to More Contacts
description: GENEVA, Feb. 28Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations said today that he hoped President Nixon's visit to Peking would prepare the way for further contacts and possibly further actions leading to an international relaxation of tensions.

title: Advertising:
description: By this time next week (if you watch your TV carefully over the weekend) you'll realize that Nero, Columbus and Leonardo da Vinci have more in common than ethnic persuasion. You'll know that all have been enlisted to sell First National City travelers checks.

title: Democrats in Europe To Send 3 Delegates
description: PARIS, Feb. 28 (AP)The Democratic National Convention in Miami this year will include three nonvoting delegates representing Americans in Europe, Angier Biddle Duke announced today.

title: Dido and Aeneas, in Concert, Bristles With Snappy Rhythms
description: Purcell's Dido and Aeneas is one undisputed operatic masterpiece that is available to almost any performing group no matter how modest. Its requirements are simple, its dimensions concise, its effect indestructible.

title: Computer Deal Tertninated
description: The Wells Management Corporation announced yesterday termination of an agreement between its computer software subsidiary, Wells Management Systems, Inc., and the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company. The three senior operating officers of the subsidiary have resigned and the parent company said it was consulting with counsel to determine the appropriate action.

title: Cubs Give Williams $115,000
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Feb. 28 (AP)Billy Williams, the Chicag Cubs last holdout, signed a oneyear contract for an estimated $115,000 today, giving the club two $100,000plus players.

title: Marshall Green
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 We set watches every day at 8:15 A.M. by Marshall Green's arrival at the office, a State Department colleague said the other day as he talked about the Assistant Secretary for East Asian and Pacific Affairs.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 28The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Feb. 22.

title: M'GOVERN NAMES CAMPAIGN DONORS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28In a voluntary disclosure put forth as a challenge to other Presi dential candidates, Senator George McGovern made public today the names of 42,472 people who have made contributions to his campaign.

title: S.E.C. Opens Hearings on Hot Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Of 49 small or new companies whose stocks became hot issues in 1968 or the first half of 1969, only 10 have subsequently had profits that exceeded their losses during the period.

title: Rift on Busing Develops in House as Hearings Open
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The House Judiciary Committee opened hearings today on proposed constitutional amendments against busing to achieve school desegregation, and there was an immediate rift between skeptical committee leaders and House members who are demanding quick action.

title: Marichal to Get $140,000 Each of Next Two Seasons
description: CASA GRANDE, Ariz., Feb. 28 (UPI)  Juan Marichal, who has won more games than any other active pitcher in the major leagues, agreed today to a new contract with the San San Francisco Giants calling for approximately $140,000 year for two seasons.

title: Guard Is Slain in Trenton State Prison
description: A correction officer was stabbed to death in the mess hall of the state prison in Trenton, N. J., yesterday by a prisoner who had just been returned from court where he had pleaded not guilty to the stabbing of another guard 18 months ago, prison officials reported.

title: Arthur Daley
description: When Larry MacPhail reached his 82d birthday early this month, he was formally notified that he had won the award for being the breeder of the country's top broodmare for 1971, the dam of Riva Ridge, who will be the favorite for the Kentucky Derby. It was an unexpected birthday present and it delighted him. But at that same approximate time he was denied the one gift he might have yearned for even more. It would have been election by the special veterans committee to baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Amex Speeding Transfers Of Certificates for Stocks
description: The American Stock Exchange said yesterday it had started a new certificatetransfer service that reduced to two days  from as long as two weeksthe time involvA in certain outoftown transfer operations.

title: Law Ending Closed Shop In Full Force in Britain
description: LONDON, Feb. 28Britain's Industrial Relations Law, intended to bring order out of chaos in labor disputes, went into full force today. But whether it will work effectively still remains in doubt.

title: Dr. Thelma G. Wolman Dies; Queens Education Professor
description: Dr. Thelma Gilman Wolman of 392 Central Park West, a psychologist and associate professor of education at Queens College, died of leukemia yesterday in the Hospital for Joint Diseases. She was 49 years old and was the wife of Milton Wolman, an official of the Health Insurance Plan.

title: MARTIN MARIETTA IN CONSENT DECREE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)  The Justice Departmentcharged the Martin Marietta Corporation today with using reciprocal purchasing arrangements with customers and suppliers in violation of the Sherman Antitrust Act.

title: Market Place:
description: READING, England, Feb. 28 It's a 30minute hopand a rather comfortable one by British trainto this university town and Prof. John H. Dunning, an expert on the multinational company.

title: U.S. Inmates in Danbury Refuse To Work but Make No Demands
description: DANBURY, Conn., Feb. 28About 420 inmates of the Federal Correctional Institution staged a peaceful work stoppage beginning at 8 A.M. today, but did not present any demands, according to prison officials.

title: 8,720 MURDERS LAID TO FORMER SS MAN
description: BERLIN, Feb. 28 (Reuters)Former Maj. Gen. Karl Rudolf Werner Best, of the SS, Hitler's Elite Guard, has been charged with the wartime murder of at least 8,720 Poles, West Berlin's Justice office announced today.

title: Manufacturers View
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, the nation's fourth largest bank, predicted yesterday that shortterm interest rates would rise substantially this year.

title: Mounted Police to Return!
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 28 (AP) Philadelphia's mounted police force will return to the streets next week for the first time in 20 years. Mayor Frank L. Rizzo said today.

title: SENATE OPPOSES COLLEGE SEX BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Senate voted today to deny Federal funds to most public college and universities that discriminate against women.

title: Soviet Shows Relief At Results of Talks
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 28The Soviet Union, in a marked shift of its treatment of China, gave indications of relief tonight that President Nixon's talks with Chinese leaders had evidently achieved only modest results.

title: Coliseum Gets First Ice Practice
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Feb. 28 Before 10,000 empty seats in the Nassau Coliseum today, the new arena reached another milestone in its short historythe ice was put down for the first time.

title: Chinese Get News Only Hours After Nixon Leaves
description: PEKING, Feb. 28 (Reuters) Just hours after President Nixon left China for home today, the Chinese people could read in their press and hear on the radio the text of the communiqu summing up his talks with Premier Chou Enlai.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Leading Economic Indicators Index Up
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Government's composite index of leading economic indicators rose strongly in January, but the size of the increase was magnified by a downward revision of the December index, the Commerce, Department reported today.

title: Taipei Says Nixon's Trip Will Not Result in Peace
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Feb. 28Nationalist China today expressed strong disapproval of the communiqu issued in Shanghai yesterday by President Nixon and Premier Chou Enlai. In an 850word statemerit, the Foreign Ministry said that contrary to President Nixon's hopes, his visit would not bring a generation of peace and relaxation of tensions in the Asian and Pacific region but was causing diametrically the opposite.

title: Nixon Wins Broad Approval of Congress on China Talks but Some Criticism Arises
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28President Nixon won general Congressional approval today for his China initiative but encountered some criticism on his conservative Republican flank as well as from two Democratic Presidential candidates for his pledge of gradual troop withdrawal from Taiwan.

title: GIRL, 18, RECOUNTS ULSTER KILLINGS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 28  A teenage girl testified today at the inquiry into last month's Londonderry killings that an innocent youth had died in her arms and that a man near her had been shot dead while waving a white handkerchief.

title: Chief of City's Housing Repair Service Testifies Unit Was Pocked With Fraud in 1971
description: The director of the city's Emergency Repair Service testified yesterday that it was permeated with fraud and kickbacks when he took it over last August.

title: javits Offers Day Care Bill Modified After Nixon's Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI) Twelve Republican Senators led by Jacob K. Javits of New York introduced legislation today to set up a modified version of the child day care program that President Nixon vetoed last year.

title: Babcock &
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Company announced yesterday receipt of a multiyear procurement contract from the Atomic Energy Commission totaling) $78,439,000, with an initial obligation of funds totaling $33,439.000. The work will be performed at Lynchburg, Va. Details were not released because of Government security regulations.

title: DAVIS TRIAL OPENS IN ISOLATED ROOM
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 28The trial of Angela Davis, the black activist, on charges of murder, kidnapping and criminal conspiracy began here today in a tiny courtroom isolated by stringent security measures.

title: L.I.R.R. 10Trip Tickets Good for an Extra Day
description: Long Island Rail Road commuters are getting an extra day of grace for a dying commoditythe 10trip ticket. Stamped across the face of each small blue ticket that meant a 10 per cent redUction for each ride on the Long Island Rail Road is the message: not valid after March 1, 1972.

title: BUILDING VALUE CLIMBS TO PEAK
description: The value of contracts for all kinds of construction work throughout the country set a record of $6,234,215,000 in January, 43 per cent above the $4,374,000,000 in January, 1971, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: Must We Abandon Our Friends?
description: WASHINGTONWhile there may be arguments as to the extent and details of our involvement in the problems of Asia, no one in a position of responsibility suggests that we can turn our backs on them. We are a Pacific power just as we are an Atlantic power. The control of Asia and its vast manpower and mineral resources by a power hostile to the United States would be as intolerable a threat to our security as would be the control by a hostile power of the human and industrial resources of Western Europe. If the rimland of eastern Asia were to fall in hostile hands, the threat against the island republics extending from Indonesia around through Japan would be palpable, and our own continued access to vital waterways and resources would be placed in jeopardy. Moreover, the geographic and political isolation which would follow would dangerously reduce the alternatives which would be available to us in planning for our own defense. This is why every American President for hundred has understood the need to maintain an American military presence in the Western Pacific.

title: ExIsraeli Star Signed by Cosmos
description: The 1972 New York Cosmos team began to take shape yesterday with the signing of Ruven Young, a 28yearold former captain of the Israeli national soccer team.

title: Behind the Cold Print
description: ANCHORAGE, Feb. 28President Nixon returns from his long marchan arduous retreat that in Chinese Communist history became a legendary victoryurgently offering the American people the claim that he is, after all, the great peacemaker, that he has found his mission for four more years, in the White House, that he has overwhelmed the agony of Vietnam with the promise of reconciliation in China and that the youth of America, which never suffered his own fierce hatred of Communism, has reason to celebrate the new China lobby led by the new Nixon.

title: PestControl Fund Allocated
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP) The Agriculture Department announced today the allocation of more than $2million to 14 states for helping cotton farmers carry out a new pestcontrol program aimed Lt reducing the use of chemical pesticides, mainly DDT.

title: Railroads Asking I.C.C. For Freight Rate Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI)The nation's railroads today asked the Interstate Commerce Commission to approve a $500millionayear freight rate increase.

title: Ban on Rhodesian Trade Reaffirmed in U.N. Vote
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 28The Security Council decided, 13 to 0, today, with the United States and Britain abstaining, to call on all countries to adhere to the ban on trade with whiteruled Rhodesia that was voted in May, 1968.

title: Tigers Cash Given $70,000
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Feb. 28 (AP)Norm Cash, Detroit Tigers first baseman, came to terms today on a 1972 baseball contract. He will receive $5,000 raise that reportedly will increase his pay to $70,000.

title: Arabs Report Israeli Pullout
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 28Reports from the commando area of southern Lebanon said that the Israeli withdrawal began around noon today and was completed a few hours later.

title: AQUEDUCT CLERKS CALL A WALKOUT
description: The Executive Board of the Independent Association of Mutuel Employes has called strike against the New York Racing Association that jeopardizes the opening of Aqueduct race track tomorrow. The strike was called, according to Andrew Squazzo, president of the union, because union and management have reached an impasse in their contract negotiations.

title: Bank of Commonwealth Called on Way to Recovery
description: DETROIT, Feb. 28 (AP)Detroit's Bank of the Commonwealth. in serious financial difficulty for the last two years, is well on its way to recovery and expansion, John E. Thompson, president of the billiondollar bank, said today.

title: Paperboard Prices Are Raised 7.9% By Continental Can
description: Major manufacturers moved yesterday to raise their prices on paperboard products.

title: Foxes Killed in Rabies Drive
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 28 (AP)A foxpoisoning program continued in the Cumberland foothills today in an attempt to cope with Tennessee's rabies threat. Teams reported killing about 1,500 foxes.

title: Soybean Futures Register Gain During Heavy Trading Session
description: A gain of 5 cents a bushel In the prices of soybean futures yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade was trimmed just before closing by profit taking, and the futures closed only 2 cents to 41/2 cents a bushel higher.

title: Fiji's Leader Attacks Racial Policy of Australia
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Feb. 28  When a brownskinned minor official from the Fiji Islands, then a British colony, was humiliated by a white customs officer at the Sydney airport back in 1961, the incident was to have international repercussions at top levels more than 10 years later.

title: Detroit Building Trades Settle for 4.5%
description: DETROIT, Feb. 28  Building tradesmen in the metropolitan area. have accepted a twoyear multicraft contract calling for pay and benefit increases of $1 an hour, or about 4.5 per cent. over the two years.

title: Notes on People
description: The Air Force confirmed that Col. Edwin (Buzz) Aldrin Jr., the second man to set foot on the moon, received psychiatric treatment at a San Antonio hospital late last year.

title: Buren H. McCormack, 62, Dead; LongTime Dow Jones Officer
description: Buren H. McCormack, executive vice president, director and chairman of the executive committee of Dow Jones & Co., Inc., died yesterday after a long illness. He was 62 years old and lived In Matthiessen Park, IrvingtononHudson, N. Y.

title: A QuasiDemocrat, British Division
description: LONDONIt is relatively easy to understand the basis, the tactics and the causative influences of another country's politics. But to acquire the actual feeling of these politicsthat is a very different matter. American politics is, of course, about being American, and this is something else which the nonAmerican can never fully appreciate, try as he may.

title: Cosmetics Regulation Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP) Congress was asked today to regulate the manufacture and sale or cosmetics on the ground that they damage the skin. Representative Frank E. Evans, Democrat of Colorado, introduced a bill calling for regulation of a $6.5billion cosmetic industry, which he said is presently virtually unregulated.

title: Jupiter Shot Put Off Again; High Altitude Winds Cited
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 28Stiff highaltitude winds forced the second postponement tonight of the launching of Pioneer 10, an unmanned spacecraft designed to conduct the first closeup exploration of the planet Jupiter.

title: Thanks From the Neediest
description: The proceeds of a rummage sale sponsored by the New Lincoln School's seventh grade. A combined ChristmasValentine gift from a Y.M.C.A. teenagers club. A portion of a soldier's newly raised Army pay. These were among the final donations to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fundsymbolic of the thoughtfulness and, sometimes, the sacrifice of the contributors. They helped push the year's total past the milliondollar mark, as the 60th annual appeal ends today.

title: Wider Army Surveillance Of Top Officials Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. disclosed today that Army intelligence surveillance of civilian officials from late 1967 into 1970 was more extensive than had previously been revealed.

title: Elizabeth Taylor's Latest
description: When you're married to Cleopatra and her crucial, 40th birthday is coming up, you need a grand gesture. And if there is a husband capable of lavish gestures, it's Richard Burton. Having already presented Elizabeth Taylor with the 69.42 Cartier diamond (the store paid $1,050,000 for it at auction), the 33.10carat Krupp diamond and Mary Tudor's enormous pearl, what do you do for encores?

title: Israel Reports Pullout From Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 28  Israeli forces withdrew today from southern Lebanon after a fourday reprisal operation against Palestinian commandos based there, an Israeli Army spokesman reported.

title: Homeless Thousands Await Future in Flooded Valley
description: MAN, W. Va., Feb. 28For thousands of persons who escaped the raging waters of Buffalo Creek on Saturday when coalwaste pile gave way, today was the day they realized they could not go home againat least right now.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ROSE 1% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Feb. 26 edged ahead to 2,439,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This was a gain of 1 per cent over the 2,416,000 tons poured the week before.

title: Manitoba Officials Resign Over Boxing Suspensions
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Feb. 28 (AP)  The threemember Manitoba Boxing and Wrestling Commission formally resigned today in a dispute with the provincial government over suspensions handed out following a Feb. 21 boxing card.

title: DISORDERS LINKED TO LIBERTIES UNIT School Principals Assail Aid Given Disruptive Students
description: The High School Principals Association accused the New York Civil Liberties Union yesterday of promoting disorder in the city's high schools by de fending disruptive students at the expense of lawabiding ones.

title: Seoul Voices Satisfaction
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. 28 The South Korean Government expressed satisfaction today with President Nixon's support of its position on the Korean problem in his talks with Chinese leaders.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Very soon now the Peking Papers will start leaking from Government Xerox machines to the press. The record of President Nixon's famous conversation with Chairman Mao will almost certainly read very much as follows:

title: PRESIDENT HOME AFTER CHINA TRIP; REASSURES ALLIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 President Nixon returned here tonight from his journey to China and told a large and warm welcoming crowd that he had established the basis of a structure for peace without sacrificing America's commitments to any of its allies.

title: Police to Take Job Action
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Feb. 28 (UM)Members of the New Rochelle Police Benevolent Association voted unanimously this afternoon to take a job action of an undisclosed nature. Their most recent contract expired Jan. 1. The city has offered wage increases totaling 5.5 per cent a year. The P.B.A. says it wants parity with the police in neighboring communities.

title: 7 Regional Centers Planned For Combating Drug Abuse
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 28The Department of Health, Education and Welfare announced today where seven regional centers for training in methods of combating drug abuse would be situated.

title: Impasse Is Reported By DayCare Union In Contract Talks
description: The union representing 2,200 employes at 176 daycare centers throughout the city reported yesterday that negotiations with the Day Care Council were at an impasse.

title: Pat Brady, Film. Cowboy, Dies; Roy Rogers's Sidekick Was 57
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo., Feb. 28 (UPI)Pat Brady, musician, singer and comic sidekick of Roy Rogers, the movie cowboy, died yesterday while visiting friends in nearby Green Mountain Falls. He was 57 years old.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 28The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Michigan Students Try Out Coed Rooming
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Feb 28Seventeen men and 12 women students have begun living together in a cooperative housing unit near the University of Michigan in a twoweek experiment to see if they can break down the sociological and psychological barriers between the sexes.

title: YOUNG ORCHESTRA PROVES FIRST RATE Canadians, in Local Debut, Are Solid Throughout
description: Twoyearolds occasionally manage to be lovable, but they seldom make sounds that anyone but a fond parent would regard as beautiful. That is generally the case, too, with orchestras, which require a certain maturation period to become really first class.

title: Fire Disrupts Subway Servicel
description: A small fire on the northbound track of the IRT Seventh Avenue line near 145th Street last night forced the Transit Authority to cut off power for about 25 minutes and disrupted some service. After firemen had extinguished the blaze at about 8 P.M., normal service was restored.

title: Syracuse U. Names Dean
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 28Prof. Jerome A. Barron of National Law Center of George Washington University has been named the sixth dean of the Syracuse University Law School. He will assume his new post on July 1, succeeding Robert W. Miller, who left the position last June. Professor Barron Is a communicationslaw specialist, holding degrees from Tufts, Yale and the George Washingion University National Law Center.

title: Nuclear Jets Left Taiwan Before Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Defense Department sources revealed today that two American fighterbombers, specially equipped to carry nuclear bombs, were removed from Taiwan before President Nixon's hiStoric visit to mainland China.

title: Verbal Clash Stirs the Onassis Trial
description: United States District Court Judge Irvin Ben Cooper and Alfred S. Julien, a past president of the American Trial Lawyers Association, each accused the other of professional misbehavior yesterday in the hearing of a suit involving Mrs. Aristotle Onassis and Ronald E. Galella, a freelance photographer.

title: ASYLUM SOUGHT BY RUSSIAN HERE
description: Mikhail B. Belov, a Soviet citizen employed by the United Nations as a translator, walked up to two policemen on a street in Queens yesterday morning and asked for political asylum in the United States.

title: A Deemphasis Indicated
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 28Hsinhua, the official Chinese Communist press agency, reported today on President Nixon's remarks in Shanghai without including his statement, This was the week that changed the world.

title: PROFIT Al BOEING ADVANCED IN 1971
description: The Boeing Company reported yesterday 1971 operating earnings of $22,430,000, or $1.04 a share, against $22,090,000, or $1.02 a share, the year before, after including investment tax credit amortization of $16million and $17.3million, respectively.

title: LONDON OFFERING TO SAVE SHIPYARD
description: LONDON, Feb. 28The Government said today that it was willing to invest $91million to save the bankrupt yards of Upper Clyde Shipbuilders from closing down.

title: Saigon Reports Another Thrust In Cambodia to Block Infiltration
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 28 (AP)The South Vietnamese command announced today the beginning of its third thrust into Cambodia this month to block the infiltration of enemy soldiers into South Vietnam.

title: Giant Step for Arab Women
description: JERUSALEMAt the East Jerusalem Vocational Center, a stone building not far from the ancient walls that encircle the Dome of the Rock, the Holy Sepulchre and the Wailing Wall, Patina Muhammed Algul and 24 other Arab women are learning to adapt the traditional Palestinian embroidery skill to the technique of the sewing machine.

title: Italy Disbands Parliament And Calls Election in May
description: ROME, Feb. 28President Giovanni Leone disbanded Parliament prematurely today. The atmosphere lacked any drama although his decision had no precedent in the 25year history of the Italian Republic.

title: Fregosi to Start at Third
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 28 (AP)Jim Fregosi, who spent 10 years at shortstop in the American League, will make his first appearance at third base for the New York Mets tomorrow in an intrasquad game.

title: Candidates Day
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 28Workers at the United States Air Force Eastern Test Range were greeted on their way to the job today by Senator Henry M. Jackson, who stood at the edge of the highway and waved to them as they cruised by him in their cars shortly after dawn.

title: He Found the Key to Making Youngsters Musicians
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I. Those who drifted away after graduating from South Huntington High in 1942 recall Clem De Rosa as the class celebrity. Ho was a musical prodigy and razzledazzle drummer who went on to help make the big band sound with the Dorsey Brothers, Stan Kenton, Coleman Hawkins, Teddy Wilson and others.

title: Muskie Attack on Paper: Many See Senator Hurt
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Feb. 28Senator Edmund S. Muskie's emotional attack Saturday on the publisher of the state's most powerful newspaper has injected a new element into a campaign that had settled into a plodding competition for percentage points. Although there is no way to measure precisely the political gain or loss from the performance, no one doubts that it will affect the vote Senator Muskie receives March 7 in Maachester, which is the key to the Democratic primary.

title: BLACK ARMY LINK ALLOWED BY COURT
description: An attempt to prevent Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy from making statements about the Black Liberation Army was rejected yesterday by Judge Charles H. Tenney in Federal Court here.

title: HARRY LEVEY DEAD; REALTY DEVELOPER
description: Harry Levey, a retired Long Island real estate developer who early in his career produced educational movies, died yesterday in the A Holly Patterson Home, Uniondale, L.I., at the age of 95.
